text: 355ml bottle. Quasi black colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, mostly lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Slightly fruity and dark malty aroma, some chocolate, hints of plum. Taste is slightly roasty, chocolately dark malty, some malty spiciness, sweet-ish fruity hints of plum and morello; smooth, soft, silky palate.

butelka do 11.2015 w smaku wodniste, jest troche mlecznej czekolady, w aromacie prawie nic sie nie dzieje, pianka ładna utrzymuje sie do konca, kiepsko... poszukam butelki z nowszych warek, bo na ta chwile oceny nie rozumiem.

Lots of caramel and chocolate in the aroma. Lovely creamy two finger off-white head. Jet black. Taste has loads of dark chocolate and toastiness, with a very slight hop bitterness on the finish. More than lived up to its high reputation. Very very nice beer.

Bottle from Fountainhall Wines Stonehaven. Aromas smooth coffee, sweet toffee, soft oak cask and plenty of chocolate. Flavour has a lovely coffee front, a soft earthiness that builds with a light smoky finish. A soft full body with a dry sharp sparkle. Lovely smooth tones with an earthy bitterness. A very fine dark smoky beer.
Piwo wypite jakiś czas temu. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Along with Yves at my home black colored body with a small off white head and with a roasted malt sweet fruity hop aroma a malt hop herby sweet bitter caramel taste with a bitter finish
Bottle. Jet black and bitter. Very rich in flavor. Not sweet. Nice and creamy head.
Shared with wim at his home. Black colored beer with small off-white head and no carbonation. Red wine malty aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is malty fruited bitter wooden hints.

Dark brown beer with brown head. Aroma is yeast, slight chocolate. Taste is slightly sour, notes of cocoa, caramel, malt. Aftertaste is bitterness from roasted malt and some hops, also cocoa. Feels a bit watery. Very dry beer, medium bitterness. Overall a good beer, maybe needs some fine tuning.
Punkty za historię, ale to porterek z syndromem rozwodnienia, za s£aby, zbyt wiotki, nieszczególny.
Nice malty flavour, but rather watery and one-dimensional. Dont really understand the hype around this one.

Bought this little cute bottle to try this legend. Nose of chocolate and caramel. Black with nice pale brown head. Mouth: sour, sweet, Podpiwek/kwas chlebowy, too carbonated, watery. Nice red fruits, plum. Little astringent and very sticky, coca-cola on tooth. 
Yes, sourness, carbonation and loads of caramel make me not appreciate this beer as much as I expected. I think Żywiec Porter is as little as 5% worse only. Probably fulfills all the style requirements, seems I like unusual porters than.

Pours black, beige head, lacing. Aroma of chocolat, sweet, sugary, roasted malts, licorice, touch of dark fruits. Taste is well balanced with sweetness and roasted malts, medium bitterness, dark chocolatate, licorice, some carameland dark fruits. Medium body, average carbonation, bitter finish.

Anchor Porter will always hold a special place in my life. From the time I was in high school, every Xmas eve my best friend and I would drink the Anchor Porters and Anchor Steams from his fathers fridge during our family parties. The smell of the porter and the vision of that label bring back wonderful memories. It is not the best porter that I have ever consumed, but it is the one I love the most.

Bottle. Black colour, creamy beige head with excellent duration. Aroma of chocolate, roasted coffee, some nuts. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter, chocolate, nuts, coffee, light caramel and dark fruits, roasty with a bitter finish. Medium body and carbonation, smooth texture. Classic, very tasty, balanced and drinkable.

Aromas a tostado y torrefacto
Buen aspecto y espuma persistente
En boca maltosa y chocolate al principio para un final amargo y seco
Fles. Aardige porter, maar niet super bijzonder in smaak. Bij mijn aantekening in 2014 2,5 sterren.

Dark red-brown with one finger beige-brown head. Aroma is roasted dark malts, chocolate, orange, light citrus and coffee beans. Taste is roasted malts, bitter coffee, dark chocolate, orange and a light uplifting citrus twist. Medium mouthfeel, light to medium carbonation and rich malty aftertaste with a hint of banana.

Dark colar color with a fluffy light brown head of foam. Intense and lush aromas and flavors of dark chocolate, roasted barley, and burnt caramel. Has a nutty edge to it as well. Very rich and satifying as a desset beer.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2017 Pours a beautiful, welcoming black with a massive dark beige head bubbling up and leaving ample lace. Nose is milk chocolate with a modest piney hop undertone. Tastes lovely, a wonderful throwback porter less obsessed with giant chocolate and roasted notes and more interested in a subtle, fruity character. Chocolate sweetness meets a cherry-laced gentle acidity, while a mild mocha backbone leads into a easygoing but dry fade. Textures to die for, creamy and smooth and begging for another sip. Just an all-around great anytime brew.
Bottle from Cocktails, Littleborough. Black with an extremely thin off-white head. Sweet nose, lesser but still sweet dark-malt taste, with a gentle smoothness to it.
Botella de 33cl. Aromas como de melaza y regaliz. Textura oleosa, con cuerpo, carbonatación débil. Sabor a café y regaliz, algo dulce. Final amargo y persistente. Una de las buenas, buenas

Draught @ Albion. Dark brown with reddish tint towards light, small creamy tan head, faint roasted malt aroma, medium carbonation, lightly bitter mocha, toffee, cherry, vanilla beans taste, somewhat thick body, medium bitter cherry-mocha finish. Smooth and satisfying.
Una porter como las de siempre. Intensa en todos sus aspectos mas equilibrada en su conjunto. Buen encaje, buen aroma, buena cerveza en definitiva.

Color negro con capa de espuma marrón de tres dedos de grosor (rápida formación de burbujas diminutas, aspecto cremoso y buena retención). Carbonatación mínima. Textura oleosa. Aroma a regaliz negro por un tubo, algo de café, toque tostado y lúpulo bastante presente. En boca se acentúa aun más el regaliz, también las notas a café y un final donde el lúpulo juega un papel importante (final de café amargo, pero amargor moderado). Postgusto a regaliz.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Händlerlieferung). Undurchsichtig schwarz mit beigem Exzremschaum. Schöne Röstaromen, ohne zu extrem zu werden.
Almost black with medium creamy beige head. Slightly sour dark bread and roasted grain aroma. Medium bitterness with roasted notes with remarkable kvass type sourness. Roasted notes

Dark , sweet , roasted malts. Excellent porter. From a mystery beer hawk case. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of my very first good beers, a friend from my youth. Dark as midnight, strong and smooth, with malty and roasted notes throughout. Light on the bubbles, an rpic, excellent example of a great, classic porter.

This beer was on Tap, fresh, brought directly from SF.
It is super dark in a glass. Has a creamy one-two finger tan head. Has Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, dark fruit. Has taste of bitter coffee, roasted malt ,some dark fruit. It is a full body, soft carbonation drink, with oily, a bit creamy mouthfeel. Good Porter, but you need to love this kind of the beer to enjoy it. Not very strong (5,6%)

Poured from 355 ml bottle.
An excellent Porter. Decent head and lacing. Slightly under carbonated IMHO. Malty aromas. Roasted malts, chocolate flavours. Dark in color and creamy mouth feel. Well balanced body. It never gets old.

Serving: from bottle--purchased at The Beer Junction.

Aroma: light hops and vanilla.

Appearance: small, light-brown initial head with fair lacing and fully diminishing longevity. Clear, cola-brown body.

Taste: lightly acidic initial flavor and lightly acidic, smokey finish with average duration.

Palate: light-to-medium bodied with watery texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: okay.

A lovely lovely beer. A roasty coffee, aroma with a hint of leather. Appearance is, black and frothy - full head. Taste is chocolatey and sweet but followed by a coffee type bitter aftertaste. Beautiful balance. Creamy, full body, soft carbonation - you dont drink this, you chew it. Nice

The beer looks great. It sure looks like a porter. The color of the beer is a beautiful dark ruby red, almost black. The beer looks quite clear. On top of the beer a nice layer of brown foam is formed. The majority of the foam collapses, leaving a lovely creamy and soft drape. 
The smell of the beer is good. It is a good porter smell. There are nice roasted malts in the front, containing aromas of chocolate, some licorice. It is nice. It contains a tiny acidic touch as well, maybe it is a fruity touch of the hops? There is a lovely bitterness to the smell aswel. Not bad.
The taste of the beer is pretty much the same as the smell. Nice bitter toasted malt, slightly savoury roast, liquorice, some caramel in the back. It is a bit stronger than the smell. It is in good balance. It contains a bit more liquorice flavours than most porters (at least, the ones Ive had). I like this one to. 
The palate is fine. Medium body, low amount of carbonation, nice smooth texture. The finish of the beer is nice. There is a nice bitter coffee taste. Good one.
355ml bottle. Dark brown with tan creamy head. Aroma: chocolate, nuts, raisins and soy sauce. A little bit of sweetness. Creamy texture. Quite good beer, but nothing special.

Bottle. And on draft. Jet Black in colour. Very Malty; roasty malts, dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, hint of liquorice. Some hop bitterness to balance the malts. Dark fruit notes. Bittersweet dry roast malty finish. Very drinkable. Liked this. Quality Beer. Good Porter! (2008)

Pours dark brown with tan head. Aroma of roasted coffee, coffee beans, cocoa, nuts. Flavour quite the same with coffee forward and some dark chocolate. Finish is dry and roasty with some astringency. Medium body and thin texture. Enjoyable after all but there are lots of better porters out there.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Aroma of dark roasted malt and rye, notes of fruits.
Medium sweetness and light-medium bitterness.
Average soft carbonation and full body. A great and very traditional porter.
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Denne porter har et sort udseende med et svagt hvidt skum. Øllen har en rug aroma og smager tørt og traditionelt. Cremet fornemmelse. Lav karbonering.

Good beer. Complex with rich notes of burnt coffee beans, nuts, licorice. The strong bitter taste overpowers the flavors but this does add a nice final dimension. The bitter after taste is very long. Nice colour and smooth light carbonation. Love the start, dont care for the finish.

Botella 33cl. Color negro con notas rubí al trasluz, espuma beige de buena retencion. En nariz cafe y fruta negra.En boca el regaliz negro te llena la boca, aparecen al calentar notas de platano con un final amargo muy interesante.

Colour: black
Foam: huge, frothy w/ brownish head
Smell: Roasted and sweet malts, dark/rye bread, soy sauce, liquorice, dark chocolate, nuts, even some floral and caramel notes.
Taste: rather sweet, rye bread, roasted malts, chocolate, and liquorice.
Nice, soft carbonation. Really balanced beer, slightly bitter towards the end. Quality brew.

355 ml bottle. Pours black with a light brown creamy head. Intense aroma of mild roasted malt, mild coffee, caramel some herbal notes and a little smokey. Medium body with a low carbonation, a light sweetness and a light bitterness. Flavors of roasted malt, caramel, dark chocolate, coffee, light licorice notes. Very well balanced.

355 ml
black, with off white rather creamy head.
dried fruits, smokey, peppermint, alcoholic
roasty, sweet, medium bitterness, 
medium to full body, creamy to watery texture, soft carbonisation
Coffee, chocolate and slight banana in the smell. Creamy, coffee, chocolate mousse. Bitterness could be slightly less for me personally, but its well-balanced. Creamy finish.

Pours a very black. Not opaque at all. Not even ruby. About three fingers beige head. Good retention, great lacing.Aroma is winey, bubblegum. Figs, maybe a touch of dates. Smokey, maybe some oak. Or is it earthy hops?Taste is char. Malty. Creamy and rich. Dark fruit and cherry. Caramel. Some molasses. No coffee, no chocolate.Mouthfeel is medium bodied. Good carbonation, not too much. A little sticky. A little bitter, semi dry.Overall, I dont understand the high ratings. Its okay, its not amazing. I would buy it again ONLY because the ratings are so high, to give it another chance. Meh.
Bottle. Almost black color. Aroma: caramel, wine, fruit esters and dark dried fruits. Taste: velvety caramel and wine, a bit of prunes and chocolate. Good.
Bottle from Bitter Virtue, Southampton. Deep black pour with small tan head. Aromas of coffee, dark malts. Complex flavours of dark chocolate, coffee and dark fruits. Bittersweet. Delicious.

Oh, yes: bubblegum in porter, what a fantastic idea! No, porter is refreshing more than ever. Innovation, but at the same time traditional - which I like so much. Dark coffee colour with very nice caramel nuance top. Medium carbonation, sticky and creamy texture. Hardwood, chocolate malts, prune and salted ripe fruits. Peace of art.
Bottle at Wetherspoons in Doncaster. Great drop. Raisiny. Dark chocolate etc. Christmas pudding. Very pleasant.
Bubblegum in the aroma with some intense spruce bitterness, sort of a funky old fashioned taste, not really an everyday beer for me.
Bottle from Beer Hawk. Aromas of coffee and chocolate. Pours a thick dark brown with a tanned head. Tastes of hops, chocolate and treacle with a chocolatey palette. May be my new favourite porter.

How: bottle. Aroma: Malty, roasted coffee beans, burned toast. Appearance: Dark black colour with small brown not for long lasting head. Taste: Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, a bit sour. Palate: Medium to heavy body, soft carbonation, slick to sticky texture, with a bit abrupt finish. Overall: Delicious porter with burned coffee beans aftertaste, but couldnt recommend more than one bottle to drink.
Very good, really enjoyed it. As compared to Founders, which I still prefer, I felt that Anchors body was a little "thinner" and the head not as thick.

355ml Bottle: Pours black with garnet highlights and thick creamy tan head that lingers. Amazing aroma of prunes, dates, brown sugar and caramel. Beautiful flavours of caramel and other dark sugars with a slight roasty note which is not distracting at all but rather gives the beer a dark chocolate note. Medium to high body, medium carbonation. Slightly higher on the IBUs than most porters, however, it helps balance out the big flavours. Overall this has to be the best porter i have had!
12oz bottle pours black with tan head aroma of booze and coffee flavor is of coffee and roast nuts.

Nieprzejrzyście czarny, z drobną, brązową pianą. 
Aromat lekko śliwkowy, później pojawia się słodka nuta, której zupełnie nie ma w smaku. Palone, lekko czekoladowe, ale też nuta kakao. 
W smaku śliwki, trochę ciemnych słodów. 
Mocno wytrawne w smaku. 
Goryczka kojarząca się ze śliwkami. Słodyczy praktycznie brak. 
Ma sporo ciała. 
Bardzo pijalne piwo.

Aromat niezwykle bogaty, było w nim wszystko i obiecywał wiele; czekolada, ciemny chleb, paloność, nawet po ogrzaniu kapitalne nuty szlachetnego alkoholu. Niestety smak mnie troche rozczarował, w porównaniu z aromatem nie było w nim nic. Aczkolwiek całość należy ocenić jako niezłe

Pours dark brown with high beige head. Aroma is beans, fresh leaves, hardwood, some fruits, light toast, light citrus. Taste is creamy, citrus, pineapple, toast, some coffee, some sourness, fresh hardwood, some caramel. Very good and refeshing beer!

A very enjoyable beer. Jet black with a lovely cream foamy head.
Smells of molasses and treacle, tastes the same with a long bitter sweet finish.

330 ml bottle, Bucharest, Bistro GUXT.
Black and opaque.Nice tan head, good retention, lot of lacing.
Aroma is coffee and chocolate, burnt sugar, some smokyness, roasted bread and roasted nuts, dark fruits. Really nice, balanced and complexe.
Taste is mostly bitter with some roasted and smoked hints, saltiness. Also hints of caramel, dark fruits and roasted nuts, some herbs. 
Light carbonation and average corpolence., long aftertaste, bitter-sweet with salty hints.
Very nice beer, I am really impressed. Well ballanced, easy to drink, light but in the same time complexe and refined. Ill drink this beer anytime again.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 Czarna, nieprzejrzysta barwa. Piękna drobnopęcherzykowa piana zdobi szkło. Aromat niezbyt intensywny, głównie palone słody, lekka czekolada. W smaku dość wytrawnie, deserowa czekolada, lekka kawa i przypieczony karmel. Przyjemny finisz charakterystyczny dla ciemnych piw. Ładna kremowa faktura. Wysycenie mogłoby być ciut niższe. Ale nie ma się co czepiać, bardzo dobre piwo
A good overall Porter that does really well in satisfying all key areas for sure.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 Noire à mousse onctueuse abondante et persistant jusquà la fin de la dégust ! Arômes marqués de cacao/chocolat, fruits noirs, prune, herbes. Saveurs chocolat, café, épices, malts rôtis. Bouche un peu piquante avec bonne amertume. Ma 1e Porter. Pas ma dernière !

18.11.2016 - Almost black pour with coffee creamy beige head. Instant aromas of roasted malt, dark chocolate and coffee. Taste is the same together with some fresh fruit notes hiding behind this semi creamy and therefore freshly carbonated mouthfeel and roast malt body. Great porter
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Klasyk, niezmiennie w świetnej formie.
Bottle. Deep black colour with stable huge head off. Aroma of chocolate, roasted coffee.Taste of caramel, light sweet, light sour, nuts,dark chocolate, roasted coffee,light floral, Great porter!
Botella 33cl cervezasdiferentes.es Porter de sabor potente, noto sabor a regaliz negro, mas fuerte al calentar

355ml bottle. Almost black appearance with a creamy one-two finger tan head. Aroma: roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, dark fruit. Taste: roasted malt, bitter coffee, some dark fruit. Full body, soft carbonation, oily creamy mouthfeel. Decent.
Roast and some caramel. Black pour with good head and lacing. Dark chocolate. Bittersweet finish. Bottle.

Prezentuje się świetnie, to na pewno. Gęsta czapa puszystej piany, która praktycznie w ogóle nie redukuje się w trakcie picia i mocno oblepia szkło. Aromat raczej mało ciekawy. Głównie palone słody, niewiele ponad to. Smak również dosyć jednowymiarowy, nie zachwyca. Palone słody, jakaś kawa z cukrem i tyle. Byłoby nieciekawie, gdyby nie faktura tego piwa. Jest cudownie kremowe, gładkie, bardziej podobne do koktajlu niż piwa. Zdecydowanie największa zaleta tego porteru, przy dość przeciętnym smaku i aromacie.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2016 Bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma is chocolate, herbal, a bit roasted. Taste is more chocolate, rather sweet, stays quite herbal. Low carbonation, creamy mouthfeel. Very nice!
Roasted malts, black with a brown head quite persistant, medium body, law/medium carbonation, quite bitter that remember me mountain herbs...not my favorite but a good porter.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2017 Pours black from the bottle. The crown is wonderfully creamy and lingers for the duration. An enticing aroma greets the nose: like lightly vinous with roasted coffee notes. All in all an attractive start. Taste bitter with roasted notes, lightly sour, and inflected with a light berry tang that grows stronger at the finish. Complex and well balanced. Body is full, lightly oily, with average carbonation. Not as alcoholic as some of my other favorites, which makes this a welcome exception. A very agreeable porter in every way, and all the more respect given that it was brewed without any added chocolate or coffee. Excellent.

Black with a soapy light brown head. Beautifully complex dark malty. Earthy hops. Mild bitterness. Sweetness held in check. Semi dry. Not heavy or cloying, instead nice and easy. Has great character similar to a big stout but all in a small, low alcohol package. Absolutely fantastic
Butelka, ciekawy porter warty zainteresowania, ciemne piwko z małą ilością alkoholu.

Quite excellent. Cant believe Ive been overlooking this one. It very well might become a regular in my refrigerator. Very dark, near black with low carbonation and slight sweet taste. ABV perfect to allow a sit back and relax...gimma another brew day. Im impressed.

From bottle in pub. Pours black with light head. Aroma is of caramel and treacle. Sweet at first with a slightly bitter finish. Dried fruits, roasted malts, liquorice and treacle. Would recommend.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Aroma of caramel coffee and slight peppery hop. Black with a tight off-white head. Taste is slightly sweet with a surge of bitterness. Flavours of licorice, sweet plum fruit and roast malt. Smooth with slightly boozy overtones, rich and full-bodied. Dry finish. Very nice.
Bottle @ home, from Voldby. Drak black pour with a hefty tan head. Notes of roast, light caramel, some coffee and light licorice. Solid porter!

Very dark brown although clear.. deeep ruby highlites when held to a light ... lite tan head with very little lacing.

Aroma is roasted grains and restrained chocolate.. very clean.. does not have alot if any fruitiness... this brew is pretty much room temp and only the slightest smell of hops.

Flavor is nice.. body is great and inviting... sorta caramelly sweet.. big brown grains and chocolate malts.. not astringent at all.. very drinkable.

13/20 Porter that's not too smokey. Coffee taste but pleasant. Hint of liquorice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

- schöne dunkle Farbe mit angenehm cremigem Schaum
- Aromen nach getrockneten Früchten und einer leichten
 Kaffeenote
- geschmacklich setzt sich dies dann auch in perfekter
 Balance so fort
- hier kommt noch ein leichter überraschender Hopfentouch
 hinzu
- ein wenig im Glas ruhen lassen, da  zumindest mir  die 
 Kohlensäure ganz leicht zu hoch dosiert erscheint
- eine leichte Säure im Abgang schließt den Genuss gelungen
 ab
Fazit: Schönes und vor allem rundes Porter
Dark brown with fizzy brown foam. Light sweet aroma of malts. Sweet taste with malts, chocolate and raisin notes. Sharp on the tongue.

Bottle. Aroma of licorice, figs, prune, coffee, mild roast. 
Pours out pretty black with a beige creamy head. 
Taste is better than the nose with more sweetness and intensity from the licorice, figs and coffee. Very balanced between bitterness and sweetness. 
Medium body, oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation, toasty finish. 
Super easy drinking and nice flavours.

My first 5. Cannot mark it down in any area ergo its a home run. Pours red hued black with large creamy head. Head smells of vanilla with smokey. Very sweet and rich tasting. Full-bodied. Dark notes of toffee, fudge, parkin, treacle and coffee balanced by lighter /sweeter nuances of vanilla and lactose. Intense finish with cocoa toffee and smoke. I could talk about it all day but quite frankly you should just go out and try it. Top quality porter from a great brewery.

Dark brown pour with beige head. Toasted grain and dark fruit, coffee/cocoa aromas. Watery mouthfeel with a mild carbonation. Taste is more dark roast with lasting bitterness. Finishes slightly chalky, with a building bitterness. Decent porter-easy drinking dark beer as expected it should be, but a bit pricey. Not the first overrated offering from Anchor!
Musta olut, suklaisella tuoksulla. Maussa suklaata, pehmeyttä, loistava porter, ei liian vahva.

Pours dark brown with a big light brown head. Rich aroma of prunes, raisins, bread, toffee, dark bread crust, smoke, hints of chocolate and coffee. Perfectly balanced taste. Creamy texture, medium carbonation and body. Amazing, one of the best porters Ive tried.

355ml bottle. Pours dark brown with medium tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, biscuit, coffee. Medium to light body with soft carbonation. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter with dry finish.

Bottle. Great looking pour, deep dark brown with a foamy light tan head that stays, nice lacing. Rich roasted malt and chocolate aroma, faint nut and citrus. Lovely strong roasted flavour, savoury, chocolate biscuits. Medium feel, very bitter, lingering roast. You think you may have overrated a beer from your formative years, then you find out its just as delicious as ever. Must drink more often.

Dark brown with a small creamy beige head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate with notes of liquorice and nuts. Flavour of coffee and chocolate, with notes of liquorice, that ends up with a nice bitterness. One of the best porters Ive had.
Dark brown/red pour, almost black with tan head. Aroma of medium roast malt and toast. Taste is sweet roast malt with very mild bitter finish. Light for a porter, but enjoyable.
Klares dunkelbraun bis schwarz mit reichlich Schaum. Röstmalze, etwas Karamell, Vanille, Kaffee, würzig, leicht bitter.

Apr. 16. A 0.355 l bottle that poured a hazy brown, copper hued body with a small to medium sized head. Really fine licorice aroma along with typical roasted malt like coffee, touch of dark fruits and caramel. Flavor was balanced with sweetness and roasted malt. Medium to thin in body with a nicely rounded finish full of cocoa, dark chocolate and toffee. Might have missed a little bit of body, but it was still an enjoyable porter.

Aroma: roasted malts, dark chocolate, hints of caramel, fruits, toffee. No hints of smoke.
Appearance: black color, totally opaque, slightly above average head thickness, slightly under average retention, tan and creamy head made of tiny bubbles. Good Brussels lace.
Taste: light-to-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, no sourness. Nice flavor of roasted malts, dark chocolate, licorice, caramel, toffee. No hints of smoke.
Palate: medium body, watery-to-oily texture, average carbonation, very long dry bitter finish of dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, toffee.
Overall: nice appearance and aroma, great flavor and nice long bitter finish of dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, licorice and toffee.cheese,

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2017 Color negro casi opaca, espuma de carácter jabonoso y retención media. Regaliz, algo de café, frutos negros. Equilibrio entre malta y amargo final considerable, se nota algo ácida.

Appearance: Very dark brown, some dark tan head.
Aroma: Malt, roasted, slight coffee.
Taste: Dark malt, roasted, light coffee. Nice.
Bought: Halle aux Boissons (Matran), 355 ml, CHF ?.??
Info: 18/6-2016, BB: 31/10-2016

Butelka 0,355l. Aromat z butelki bardzo przyjemny i intensywny, kawa z mlekiem i czekolada. Ciemne z rubinowymi przebłyskami, klarowne. Obfita piana. W aromacie ze szkła to samo co z butelki. W smaku bardzo wytrawnie, kawowo, umiarkowana goryczka. Średnie nasycenie. Bardzo przyjemne piwo.

Svart med ett stort gult skum. Söt och nästan lite klibbig. Malt med lite kallt kaffe. En enkel stabil porter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Type: 12-oz. bottle 
Glass: Clear 14.75-oz. porter/stout glass
From: Bine & Vine in Normal Heights (San Diego), Calif.
Price: $1.79 (10 pct. off for 6-pack deal)
Purchased: May 4, 2016
Consumed: May 19, 2016
Misc.: Bottled on Dec. 14, 2015

Cant remember ever enjoying an Anchor beer and I dont expect that to change with this porter, but Ill keep trying. 

Poured a mahogany color with 3-to-4 fingers of khaki tan, frothy head. Average spotty lacing. Below average retention. (Sight - 3.50)

Smelled roasty malts, sticky toffee, spoiled dark plum, fig, raisins, hints of roasted nuts, dry chocolate, rough molasses, cocoa and unknown hops. Almost reminded me more of a dry stout. (Smell - 3.75)

Tasted better than the nose and more like a porter. Got roasty malts, bitter dry chocolate malt, dry cocoa, dark plum, raisins, hints of dark fig, charred molasses, toast, muted black coffee, dark toffee and unknown generic hops that you find in cheap-ass beer (thinking DieselPunk Porter). (Taste - 3.75)

Medium-to-full body. Sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, bitter finish. (Feel - 4.00)

Might have underrated this slightly overall, but just slightly. Maybe the best Anchor beer Ive had though. (Overall - 3.75)

3.76 85 B+

Big malty notes of dark bread and chalk. Pours a deep dark brown with a big almost brown tan head.some lacing. Large tastes of toffee and toast with a balanced sour short umami finish. Medium carbonation. Very good porter.
Cerveza negra, bastante buena. Cuerpo medio, con buen sabor como a regaliz, aunque me gustaría que fuese un poco más largo.

Big roasty porter thats nice on the palate! Pours black w/ a tan head that leaves good lacing. The aroma has some lovely chocolate & roasted notes. The taste is chocolate & velvety smooth upfront & then in traditional porter fashion has a roasty & bitter finish. Pretty darn tasty!
Probada en barril, porter muy intensa con aroma a cafe torrefacto. También se pueden apreciar ciertas notas de vainilla y caramelo
UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Pours a dark brown with a tan foam head. Aroma of roasted malts and some coffee notes. Taste is malts, chocolate, coffee and a slight hint of liquorice. Smooth.

caramel, bread, coffee, basement aromas, brown, cloudy, frothy, heavy cloying sweetness, sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, light body, creamy, long finish, 

Sí joder! Esto es una cerveza. Notas cada trago. Tiene ese color a trote entre el negro y el marrón oscuro, no deja pasar la luz. Espuma muy densa al tirar la cerveza pero casi inexistente cuando se disipa. Sabor tostado, me recuerda al café pero acabando en dulce.

Butelka 355ml w The Squere Bottle Chester.  Czarny kolor. Piana bezowa palona dosc obfita. W aromacie wyrazna czekolada karmel kawa i palone-wedzone slody. Lekkie nuty owocowe w tle. W smaku raczej wytrawne niz slodkie. Kawa karmel lekka czarna porzeczka. Z pewnoscia mniej ciezkie niz wiekszosc porterow. Bardzo pijalne.  Marcin G

355mL bottle
Near black body, holds a dense tan head.
Decent nose to it - roast nuts, dark caramels, dark chocolate, touch of woody hop in the mix,
Full bodied, slightly creamy yet drying texture to it, moderate carbonation.
Lovely body - moderate roasty note of burnt crust, roast nuts, crystally dark toffee. Firm bitterness, dry finish.
Good stuff.

35,5cl flesje via Raadhuisplein, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 5,6%
Uitgeschonken in St. Bernardus glas

Uiterlijk: zwart met redelijke schuimkraag 

Aroma en smaak: donker fruit, rozijnen, zoet, caramel, gebrande mouten, koffie, chocolade

Conclusie: lekkere zoete porter, niet te, maar is normaal een stuk bitterder qua smaak

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Originally rated on 9/7/08. I had been wanting to try this one for a while now, it pours a dark black body with a thin tan cap. Aroma of mocha and a little chocolate, flavors were similar. Mouthfeel was a little on the light side for me, but it was smooth and easy to drink, and a clean finish. Overall it was a pretty good porter.
Bottle at hopaholic. Pitch black colour with a small brown head. Nose of roasted malts with some funkyness. Taste is light roasted malts. The funk is noticable but not as distinct.

12oz bottle at Arcona Living, Osnabruck, Germany on 24-Mar-2016. Dark, slmost black in colour with a medium sized tan coloured head. Sweet malt hoppy aroma. Full body and carbonation. Smoky, bitter and sweet. Nice dessert beer.

Almost total darkness in color with a two finger tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, slight chocolate and some hops. Taste is similar but the coffee and roasted malts dominate. A good porter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nagy, tartós, tejeskávé színű hab. Fekete szín. Illata fekete csokis, pici savanykás felhanggal. Finom, feketecsokis ízvilág, gyümölcsös, vörösboros felhangokkal. Közepesen testes és nyomokban sincs vizes érzet. Utóíze is a pörkölt malátáról szól és jó hosszú ideig szól. Jól eltalált, kiegyensúlyozott sör.

Bottle at The Green Dragon, Leek (JDW) Pours a black colour with a fizzy tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, raisin, roasted malts, some chocolate, maybe marshmallow, slight metal, a little burnt toast and subtle smoke. Taste of toasted malts, coffee, slight chocolate, a little burnt toast, dark fruits, raisin, some metal and subtle toasted malts. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dry, roasted, fruity bitterness in the finish. A full flavoured, complex porter but its not unique, theres better porters out there.
355ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours very dark brown with a foamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malt and coffeewith toffee notes. Taste is very malty, quite sweet, a little bitter. Very smooth.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 Bottle. Average aroma and carbonation. Pours translucent black. Very slightly sweet. The prominent flavor is raisins, with secondary notes of dried apricots and other fruit.  Missing the toasted chocolate, malt, toffee and coffee flavors of the best porters.

dark brown, close to black, but showing red highlights. mild carbon and fine bubble. It produces a foam crown mean amplitude and latte color. Very compact, creamy appearance and good durability. Abundant lacing in glass. an intense aroma of caramel mixture and roasted malt appears on the nose. The roasted nuances in a first contact where coffee beans poke lead to other more hidden notes like black chocolate, nuts and smoke.

Bottle. I used to drink this back in college and thought it was great. But that was in back in 1980--35 years ago. Maybe theyve changed the recipe but this doesnt live up to my memories of a full-bodied roasty brew. What I find now is a thin, light bodied, brew that smells of coffee and dill pickles (two things I like but not together). Gone is the roasty toasted flavor and in its place a brew without the same richness or character. Its still worth a try but a little on the thin side.

Bottle from Uba ja Humal in Tallinn ( 3.90). BB 11.2016. Pours brown with a ruby glare, appearing black in the glass. The heads biiig, soft and thick, drops very slowly and leaves considerable lace. The aromas... mmmh, roasty, grainy, dusty, chocolate powder and red berries... Lovely! Tastes similarily, nice sweet and bitter balance, plus roasty. Dryish on the palate, moderate to low carbonation, body good, finishes dry and faint bitter. Good!

Porter blind taste [sample 1]. Dark brown / near black, foamy brown head. Nearly opaque with red/brown edges. Aroma: chocolate, marshmallows, toast. Moderately sweet. Sorta oxidized? Eugene says "tutti-fruti" and Im gonna steal it. Palate: light medium body, oily texture, dryish finish. Overall: okay. Neither roasty nor too chocolaty. Pretty dull all around.
Bottle. Nice dark brown body. Hops, malt, toffee. Bitter. Dry finish. Thick and gloopy, with some chewiness. Delicious.

Black with an off-white, long-lasting, lacing head. Cherry, plum, cocoa, coffee, chocolate on the nose, lovely aroma. Ripe fruits, malt in flavour with toffee hints. Fruity finish. Sweet, low bitterness. Medium body, a bit slick texture. Average to low carbonation.

This is solid, for some reason I get turkish delight on the nose like hints of rose petal flowed by rich caramel. the taste is very well rounded, starts off with a hit of sweetness evolving into delicious malt. The finish is clean but doesnt dissipate leaving a light desire to drink more. Super tasty!

Porter Blind Tasting. Small ghost white head. There is a surprising ester character, like light banana. I dont get roast aromas. Its a bit of a fruity-tutti flavor for a porter. Well attenuated, low sweetness. Low hop. I am weirded out by the banana/ruity-tutti aspect but I have seen that in porters, rarely, before.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: A must drink porter. Pleasant aroma and taste of caramel and coffee. Thick brown head with excellent retention. Leaves sweet toffee finish. One of my favorite beers so far.

355ml Bottle at The Water House (JDW), Durham, £2.99. 

Black beer with a smooth and appealing, frothy, pale tan head. The aroma smacks of prunes and as such isnt too appealing, although hints of nuts, damp earth and chocolate portend the complexity of the flavours to come. Indeed, its a varied roller-coaster on the palate, opening with dark fruit and berry notes, before yeasty marmite takes over, then bitter coffee and finally sweet, creamy chocolate and dairy flavours come in to round the taste off. Its very rich and very busy, with lots to like about it. However, a distinct and unpleasant vaguely rubbery off note runs through both its aroma and flavour characteristics, marring the overall score. A really hard beer to rate - Im hedging my bets.
Bottle. Black color, grey head. Aroma of coffee and honey. Taste is light bitter, light sour and medium sweet. Well balanced, but not intensive in aroma and taste. OK.

Dark brown color . One-finger , tan head. Caramel and weird metallic notes in aroma . Rich taste with notes of chocolate, roasted malt , hint of fruits . Hoppy and roasted bitterness intertwined at the finish .
An exemplary porter! chico and coffee aroma. Roasted malts caramel and coffee taste. Bitter aftertaste. short brown head. A must drink porter!
UPDATED: FEB 27, 2016 A perfect guide on how porters should taste and look like. Full body, caramel coffee and choco aroma. slightly bitter on the finish. Great recipe!

Bottle.

A: Mahogany body with a foamy cappuccino head. 

N: Enormous chocolate and coffee. Bit of earth and tang. Roast and toast. A bit of licorice, and possibly some molasses.

T: Quite bitter, lightly sweet.

M: Light body, foamy carbonation, no alcohol presence.

O: Quite tasty. Theres a big amount of flavor here, and its not a cloying sugar bomb. Nice work; classic.

Pours dark brown with tan head. Aroma caramel and dark figgy fruits. Flavor is very fruity with a smoky sweet backbone. Loads of prunes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

BOTTLE. Black in colour with a red hue, bubbly tan head.. Aniseed and dark malts on the nose.. Thick dark malts up front, very rich, almost an oatmeal feel, slight touch of aniseed/liquorice at back.. Different for a porter.. Sourced Goose Restaurant

Kolor: Ciemnobrązowy z rubinowymi refleksami pod światło. 
Piana: Beżowa, gęsta czapa. Piana zbudowana jest ze średnich oraz małych pęcherzyków powietrza, które zwartym szeregiem otaczają ścianki. Bardzo ładny lacing.
Czapa bardzo długo dryfuje na powierzchni. 
Zapach: Jest tutaj wszystko co powinno znaleźć się w perfekcyjnie zbalansowanym porterze: jest paloność na odpowiednim poziomie. Nie jest ona tak wysoka jak w stoutach. Jest tutaj wiśnia, lukrecja, trochę wanilii.
Na koniec subtelna nuta gorzkiej czekolady. 
Smak : Jest tutaj podobnie jak w zapachu. Porter ten bardziej ma wytrawne zabarwienie.
Są tutaj ponownie wiśnie, lukrecja, wanilia. Po kilku łykach daje o sobie znać gorzka nuta orzecha laskowego.
Paloność jest na znacznie wyższym poziomie niż w zapachu.
Na finiszu kawa z mlekiem. Goryczka średnia. 
Wysycenie : Średnie. 
Podsumowanie: 

Anchor Porter to moje kolejne piwo z Browaru Anchor prosto z San Francisco.
Bardzo dobry porterek. 
Jest bardzo gęsty, treściwy i gładki.
Wszystko tutaj zagrało jak należy. Nie ma się do czego przyczepić.
Klasyk jakich mało i idealny wyznacznik stylu.

bottle: pours dark brown with a rich light brown head......coffee, malty, dried fruit and molasses aroma.....medium body with some sweetness, toffee and toast......lively carbonation with a smooth increasing bitterness.....a great porter
Bottle from Mad Hatters bar. Pours jet black with a creamy fawn head which lasts for ages. Nose of malt loaf and coffee. Taste is creamy with a bit of sweetness, toffee, treacle. Long, dry finish.
Great foam. Faint aroma. Ripe fruits. First sweet, dry in the end and roasted. Leather? Slighty bitter and dusty.
Creamiest head you can get, with strong aroma! Really dark true color! I enjoyed it till the last drop! Must taste!
355ml bottle, watching Super Bowl. Dark, dark brown with a creamy tan head. Sweet chocolate aroma, taste is similar. Very smooth

Farbe: schwarz
Schaum: braun, leicht sämig
Nase: rauchig verbranntes Malz, bitter, Holz, dunkle Erde, später leicht dunkel-schokoladig.
Geschmack: sehr feinperlig, mit vielen Perlen, also erst mal recht frisch auf der Zunge. Dann kommt natürlich der Rauchhammer, dann wirds aber im Abgang überraschend süß und leicht: Karamellmalz. Ist auch bitter, das merkt man am ehesten im Nachgeschmack, aber nicht negativ, da auch das karamell dableibt. Watn Bier!
Bottle at the standing order. Pours black, nose is roasted, chocolate, liquorice, taste is similar, creamy.

355ml bottle, served in snifter glass. Poured black with a small light brown head that disappeared quickly. Aromas of roasted malts, vanilla, coffee, dark fruits, honey, walnuts. Taste pretty much a continuation of the aroma, very malty with notes of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, dark fruits, some hops in the background. Full body with a creamy, sticky and somewhat dry finish. Overall a very good tasting Porter. Its a shame my glass is already empty. Loved it...

Aroma of honey, dry fruits, cranberry, and something like roasted malt o.0 Aroma is similar hint of honey, coffee, some ash, some dry fruits (mainly plums). low bitterness, medium-high carbonation, a little biting. Decent porter
355ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen on 2 December. Pours black with an off white head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee. Dry cocoa bitter finish.
Bottle, 355 ml. Overall pleasant, well balanced porter. Carbonation is felt, but not too prominent. Had this with thai food (prawns) at home, would try again.
Butelka. Aromat kawy zbożowej, czekolay mlecznej. W smaku goryczka lekka, trochę jakby popiołowe, niesamowicie głakie, słodkawe.

Aroma: roasted malt, caramel, bitter chocolate.
Appearance: deep brown color and amazing beige head.
Taste: low bitterness, roasted malts, caramel, coffee, bitter chocolate, slightly acid, dry, smooth.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Amazing porter, really drinkable and roasted. Prima.

Pours deep brown almost black colour with a huge fluffy beige head. 
Heavy (roasted) malty aromas. Mostly coffee with hints of dark fruit, dark chocolate, and chocolate coated cherries. 
Medium bodied. On the palate it tastes mostly of coffee and dark chocolate. Mildly bitter in the aftertaste with some fruity sourness. Its a very nice porter.

33cl. bottle at HopDoc. Pours very dark brown, black, with a medium creamy beige/ brown head.
Aroma: vanilla, chocolate, dark fruits, roasted malt
Taste: medium sweetness, chocolate bitterness, notes of dark fruit, roasted malt and coffee
Palate: medium body, light carbonation, long roasted aftertaste
Overall: a solid porter, definitely in my top

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2016 I bought this bottle at Amstein. I drank it at home. In my opinion, this beer is a diamond. It is just a delicious porter. The color is a deep black, thin foam, opaque. The carbonation is regular. The taste is really typical of this beer, I didnt try until now a similar porter. There are roasted malt, touch of coffee and an extraordinary note of pear, giving a really nice side of sweetness, hop, well balanced. It is one of my favourite beer.
Black color with a good tan to brown head. Light smoked aroma. A little sweetness and liquorice taste. Dry finish.

dark black colored
aroma of malt, chocolate
medium body, hint of hip and bitterness
Dincroyables arômes fruités, de fruits rouge, de prunes, de fruits secs, de raisin et de tonneau.

Dark black color with light head. Good Belgium Lacing. Intense sweet aroma. Full body, light carbonation. Flavors of Grain and Herbal hop. Nice balance of sweetness and bitter. Very good porter flavor and craftsmanship.
Bottle. 0,355L. Price 2,19. Labai grai spalva, puikios putos...Geras skonis ir kvapas...Jeigu ne, didelė, kaina, būtų vienas mėgstamiausių
Bottle 33cl. Deep black with a fluffy off white head that stays nicely. Aroma of malts and surprisingly some fruits (like raisins?). The taste is very mild. Bitter, not very complex, but quite well.

Licht rokerig, rozijnen en gedroogde dadels in aroma. Smaak heeft eenzelfde rokertje, kruidje en pure chocolade, niet super vol maar wel met voldoende pit. Nasmaak ebt weg, beetje droog zelfs. Bijna zwart met beige top.

Schwarz wie die Nacht mit herrlich dichtem Cappuccino-Schaum. In der Nase tolles Kaffee-Röstmalzaroma. Im Trunk leichte Süße, dann plötzlich etwas stärker werdend, Kaffee, Schokolade, sehr rund und abgewogen. Ein astreines Porter.

Dark brown to black beer with a one finger high beigebrown, creamy head. The lacing stays on the glass in large chunks. 

Nose: Dark fruit, chocolate, whipped cream, vanilla, coffee beans, roasted malt, dark bread and molasses. 
Taste: Molasses. Very malty (roasted), cocoa, cold brew coffe, coffe grind, licorice and caramel. 
Mouth: Creamy mouthfeel. Low carbonation. Sweet in the middle with a dry, bitter ending. 

Beatiful porter!

Bottle 0.355L.
Dark brown body with a large, frothy, tan head, mostly lasting with fair lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty (roasted, light caramel) aroma with smoked character and notes of coffee and licorice.
Moderate bitter and light sweet flavour; some dark chocolate notes in the finish.
Medium-to-full body with oily texture; soft carbonation.

Poured into a taster showing pitch black center with thin coffee brown translucent rims and a thin layer of latte colored foam. 

The nose shows a lot of sweet molasses with hints of toffee and caramel. 

The palate is light bodied and carbonated. Seems to have a sweet barleywine forwardness that is in the background but is clearly dry. This aspect is very interesting. Closer to a barley wine in my opinion but the finish is a clean light bodied porter with a roasted malt bitterness. Definitely interesting, just not so great.

Bottle.

A- Roasty, milk chocolate, dark fruits.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head.

T- Milk chocolate, roasty, slightly bitter cocoa, dark fruits.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, complex finish.

O- Nicely executed. A balance of many flavors. The chocolate and roastiness were obviously welcomed but the addition of what felt like some subtle dark fruits such as prunes or grapes in there was a nice added touch.

Butelka 0,355l prawie bączek. Kolor ciemnobrązowy, mętnawy, piana średnia, pięknie oblepia szkło. Aromat palonych słodów i czekolady, smak karmelowy, lekko kawowy. Piana zostaje na szkle i pięknie oblepia, bardzo dobry porter.
Bottle at Huis place. Full roasted flavor, some hop, sweet and dry bitter end. Good go to porter. Backlog from 2014/11/01.

Black colour, off white head that last forever, great lace. Smell of dark fruits, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Medium body ( I miss some more here), good carbonation. Taste of chocolate, dark fruits, coffee, licorice, caramel.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2016 Bottle, 355ml. Pours with a large dark tan head with brilliant lacing, floating on top of a marvellously dark, almost black liquid with reddish tones. The aroma is rich: toffee and burnt sugar... especially a dark chocolate to cocoa powder aroma. Coffee, pure cocoa flavours perfectly balanced with the smooth oily creaminess, some smoky notes. Medium body. Very drinkable and smooth.
0,33l. Pours deep dark brown with medium tan head. Aroma sweet, chocolate, bit sweet, malts. Taste roasted malts, coffee, caramel. Medium body, creamy, nice long finish.
0,355 l bottle Vinmonopolet. Aroma is malty, roasted and chocolate. Taste is sweet, roasted, chocolate, some licorice and some hops. A nice bitterness in the end. A nice porter!!

How: Bottle..
Where: SBWF 2015.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, chocolate, caramel.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, some coffee, roasted malt, some fruit.
Drank from a pint glass poured from a bottle. Pours a nice black color with decent amount of beige head. Has sweet aromas. Has a sweet taste a bit off putting finish.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 it pours a black full body.One finger head with medium retention.The aromas are burries,coffee chocolate.the taste is aroma like.slight carbonation.the aftertaste is sweet, slightly coffee, chocolate like.Nice beer.
5.6%abv. Purchased in BottleDog, Merchant City. Recommended by staff. Nice coffee and chocolate aroma, black colour with brown head. Love the palate, very satisfying. Slight bitter finish.

33cl bottle at Merchant dog in Glasgow
 pours a a dark brown with a thin off white head
 Aroma is very little grain and not much else
 Taste is sweetish with bit of mocha,not much of a finish
 ok beer from a ok brewery,bit old fashioned need to upgrade their output,very boring beers
12 oz. bottle. Pours black/cola colored. Thick tan head. Aroma was very fresh, sweet malts and chocolate. Taste was sweet with slight bitter finish.

Caña en Cimmeria 13..11..2015 (r2912) Color negro intenso con espuma oscura más menos persistente aromas y sabores maltosos tostados algo quemados pero bastante dulces y con bastantes toques de caramelos tostados algo de regaliz ligeras especias y un poco de café. Ligero amargo final. Cuerpo medio fácil de beber líquido ligeramente espumoso. 5.6 vol que se dejan notal. Bastante buena. Una sorpresa beberla de caña. 
Botella tomada en varias ocasiones en el Lupulo

UPDATED: APR 25, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, liquorice, chocolate and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a ruby glare and with a medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, liquorice and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts.

Shared bottle. Pours is dark with thick brownish creamy head that doesnt last long. Aroma of roasted malts, roasted nuts, milk chocolate, fruity sour. Taste is light sweet, acidic fruity notes (apple), hints of bittery, roasty mouthfeel. Light body, thick texture, soft carbonation, coffee bittery finish.

Botella. Negra opaca. Mucha espuma. Aroma principalmente a caramelo con toque a higos. Agradable. En boca entra amarga y con cuerpo para acabar tornando a algo más achocolatado y dulce. De hecho el caramelo sólo sale en el postgusto y le da un toque muy interesante. Muy rica.
Bottle, average creamy light brown head. Smooth, strong and bitter taste. Notes of licorice, chocolate and coffee.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2015 0.1 l sample from tap at Craft & Draft. Clear, very dark red to black with a medium large, creamy, stable, brown head. Sweetish-malty, roasty, fruity aroma of raisins, dates, treacle, dark chocolate and hints of coffee. Sweetish-malty, roasty and fruity taste of raisins, prunes, treacle and dark chocolate, followed by a short, slightly bitter and lightly roasty finish with notes of coffee. Medium to full body, slightly oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Quite complex for this abv, very sweet and fruity as well. Nice!

12 oz. bottle, brought to Joes Halloween party by Daniel. Pours very dark brown, nearly black, with a brown, huge, foamy head. The nose is big, roasted coffee, caramel, bitter chocolate, and some earthiness. Sweet, syrupy, and malty up front, with a strong bitterness that balances out the flavor pretty well. Heavy body, creamy, lightly acidic, and hard. This is a very solid porter.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Bottle. Supplier: West Gate (Bath). Sour fruits with hints of smoke.

355ml bottle at Prestwick Pioneer, Prestwick, fruity, toffee aroma, opaque dark brown near black with a good creamy tan head, toffee, chocolate, very sweet, creamy, smooth, served just a little too cold, very nice as it warms.

Pours a dark brown with chocolate shake colored head. Kind of tastes a little like a chocolate malted too, but not heavy on chocolate flavor, just notes. A little molasses in there, some bitterness too. Good beer.

Form 0,33l bottle, BBD: 1 2017 Pours dark brown liquid, big frothy head, Aroma: rich coffee notes, dark chocolate, dark malts, sweet, licorice, Taste: medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light ot medium sour, roasty coffee notes, dark chocolate, hops, sweet, little acid, Palate: medium body, average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long roasty aftertaste, Overall: fine, enjoyed, very nice rich porter, very drinkable.
Great Porter. Simply perfect aroma and appearance. The taste is almost flawless.

Pours a dark brown with a thin off-white head. Aroma is dark fruits, caramel, and subtle chocolate. Flavor is dark fruits, slightly sweet bread malts, caramel, and some chocolate. Unique porter, and pretty good.

Brown to black color. Good head retention. Aromas of fruits, raisins. Surprisingly little dark malts on the nose. Has a nice fruity taste as well..slightly almondy. Balanced sweet/bitter, with a edge to the sweet side. Very easy drinking. Doesnt taste as dark as the color suggests. Clear and present hops character. Pretty good. Porters can be all over the place

-	Subtle, gently creamy, slightly rum & coke-y(!), cocoa-sprinkled, light porter.
-	Nose: Light cocoa, caramel-y, rum & coke vibes.
-	Body: Slight roasty, dark chocolate malt, some cream.
-	Finish: short-medium; more cocoa + caramel malt on the way out.

Delicious dark ale
.............................................. via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a blackish color with a good head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark fruit and hint of chocolate. Taste follows with roasted malt, dark fruit and trace of chocolate. Nice bitterness and a dry finish. Fairly full body, smooth and creamy. Has a good malty richness. Worth checking out.
Very dark brown foamy head, Cherry smell, Taste dark malty coffee. Well carbonated, yeasty. Good lasting head and lacing. Lovely beer
Very nice appearance. Smooth and pleasant chocolate aroma. Such a heavy bitterness is surprising for a porter. Full body and creamy texture. Soft carbonation. Good beer but not so special.

Bottle - Dark brown colour wih light brown frothy head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and toasted malts with a slight hoppy scent. Nice balance beetween malt and hops. It has a slight sourness in the end, wich i dont like, but its eounded overall. Light body, average carbonation, dry finish. It could use some more late hops. Nice.

Black colour, small brown head. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, cocoa, vanilla. Taste is dry bitter with roasted malt, coffee and hops. Dry roasty finish and bitter hoppy aftertaste. Medium body and average carbonation. Nice porter, well balanced and with good bitterness.

Bottle. Nice design. Dark body, medium head. Aroma has roasted malts and some lactose-like sweetness. Sweet taste with decent roast and milky notes. Roasty finish with plenty of hops. Perhaps the bitterness is even a notch too much to make it truly sessionable. But its still a great classic porter. Not much to add here.

Pours a dark brown color with khaki colored head. Roasted malt, coffee, and raw cocoa on the nose; follows onto the palate. Full bodied porter, nice smooth mouthfeel. Finishes with a nice roasty character.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 Wow! It took me wayy too long to drink this guy for the first time! First off it?s gorgeous! Black with loads of head. Chocolate chip cookies, annis, and mild coffee bitterness. Light body big flavor! Tastes like the base of the Merry Christmas just a bit more subtle. Makes sense theyd drink this in that windy cloudy cold and lovely city of SF. Filling but I could imagine this with a big bowl of stew or chowder. Noice!

Bottle. Opaque black color with light brown head. Aroma has coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate and ripe fruits. Taste is malty sweet with quite long somewhat dry aftertaste. Flavors of roasted malt, chocolate, ripe fruits and salted licorice. Drinkable and very tasty.

33ml bottle at Brudenell Social Club, Leeds. Seriously good porter, as always. Dark brownish colour, not much head retention. Dark chocolate, dried fruit, dates, liquorice, cherries, coffee. Medium/light body. Quite sweet, but not too sweet. Quite creamy palate, not as "robust" as some. Only rivalled by Founders Porter and Sam Smiths Taddy.
Большая кремова& шапка. Аромат обалден& бельгий& шоколад, сушеные фрукты и карамел& солод - очень комплек& как у бельгий& квадрюп& Вкус классич& горький с легким кремово- послевк& Хороший портер.

Pours dark brown, almost black haze colour with light brown creamy, stable head.
Aroma is without note of an alcohol, with hints of roasted barley, tobacco, dark chocolate, cherries and coffee.
Flavor is smoothy-fruity sweet, with malty notes of chocolate, coffee and fruity notes of cherries, strawberries and vanilla.
Malt sweetness is medium, hop bitterness also, body is sticky, finish is dry bitter long lasting. Carbonation is soft.
Really good porter.

Bottle. Nose is chocolate, cream, hints of latte, slight blackberry, hints of vanilla, very inviting and slightly sweet stoutish. Taste is bitter, chocolate, vanilla, cream, coffee bitter with a herbal hop note in the finish. The second sip reveals licorice, and a bramble and cherry note.

A lovely porter which errs on the side of stout to my mind.

Dark chocolate (like those mini Hershey bars with the red label at Halloween) and black licorice aroma yet the hops come through with a bitter chocolate flavor on the finish. Delicious. Poured from a bottle.

Buen aroma a caramelo y buena presencia, con espuma de escasa persistencia. Gusto a caramelo tostado dulce con ligero amargor final. Paladar agradable. Buena Porter quizá se echa de menos mayor riqueza de matices.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bottle, from Craft Beer Cellar in Waterbury VT. Poured into a pint glass, poured an opaque black with a light brown head. Thick, sweet & heavy, with hints of molasses and roasted grain. A beer with presence, best savoured in a comfy armchair next to a well-stoked hearth.
Bottle at home. Sweet dark fruit, caramel, roasted malt. Dark and rich. Delicious :)
Aroma de café e caramelo. Espuma cremosa, de baixa persistência. Sabor de malte tostado e café.
Draft - Dark roast and molasses sweetness. Jet brown with a brown head. Bitter dark roast, nice sweetness and a bitter finish. Solid.

A fairly flat nose of earthy and caramel aromas adumbrates the heavy silkiness or the pear, cocoa and burnt flavours which give way to dry bitterness. There is perhaps a very slightly cloying sweetness that detracts marginally from a wonderful tasting experience. The mouth feel is as luxurious as velvet cascading around the mouth. Overall a fantastic beer I was sorry to see the bottom of, best appreciated on its own.
UPDATED: AUG 14, 2015 A great little Porter! I?ve tried some with richer and more complex tastes but that doesn?t mean there?s anything wrong with this one. I like it a lot.

Brown beer, tan head. Nose is cocoa, malt, bready notes. Theres more flavor than the nose would suggest, lots of chocolate and malt notes, vanilla, mild notes of smoke and licorice. Finishes with garepfruity bitterness, chocolate and smoke notes. Pretty interesting stuff.

Bottle, 355ml. A dark reddish beer with a medium size brown head. Aroma is of spcies, nuts, alcohol, caramel and maybe coffee. Taste is bitter with a roasted malt character. Aftertaste reminds me of coffee and nuts. Its great. Nice and warming.

0,355L bottle (from beerExpress, Tallinn). Pours dark brown with light brown head. The head stays forever. Aroma is sweet, vanilla, malt, cacao. Flavor is sweet and bitter, dark chocolate, malt, fruits, and some citric notes. Finish is dark chocolate bitter. Body is rather light. Overall: very nice.
Pours coffee/chocolate with beautiful Amber lacing. Taste is slightly burned fruit with a pleasant finish. Overall a great porter.

Aroma: rich and sweet, caramel, fruits, chocolate, 
Taste: dark fruits, candy, a bit of smoke, a slight acidity in the finish.
Very pleasant and well balanced beer.

Bottle at Wetherspoons, Wokingham, 27th July 15. Black, aroma, burnt, cocoa, chocolate, malts. Taste is burnt, creme brûlée, caramel, ash, sweet, but with bittering hops cutting through. Pretty nice, and punches above its ABV
0.335 bottle from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Dark (its getting dark), dry fruits, nuts, chocolate, Nutella. Very earthy taste, dry finish, medium body. Nice!

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 WYGLĄD: Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, średniej wysokości, krótka.
AROMAT: Dość intensywny. Kawa, czekolada (praliny), nuty paloności.
SMAK: Ciemne słody. Przyjemny czekoladowo/kawowy posmak. Dobrze pijalne. Goryczka średnia.

Appearance: clear deep brown with a high rocky tan head, good retention and moderate lacing. (4/5) Aroma: roasty malts, liquorice, coffee, herbal. (7/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderate bitter, mild tart. (7/10) Palate: medium body tending to watery, soft carbonation, off-dry and slightly tart finish. (3/5)

A fairly unique brew - it smells and tastes hotter than the 5.6% ABV, but not offensively so. Despite that and the forbidding colour, its quite sweet at the outset, and the body tends to the light side. It finishes with a sharpness thats almost cola-like and tart. I like it. (14/20)

Marrom escura, espuma bege de média formação e pouca duração, irregular, cremosa. Aroma mais licoroso do que o esperado, encontrei mais passas do que café/chocolate, o que não deixou de der positivo. É no paladar que aparece mais a torrefação, café, cacau, bem ao fundo cerejas escuras, muito bom . Corpo e carbonatação médios. Aftertaste mantém a impressão de passas, café em segundo plano. Uma boa surpresa.

Poured from 1pt 6oz bottle. With my buddy Josh. Interesting color, dark brown, opaque with brown foamy head. The dark foam falls down within the light foam like guiness. Moderate chocolaty & burnt smell

Bottle from Hippo (£2.65). Black. Light brown head. It's quite sweet at first then it's long and dry, ending in tart bitterness. Strangely, the 2nd sip was the best, going downhill after that - as if exposure to air changed it somehow.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 355mL. Home. A black beer with a beige creamy head ; medium retention. Roasty and toasty aroma, coffee, herbs, licorice. Light to medium sweet ; medium dry bitter ; light refreshing. Medium body, thin creamy texture, smooth, average good carbonation, sweet toasty finish, herbal note ; light spicy. Overall, a truely delicious creamy porter ; great one !
Bottle to pint glass. No detailed notes - had it a bunch, really good example of the style.

A really nice porter who looks just like you would expect it. Deep black color with beautiful continuous light brown foam. It smells distinctly of caramel and hard roasted malt, but it is not enough to hide the tones of coffee and good licorice. The taste is very kind and very rich. It has only the sweet flavor from respectively caramel and malt, later, coffee slightly bitter taste note nice complex with a slightly sweet licorice. Comfortable long bitter aftertaste of coffee, and a little hop.

10.07.2015 İstanbul. Şişe. Çok koyu kırmızı-siyah bir renk. Kahverengi başta devasa, yarım parmak kalıcı köpük. Gazlılık bardak duvarlarında belli. Koku kuru kırmızı meyve (erik,Vişne), kavrulmuş malt, Sütlü (tatlı tınılar) ve bitter çikolata.
Tadım kavrulmuş malt, hafif acılık (şerbetçiotu), bitter çikolata. Damakta orta kalıcılıkta ve kalıcılık bitter çikolata ve kavrulmuş malt tatları ağırlıklı.
Net, kompleks ve buna rağmen dengeli! Müthiş bir Porter..
355ml bottle. Pitch black body with a huge fluffy head. Chocolate, some roasted notes, lactose, spices. Well balanced

Aroma: Roasted malts, clean wet hop.

Apperance: Medium sticky head, reddish brown colour.

Taste: Light sour friuts, roasted malts like mild coffee.

Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation and finish with quite long lasting flavour of roasted malts

Overall: Well-balanced porter, better the devil you know.

Dark brown to black colored, small tan creamy head, not very lasting. Aroma is of chocolate and roasted malts. Taste is moderate sweet, strong chocolate, bit of licorice, lots of roasted notes, bit of hops also, dry bitter roasted finish and after. Medium bodied, moderate+ carbonation, creamy.

0,355 l Bottle cereal, chocolate, coffee, roasty, herbs, brown, hazy, frothy, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottle 0,33.
Dark, creamy with small head. Light carbonation. Medium body. Aroma: roasted malt, smoked, dark berries, chocolate, coffee. Taste: classical porter. Good.
Meeldiva maitsega kerge porter, Lõhnas tunda karamelli, välimuselt kena tumepruun ja Püsiva õrna vahukihiga. Soovitan kindlalt maitsta.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours dark brown with small tan head. Aroma is sweet, roasted, malty, dark berries, plums, chocolate. Taste is sweet, really smooth and creamy, roast, berries, coffee. Medium body. Easy drinkable with good taste.

Escura,semi opaca,espuma bege cremosa com boa formação e manutenção;no aroma malte torrado,lúpulo,baunilha e notas achocolatadas;no sabor torrefação,café,chocolate amargo,corpo médio,boa carbonatação,álcool quase passa despercebido,final seco,retrogosto torrado. Porter gostosa e com boa drinkability,ótima referência para o estilo.
bottle to glass. solid porter. dark roasts, some choclate. taste and nose. id drink again

Been drinking this since the 70s. Took years for us to come up with comparable brews. I have no idea how to describe brews like most of you folks. I have been drinking craft beers since the Reagan administration. I know what I like and this is good stuff.
Bottle 0,33l from Pivoljub in Ljubljana. Dark liquid with big beige head, medium body and carbonation. Coffee aroma and taste. Some roastiness. Nice.

355ml bottle into glass. Rich caramel malt nose. Deep brown/red beer. Nearly opaque with two finger tan head. Slightly zingy mouthfeel. Milk chocolate taste with fruity/sour finish. Touch of bitterness late on. Good balance, easy drinking.

12oz bottle pour with thick dark brown color and thin off white head. Smell of coffee and dark chocolate with smooth full mouth feel. Nice flavor with little bitterness noted at finish. Really nice Porter. Will buy again
This is a solid porter. Poors a dark brown with little head and lacing. Has the smell and tastes of roasted malts
This is probably the best porter Ive tasted. Pours a very dark brown it a decent head. Great malt taste, background of coffee, bitter, smoked. No bitter or hoppy aftertaste, super smooth.
Botella. @La Taberna de Hank, Luanco. 13/06/2015 color negro espuma blanca, Aroma torrefacto, sabor dulce torrefacto. Cuerpo medio.

Negra profunda, opaca. Bonita espuma ocre, muy cremosa y con forma, abundante. Aroma complejo, café, malta tostada.. Muy cremosa en boca y agradable. Cuerpo moderado y carbonatación media. Inicio dulce y frutal que va evolucionando a un amargor marcado y seco de café, dejando un postgusto muy duradero en el que en medio de un fuerte amargor recuerda de nuevo tonos dulces. Muy buena.

335ml bottle at home bought at Ammersin5. BB 11/2016. almost black color. small coffee colored head. smells of spices, malty roast, light dried fruity, milky smell, coffee. quite nice smell. medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of malt roast, some coffee, spices, light sour, a bit herbal, some pines, acidic, light dried fruits. finishes roasty bitter and with some pine notes. quite nice, drinks great and easy.
Nice flavor. Easy to drink. Not heavy. Light enough that you could have a couple. Bottle.

Prezentacja:
prawie czarne z rubinowymi przebłyskami, piana bardzo obfita, beżowa, drobna, dość szybko opada do kożucha, super koronkuje
;
Aromat: 
bardzo słodki - syrop klonowy, rum, alkohol, śliwki, wiśnie, czekolada słodka
;
Odczucie:
pełne, gładkie, nisko nasycone, finisz palonego słonecznika
;
Smak: 
lekko słone na początku, potem czekoladowe na gorzko, przechodzi w słonecznikowy posmak
;
Ogólnie:
niezłe
.
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2015 A porter as a porter should be: roasted flavours, black with a brown head, bitter finish.
Appearance, aroma and taste characteristic of a Baltic Porter, but parameters (BLG&alc) typical for a regular ale-style Brown Porter. Magic.

ganz ordentlich

-im antrunk karamell,toffee,Rosinen
-für ein porter recht große mittel-bittere hopfennote
-wenig kohlensäure
-wenig ausgeprägte röstige kaffeenote
-wässrig,hopfig und kaffee im abgang

Bedeutend süßer als andere Porter.
Die Hopfennote war etwas zu stark für den stil.
Overall good taste, creamy nd very goog apernce. Good beer to go down together a smoked meat sandwich,
Bottle from Saveur Bière. Big creamy head, dark brown body. Weak smell of roasted hops, hints of chocoalte and vanilla. Salty and bitter taste of oats and coffee. Well balanced brew.
Drank from a bottle. Quite nice and very smooth. The beer has a roasty taste with sweet maltyness.
Cor preta. Espuma boa, bege e persistente. Aroma maltado e café. No paladar caramelo, chocolate, café e grãos torrados. Encorpada. Retrogosto agradavelmente amargo. Deliciosa!!!!

ポーター   
香ばしい香り&

Low beige hue, black body, sweet fresh fruity aroma of plums, liquorice and fresh peels. Dark caramels, plums, prunes, candiced peels, dark grapes and black honey to the taste buds. Feels soft, fruity, clean, and ok body. Somewhat dry finish with more plum peels and sweet roasted dark soft malts. Delicious fruity porter . 355ml bottle @Hildr Gastrobar Tromsø.

Bottle. Pours black, tan - coloured head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, floral and slightly fruity, very pleasant overall. In taste its smooth, chocolate-y, slightly sweet with good hoppy aftertaste. Fantastic, complex beer.
Black/copper with small frothy head. Sweet and fruity start, then dry coffee, tobacco. lingering smokey bitterness. Pleasant.

Coffee, has that pilsner taste at first sips but darker flavor. Very light for a porter, but easy drinker because of it. Enjoyed it a lot. Bought a six pack (very cheap), so will be enjoying five more!

Butelka. Barwa ciemna, brunatna z refleksami. Piana kremowa, opada do niskiej warstwy, która utrzymuje się do samego końca. W aromacie przede wszystkim czekolada i śliwka. Wyczuwalne również nuty orzechów oraz nuty palone. Wysycenie niskie, goryczka niska - symboliczna. Zbyt mało ciało, co sprawia, lekką wodnistość. Piwo jest bardzo delikatne w odczuciu.

Marrone scura, quasi nera con riflessi rossastri, schiuma beige di media persistenza.
Aroma di prugna e ciliegia, caffè, cacao, liquirizia e zucchero candito.
Al palato esteri fruttati, liquirizia e cacao, successivamente si fa sempre più avanti il caffè tostato e una componente zuccherina che ne complesso ricorda il cappuccino.
Ben carbonata, corpo medio.
Ottima Porter, davvero piacevole.

5/2/15 (Bottle) - Pleasant chocolate, coffee and roast aromas. Nice dark pour with tan head. Sweeter tasting than I expected, aromas captured well in the taste. Very smooth going down. Overall good beer.

Cest un Porter surprenant en fait... Il est presque pétillant en bouche, me rappelant une certaine Noire de Chambly (Unibroue). Cest plutôt piquant en bouche et léquilibre est excellant. Pas trop fumé, juste assez mordant, sans être trop sucré. Rien de "wow" mais plus que respectable.

0.355l bottle from Csakajósör. Starts with wonderful thick brown-beige head that smells sweet and fruity (cherries) and tastes bitter sweet. Aroma also has nice port-wine or liqour characteristics. The beer is sweet and malty with some chocolate and coke in it. Some fruity moments, too little. Palate is not pleasant at all, coke-like, too much carbonation, fizzy. Sweetish aftertaste. Shows signs of complexity occasionally, but very unbalanced. Or maybe just not my concept: expected more from Anchor.
Solid porter. Wonderful blend of coffee/chocolate malt taste. The only thing with this beer it I wonder why it tastes so sugary....
Opaque black beer with a decent beige head. Its a typical porter but a seriously good one. Malty aroma, vanilla, chocolate and coffee. Nice bittersweet aftertaste.
Great ale! One of my favorite porter! Nice coffee and malts combination. Roasty

Very dark brown with tall frothy tan head. Light roasty and chocolate aroma. Taste- bittersweet cocoa and some sweet milky chocolate along with some light toasty bitterness. A mellow easy drinking porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smells very sweet and malty with some plum/black cherry. Not much to the aroma; it is not particularly complex or strong. Appearance is nearly black with an enormous cream colored head. Lots of lacing is left on the glass. Taste is sweet up front, then slightly bitter with a chocolatey finish. Refreshing and easy drinking with only the slightest hint of roast. Although it is dark in color, it shares virtually no characteristics with other dark beers. I really wanted to like this one and become more familiar with porters in general. I found this one to be weak in all areas: aroma, taste and palate. It does go down easy but theres just no depth there. I will not be buying this again.

From tap at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Black color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, bready, chocolate, light coffee, some smoked notes. Light sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle at the Free Press, Cambridge. Incredibly dark brown with a nice looseish tan/khaki head and generous lacing. Liquorice, coal, slate aroma: dark things. A candied sweet taste competes with fresh hop bitterness. Tastes stronger than it is, which is no bad thing. Soft but effective carbonation. A top porter.
Een mooie porter, mooi donkerbruin van kleur met een kleine schuimkraag. Aroma van koffie, zo ook de smaak.

bottle at home. Pours deep brown with a light beige head. Aroma is freshly grinded coffee bean with something floral to it, like rose petals. Light, almost watery like mouthfeel, yet creamy towards the mid and pulling dry by the end. Taste is green paprica, cold coffee and medium dark chocolate. Impressive given the low alcohol.

Bottle, 355ml. Dark ruby with a frothy, creamy brown head. Aromas of dried fruits, chocolate, molasses. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth chocolate sweetness with a moderately bitter, but surprisingly tasty fruity character. Modest, but very pleasant.

12 oz pour from room temperature bottle into goblet. Decent carbonation, opaque, blank as night, strong, pillowy head. Nose is dark malts, a little smoke, a little burnt, dark chocolate. Dry. Mouthfeel is a bit watery for a porter. A little thin. Taste is good. Dark malts, woods, earthy, a little chocolate, bitter, vanilla. A pretty good porter.

355 ml bottle. Pours an opaque, black with an average, creamy, brown head that laces. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate and coffee. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, liquorice and a hint of smoke in the aftertaste with a dry bitter finish. Medium body with a creamy, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation.

Really strong fruity caramel aroma. Quite syrupy tasting and a real hit of chocolate. Gorgeous dark colour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ook na de clam chowder, uit plastic of fles. Ruikt zurig naar drop, grappig. Mooi donker met dik schuim. Smaakt fris voor een porter maar wel lekker. Update: Iets dieper uit de fles minder fris, sterke en ook lekkere koffie smaak.
Bottle from drinkstore. Pours black with little or no head. Cherry, liquorice, slight leather, coffee. Lactose, chocolate, bittering dark fruits flavour. Smooth mouthfeel. Nice balanced beer.
UPDATED: APR 12, 2015 Really nice beer . The body and the texture of the beer for me was the most astonishing (perfect carbonation and a creamy touch) . The taste fantastic. I really enjoyed it.

Bottle from AH, taste @ home 03.04.15.
Dark brown to black color, with large beige head.
Aroma: dark malts, some coffee, chocolate malts. Medium body.
Taste: some sweet, dark fruits, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee notes, mild bitter good balance. Dry ending.
Beautiful impenetrable dark colour. Nice toasted aroma. Though the toasted flavour dominates, there's a pleasant hoppy feeling. Solid structure. Good scattered carbonification.

Aroma is quite weak - mostly dark malts. Taste is better - caramel, rousted malts, a bit of sweetness and some bitterness lingers in background. Nice, medium carbonization. But the best part is aftertaste - quite long and dry bitterness from malts and also some sweetness. More you drink it - more you like it.
Pours pitch black with a beige head. Roasted, coffee, light chocolate aroma. Flavor is sweet and bitter with notes of roasted malt, coffee, light hoppy and fruity.

355cc bottle. Pours dark brown with a dark beige head. Very pleasant toastiness. Mainly coffee with some fruit. Some sweetness but then the roast malt/hops finish it bitter. Very nice "Stouty" Porter.

Dark brownish color with a fine beige head. Ok lacing. Bready, coffee and roasted aroma. Medium (+) body. Ok balance between sweetness and bitterness. Average to soft carbonation. Toffee, coffee, roasted and a bit fruity flavor. Nice and tasty porter.[Bottle from Vinmonopolet Kiellandsplass in Oslo, Norway]

Kolor: czarny z rubinowymi refleksami. Piana: beżowa, drobnopęcherzykowa, puszysta, zwarta, dość obfita. Zapach: suszone śliwki, czekolada, owoce. Smak: niskie nasycenie, aksamitne, półwytrawne. W smaku przyjemna czekoladowa słodycz zbalansowana średnią goryczka. Bardzo delikatne ale bogate w smaku zarazem. Bardzo pijalne. W smaku przypomina czekoladowe pralinki z nadzieniem śliwkowym, rodzynkami. Nuty palone i orzechowe. Na podniebieniu pozostaje czekoladowo-kawowy posmak. Ładnie ułożone. Bardzo dobry porter. Momentami przypomina łagodnego RISa.

Bottle. Average brownish head with good retention. Very dark brown, though clear. Aroma is toasted, fruity (prune), chocolate and coffee hints. Flavours are roasted malt, burnt dried fruits and coffee. Medium body, medium carbonation, some acidity with roasty bitter aftertaste. Strong and very good porter.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Very dark, small head. Aromas of molasses, soy, plums, cherries and dark chocolate. Taste has caramel, stewed cherries, hop bite and a little umami. Medium bodied, spicy and drinkable. Really quite good.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2017 12 ounce bottle poured into a tulip glass, this porter pours dark brown with a khaki head. Has a nose of dried dark fruit think figs and raisins, light coffee, cocoa powder and toasted barley, nice creamy palate. Would recommend to friends!

12oz bottle from the state store 
Pours clear dark brown with a medium sized beige head that dissipates quickly, some light lacing. Aroma is roast, caramel, bready, bitters and chocolate. Taste is roasty, caramel, chocolate and bitter 
Ok, clean

Appearance is almost black, a two finger beige head which clings a bit. Aroma- caramel, biscuit, milk chocolate, bread, malts. Taste- smooth chocolate, milk, roast malt, burnt toast, chocolate hob nob, bitter chocolate, dry roast finish. Tasty stuff.
nice porter, bread, chocolate - coffee toasted notes, lively carbonation, smooth, easy drinkable...good

Really nice drink everythings ng a porter should be pours jet black with nice head nice aroma of Christmas cake and raisen tastes of dark berries with their alcohol subtly cutting through hats off anchor an excellent beer
