Flasche (355 ml) von Bierlieb, Berlin. - Tiefdunkles Kastanienbraun, beinahe schwarz; sahniger beigefarbener Schaum. - In der Nase traubenzuckerartige Süße, milde Röstnoten, herb süßsaure Frucht und holziger Hopfen. - Antrunk schlank und überraschend süßlich-dunkelmalzig mit Traubenzucker und kräftigen Röstaromen, die in eine etwas unmotivierte Fruchtigkeit eingebettet sind und dadurch nicht voll zur Geltung kommen. Mild rezent, samtig im Mund aber fast schlank. Im weiteren Verlauf breitet sich doch noch erdig-holzige Hopfenherbe aus, die mit kräftiger Bitterschokolade in einen langen, kaffeebitteren, recht trockenen Nachtrunk mündet. - Eigenartiges Porter mit nicht ganz stimmigen süßlich-fruchtigen Aromen.

Couleur noire, mousse beige qui disparait. Nez malté caramel, fruits noirs (figues sèches, raisins secs), chocolat, notes fruitées. Gout malté, chocolat, fruits noirs, raisin sec, caramel cuit. Bon corps. Fin Fruité, caramel et chocolat onctueux et notes grillées.

Aroma of dark chocolate malt and coffee. Tastes amazing with a full dark malt taste with hints of coffee and prunes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Masuyos in 2014. Poured into a shaker pint. Deep dark brown with a long lasting beige head. Chocolate malt, coffee and prune on the nose. Tastes the same with a bit of roasted coffee and dark chocolate. Silky mouthfeel. Really well-balanced and not overly sweet. Top class porter.

From 345 ml bottle. Pours a deep dark brown with a thick lasting latte-coloured head. Aromas of raisins, currants, chocolate, coffee and cherry. Taste starts off with a rich dark fruits before a smooth coffee-like bitterness comes in. Thats followed up by gentle milk chocolate and hints of cherry and smoke. Creamy mouth feel. Beautiful, complex and balanced - excellent porter.
Bottle 0,33 ml. Dark, almost black with small head and nice lacing. Sweet aroma, chocolate and coffee. Taste also sweet, chocolate and coffee. Great beer.

Great awesome sweet aroma. Cherry in chocolate notes, coffee with milk, dark malts, Porto wine, very very mature pineapple. Its a black beer with ruby reflections. Medium, tanned, steady head. Nice lacing. Its definitely a sweet porter. With similar notes in taste. Mostly cherry in chocolate, milk chocolate. In aftertaste theres a small bitter note with tanned flavours. The mouth feel is very good. Its smooth, clear, a little bit to much carbonated. In overall its really well made porter.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2015 Pours black with a thick tan lacing head. Aromas of chocolate and malt. Flavours of roasted malt, chocolate, oatmeal, hops. Not too sweet, just enough bitterness and very easy drinking. Top notch porter.
Black, strong beige head. Roasty cocoa and chocolate nose. Medium bodied, roasty, smoky, intense coffee and cocoa, hints of vanilla. Finishes chocolatey bitter. Delightful.
Clear dark color. Very good foam with amazing lacing. Roasted barley, fruits and chocolate in aroma. More coffee in flavor. Very good bitterness.

This beer pours a dark brown with some ruby shining through it when held up to the light. There is a small tan head that left a little bit of lacing around the glass. The aroma is roasted barley malt, some chocolate. In the taste is where this beer really comes alive. I get dark fruits, hop bitterness, chocolate, oatmeal, and some coffee. The mouthfeel is on the medium to heavy side. I really enjoyed this beer.
Black with tan head. Chocolate, dried fruits, leather and some coffee. Fruity and chocolate finish. Overall: Enjoyable.
A strong porter that is very dark and blends nice amount of hops with a well balanced malts. Dark and think with a nice creamy head.

Big beige head dark pour medium carbonation aromas chocolate rich coffee dark fruits cocoa the flavours malt chocolate and cocoa a dry note roast coffee richness of fruits mild bitter good balance the finish okay porter good malt tastes hops has a moist and dry note good on palate goes down well
Smells like roasted chocolate, dark brown with a creamy tan head, tastes of quite bitter chocolate with very smooth nutty finish. really good!

355 ml, flaske, 5,6 % ABV, BB 09/2015, købt i SuperBest i Rødovre Centrum
Sort, rolig og ufiltreret amerikansk Porter med 2-3 cm moccafarvet skumkrone, som svinder til kant og overflade efter en halv snes minutter.
Spændende aroma: tørret frugt henad rosin. Desuden chokolade, ristet malt, læder-aroma, alkohol, skunky.
Smagen er solid bitter, let sur og en endnu lettere og fjern sødme. Ganske fuldendt, fyldig og i fin balance. Og rigtig meget smag i de beskedne 5,6 %.
Mellem fyldig krop, olieret konsistens og fin naturlig karbonering på et medium niveau.
Eftersmagen er bitter og middel lang.
Bedste Porter jeg har smagt, og det skyldes den fantastiske sammensætning smagselementerne imellem samt den fine balance.

Jet black, rocky tan head with a decent lace. Nose is coco, chocolate malt with hints of dark fruit. Bittersweet. Middle is chocolate, currants, dark cake like sweetness. Finish has a nice little hop kick to finish the show. Tour de Force brewing.
Was expecting bit better, nevertheless very nice porter. Simply very good but to grade more, it would be an overrate. drinking after IPA, so have to try once again for more precise verdict

This brew is slightly sweetish with a fruity bitterness. Less dry than other Porters though. Hints of caramel. The body is too light for my idea of a perfect Porter and the finish is bitter sweet but far too short.
The Porters in the London docks would have been on strike if theyd got this one

Bottle 35.5cl. Pitch black with a red copper hue, large frothy tan head, good retention, ample lacing; sweet malty aroma, roasted, dark chocolate, coffee, bit nutty, spicy notes; smooth taste medium sweet, good chocolate bitterness; full body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation, aftertaste roasted sweet bittersweet, chocolate, fruity and spicy notes, lingering chocolate bitterness in the finish; excellent porter.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, Pod Mosteczkiem. Ciemny, prawie czarny, z dosc skapa piana szybko sie redukujaca. Aromaty palone, popiolowe, owocowe (sliwki), troszke kawy. W odbiorze taki ziemisty. Smak jest kontynuacja aromatu, ale jest chyba bogatszy, czuje sie tez karmel, posmaki tostowe, chlebowe. Goryczka wyczuwalna. wysycenie niskie. W caloksztalcie - na pewno dobre, takie eleganckie piwo. ale strasznie grzeczne zarazem. byc moze niepotrzebnie przed wyborem zerknalem na oceny, wiec mimo, ze ewidentnie dobre piwo, to rozczarowany bylem ;)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

355 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours black with off white head. Not quite opaque, with some red tinges when you hold it up to the light. Nose is roasted malt with some cherry, fruity notes. Nice creamy mouthfeel. Mild bitterness, bittersweet chocolate. Flavours seems to get better with each sip. Delicous smokey, roasty notes linger at the back of the throat on the finish, which makes it very hard to drink just one. I really like this brew.
Dark, dark fruits followed by some bitter chocolate. A ldelicious porter!
Super dark in color, tan/off-white head. Aroma of roasted nut, sweetness. Taste is of roasted nut and malty hops.
One of the best low-ABV beers out there. Drank with Kaspar at home 4-2-2015. Soft, creamy taste. Hints of coffee and bitterness as well. Nice combination between dark tastes and hopes. Good.

Bottle. Dark brown with large creamy beige head. Aroma chocolate, plums. Quite strongly carbonated. Medium body. Taste mainly coffee, roasted malts.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!
Bottle a dark brown colored beer with a white head aroma malts some roasted malts fruits dark fruits spicy and hops flavor malts some roasted malts fruits dark fruits laurel spicy and bitter hops

Dark brown color with rich beige head. Roasted chocolate, coffee beans and dark fruits are mostly present on the aroma. Light to medium body. taste has roasted malts, with dark coffee and chocolate, cherries, toffee and some grassy notes. Aftertaste has a slightly and pleasant bitter character. Very smooth and balanced American Porter.

Bottled. A very dark red-brown - almost black - with a small light brown head. Boozy aromas of chocolate, black cherry, dried fruit, and just a hint of coffee. All those aromas a present in the mouth too; a sweet start with a drier, slightly smoky finish. Excellent.
Strong aroma. Roasted. Dark black. Kinda creamy. Aftertaste is very reminiscent of coffee. I dont know if this is the right word, but there is something pure about this. Well done.

Bottle @ home. Marrone, velata, con schiuma beige finissima, e persistente. Aroma piuttosto intenso. Caffè, cacao in polvere, toffee, frutta secca (nocciole) , leggermente erbacea da luppolo. Gusto abboccato allingresso, acidulo, maltato e tostato, divine amaro nel prosieguo della bevuta. Poco carbonata, molto gentile, rotonda e piena. poco calda, ma equilibrata ed armonica.

Pours black with a visible fizz and very little head. Smells like treacle with a hint of black cherry. Slightly too fizzy but fades to a pleasant creaminess. Treacly taste with slight hint of cherry. (K)
Svart med høyt lys brunt skum. Melkesjokolade, godt moden banan og noe mørke frukter. Bittersøt smak. Brent karamell, mørk sjokolade og kaffesmak. Fyldig. Lett bitter avslutning.
355ml bottle from the LCBO. Dec 14. Black opaque body with a thin beige head. Mostly roasty flavors, extremely sessionable, an oily texture which was perfect for the style and purpose of the beer.
Taken from old ratings. 2008. Bottle poured to glass..___________________((_________

Bottle from Seoul Plaza. Aroma dark roasted, chocolate, light fruity. Clear colour, very dark, moderately thick texture. Moderately stable head. Taste is very smooth and nicely balanced. Equal intensity malty sweetness, toffee, fruity flavours, and dark bitter roasted, chocolate flavours. Finishes bitter with a definite hops presence, grassy. True to style and very enjoyable beer.
How: Bottle. Appearance: Black with a tan head.. Aroma: coffe,dark chocolate. Palate: full body, creamy, smooth carbonation.

Bottle from Au Grain dOrge - Black color with a nice tan head, fully lasting and good lacing on the glass - Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, mellass and chocolate, dried fruits (raisin) - Flavor of roasted malt, earthy hops, bitter chocolate and dried fruits - Light/medium body, medium bitterness, good carbonation, bitter dried fruits mellass finish - Good but simple porter
Currently I am updating my ratebeer with al the beers I drank but was too lazy to rate at the time. I give the scores I gave back than. If I drink the beers again I might re-rate them.

Perfect aroma of roasted coffee beans and toffee. Great, thick, tan head with a lace that lasts for a good while. Chocolate notes in the begging, but it gets more complex after a few sips, which results in a liquorish taste that lasts through the palate. Great, artisanal porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very tasty licorishy beer. Tasty. Gorgeous in the glass. Laacing beautiful. Yum uum. X second rating it is better. Taste nice mor licorise. Roch and non. Inspire, entertain, surpass your imagination its limitless.
Bottle at home. Pours deep brown color, small beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, ash. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet, coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt.

12 oz Bottle. Appearance is dark caramel color with loads of beige head. Aroma is malty, coffee, and some herbal notes. Taste is dominated by sweet, caramel malts, coffee with a anise bitterness. Palate is medium-bodied, very smooth texture, and a bitter finish. Ok Porter but was slightly put off by the heavy licorice taste.
Bought this to use in my winter stew. Kept some by for tasting. Really nice malty aromas, smooth and easy to drink. Nice.

Di colore marrone scuro, vicino al nero, ma con riflessi rossastri. La schiuma è di buon livello, molto compatta, aspetto cremoso ed una buona persistenza. Al naso, troviamo unintensa miscela di aromi, partendo da frutta scura, passando al cioccolato, ed infine arrivare ai più intensi di caffè e malto torrefatto. In bocca si fà subito sentire la presenza di caffè, per poi virare su caramello e frutta scura; retrogusto denso e lungo di malto torrefatto, con una leggera sfumatura smoked.

De color marrón oscuro, cercano al negro, pero que muestra brillos rojizos. Carbónico leve y de burbuja fina, con una espuma de amplitud media y de color café. Muy compacta, aspecto cremoso y de buena duración. 
 En nariz aparece un intenso aroma mezcla de caramelo y malta tostada. Los matices torrefactos en un primer contacto donde asoman granos de café conducen a otras notas más ocultas como chocolate negro, frutos secos y humo.
 El cuerpo es bastante ligero y la textura muy suave, para tratarse de una cerveza de este estilo. En boca se aprecian la malta tostada y el caramelo. Aparece algo de regaliz y de ahumado. Los lúpulos también se unen al conjunto hacia el final del trago, añadiendo un punto floral. Una porter ligera y que entra muy bien, muy interesante.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
This is the best porter I have ever had. An incredibly smooth flavor and texture. You cannot go wrong g with this beer

Bottle; pours dark brown with a tan head; roasted dark malt aroma with hints of dark fruits and a hint of chocolate; taste is sweet dark malts with chocolate, dark fruits and hints of nuts; light bitter finish; very good porter

Not bad but not my favorite porter. Has a licorice like aftertaste. Probably would not get again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Again, too strong, I think american porters are over tasting in alcohol for me. Ive always expected a more balanced beer than this one for a porter.

Not a big fan of this. There was an acridity, almost anise piece here that in other forms could have lended a great layer to this porter but here somewhat overwhelmed the taste. Looked great, with a tan head and a deep dark to red profile. Will revisit in the future in case there was something else going on here.

Deep brown to black color, light brown head. Roasted malt nose, chocolate, yeast, burnt sugar, hint of ripe fruit. Chocolate and coffee taste, roasted malt, hint of alcohol, bitter finish. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Porter 5.6% this beer gave me a fantastically thick dense tan foam and a great classic looking pour worthy of a Michael Jackson book. The aroma is savoury bitter chocolate with a rich roastiness. Medium bodied with fairly smooth mouthfeel. The taste is surprisingly bitter roasted malts with a nice depth of flavor - a bit nutty, savoury bitter semi-sweet chocolate with a hefty dose of roasted barley. While it isnt a hugely challenging porter it does have a lot more flavor than I expected.

bottle 355 mL poured in pint. deep black color with tanned creammy head. aroma are malts with roasted coffee. flavor is intense, good bitterness with intense roasted coffee, caramel, nuts and kinda slight chocolate finish, sliky sensation afterwards and some bitterness that lingers, really good, maybe my 2nd favorite porter after london porter.

Porter de 5,5 % abv, et 35,5 cl dans la bouteille
Couleur brun noir, dune opacité quasi totale.
Mousse beige foncé très crémeuse, stable à 3 mm. Superbe texture.
Arômes de malt cara, grillé et légèrement torréfié, cassonade, fruits mûrs, raisins secs.
1ère bouche soyeuse, au sublime ensemble café/crème caramel/fruits mûrs.
Arrière-bouche dense, très longue, parfaitement équilibrée.
2ème avec de nouvelles nuances déjà, comme un prélude à la longueur.
Arrière-bouche superbe avec un malt torréfié, des sous-bois.
3ème aux nuances délicates de vin, porto sur du bois de fût jeune.
Arrière-bouche malt/houblon très longue et profonde.
La longueur donne infiniment de nuances, avec une progression exceptionnelle. Une merveille pure.
Les jambes sont épaisses et très marquées. Magnifique.
La levure est dune grande veine souple.
Lalcool, bien que modeste, remplit parfaitement son rôle de soutien.
La finale est un pur élixir que lon voudrait éternel 
CONCLUSION : en ce jour du 70ème anniversaire du début de la bataille de Bastogne, quel plaisir
de trouver aux Etats-Unis ce merveilleux porter qui est aussi valeureux GIS venus combattre chez nous. Simply the best. Thanks.

12oz bottle from Downer Wine and Spirits. Pours a deep, dark brown color with a tan head. Aroma aroma is malty, coffee, chocolate. Medium on the palate with creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, chocolate, caramel, roasty, coffee, toast, a little nutty, with a bittersweet chocolate finish.

Prachtig bijna zwart bier met een mooie stevige schuimkraag. Geur van caramel. Smaak met drop en caramel, lekker bitter en wat zoet. Gedronken @home

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Gęsta, beżowa i obfita piana otula czarną z rubinowymi refleksami ciecz, ładnie krążkując szkło. W aromacie przyjemne palone nuty, czuć piernik, wiśnie w czekoladzie, rum, orzechy. Czuć tu też chmielowe akcenty w postaci czerwonych owoców i ziół, da się też wyczuć lekko winne zapachy.
Smak jest wyborny, lekko słodki, truflowy, fajnie kontruje to spora czekoladowo-palono-chmielowa goryczka, jest nawet odrobina wiśniowej kwaskowości, ale dominuje piernik, czekolada, kawa, likier śliwkowy. W posmaku suszone ciemne owoce, ciemny winogron, likierowy alkohol i pestkowa goryczka. Wysycenie średnie do niskiego, treściwość dość wysoka, ale dość pijalne (z uwagi na wytrawny finisz i niewysoki alkohol).
Bottle. Pour is black with a caramel head, aroma is toffee, malty, sweet. Taste is roast malts, toffee. Solid porter

Brown head, black beer carbination. Smell & taste of chocolate in a chocolate milk like way, Some water and at times some hop bitterness and roastness. A tad little sourness like what is tasted in a milk stout. Not bad, but not fantastic. Cheers!

355ml bottle from the lcbo
dark pour frothy head nice
aroma of chocolate and dried fruit
quite good
Bière amère. Avec un arrière goût qui dure longtemps et qui évolue. Bière qui ne pétille quasiment pas. Un peu plus légère quun stout
Aroma of sugar cane sweetness. Somewhat reminding me kasteel bruin. Quite light in the mouth but still interesting progression between first and aftertaste. Slight dirt-like aftertaste.

355ml bottle. Pours a dark, dark, dark brown with a large head of fine tan bubbles. Looks beautiful. Black licorice, dried dark fruits, brown sugar, coffee, and dark rye breads on the almost Dubbel-like nose. Taste wise, lots of black licorice up front, with a light menthol note, bitter coffee, and treacle that leads into molasses, dark bread crust, dry mineral notes, with prune, and a taste that makes me think of plum skin in the finish. So many Beligan dubbel-like notes. Its like a porter/dubbel hybrid. I love it. One hell of a porter.

Bue en bouteille de 35.5cl à la brasserire, couleur noire grosse mousse blanche effervescence moyenne, grosse attaque café et chocolat, belle longueur sur la fin avec une pointe damertume excellente.
Bue en bouteille de 355ml. Brun foncé puissant. Malt torréfié, café, et grillé au palais. Finale à peine alcoolisée. Good.
Black with tan head that almost disapears. Rich coffee and chocolate aromas and taste. Roasted malt taste.

Butelka 0.33L.
Wygląd: Czarne, obfita, beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa piana. Opada powoli i oblepia szkło.
Aromat: Aromat delikatny, karmel, ciemne słody, suszona śliwka, wiśnia, minimalnie alkohol.
Odczucie: Gładkie, kremowe, średnie do wysokiego wysycenie, ciało średnie.
Smak: Tostowe, przypiekane i palone słody dające lekką kwaskowość, gorzka czekolada, kawa, wiśnie, melasa. Słodkie ale fajnie skontrowane paloną goryczką na średnim+ poziomie.
Całość: Bardzo dobry porter.

This beer is really smooth it went down nice, it had a nice dark color and poured a good strong head that held well. This beer was not to bitter and it was easy to drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
355 ml bottle. Pours black with great brown head, that is disapearing pretty quick. In aroma its coffee and chocolate. Oily texture, bittersweet afterstaste. Very drinkable.

12 oz bottle pour. Pours black with a fluffy tan head. Very rich milk chocolate aroma with some malt too. Flavor is pretty rich at first. Full of chocolate flavor with a long, roasted finish to it. This is really not what I was expecting from this, not that its a bad thing. I honestly have trouble really saying how I feel about this beer. It is missing something that I love about porters, but I cant quite figure out what it is. I enjoyed this beer nonetheless. High drinkability and decent flavor. Would I put it in my top list of porters? I would not, though that is some stiff competition. Im sure Ill drink this again some day. Not bad.

pretty intense aroma of coffee and chocolate, roastiness is also pretty significant. Very nice, but could have been stronger. pours black with big head, that disappears a bit too quickly. Taste is mildly bitter, lightly sweet, quite thick. Overall ist a very nice beer, really smooth, carbonation is pretty low which makes it a good session beer.

Well it is said to be a porter, It is a porter aged with plum. Funny, but it has a strong plum aroma, like if I would place a dried plum into the beer for hours. Head nice, brownish, aroma of plum, plum jam. OK, I must be crazy, but this is a plum porter.
355 mL bottle. Looks like a porter. Smells mostly like a porter. Tastes like a porter, only more fruity (yeast?) and less roasty. Good, not great.

Beczka na Poznańskich Targach Piwnych. Aromat kawy i czekolady, bardzo intensywny. Piana obfita, gęsta, bardzo drobna, bardzo trwała o jasno brązowej barwie. Kolor piwa niemal czarny. W smaku nuty jak w zapachu i słodu palonego. Bardzo intensywne. Lekko słodkie z idealnie zbalansowaną goryczką. Odczucie w ustach bardzo przyjemne, duża treściwość. Kawa i czekolada na finiszu utrzymuje się długo.
Roasted sunflower seeds, a bit of chocolate and coffee. Pitch black with big, brown head. Taste is full, with some porter-like sweetness and lightly bitter.

Bottled 03/08/2012. Not sure why but I ended up aging this one. Pours pitch black with tan head and nice lacing. Aroma is tons of chocolate, kinda boozy, ;roasted malts. Flavor is awesome. I didnt know how itd hold up but damn. What a surprise. Delicious. Not weak bodied at all like I expected. Flavor has lots of chocolate in it. Some vanilla and some booze too. Almost a barrel-aged quality? Hard to describe. Really sweet up front and a slight coffee bitterness in the finish.

Bottle from local BD. Pours a thick, dark brown. Big, thick, caramel colored head that fades slowly. Malty, bready smell. Velvety mouthfeel. Slightly sweet at first, then quickly turns to a toasty caramel and coffee flavor. The finish lingers very long.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2015 12 oz. bottle from BevMo. The nose is dark malt to the heavy side. But to taste, traditional roasted coffee, molasses and bread-like flavors give way to a delicate base of hops and alcohol. The perfect balance results in a very big, smooth and satisfying flavor that is surprisingly sessionable. A classic porter.
Perfectly poured. Black with tan head. Scent of coffee caramel. Taste is coffee with bitter currants. Theres a woody background too. Cheers!

Bottle to glass,pours black with an average light brown head that rapidly diminished, but did leave good lacing.Heavy aroma of roasted malt with average hops.Medium body,lively carbonation with a bitter finish.Good flavor but a bit thin and to much burt in the finish.
Poured from bottle. Aroma of coffee. Medium bitter taste. Full bodied, creamy. Very nice.

Bottle into a pint glass. Pours a very dark brown, with a moderate tan head which slowly fades. No lacing. Nose is smoky dark malt, and the taste follows the nose. Hints of raisin and dark fruit, with a touch of smoke on the finish. Very smooth. Nice.

Piwo butelkowe. W aromacie rodzynki, przypieczony spód od ciasta, wanilia, czekolada, kawa, po prostu bomba. Kolor czarna smoła z lekkimi refleksami. Piana. Piana to poezja, drobniutka i mocno zbita niczym bita śmietana, przecudny lacing. W smaku cappucino, belgijska czekolada, lekka śliwka/wiśnia w likierze. Piwo gęste, pełne, o kremowej konsystencji, o średnim perfekcyjnie pasującym wysyceniu i przyjemnym słodkawym rodzynkowym finiszu. Dla takich piw warto żyć.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2015 Pours opaque brown-black with fizzy tan head and legs. Smells of dark, sweet, roasted, smoky malt. Raisin, ashy tobacco, leather, dark fruits (berries, blackcurrant), some hay/grass and yeast, boozy and sweet like a dessert wine but balanced by smokiness and hint of coffee bitterness. Tastes of sweet dark malt, some earthy/mineral bitterness, quite sharp acidity. Body is thin but relatively creamy and slick, citrus/burnt malt acidity, bitter finish. Lots of big complex flavours in this one, though I’d personally like it much more if it had less raisiny sweetness and more coffee/bitterness. Still a great porter.

Pours almost black with small tan head. Faint aroma of black malts. Rich taste, characterized by roasted malt but well balanced. Medium body, oily texture. Carbonation too high, but maybe due to incorrect pouring. Seems more alcoholic than 5.6
6 pack from LCBO. Creamy roasty aroma. Bitter roasty taste, with a light creamy sweetness. Dry finish.
Great porter, appearance is dark oil with tan head, aroma brings slight mocha and toast. Smooth and approachable-classic porter
Thick tan head. Chocolate notes. Black in color. Light to medium body, a lot of carbonation. Nice balance of roasted chocolate malts with some mellow hops.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2015 Bottle @ home. Pours with a pitch black colour, big long lasting rocky tan head. Aroma is medium malty, slightly hoppy, with notes of roasty malts and coffee. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, slight sour, good. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation.

33cl bottle at home. Dark brown with a medium off-white head. Medium body with low to moderate carbonation. Nice sweetness with some bitter tones. Roasted malts, dark chocolate, brown sugar, caramel, spices and herbs. A quality porter.
"one of the better standard (readily available in a sixer) porters out there. very smooth, lots of malt and hops, robust for the style. anchor hits the mark with this one."

12 ounce bottle. Dark translucent brown color with reddish highlights. Big rocky tan head. Rich roasted malt aroma has notes of dried fruit, coffee and floral hops. Sweet roasted malt flavor is rich and complex with notes of chocolate, coffee and toasted nuts. Chewy and thick with a creamy mouthfeel. Rich and earthy with complex layers of malt and hop flavors. This is truly one of the best American made porters I have ever tasted. Very drinkable.

This pours a dark brown color with a foamy, light brown head. The aroma is mild with caramel malts and sweet malts. The flavor is big and bold for a porter with a thinner texture that finishes slightly chalky. Really well made for a porter style brew. A must try for any porter lover!

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 355ml bottle poured in my Grimbergen chalice.
A: Very dark brown. Medium brown head. Lot of lacings. Beautiful.
S: Dark chocolate. Smoked malts. Hints of coffee. Fresh hops. Little bit of alcohol in the end. Delicious
T: Smoked malts. Hints of chocolate and coffee. Very nice hop sting in the end. Robust and balanced. Delicious, again
M: Dry. Medium body: Creamy. Medium carbonation
D: High. Strongly recommended 
Genuine Anchor quality. Delicious beer.
[ BA Review @ 1/21/2010 ]

Pours black with a white foamy head. Aroma of nuts, dark fruit, coffee. Taste is fantastic with coffee, almond, dark fruit, chocolate and an amazing complementary bitter hop taste that kicks in near the end. Fantastic porter, especially if you take the ABV into account this is a great brew.

12 fl.oz. bottle - pours black with tan head that fizzled out fairly quickly. coffee and dark chocolate in aroma. Carbonation more noticeable than expected for this style. Taste is coffee and dark chocolate, and something else I couldnt quite isolate.... licorice / aniseed ?

12oz bottles, once a year 2012-2014, last 10/2014. A debonair dry and balanced everyday porter full of subtle aniseed, minty, roasted and dried red berry sidetracks diverting from the main event, an expertly dosed Wiener mélange with liquorice infusion. In the league of Old World grandmaster Fullers: a humble sessioning classic to remind boisterous West Coast pyrotechnicians that bigger is not always better.

12oz bottle. Deep brown with a creamy tan head. Flavors are chocolate, caramel, marshmallows, licorice, dark fruits, roasted malts and coffee. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture. Deliciously unusual.

Jet black and pours smooth. Bitter coffee in taste and a little bit more carbonation than you would expect with a porter. The carbonation sure helps with making this seem a lot less heavy than all of the other clues would prepare you for. Delicious.

Appearance: pours with a small tan head that dissipates quickly, opaque black color, maybe some brown on the corners Aroma: sweet milk, coffee, flowers, subtle Taste: coffee, has a bitter punch to it, some dark roasted grain, moderate bitter finish Palate: lively carbonation, medium mouthfeel, bitter aftertaste Overall: a pretty good porter, subtle flavors with a nice strong bitterness to this beer, nor too thick on the tongue, gets better and more milky as it warms ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, creamy tan head, nearly opaque brown body nice lacing. Aroma big roasty malt, cherries and raisins, vanilla. Taste is coffee, vanilla, cherries, citrus rindy finish, tries to be dry, doesnt quite make it. Palate is nice, rich, not super heavy, but good for a porter, carbonation subdued. This is almost a cherry cola, or cherry coffee. Quite good. Wonder why Ive never had it before?!

Mooi zwart bier met een cremekleurige schuimkraag. Geur van gebrand mout, chocola. Smaken van gebrande mout, chocola en pruimen, licht rokerig en bitter met een klein zoetje. Een fris donker biertje met een ronde volle smaak. Heel lekker!

Pours a wonderfully dark brown with tan head of rocky foam. Aroma is caramel malty and hint of dark fruit/molasses(?). Taste is sweetish malt with slight hop bitterness. Very good and crisp, not a tongue-coater like some other porters.

Bottle. Dark brown beer with a small head. Sweet aroma, roasted malt, dark chocolate. Flavour of brown sugar and chocolate. Long dry finish with some switness. Excellent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Schwarz, kein Schaum. In der Nase dunkle Früchte, SChokolade, Milchschokolade, Karamell, Süße. Am Gaumen dunkle Früchte, Kaffee, süße, hopfige Bitternoten. Sehr dünner Körper.

Transfer from BA review on 10-5-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a deep-deep brown color with a nice thick cream colored head of one finger. The head has an amazing level of retention, very slowly fading over time to leave an amazing level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is sweet and roasty. The biggest smell is of a roasted malt mixed with notes of chocolate and coffee. The sweeter smells are of a molasses and caramel and a tiny bit of a wood and pine rounding it all out.

 Taste  The taste begins with a sweet molasses and caramel flavor with a good chocolate and roasted malt base. Some flavors of vanilla soon come to the tongue along with citrus hop as well as some other sweeter dark fruit flavors. A very light coffee and some nut come to the tongue more toward the end of the taste, combining with the rest and a newly encountered floral hop, which overall produce a nice roasty, sweet and lightly hopped flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  For a porter the body of the beer is on the average to slightly thinner side in terms of thickness and creaminess with a carbonation level that is on the average side. The carbonation balances the porter characteristics of the beer with the hop very well, but a thicker body may have been slightly more appropriate. Even with that said, overall the feel was pretty good.

 Overall  A rather tasty and slightly higher hopped porter. A nice take on a porter.

It has a dark brown/black body with deep crimson highlights and a tall three finger beige head on top. The head is slow fading and thick. It coats the glass as I tip it to my mouth and leaves thick splotchy lace patters behind. The nose is malty sweet and roasty with caramel, toffee, bready and light toasted bread notes with a hint of chocolate. Its sweet up front with lots of deep malty texture in a full body. Roasted grain, toasted bready notes, caramel and toffee blend with mild bitterness from the mostly hidden hops and finish a little dryer but still with some residual sugary sweetness. It has a smooth full feel with light carbonation.

Oh, thats good. The fruits sit up high in the flavour - ingredients from a great fruit crumble, with blackcurrant, cherries and a hint of plum as well. Roasted malts sit underneath, with some vanilla and subtle bitterness. Very dark, with a small white head. Body medium thick but smooth and easy to drink.

Aroma intenso de baunilha. Um pouco de mato e café no fundo.

Belo creme denso e castanho. Negra e opaca como a noite.

Ferrugem e defumação forte no sabor. Um pouco de caramelo, mas bastante amarga.

Retrogosto forte e amargo. Bastante persistente.

Boa mesmo essa cerveja!
Pours perfect. Aroma is coffee chocolate and very slight metallic. Body is fairly light and goes down very smooth. Flavor is interesting - not much chocolate or coffee. More metal than anything.

Pours dark brown, almost black color with minimal tan head. Aroma of rich quite sweet dark malts, some hops. Taste is dark fruit, followed by lots of chocolate. Didnt quite stand up to my expectations.
Aroma is inviting chocolate roasted malt. Taste is of that, together with mild hops.

A bang on porter that tastes like it sounds in the history books. Pours black with a big tan head. Aroma is of roasted malts, hops, coffee, and plums. Tastes plumy, vinous, roasted malts and dark fruits. Has the perfect porter body that is low in carbonation, very smooth and not too heavy. Has a bitter malt aftertaste and a touch of sourness. This beer was fun.
33cl @ spina. Una scura ottima con sentori di cioccolato fondente e caffé. Da riprovare assolutamente.

Almost black beer with a nice long lasting creamy head. Aroma is very malty, sweet syrupy, caramel, roast, raisins maybe and decent hoppiness. Taste is caramel and bready malts, a bit sweet, with bittering hops. Smooth. Really good porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355 ml bottle from The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Black color with a nice thin brown head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee and roasted. Taste pretty much the same with some dark fruits added. Sweet aftertaste. Medium body with medium carbonation.

Damn what a good Porter. As black as brown can get while still being brown, topped with a thin medium tan noggin. Smells of burnt toffee, dried cherries, raisins, molasses and toast. Bittersweet is the name of this Anchors game, the flavours play very interestingly on the tongue the whole time. It has a thinner body and livelier zip to it than I am used to for the style but it a welcome change. All I need is a pint a day.

Served on-tap at Shady McGradys a few months back. Reviewed from notes.


A - Pours deep, dark, brown; bordering on black; with a small half finger tall tan head leaving spotty lacing down the glass.


S - Smells of dark roasted malt, dark chocolate, toffee, and a hint of earthy hops. Simple yet complex.


T - Starts off with some chocolaty sweetness quickly giving way to a mix of dark roasted malt, lightly roasted coffee, toffee, and some earthy hops. It is sweet but not to the point of being overpowering. The finish is mostly dark roast, lingering for some time.


M - Medium-Heavy body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Roasty feel with plenty of it lingering through the finish.


O - Overall I enjoyed this one. It has all the elements I look for in a good porter. It possesses a good amount of sweetness with just enough roast to keep it in check.

Bottle from deeside drinks emporium. Pours a jet black with a thick Beige head which fades. Nice lacing. Aromas of roasted malts, chocolate and coffee with a slight ripe plum note. Lovely flavours of chocolate and dark fruits with an almost pine dry finish. Very nice porter.
Bottle. Great beer! One of the best Porters Ive had. Wonderfully rich, roasted, and complex. Bitter, almost chocolaty, excellent beer.

Probably my favorite beer from Anchor Steam. No frills, bells or whistles, this is just an incredibly solid Porter. Nice malty, roasted coffee/chocolate flavor that doesnt leave a lingering taste in your mouth like some others tend to do.

The smell has notes of chocolate, coffee and caramel. It pours black with a beautiful creamy head. 
The taste is rich of roasted malts, a lot of burnt sugar, coffee and dark chocolate.
Smell of burnt sugar, malt. Black colour, brown head. Aroma of burnt sugar, roasted malt. Bitter. Heavy body, oily texture. Soft and plentiful carbon.
UPDATED: MAR 25, 2015 Dark black with red and a big brown head. Aroma of chocolate, maple and red berries. Nice dry chocolate coffee and some berries and wood. Subtile

Tap at brewdog, Clapham. Pours a dark coke colour with a dense off white head. Sweet, treacly aroma. Medium body, light to medium carbonation. Lots of dark fruit, rum, lemon, coke, light chocolate cake. Rich, flavoursome and tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pitch black with huge brown head. Heavy aroma of sour cherries, chocolate, coffee. Tasting first hits you with a huge load of roasted coffee, then a pleasant bitterness, then sweet milk chocolate. Unlike other porters that are clean and dry, this is much closer to a stout with a fuller, more luscious body and on the sweeter side. Long coffee aftertaste. Creamy smooth mouthfeel like all Anchor brews. Delicious.

coffee, caramel, roasty, black, hazy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation
This is not my favourite porter.. i missed the kick in this..

feel like ive had this a million times and just not getting to rate it. good roasty malt character. a little on the bittersweet and hoppy side of things but that adds a little more excitement to what you usually get in a porter these days. well made beer. single from total wine.

Aroma: Malt: Rich, roasted, dark fruit, plums, dark chocolate, coffee, very complex. No DMS, No Diecetyl.
Appearance: Very dark brown body. Large frothy, rocky, light brown head. Good retention. Lacing.
Flavour: Malt: Medium-high Roasted, medium burnt. Dark fruit, light toffee. Dry finish. Medium-light fruitiness. Medium-high bitterness, medium sweetness. Hops: woody.
Mouthfeel: Medium-full bodied. Medium carbonation, creamy. Dry finish, with lingering bitterness, slight astringency.
Overall: Slightly too burnt, but otherwise an amazing beer.

355 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
12B. Robust Porter

From a six pack. Pours a dark black body and a thick light brown head. Aroma is of espresso, chocolate and malted barley. Taste is of malt and cocoa. Mouthfeel is between a porter and a stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark, dark fruits followed by some bitter chocolate. Like a dry Fruits of the Forest Gateaux. A ludicrously luscious porter. Smooth as a snooker ball & black as a moonless night.

Rated by BrewTom
Tap at the Brewhouse, Sheffield. Clear, chestnut brown. Thin, tan head. Cant imagine I can add anything thats not already been said. A lovely porter. Smooth. Fruity. Dry. Good stuff

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2016 Famous American porter with deeply beige (almost brown) foam, thick and creamy, and a near to black colour with a copperish hue. Rich malty aroma, chocolatey and caramel-like with lots of dark fruits and appetising spicy notes; taste likewise, a deep, soft, mellow, almost buttery dark maltiness, caramel and chocolate, dark fruits, finish toasted bitterness with an oily, vinous mouthfeel - or should I say, throatfeel. Absolutely delicious, a pity its hard to get in Western Europe, otherwise Id have this every week.
Very dark brown with stable, beige head. Aroma has chocolate and caramel, roasted malt also. Flavour has brown sugar and discrete, vinous alcohol. Good one.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2014 drank it @ Eldorado in Zurich. nice dark brown colour. texture of a stout but sweeter. drink cool, but not cold (10-12°C) hints of chocolate, rasted malts and caramel. "buttery" and long finish. not watery at all, just very nice.

Deep brown beer with some ruby high lights.
A large foamy head thats a nice taupe color and very dense.

A rich roasted malt aroma.
Complex roasted malt taste that has hints of chocolate and espresso followed up with a nice jolt of hop bitterness.
A nice rich mouthfeel with a dry finish smooth .
Bottle. Pours dark purple with big tan head. Nose is milk chocolate and malt. Taste is sweetness and raisin.
UPDATED: AUG 19, 2014 Dark brown black colour, light brown creamy head. Taste of coffee and some dark chocolate. Soft carbonation. Great bottle and label. Really good porter.
Pours jet black with a thick mocha head. Aroma of chocolate, roast and caramel. Taste is chocolate, coffee, caramel and cream. Really smooth and delicious.

Almost black body capped by mocha head. Excellent lacing and head retention. Roasted malt, cocoa, cafe and smoky aromas. Bittersweet chocolate, coffee, smoky flavors. A big creamy tasty Porter that is easily drinkable and enjoyable.

355ml bottle. Dark brown-black colour, tan foam head leaving some lacing and aroma of roast malt, molasses, raisins, chocolate, coffee. Taste is sweet chocolatey malt, tangy, with raisins, dark fruits, nutty, coffee, roast bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, sweetish tangy lingering roasted bitter finish. Very drinkable.

35,5 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Gall&Gall, Doorn.
Dark brown with a beige head. Sweet coffee aroma with roasted malts and dark chocolate. Nice round mouthfeel and a satisfying long aftertaste. Great porter.
Pretty good stout. Nice blend of imperial bitter and sweetness. Mild mouth full.
Nice brown pour with a 2 finger caramel colored head. Notes of caramel, and roasted nuts. Nice caramel flavor followed up by a touch of coffee.

Completely dark bodied, small to medium sized tan head. Sweet alcohol nose, although it has only 5.6% ABV. Very nice coffee aroma, but maybe a little bit too sweet. Some dark fruit too, sweet chocolate. Medium to full body. Flat to soft carbonation. Very nice. Very nice indeed.

(Za Popent 0,33l bottle)
Bottle, 355 ml from Za Popent, Ljubljana. Pours black with tan head. Roasted malts aroma with some chocolate. Roasted malts and dried fruits in flavor.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with good head. Aroma: dried fruits, plum, chocolate, dark malts. Taste: dark chocolate, dried fruits, coffee. Medium body, small bitterness.

Purs dark brown, almost black color with minimal tan head. Aroma is chocolate, malt, dark fruit, a bit of coffee bitterness in there. Medium to full body. Sweet taste followed by some bitterness. Overall, pretty good one, but nothing to really amuse you like I thought it would be.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2015 Black color, average sized brownish head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, cocoa, red fruits. Medium body, soft carbonation. Lots of lacing. Taste of coffee and chocolate, some fruitiness. Medium sweet taste with light bitter finish. Great porter!
Lots of porters but this is good for the style. Smoky toasty and roasty goodness. Nice easy drinking which I have had in bottle and fron brewery as a taste.

Hell yes. Anchors Porter may be four decades old but this stuff still kicks ass. This is a quintessential Porter. Not-quite-black color, tan head, and a roasted flavor. On the nose, Porter gives you a lot of cocoa and some fresh coffee. Taste is less sweet than the smell might make you think. Toasted malt, coffee, and bitter chocolate create a dark, excellent harmony. Mouthfeel is rich and a bit sticky. You know youre doing something right when your 40-year-old recipe is still considered one of the best for the style. The brewers at Anchor can rest easy knowing that Porter still rocks.

Bottle from Drinkstore, Dublin [260614]
Thought this was a re-rate...didnt think I hadnt rated it before
Pitch black, big tan head, nice lacing
Aroma of rich quite sweet dark malts, some spicy hop in there, sweet dark sugars, very soft roast
Taste as aroma, slight liquorice, not a particularly complex porter but some nice dark bit spicy malts in there
Palate - Soft carb., medium body, soft creamy. Finish is soft bitter, now getting a bit of chocolate on the tail
Overall - Id liked to have more than in this wee bottle, little roast in here, its mainly dark malts - quite a decent porter

Bottle from Magasin du Nord, Kgs Nytorv, DK. Pours black with huge creamy tan head. Intense sweet smell of ripe fruits, sweet botrytized muscat wine. Aroma is complex with dried plums, raisins, figs, dates, caramel, roasted malts. Palate is sweet but not too much
Nice drinkability. Refreshing and ligh body. Smell a little bit chocolate. Taste chocolate and a little bit caramel.
Alors la super bonne bière, ultra légère et aéré avec un pu.....de goût de malade !! Elle se boit tellement facilement qu on en veut encore après avoir fini...

BOTTLE 355ML

Look: almost black with red highlights, beige creamy head.
Aroma: intense dried fruit (prunes, raisins), some chocolate, toasty, not much roast.
Taste: mostly dried fruit, some chocolate, a hint of acid astringency, dry moderate bitterness, some ashes in the finish. An excellent fruity porter.
Excellent beer, great flavor and smell. One of my favorite porters. Sweeter taste and not too heavy.

12 oz bottle served in a Belgian snifter. "4JX" stamped on back label.
Pours very dark brown with a tan head that quickly reduces; fairly good lacing nonetheless. 
Aroma: mild with more dark fruit than expected.
Flavor: richer and less sweet than the aroma suggests. Hints of dark bread, raisins, and light spices, with some bittersweet chocolate and a touch of coffee in the finish. 

O: excellent porter, if not a great as the best (e.g., Fullers).
On tap at BrewDog Dundee. Pours black with a fairly thick head. Smells malty and sweet. Tastes of malts and honey. Medium viscosity.

"...is virtually handmade..." What the fuck does that mean? 

Good appearance: strong head retention, handsome lace. Aroma and taste are fruity & sweet, exactly what a porter shouldn't be. Wtf Anchor?

Opaque dark purple with excellent caramel-coloured head. Nose milk chocolate and burnt malt, Taste medium bitter, light sweet. Creamy texture. The finish is quite short and the sweetness makes it too cloying.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2014 Color marrón intenso casi negro, abundante cabeza de espuma beige que perdura; en nariz aromas a maltas tostadas, chocolate y café; en boca entrada suave con amargor equilibrado, agradable y largo pos gusto un tanto maltoso. Buen cuerpo con carbónico medio, buen ejemplo de una excelente porter, buen equilibrio entre el dulce de la malta y el amargor del lúpulo.

Based on the raving reviews I expected more. That said, it is a good porter. Love the texture and the fact it is not sweet. Flavor is subtle but a bit weak. Mostly coffee with some interesting elements coming through: a faint smokyness, bitter hops, caramel and licorice. There is some nice sourness and a long dry bitter finish.

Insane! Never tasted a porter like it although always stuck to British ones so far. Appearance: endless black abyss topped with a delightful copper foam. Smells like heaven. Cola, spices, chocolate, caramel and a really dark top quality single estate espresso brewed to perfection. Taste is first sweet then sour with a roasted malt flavour that lingers deliciously at the back of the nose. Must try more American porters.
355ml bottle from The Beer Cellar. Rating from January 2014. Poured a deep dark brown to black colour, slight head. A fair bit of malt in the aroma and a long dry finish.

Drunk 16/05/14 at a geek sesh with cam. final beer of the night, what a closer. cam recommended this as i wasnt enjoying imp stouts as much. this was perfect tbh. pours black with a poppy tan head. aroma of roasty malt, caramel, raisins, plum. body is full with smooth creamy fizz. taste is malty, caramel, slight chocolate, some tangy dried fruit. this shit was just like coke it was delicious

Coffee, coffee as the description says. But nothing much more than that. Starts of bitter with a light finish. Not a full bodied beer for sure. Always leaves you wanting another swig but never gets you there. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle
Appearance:Dark brown color (allmoste black) with a nice one finger white foamy head, leaving a nice amount of lacing.
Aroma: Dark roasted malts, a hint of caramelised malts, some coffee, chocolate, and a hint of red fruits.
Taste: PLums up front before the roasted malts come in adding some cofee and some chocolate in the finish. Sweet with a hint of bitterness.
Slick rich mouthfeel, above average body,slightly below medium carbonation, 

Classic Prime example of the style, Probably the first Porter I have ever had, and still the reference to me to any other Porter. In addition this seems to be quite good available worldwide. So No excuses to not get this.
Nice taste of Caramel and chocolade. Not to much alcohol and that makes it easy drinking. One of my favorite porter
Deep black color with a nice white head. Aromatic nose with roasted coffee and dark chocolate. Full bodied with an integrated bitterness and long finish.

Reviewed from notes.
I poured this one into a pint glass.
The appearance was a dark brown color with a nice one finger white foamy head. This one had a nice coating of lacing rimming the glass after the head died after a minute.
The smell was dark and roasty with a nice underlying chocolate coming in to balance the coffee that made a slight appearance.
The taste was roasty and sweet and still had a decent bitterness from the coffee coming about in to it. Theres no aftertaste but did have a quick dry finish.
On the palate, it sat about a light to medium on the body with a decent sessionability aspect to it. The carbonation was somewhat smooth and ends up leaving a decent coating over my mouth and tongue.
Overall, I say this was a good American Porter that I would have again.
pours black with a thick lacy light brown head. aroma is malt with a hint of coffee. taste is rich. malt and dark roast coffee. Some hop presence gives it a subtle bitter kick. Really good beer!
Bottle 35,5cl. Black with a small creamy beige head. Nose has hints of bay leaves, malt and liquorice. Nice rich taste which follows the nose and in addition some caramel. Medium length

In a bottle rich creamy and smooth. 
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Carmel is what I would explain this beer by, its a good tasty porter with a strong flavor lineup

Butelka 355ml.
OCZY : czarne piwo o sporej, beżowej pianie. 

NOS : piwo ma aromaty owocowe tak jak gotowane śliwki, delikatnie rodzynki, anyż, czarna czekolada, lody śmietankowe. Jest coś jeszcze czego nie mogę ogarnąć. Zapach oscyluje miedzy mocnym bawarskim pilsem a belgijskim quadruplem. Bardzo bogaty. 

USTA : piwo jest średnio gazowane o mocnym nasyceniu co jest zaskakujące przy tak malej zawartości alkoholu. 
Piwo jest zaskakujące. Bardzo bogate i zrównoważone zarazem. Nie za słodkie ani, pomimo podpalanych nut, nie idzie w cierpkość kawy. Gorzkość jest delikatna ale nie jałowa. Koniec jest średnio wytrwały ale bogaty w nuty podobne do czekolady, owoców i anyżu. 

ODCZUCIA : piwo jest z górnej półki. Trudno, przy tak malej zawartości alkoholu wydobyć tyle bogactwa. Coś pomiędzy Guinness FES a Rochefort 10. Naprawdę zaskakujące. Brawo dla piwowarów z Anchor. 

OCENA : 
smak : 8/10
pijalność : 8/10

Bottle into a tulip. Black pour and thick head with great lacing. Aroma is of dark fruit and some butterscotch. Taste is dark fruit - plums in particular - first followed by lots of chocolate. Super thick mouthfeel. Not my favorite porter.

Bottle at Piccadilly, Bodø. The colour is pitch black and with a medium, beige and creamy head. The aroma has lots of chocolate, dried fruit, sweet licorice and coffee. Fantastic. The flavour is more roasted with touches of cold coffee and dark chocolate. Has a slick, soft and rich mouth feel, and a light bitterness. An easy drinking, sweet and well-balanced porter.
UPDATED: FEB 20, 2015 Chocolate, caramel, soft roasted malts... some nice bitterness at the end. Smooth and malty like most things Anchor does.

Bona porter, mols tons torrats, però té un petit toc dolç.
Buena porter, muchos toques tostados, pero tiene un pequeño toque dulce.

355ml bottle from beers of Europe. Black colour, minimal brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malty. Taste has a nice light sweetness, with a medium bitter finish. If I was a porter at Spitalfields Market I would love it!

A really smooth and easy to drunk porter. No smokey flavor at all with a hint of caramel. Pours dark brown almost black in color. Had this one I. Myrtle beach. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black body, latte coloured, thin head. Faint malty aroma with some sweet tones. Nice, soft taste with some bitterness in the end. Smooth mouthfeel. Pretty good overall.
Small/medium beige head.. opage black colour... smell yeast malts hops.. taste hops liquorish..
Black with beige head. Aroma: coffee, chocolate. Taste: delicious chocolate ending with some coffee.

Beautiful black with a big very light brownish head Aroma is chocolate, roasty, oranges. Taste is softly bitter chocolates, coffee and a pleasant roast-taste. Creamy mouthfeel, not watery at all, despite being relatively light. Solid Porter.
Tap from Lazy Dog. Pours a dark brown with tan head. Aroma of malt, fruit, and chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee. Medium bodies. Tasty beer

Pours a very beautiful deep black color and is covered wit ha decent tan colored head that stays around for some time.
The aroma is slighty roasted, some fruits also present.
The taste starts with a nice bitterness and is followed by slightly roasted body, lots of coffee. Finishes with a decent bitterness.
Not my favourite Anchor, but very nice nad easily enjoyable.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown with a nice fluffy tan head. Lots of lacing. Aroma of malt, fruit, and chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruit, and some coffee. Excellent.

Porter squisita, decisamente sopra la media, con note intense di cioccolato, caffé, malti tostati e estremamente piacevole da bere. Una volta su questi lidi californiani, non puoi che gettare lancora e restarci!!

On draught at woodsman tavern - pours very dark brown with medium thick head, noticeable yeast. Nose if roasted malt, chocolate, coffee. Taste is of smooth creamy malt, smoke, and chocolate. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very nice Porter. Not very strong but with the right amount of coffee. The roasted malt prevails over the coffee flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Very dark brown color. Massive brown head, stays. Sweet, peppermint, hops, syrup, roast, flowers in aroma. Nice roast, malty, faint hops, chocolate, coffee in taste. Very well balanced and easy to drink. Long lasting chocolaty roast in aftertaste.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2014 355 ml bottle @ Ukkometso
Black beer with huge blonde cloudy head. Aroma has surprisingly lots of dark fruits up front, like a dubbel. Underneath are more typical porter aromas like roasted malts, licorice and loafy bread. Flavor is loafy bready, roasty and licoricy with dark fruits and apple sidenotes. Has medium bitterness on the finish, leaves a licoricy aftertaste for a good while. Palate is medium full and soft with a medium strong carbonation. Good porter with interesting dark fruity notes. Enjoyable like this but could work even better if it was a bit fuller.

En bouteille servi dans un verre de chez Duvel. Belle robe noire, mousse crémeuse, on sent le goût de graines torréfiés. Pour une Porter le goût est bien rond, idéal pour commencer avec ce type de bière.
pours deep black with creamy head...smell and taste is chocolate,toffee,coffee...full flavored with a nice smooth finish....top 5 porter that i have tried thus far.
330ml bottle. Intense and rich, ticking all the boxes with a nice smooth texture. Lovely stuff.

Bottle. Pours dark brown/black with a large tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, hints of dark fruits. Taste expands on this with vanilla, wood and hints of citrus. Smooth, light-medium body, medium bitter, long dark chocolate and vanilla aftertaste. Lovely brew!
Tastes of coffee, molasses, Tootsie roll, and maybe a barely detectable hint of orange. A little thin for a porter, but otherwise very good

Great taste of Chocolate and Vanilla. Nice lacing. Very Dark pour. One of the better Porters I have tried. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Beige head. Bubbly. Regular lacing. Color of coke. Coffee & toffee. Hops in the back. Not muddled. Smooth medium body. This one was a bit off (sour and stale). Not the best stout I had.
(bottle) clear very dark brown colour with a medium tall brown head; aroma of roast, stewed fruit, balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish; quite nice

This dark, dark brown Porter vergers on black with a thick dark tan head. It contains deep roasted coffee and nutty malt flavors. It is well carbonated and fizzy on the palate. It is much lighter than I expected it to be, which is not an unpleasant thing. This is a great, great beer.
0,35l Flasche. Schwarzes Bier mit einer festen cremigen Schaumkrone. Ein intensiver Duft nach Röstmalzen; schmeckt dementsprechend nach stark geröstetem Getreide, dennoch gut abgerundet.

Vigorous frothy 2" tan head, short lived with moderate lacing. Dark deep brown and clear. Moderate to strong roasted and chocolate malt aroma, some floral detected. Strong roasted malt balances with sweet and low hop character (although in the high range of scale for porters-a good thing for my taste). Finishes clean but with some nutty notes. Not as thick body as I was expecting. Great overall example of a bold American porter beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cask at Pure Bar & Kitchen; clear amber pour with a smooth white head, tangerine and malt aroma, taste is light citrus with some pale malts, ok.
Not as smokey as I usually like a Porter, but really deep, rich coffee and toffee flavours make up for it. Choclaty aroma, and opaque black appearance without much of a head. Good Porter.
Tap from Lazy Dog. Pours dark nearly opaque brown with a decent layer of tan head. Aroma of roasted malts and caramel. Taste of caramel up front with hints of roastiness.
UPDATED: FEB 9, 2015 Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Cerveceria Internacional. Color marron. Sabor a malta tostada, lupulo, chocolate. Una buena Porter, clasica.
Great Porter. Not too smoky. Beautiful looking beer with a wonderful brown / white head. Good lacing. Great tasting.

355ml bottle. Clasic porter pour. The smell is bubble gum and tootsie roll, huge turnoff. Flavor is better, still bitingly sweet and candylike despite the abv. Lots of butterscotch, english hop and yeast character, subtle finishing bitterness that is grassy, very few standard porter notes. Unfortunately a bit of a stinker. Edit, it get worse and worse... Keeping on drinking it... dont want a drain pour it is sickening.

35.5cl bottle @ home. Black color, minimal brown head. Aroma fine dark chocolate and coffee, roasty, malty, slightly fruity. Taste light sweetness, medium to heavy bitterness. Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, fine roasty bitter finish. Good balance, simple still nearly perfect.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2014 My first craft beer. I normally go for shiner and I liked this one. Nice head and mahogany look. Nice frothy head at first..
12 oz bottle. Poured a mahaugany-brown with a khaki top and great head retention. Taste of dark chocolate, malty goodness, slight bitter hop finish. Medium carbonation, medium body.

Had with the bjcp class group. Pours dark brown with a thin off white head. Aroma is bready and malty. Slight chocolate. Flavor is pronounced chocolate and some burnt roastiness. Lighter bodied. Finishes dry.

0.356 cl bottle. Pours dark brown, with brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, liquorice. Beautiful porter. Medium to full bodied. Complex, hoppy and refreshing. This is porter is a standard for me. A perfect combination of texture, taste, aroma and looks.

Earthy, roasty, slightly sweetish. Dark almost black with a thick, creamy, foamy long lasting head that leaves tons of lacing clinging all the way up the glass. A little lighter bodied than it looks. Very well balanced. Roasted malt. Toasted bread. A hint of hops to give a crisp finish. A classic porter. Nice.

12 oz bottle into a pint glass.

A: Pours a very dark ruby color. A shit ton of head is formed - its three fingers high, and light tan in shade. Its also pretty long lasting, with a rocky texture and some great lacing left behind.

S: Theres actually a lot going on here. The very first thing I notice is some plummy dark fruits and some chocolate. Backing that is a healthy yet subtle hop note. And theres also a decent amount of caramel, toffee, and brown sugar. Its not the biggest nose ever, but who cares? Its contemplative and inviting nonetheless.

T: The very first sip is chocolaty. The second sip is fruitier in tone yet with a hoppy finish. The third sip sees the hops mingle with the subtle roast to create a great coffee flavor. Some licorice flavors also appear. Its not suffocatingly complex; rather all the flavors are quite defined and readily noticeable...making its delicate balance all the more impressive.

M: Drinkability is the key here: its light in body and dry on the back end, with only a touch of lingering sweetness. Carbonation is actually pretty low, allowing said sweetness to appear.

O: This is probably the best robust (hoppy) porter Ive had. Everythings in good balance, yet the flavors stand out quite well. I could see this becoming a go-to porter.

355ml bottle. Deep black colour, with thick, creamy beige head. Notes note of deep toasted malt, chocolate and caramel. Creamy and smooth with a hint of hoppy bitterness. Full body, but highly drinkable.

Bottle 0,355L. Black as night, with big thick, light brown head. Aroma is suprisingly light: roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee and caramel. And maybe some tiny smoke note. Taste starts moderate bitter with dark chocolate and smoke. Finish is heavy bitter, with smooth mouthfeel. Full bodied beer with oily texture, but lack of aroma to be perfect.

A very good beer. Pours almost like syrup with creamy head. Head doesnt stick around very long, which is too bad. Smells of mocha, molasses, coffee, tabacco and at the same time tropical fruit. Very surprising. Taste is dry and refreshing, with lots of those coffee and malt flavors. Good near the end of a meal with hard cheese platters and dessert. Not a good pizza or pasta beer, nor a good before dinner beer.

355ml bottle. Pours deep black color, with thick, creamy brown, frothy head. Aroma of roasted malt and coffee. Taste is similar. Full body, oily texture and soft carbonation. Very smooth and drinkable. Pleasant, lightly dry aftertaste.
Dunkelbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Karamell, Schokolade, Vanille. Geschmack röstmalzig süß, Schokolade, würzig.

Great appearance at pour. Tan head. Full body, but very drinkable. Chocolate notes with a clean finish. I am not a fan of coffee and that usually deters me from many porters, so I enjoyed this beer a lot more than most because it wasnt dominated by coffee roastiness.
Great aromas and nice head. Subtle taste of blackcurrant and a nice finish. Easy drinking.

A note of deep toasted malt and caramel in the aroma that transfers to the deep and heavy taste. It does have a creamy mouthfeel as well. A little cloying if more than sips are taken. Overall very tasty and well balanced porter.

Lots of portery porterness in this one. Smells like porter. Tastes like porter. All roast nothing else. No sweetness. Just roasty tree bark porter. Not boozy strong but roasty strong. I need somethig else with my porter. This is just porter.

Nesten svart, medium høyde på det brunlige skummet. Aroma av sødme, i form av sjokolade. Kaffe også, men ikke mye. Finner hint av banan, litt overraskende. Mild og lun aroma! Smaken er først søt, så blir den mildt bitter. Kjenner humla i denne. Medium konsistens, litt tørr.
Pitch black. Thin tan head. Bit of hops with roasted aroma. Thick black palate. Raisins, roasted malts, bit of coffee. Relatively easy to drink. Not bad.

From the bottle it pours a deep red that nears black with a thick tan head. Mild roasted smell. Very light feeling with fine carbonation. Roasted grains, and a good malt/hop balance. Finishes dry and very clean.
Well balanced. Just enough hops to balance the malt. Pours dark. Soft carbonation. A little coffee and raisins, but mostly dark malts and bread.

Pours black with a medium sized tan head mostly lasting. Aroma is of dark roasted malt and caramel. Nice mouthfeel and creaminess. Taste is of dark roasted malt, coffee, a hint of chocolate and a slight bitterness on the finish. Very tasty and well balanced and a great accompaniment to deli sandwiches.
toast, roasty, chocolate, black, cloudy, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, average carbonation,
on tap. black body with brown head. aroma of roasted malts. taste is similar with hints of coffee, caramel and a dry finish.

Bottle poured a deep dark brown hue w/ big frothy head and sticky lacing. Big sweet aromas of banana and malt. Initial flavor is moderate sweet w/ a light bitter finish of short duration. Tastes are bready malts, light roast, and fruity esters. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, and average carbonation.

Pours black. Aroma of roasted barley, earthy hops, sweet milk chocolate, and some wood. The taste has coffee, chocolate, some cherry notes, and raisin. Medium mouthfeel that coats your palate well, pretty high carbonation. Classic porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black with a one finger head. Some lacing on the glass. Interesting nose with fruit and spice. Very rich mouth feel. Nice balance of alcohol. Tasty brew.

One of my favourite porters! This brew poured up near black with a mocha-coloured, very foamy head with amazing retention and lacing effects. Aromas of caramel, coffee, toffee, dark fruits (figs, raisins), and a touch of molasses. Flavours of the same in a medium-bodied brew. Extra creamy and smooth with just a touch of a hoppy bite to make for a clean, refreshing finish. You cant go wrong with this porter!

Poured from the classic smooth and stubby Anchor 12oz bottle - dark brown almost black with a massive thick, foamy and lumpy light tan head. Lacing is more a coating. Aroma is toasted grains and malts. Taste is classic porter and very pure - roasted malt with a true grain flavor. There are notes of chocolate and coffee fading into some welcome backing hop bitterness. Medium body, moderate carbonation, a bit oily on the palate. I've been waiting awhile to find this and I found one of the world's better porters. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours near black with a nice and toffee-colored head. Aroma is fruity with moderate roast and malts. Taste is also somewhat fruity, with hints of caramel and bitter coffee. Well rounded.
Pours black with nice brown head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, plums and cherries. Sweet with some acidic notes and pleasant carbonation. Very good porter.
12oz bottle. This sniz is yummers fo sho. One the best I had ever. Ypu like porters get down on it.

botella 355ml. color negro profundo con espuma marron que se disipa rapidamente, aroma a caramelo, cafe torrefacto, toffee,, en boca volvemos a encontrar caramelo, toffee, y regaliz dejando un retrogusto amargo

Pours deep brown with thick tan head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel with hint of coffee and pleasant fruitiness. Little acidity from dark malts which is quite good. Medium body, medium-low carbonation. Medium bitterness. Good beer with nice drinkability.
Bottle from world beers. Pours black, tan head. Scent is chocolaty with some black cherry. Taste is dark chocolate and sweetness. Really good beer.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2014 Another porter I had high hopes for. Pours a deep brown with a thin tan head. Easy on the palate but something about the taste is off. Its sweet at first and bitter on the back end. A decent porter but hoped for better.

1/21/14. Bottle. Dark with chocolate 2 finger head. Mild malty biscuity nose. Nice sour dark tones on the mouth with just enough hop to keep it from going sweet.

Bijna zwarte kleur met een volle koffie kraag. Ruikt koffie, stroop, drop. Smaakt stroop, drop en iets bitter in de afdronk.
Pours a dark brown beer with a tan head. Smells coffee, and roasted. Tastes coffee, dark chocolate and somw fruityness. Average carbo, thin body and a sticky texture.

12 oz bottle pours black with a off white head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Taste is coffee and malts.

Black with beige head. Nice fresh aroma of chocolate and a hint of coffee, some malty and some milky. At taste is smooth and light sweet with malt caramel and chocolate, coffee, nuts and almond flavour.

Aroma has light chocolate, only little bit roasty, clear. Taste is light roasty sweetness with some earthy short lasting bitterness. Black body with medium creamy tan brown head. Body is light with very high carbonation. Not bad, but little bit boring.

Coloração marrom muito escura, espuma cremosa beje, consistente com duração até o final da taça. Aroma discreto de malte torrado, mel e café. Saboroso equilíbrio de álcool e malte torrado, com pouco lúpulo. Retrogosto equilibrado, discreto e agradável. Excelente cerveja, que representa bem o estilo Porter.

12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass. Pours almost pitch black with a 2 to 3 finger head. Aroma is sweet, plums, raisins, a little bit of chocolate. The taste follows the aroma pretty much, lots of plums and chocolate covered raisins, very pleasant. Overall a very well made beer, been waiting a long time to taste this and well worth the wait. One of the best porters I have had

Un beau porter brun, presque noir, surmonté dune tout aussi belle mousse épaisse et capiteuse, qui laisse une écume au verre en se résorbant très lentement. Des arômes de levain et de malt rôti, ainsi quun aspect poivré et caramélisé suit. Cest velouté et soyeux en bouche, qui donne une impression aqueuse, tout en laissant des saveurs chocolatées, sucrées et légèrement amères. Cest surprenant léquilibre de cette bière. (946-281213)
This is legit. Smooth. Good level of hops. I really like everything from anchor that ive had so far
Extremely solid porter. Medium body, roasty, and slightly hoppy. Well balanced and refreshing.

average frothy (creamy after a while) light brown head. fair lacing. mostly lasting. flat thick brownish black body. aroma: heavy malty, dark chocolate, strong coffee. if: moderate sweet. ff: moderate sweet bitter light acidic; long duration. palate: light medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish. Aroma metalizado no copo, deixada 15 minutos fora. Amargor de café. Dulçor maltado, achocolatado.saborosa, boa drinkability. 100 s

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2016 Pours almost blabk with brown creamy beige top, light lasing. Flavor is mild, well balanced, well rounded - cocoa-yeasty, darker malts, a bit raisins or dried fruits, far away roast and hops bitter. No dominant notes so balanced it is but also without intense character for me. So it was good brew but I wouldnt buy it second time. Close to full body, stewy texture, dry finish, no long aftertaste, medium+ carbonated. Taste is light sweet plus min bitter at the end. 6-4-6-4-14/3.4
2015th rerate: 
dark balsamy in color, thick beige top, mid lasind, good head retention, aroma- malty, sugary, caramel malty and sourish on top- same sour through taste, medium bodied, texture seems foamy- like watery and spungee same time, some light to medium dryness in aftertaste. not very pleasant nor complex flavor, I wonder why it has so high ratings.

355 ml bottle. Brownish black with big tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, molasses, chocolate, raisins and dates. Taste is sweet, chocolate, raisins, dates and brown sugar. Light body, nice beer

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured dark, almost black, thick tan head decent lacing on the glass. Aroma of malts, coffee, some grain and some caramel. Taste is sweet and malty, touches of coffee that bring a nice mild bitterness to it. Very nice Porter, Quite enjoyable.
UPDATED: MAR 20, 2014 Beautifully dark, a lot of roasted/chocolate with just the right amount of bitterness. Excellent porter, very easy to drink.

Pours a deep dark color with a medium tan head. Aromas are roasted malts, coffee, raisins, caramel and plum. Slighltly bitter at the end. Creamy texture and medium carbonation. Well balance beer and very nice porter !
cereal, chocolate, coffee, toast, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
Black colour, khaki head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and cream, light hoppy, chocolate. Flavour is light, coffee and cream, toffee.
Stout-like black pour with a creamy tan head. Aroma of chocolate, dark fruit, and molasses. Flavor of chocolate, roasted malt, dark fruit, and brown sugar. Very nice beer.
Great porter! Very dark color, average beige head. Notes of chocolate, plum and cherry liquor in the aroma. Throatwarming feel in taste, raisins, chocolate, some bitterness. Alcohol is pleasant.

Bomber into HF stemware. Black brown with a massive tan head. Smell is caramelized sugar, molasses, chocolate, raisins and dates. Taste is entirely too sweet for my tastes. Super sweet chocolate, raisons, dates, brown sugar. Not very sticky, which is slightly impressive. Decent, but too much raison and sweetness for me to enjoy.
0.355l bottle. Reddish black body, light brown head. Aroma of plums, chocolate, coffee and cream. Taste of plums, chocolate, sour cherry and reisins. Easy to drink. Awesome beer.

Delightful porter, just what I was looking for. Nice mouthfeel, good head, great aroma...chocolate, fruity raisin. Great beer

Sehr leckeres Porter. Kaffe, dunkle Schokolade, geröstetes Malz. Sehr runder Körper mit nicht aufdringlicher Bittere. Ein muss für jeden Porter Liebhaber.

Bottle to half-pint glass (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a semi-opaque dark cola with foamy beige head. Smells of dark malt, roast, and a fair amount of metallic bitterness. Tastes like it smells with less metallic bitterness and with some mild chocolate and hops in its place. Nice and smoth on the palate. Solid, but overrated IMO.
Cerveza porter americana. Color negro con espuma ligeramente consistente. Sabor a café, ciruelas y anis. Muy buena.

Malty, slightly savory base. Notes of chocolate and a dark fruit sweetness. Just enough bitterness on the finish to make it highly drinkable. Smoky aftertaste is perfect.

Light medium mouthfeel. Moderate carbonation.

A: pours beautifully dark brown with excellent clarity which reveals underlying cherry tones. three finger mocha head falls to a quilt of the same which remains through the life. Cobweb lacing. 

S: Coffee, molasses, dark malts. Hints of creamy vanillla and white cake smells to me. Very nice nose. Hints of cocoa perhaps as well.

T: Finest hint of earthy, noble hops over the strong bone of a dry, coffee like porter. Outstanding flavor profile. Not my favorite, but very, very good. 

M: creamy yet dry mouthfeel. Middle of the line body with lower carbonation. Sticky and dry finish. Makes me want more immediately.

O: Cheers to Fritz and the guys. This ones a winner.

Serving type: bottle

05-03-2011
A very liquorice taste. My first taste of the porter style. It becomes better and better for every sip.

Time to taste the classic porter. Dark brown color, firm and dense head, creamy. Aroma is not as strong as expected. Roasted malt, hints of dark chocolate. Taste and palte: bitter chocolate and coffee with quite a lot of bitterness. Long finish. A "must have" as a perfectly balanced porter.
UPDATED: DEC 15, 2013 Bottle @relish doncaster . V dark black colour. Aroma is liquirice taste is same very liquriche. V nice  porter

Bottle pour dark black with brown highlights. Nose sweet malt and soy sauce. Taste bitter up front followed by roast. Some mid palate sweet and high bitter finish. Possibly a bad bottle but just wasnt feeling this one.
A decent enough Porter with nice well balanced flavor typical of the style, unfortunately just not a favorite style of mine. Easily forgettable in my mind.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text:
I had this at Global Brew. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Taste coffee, chocolate, roasted malt. I thought this was not good (don't like coffee). I wouldn't drink this again.

Bottle from the Wellington Inn, Hull. Mahogany body with a frothy tan head. Sweet red fruit aroma. Quite a fruity taste at first too before licorice and coffee in the finish. A bit too sweet for my tastes, but otherwise a nice beer.

Pitch black thick pour with thick khaki head. Nutty and roasty aroma. Medium licorice and coffee notes. Boozy throughout. Not your traditional chocolate/coffee bomb In the flavor. A nog like flavor. Pretty sweet finish.
