Black with creamy mocca head. Black chocolate, dried red fruits, cranberry, almost burnt toast. Taste is nicely balanced between sweet, tart and burnt-bitter. Medium-light bodied with average carbonation. Tasty and very drinkable, love it.

Aroma of burnt malt, coffee, cookie. 
Pours black with light brown head, which isnt lasting too long. 
Taste is good bitter and sour. Some caramel. 
Long lasting aftertaste.

Bottle from Breeze Thru - amazed never rated this one before. Pours a very dark brown with a chocolate milk head leaving some bits of lace. Aroma has dark chocolate, caramel, some molasses, some espresso and some plastic. Taste is of bittersweet chocolate, roast, sweet molasses and brown sugar and black patent malts with some earthiness. Medium bodied. Finishes to the sweet side of bittersweet. A touch of that anchor water flavor. Shrug? Had better and worse bottles of this one, so probably properly rated.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2013 Appearance: Dark like stout

Aroma: Malty, dark fruit and a bit of coffee

Taste: Malty roast fruity taste with a slight bit of coffee there. Nothing too sweet and a pleasing mild bitterness to it.

Palate: Slightly oily with a very refreshing mild amount of carbonation. Very refreshingly pleasant

Overall: I very much want to drink this again. Its got lots going on with the taste and it could well be my favourite porter.

Rating from 2010: Chremfarbiger, stabiler und fast cremeartiger Schaum. Karamell-creme. Der Antrunk ist schwer, aber frisch. Leicht hopfig-grasig. Der Hauptteil ist säuerlich-dickflüssig-süßlich-malzig. wirkt schwer, alkoholisch. Der Nachgeschmack ist Kaffee, Schokolade. Dickflüssig-schwer-dunkel. Auf der Zunge bleibt ein langer trocken-malziger und leicht herber Nachgeschmack. --> 10/11/12/11
Aroma: caramel aromas with some rich maltsTaste: smooth sweet malty taste almost with belgium sugar tastesAppearance: dark body with thin white head with good retention

Another great one from Anchor. Explosives in aroma: dark malts, coffee, toffee, ginger, vanilla, chocolate. Beautiful creamy head with perfect lacing, dark brown to black color. Palate is oily with smooth carbonation, the taste is extremely complex from chocolate through smoke into ginger or caramelized fruits. I love how it reveals more and more layers of aroma when it warms. This must be great with raspberry or strawberry dessert. Pana cota perhaps?
Clear pitch black appearance with medium head. Strong roasted caramel. Slightly sweet with bitter finish. All attributes are very good balanced, a perfect porter.

Dark black with a dense brown head. Aromas of nice malt: caramel, smoky, chocolate, coffee, roasty with some notes of baked bread. A bit sweetness with a medium bitter, oily texture and flavours of vanilla (aftertaste) and licorice.

Amazingly thick and creamy head. Pitch black body. Sweet malty aroma. Initial taste is very sweet, ginger bread, nutty. Light coffee aftertaste, long bitter finish. The best part is the body, very creamy and thick. Overall an amazing porter. Balanced in every way. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Dark with a nice thick head. Aroma is pleasant but somewhat weak. Balanced with a smooth chocolately flavor and mild after taste. A good choice when you want "a few" good beers.

Nice chocolate warm aroma and favors. Some balsamic favors, I see the labe reads 10 months old. Nonetheless very smooth. Definitely more chocolate than coffee. Full velvety mouthfeel but not too heavy.

Bottle 12 fl. oz. Pours deep black, with thick, creamy beige head with gilded reflects. Amazing appearance! Aroma and taste: barley, hops, vanilla. Sweetness is well balanced and the alcohol is well hidden. Lively carbonation.
350ml bottle. This beer is black like oil. Flavour is nailed to the roasted mast. Can taste a lot of alcohol for the relative abv.

Twelve ounce bottle, pours dark with tan head. Aroma of sweet (banana). Taste is sweet and finish is light balanced and short. Not for those that like strong or heavy bitter porters. A porter if you are going to drink more than one.

Appearance: Dark brown/black with 2 finger creamy ivory/tan head.
Aroma: Chocolate, vanilla, butterscotch, hay, bread/toast and a touch of fruit cake.
Taste: Low/medium bitter and sourness, medium sweetness and slight saltiness.
Palate: Smooth thick texture and light body, average carbonation, lingering astringent, roast malt, vanilla and butterscotch finish.
Comments: Very good and glass lace.

350ml bottle. pours very dark brown/black with thin film of head. aroma is strong of coffee, malts and a bit sharp. yeasty. nice full mouth feel but the actual taste didnt last long. disappointing. just coffee.
Really dark. Lots of flavor. Has a roasted malt flavor, but is also sour and tastes like alcohol. Kind of reminds me of a barley wine.
Toasty molasses and malt aroma. Low abv but alcohol noticeable a bit. Malt molasses dark chocolate flavor.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2014 Bottle from bier-deluxe.de. Dark brown body with creamy beige head. Wow, what an aroma! Ripe banana, dark chocolate, roast malt, nut, vanilla, still very fresh! The taste is even better, again this wonderful ripe banana, dark chocolate, vanilla and then comes a hop bitterness, not to agressive, just to balance the whole thing. Creamy palate, with a good carbonation and a bit astringent. Again: wow! Fantastic aromas in the nose and even more in the mouth and although it is a somehow heavy beer it so smooth to drink. Perfectly balanced! This deserves to be the highest rated beer from this great brewery.

Poured from bottle to shaker. Nice frothy head that doesnt stick around too long. Deep dark color, if you hold it up to the light you can see red. Aroma is of freshly ground cane syrup. Sweet sugary taste with mild hop flavors in there. Lively on the tongue, medium body, abrupt finish. This is a fine example of a sweet porter.

Bottle to glass. deep black with strong tan head, almost poured it a little to heavy. Aroma of roast malt, chocolate and finishes with vanilla. Good body, taste of dark malts vanilla and finishes with a slight lactose. One of my favorite everyday porters.
Dense, light brown, thick head.    Sweet aroma.  No light penetrates this beer.  Pleasant hop aftertaste.
Dark, smoky and chocolaty. Pours black with skimpy beige head. Aroma of oak barrels, chocolate and peat. Taste is chocolate, bananas and roast grains. Velvety smooth, deep and rich truly enjoyable.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 Pours a deep black with a small creamy head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, some hops present. Almost like a stout but very easy to drink. I really enjoyed this brew and will definitely revisit!

Bottle 33cl. Small off white layer. Staying. Quite opaque. Aroma is chocolate and roasted malt. Taste is caramel butter, hazel nut and sugar.

Bottle before the Giants game with Mark. Pours black with medium, lumpy tan head and nice lace. Nose roast, chocolate, molasses, dark fruits. Medium body. Smooth drinking porter.

Poured from bottle into glass. Nutty, rich, coffee aroma. Very dark brown, almost black. Full head, creamy and nice. Picked up hints of California hops, but very malt forward. Very rich tasting, sweet and somewhat heavy. A lingering silkiness as it covers the palate. Overall, a wonder tasting porter. Very much a true tasting porter.

Bottle: Very deep brown. Reasonably clear. Thick, persistent tan head. Caramel roasted malt nose. Chocolate and coffee. All roasted malt. Off dry. Not sour. Low to moderate bitterness. Roasted malt flavors. Not as dark as the Mill Valley Porter. Almost half way between stout and dark or brown ale. Medium dense to dense palate. Slightly hollow. 
Not sure this is classic Porter.

Bomber. Pour is black with a thin light brown head, good lacing. Smell is dark roast, coffee, spice and smoke. Also takes on a yeasty note, like a Belgian ale. Taste is dark roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, hops and smoke. Almost like a stout but a bit less viscous, good none the less.

Dark black red body with a tan head that dissipates. Dark chocolate, coffee and caramel aroma. Some hoppy biterness in the taste.

Pours a deep brown with a thick light tan colored head of 1 finger. The smell is sweet (molasses and caramel) and roasty with notes of chocolate and coffee. The taste was lightly sweet with a malty roastiness and hints of toffee and chocolate in the beginning, becoming more bitter with a bit of coffee. There is a mild dark fruit undertone as well with a hoppy finish. There is a medium mouth feel with good carbonation and a dry finish. This is a nice porter. A little more hoppy than I prefer in a porter/stout, but that does not detract from the quality of the beer.

Coffee, caramel and licorice. I find it quite salty for a porter, lighter on the sweet malty notes present in a lot of its peers. Thats a refershing change though. A good one.

From 22oz bottle to shaker. Pour is a black color. With a very fiting khaki head. Nose is heavy roasted malt slight hop. Great beer.

Prunes, chocolate, coffee and roasted malts in the aroma. Almost black looking with a tan head. Really good balance between the sweetness and the bitterness. Medium to full body with a almost perfect soft carbonation. Overall a really good porter!

Bottle into pint glass, very dark brown with light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, char and some dark fruit. Taste adds some notes of coffee, chocolate, toffee, toast and light hop bitterness. Medium body, low carbonation, creamy with toasty finish. Very solid porter.
Poured into a shaker. Very dark pour with frothy tan head. Nice and balanced porter with a very nice slight bitternes at the end

The palate was very thin, especially for a porter, with heavy carbonation. Also, it was very hopp-y for a porter. Overall, nothing terrible, but nothing special, either.

Dark brown with big tan foam. Roasty malt aroma. Well carbed. Dark roasted malt flavor. Lightly bitter finish. Really great porter.

For cap collectors: a brown cap with an anchor.

Bottle.
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, nice stable beige head.
NOSE: caramel, toffee, burned malts, sweet, slight alcohol, some port, dried fruits.
TASTE: coffee, chocolate, toffee, some alcohol, little sour, sweet, mocha.
Caramel Malt comes through this almost black brew. Palate is medium bodied with the chocolate and coffee aromas ringing true throughout the tasting.
Refreshing porter, dark brown. Has a fairly high hop profile that comes out in the flavor rather than the aroma. Much less charred tasting than many stouts and porters.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a nonic pint glass. It was bottled in 2/21/13 and cost $2.75 ($0.23 per ounce).

Appearance: Opaque black body with no visible carbonation. Pours to a large, tan, frothy head which laces and retains extremely well.

Smell: Typical porter aroma of dark malts and toffee sweetness. Slightly tangy.

Taste: Theres something bittersweet about drinking a traditional porter from a traditional brewery. Anchor Porter epitomizes the style, which makes it good in that its familiar. Though its also quite familiar, almost cliché (if that term could ever apply to beer). Its sweet, but not overbearing and highly drinkable. If you want a good porter, you get that here.

The bottle I was drinking was relatively old, which probably could have been avoided had the brewery used an easier-to-read bottling date instead of a code. I did detect some tanginess to the palette, though it seemed to accentuate some of the notes. It begins with an English-like taste with hints of fruit, but mostly dark, toasted malt. Theres significant bitterness through the middle with a distinct peanut brittle-like flavor all throughout the back end. Its slightly tangy or sour, though it works with the beers natural flavors of roasted peanuts and toffee. Nothing in the way of chocolate or coffee, though, which is fine. It leaves a slightly dry aftertaste, but its easily tolerable. Either way, its a by-the-book porter: no frills; but nothing off, either. 

Drinkability: What separates porters from stouts is their drinkability, and Anchor Porter is a good example of that. The mouthfeel is soft, smooth and comfortable. Though slightly thin, consistent carbonation is noticeable. Its easy to drink in large swigs or small sips. At 5.6% ABV its got enough body to satisfy and work well as a standalone beverage, though a bit too heavy to session.

Fles thuis, donker bruin tegen zwart aan met een dikke bruine schuimkraag. Geur van haver, donkere mout, cacao en ook aard tonen. De smaak is vol bitter cacao voert de boventoon en wat een body. Dit is echt een mooie porter
Decent, solid porter, lots of chocolate, sugar and malt, excellent carbonation, caramel aftertaste

Poured two and half fingers of head on the darkest brown colored body.
The aroma is roasted and burnt malt, candy corn and a little burnt wood.
The taste is roasted malt, touch of coffee and a little vanilla at the finish. Nicely balanced.
The texture is fizzy and crisper with moderate carbonation.
Well done.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2014 Bottle: Pitch black, volatile brew with a big and fluffy tan head thats fairly quick to settle to a thin film. Aroma is huge roasted malt, slight hints of chocolate, and some deep grape and fig sweetness - almost a wine-like fruitiness, covered by intense amounts of roast. Taste is incredibly roasted as well; unsweetened coffee, dark cocoa, enormous barley flavors - toasted and dark. Some sweet dark fruit up front that transitions into roasty-bitter. Hops are faintly present, leafy and ashy. Mouth feel is almost creamy but a little thin for the style. Well made perhaps, just not exactly in my wheelhouse.

Location/Date:Bottle split with Dave on 9/29/2013.
Appearance: Pours a dark black opqaue. 
Aroma:Aroma of roast, chocolate.
Taste: Roasty, light chocolate, similar to the nose.
Palate:Light body, some fizz.
Summary: I have been trying to find this one for awhile, and even thought I bought it at State Line(it was on the receipt) but couldnt find it when I got home.. Pretty nice porter, nice amount of flavor.
Delicious Porter! Welcoming coffee / salmiak / Chocolate aroma. Creamy taste...could be more expressieve.

Aromas agradables e interesantes, se perciben notas dulces las cuales desprenden notas a caramelo y principalmente chocolate, ligeramente vainilla. Muy agradable.

Su apariencia es la que cualquier cerveza que se haga llamar porter debería tener. Color obscuro, casi negro. Carbonatación de media a baja. Cuerpo medio, cremosidad excelente. Corona abundante de retención media. Simplemente espectacular.

En boca agradable y sabrosa. Ligera, pero a la vez sumamente cremosa. Elegante sin llegar a espantar el paladar. Chocolate y café a cada momento.

Al paladar considero que cumple ampliamente su cometido. La cremosidad y sabores a malta tostada destacan. Un ligero amargor se percibe en garganta, sin embargo en ningún momento es agresivo. Tampoco llega a percibirse empalagos a pesar de su sabrosa cremosidad. Quizá el único aspecto que no hace convencer al 100% es un muy ligero sabor acido en garganta el cual o debería existir, pero que llega a confundirse con un ligero amargor. Muy grata después de todo.

En general una cerveza muy buena, que cumple con las características de una buena Stout y que definitivamente volveré a adquirir cuando la vuelva a ver.

Recomendable 100%
Trocken, leicht sauer. Richtig gut haltender Schaum. Hätte eine bessere Hopfennote verdient.

12 fl.oz. bottle. Poured with immense head, gently subsiding. ar:molasses. ta: the same, manages to be sweet and dry, medium bitterness. pa: medium-full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, finish: lingering molasses. ov: a treacly porter, good.

Black, off-white head. Coffe-hoppy aroma. Coffe , malty, well balanced taste. Oily palat. Likeably porter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Bottle): Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of heavily roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, liquorice and cream. Same notes in taste. Spectacularly smooth with good carbonation. Perfectly balanced porter. Anchor porter rivals any in its category.
Deep rich dark color with a full head. Full body. Balance of the barley malt and the hops is close to perfect for a porter. Excellent beer.
A good beer, I think it miss something on the flavor and something on the aroma doesnt fit pretende well. Despiste of that, the foam is good and persistent and the caramel flavor can be noticed.

Classic porter. Thought it was a bit light on the roast and a bit heavy on the sweetness. Mouthfeel was good. Nothing to write home about, but a competent, well executed brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I usually like porters, but this one is too creamy and especially too sweet for me. Bummer.

355 ml bottle. Pours an orangeish-brownish black with a nice beige head. Aroma is fruit, roast, chocolate. Flavor is red berries, roast, chocolate. Finish is café au lait bitterness. Medium body, soft, creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. A fine porter.

Pours dark brown to black with a thick, rocky tan head that leaves some thick lace behind. Nose involves plenty of chocolate, toasted malt, cream, earth, subtle spice, floral hops, and some licorice. Quite sweet with a fair bitterness. Medium to full bodied, rich and creamy, quite actively carbed, vibrant, with a toasty earthy bitter finish. Really nice porter, great body and hopping, with lots of chocolate.

Ótima porter dessa cervejaria de Sao Francisco. Cor escura com boa formação de espuma bege. Aroma proeminente de chocolate e café. Na boca ótimo corpo, com destaque para o malte torrado, exibindo bom equilíbrio entre o dulçor e o amargo, de leve. Notas de chocolate e café. Final longo e agradável. Ótima breja!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12oz bottle into a Leffe glass. Pours a very dark brown with light head and light lacing. A bit of a roasted coffee aroma, with plenty of malty roasty flavour. A bit of bitterness.
Svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av malt, sjokolane og kaffe. Smak av sjokolade, malt og kaffe. Vinmonopolet.
Kremfarget tykt skum. Sort av farge. Fin duft av malt og sjokolade. Fin smak av kaffe.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2015 Re-rate. White lady. Bottle. Up 2. Nothing metallic this time.

Bottle at home. Dark brown, near black, with a good, lingering off-white head. Creamy, nutty aroma, with hints of coffee and chocolate. Something sour on the taste though, and too much sweetness for me, not enough roasty bitterness. Some caramel and burnt orange at the end, then going weirdly metallic . Not bad, but not as good as I?d hoped.

Bottle - fair size foamy head, dark brown/almost black color, sweet and roasty aroma and flavor, good hop balance, nice smooth finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

lots of roast smell, ashiness, coffee. taste is minerally, hard, somewhat bitter and full of roastiness. mouthfeel is slightly overcarbonated for me. dark, dark brown. i was disappointed, though i can see it being impressive for an original microbrew and having an important place in beer history. (not scored with these regards in mind)
Poured from a cold bottle. Dark brown color, full tan head. Slight sour and roasted malt smell. Light watery malt taste, with a bitterness.
Black with a thin tan head that dissipates in the center. nice malty aroma. Taste is malt, some sweet some bitter, a hint of hops. medium carbonation, roasty finish.
Big aroma of roasted coffee, chocolate, some dark cherry. Creamy coffee taste, bitter caramel, touch of red fruits. Another masterpiece from the Anchor wizards, thumbs and bottoms up!
Very good porter, nice aromas and tastes of chocolate and coffee, but not too dominating.
One of the best and most balanced porters out there. Amazing full taste/ Coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, super appearance, full aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours a very dark ruby, almost black body, with a brown head that diminishes slowly, leaving a very good lace. Mostly malty aroma, some caramel, roastiness and some cherry maybe. Tastes fantastic, light bitter and medium sweet taste, notes of coffee, cherry, caramel. Very smooth on the mouth, very nice carbonation, smooth texture, full bodied. Fantastic stuff, considering the alcohol level, too. Well done Anchor.

On tap at the Anchor Brewery. Pours a solid black. Surprisingly fresh and fruity on the nose. Interestingly crisp coffee and burnt toast flavors. A refreshingly unique porter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From the 25 fl. oz. rounded stubby bottle marked 238. The pour is jet black with a fluffy, tan head that lingers and laces the whole time. The aroma is keen with dark malts, some smoke, molasses, butter, and subtle hop note. The body is full. The taste has a powerful moderate bitterness that erupts with each sip and ends on the dry side. An excellent Porter.

Pours black with a tan head. Chocolate, caramel,coffee and roasted malt aromas. Creamy mouth feel with chocolate, roasted malt, coffee and bready flavors. Good carbonation and a medium body. Roasted chocolate finish.

Bottle. Dark, almost black pour with some ruby translucense. Large brown head with good retention. Flavour starts off fairly neutral sweet malt witha bit of sournesssome chocolate, then moves to coffee and bitterness comes in. Aftertaste introduces smoke. A very tasty porter, but lingers just a bit too smokey and bitter for my liking.

(Bottled early 2009)
Appearance: Dark brown cola colour.
Aroma: Initial aroma of coffee and dark chocolate. Gradually more coffee, dark (rye) bread and some caramel.
Taste & palate: Slight sweetness paired with nice bitterness and freshness. Quite rich and creamy, very fine carbonation. Very long and fresh, well balanced finish. 
A very nice porter, keeping up very well in its 4th year. Not sure how much the ageing has done to develop the aromas and taste but have a feeling it has at least added to the creaminess of the beer.
Bottle deep black body with nice tan fast disapearing head nose is roasted malts some dark fruits taste is very balanced betwen malts and hops aftertaste is great like this vety much

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2014 Pours a deep brown topped by a thin ring of foam that leaves minimal lacing. Aroma is a mix of caramel, chocolate and dark fruits. Taste is sweet, this feels like a cross between a british porter and a belgian dubbel really. Flavors are made of caramel again but now with coffee and/or bitter chocolate. A superior one indeed, but atypical.
This beer smells great. An overall decent porter. Nice coffee finish... I will definitely be drinking this again.
This one has a thin, tan head with nice lacing. Its color is a clear chestnut. The aroma is a roasted chocolate with a hint of hops.  It has a medium body, with a bitter, grapefruit-like finish.

Poors deep black with a nice thick tan head that settles to a thin head after 1 minute. Aroma is a rich roasted character with lots of stone fruit character. Flavor is dominated with roast, medium low sweetness, and hops detectable in the back of the throat. Palate is nice and dry, good carbonation, medium body and nice finish. Overall great porter. Cant believe I waited this long to try it.

I really like the lingering smoothness and faint chew finish. All around this has got some good toasty aroma backed up by an even better taste that is sweet, nutty, chalky and delicious. Certainly worth a try. Aging it might be fun too...and checkmate...see i told you this game was fun...

Pour is bery dark brown with beige head and little lacing. Aroma of licorice, roasted malts, dried fruits, chocolate and light coffee notes. Taste is almost the same as the aroma but with less licorice, a bit of sweetness ans a 
Iigh acidity, very light grassy hops. Low to medium body and medium carb. A good porter.
Fantastic pitch black color with a brown head. Lots of roasted malt on the nose, and a hint of dough. Lots of burnt malts, and coffee flavors. To bitter finish for me.

Probably the best porter Ive tasted. Contains all of the things you could hope for, the coffee and the chocolate hint, and its also actually well-balanced and refreshing in general. Soft, easy and tasty!

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, bottled on 11/26/2012. Pours nearly opaque dark brown color with a nice 2 finger dense and fluffy tan head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass. Aromas of caramel, toast, toffee, chocolate, molasses, dark bread, raisin, light roast, and toasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark bready malt and light roasted notes; with good strength. Taste of caramel, toast, molasses, chocolate, toffee, dark bread, floral, light roast, raisin, and toasted earthiness. Lingering notes of caramel, toast, toffee, chocolate, molasses, dark bread, light roast, raisin, and toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome balance and complexity of dark and bready malt flavors; with good roast/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a creamy and lightly slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with hardly any warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is a highly excellent porter! All around great balance and complexity of bready and dark malt flavors; and very smooth to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle (12 oz). Black with a medium, mostly lasting, creamy beige head and some lacing. Aroma is of coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, sweetness and light fruity notes. Taste is moderately sweet with bitter chocolate, roasted malt and dark fruits. Theres also a kind of lactose(?) sweetness that I dont like that much. Medium body. Slightly creamy mouthfeel. Moderate carbonation. The best quality of this beer is without a doubt the balance. Quality Porter. And a cheap one!
Bottled sample at the Peasant Cookery. Deep dark colour. Rich flavour. Went great with the ribs
una buena porter con balanciados aromas de caramelo fruta seca malta y algo de cafe,muy delicada al paladar tiene todo lo que una porter debe de tener muy buena!!
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: 6/28/13- first time in years. Another oldie getting a review. Meggie wanted a Porter and this was always a favorite of mine. Malty, sweet not as good as I remember. Metallic taste.

Aroma: Coco Pops, milk chocolate, cream, prune, plum and red grape.

Appearance: Black body with a massive beige head. Excellent lacing. 

Taste: Rich, robust chocolate malt flavour with a light fruity edge. It tastes as though theyve used Belgian yeast, though I doubt they have. Theres certainly a well conditioned, peppery quality to this beer. Very smooth and moreish. 

Palate: Medium body with a smooth, luscious mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. 

Overall: An outstanding Porter full of roasted flavours with a hint of tangy fruit. Possibly the best mouthfeel to any bottled beer Ive had.

Deep dark red-basically black with a thin beige head. Aroma of deep caramel malt, toffee, coffee, dark fruit, light hoppy. Flavour is light sweet, light bitter, well balanced. Light fizz on the tongue, but lacking a bit of depth for me- a bit watery, though it has a slick texture.

Words that come to mind...Prune Juice...Cough Medicine....Robitussin, Anise. Very strong initial flavor, long bland finish. Unfortunately, when you dont like the taste, neither one of those things are a good thing. Really liked the aroma though.
Bottle. Almost black with mocha head. Aroma of coffee and roasted malts. Taste is roasted malts, coffee, bitter chocolate and some Pontefract cake. Medium bodied with some carbonation. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Wow is this good.  Seeing it say 5.6% surprised me.  The flavours that come from this you would normally see in at least an 8 or 9.  So rich with chocolate, plum, some coffee, and prune.  Simply one of the best porters Ive tried so far.

Pours almost black, rubied, with a huge, dark tan head.
Aroma is chocolate/banana.....roast.
Taste is creamy, chocolate, light coffee bean, banana,
Slight smoke.
Spiced bitter that lingers.
Exceptionally good.

zwart, met schuimig bruine kraag, schenkt als motorolie
aroma: zoet, chocolade, caramout, gebrande mouten, rood fruit, aroma is prima
smaken: medium body, stevig bitter, zeer sterk, donkere fruiten, geroosterde- cara- en gebrande mouten, peper, noten.
medium body, romig, laag co2, smaak minder als aroma, te bitter en te lang nadrukkelijk aanwezig.
Dark, full-bodied, roasted malt, coffee and a strong chocolate character. Really enjoyable porter.
Pours very dark brown, light brown head. Aroma of not much roast, a lot of chocolate malt, banana. Flavour is banana and chocolate. Sweet finish. Cant say its my favourite style of porter.
Black, merest tint of ruby; tan head; fruity, hoppy aroma; roasted malt, smokiness and American hops; the very definition of solid.

12oz bottle. The pour was a deep dark murky black with an average (1-2 finger) medium beige frothy head that reduced down to a thin scattered film with a large collar, and produced some fair spotty lacing.

The aroma was of a roasted bread malt, mild resin hops and an earthy yeast with notes of dark chocolate, roasted coffee, toffee, dark fruit (figs) and a whiff of smoke.

The taste was lightly sweet with a bold malty roastiness and hints of toffee and chocolate in the beginning, becoming much bitterer with a large coffee presence, a mild fruitiness and had a hoppy smoky finish. The flavor hung on for a nice long time proceeding the swallow, with a bitter roasty smoky taste left behind to linger on the taste buds for a while longer.

Mouthfeel was just a tad under medium in body with a dry, oily texture and a surprisingly fizzy carbonation.

Overall this was a very tasty and satisfying brew with a smooth roasty bitterness, which was offset nicely by a mild sweet fruitiness. Simply said this is a well balanced and enjoyable brew... www.facebook.com/KAJIIsBeerReviews
One of the best porters out there, coffee and roastiness on the nose and taste. Simple and well rounded.
Very good porter.medium body. Pours black with a foamy tan head, roasty and smooth.

color negro opaco con espuma beige densa y duradera. El aroma es complejo con notas dulces, café y una ligera acidez.En boca, con una densidad media, es bastante fresca, entra con un sabor de azúcar moreno o melaza para acabar con un amargor acafetado muy equilibrado.

Pours pitch black with cloudy, creamy tan head. Aroma has chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, yeast. Taste is the same, a bit bready also. Light carbonation, medium body. finish is malty and slightly bitter.
Flaske fra Vinmonopolet. Svart farge med en beige skumrand. En smooth øl uten veldig dominerende smaker.  Mørkbrent malt, kaffe,røyk, tre.hint av frukt i bakgrunnen.  En veldig behagelig øl

A smooth porter. Not too smokey, very mellow yet round aroma of roasted malts. Black, with a brown head. 

Tastes of cocoa, coffee, roasted malts. Creamy texture, great smooth finish.

Pours a nearly opaque, very dark with cola brown glitz around the bottom edge. Caramelized colored head retains very nicely. Aromas of prunes and roasted barley malt. Mouthfeel is smooth, moderately thick, and balanced and blended perfectly with the carbonation. Dark fruit up front. Lingering coffee platter the finish. Surprisingly nice Porter.

Color is black, as it should be, with a very fluffy beige head. The aroma is an inviting mix of chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt. Sweet malt comes through first in the flavor, with plenty of coffee and chocolate. Dry, oak finish. 

Smooth texture, phenomenal balance and flavor, and at only 5.6% ABV, its not heavy handed. Its beautifully crafted brews like this that make me love porters so much!

ciscos famous Anchor Porter brand is made in one of the smallest and most traditional breweries in the world by the brewers of Anchor Steam Beer. Our old-fashioned Porter is virtually handmade, with an exceptional respect for the ancient art of brewing. We use 100% malted barley, generous amounts of fresh, whole hops, entirely natural carbonation and a simple, natural brewing process which is like no other in the world. The deep black color, the thick, creamy head and the intensely rich flavor of Anchor Porter, made in San Francisco since 1974, have earned this delicious and unique brew a worldwide reputation for outstanding quality. It is aesthetically pleasing and wholly superior in every respect.

Deep brown with an average head, there are strong coffee and malty notes in the aroma.  The flavor is rich and fairly complex.  Theres coffee and chocolate and rich, dark, bready malts.  A little caramel, too, and some hop burn.  I liked this and Ill buy it again.
bottle @ Cafe de Tijd. Was one of my first porters. It is a heavy beer with a taste and smell of meat.

The head is good, the body black. It smells sweet, malty, a bit darkamalty, fresh, a bit woody. The taste is woody, malty, darkmalty, a bit roasty, a bit sweet,  touch of sour but stops with a full bodied maltaromatic taste. This beer is highly interesting and delicious! 13/13/13/13/14/13
UPDATED: OCT 29, 2013 Dark brown/black. Medium carbonation. Not a lot of alcohol but a very complex aroma of coffee, dark chocolat, caramel and liquorice. Very good porter

Clear dark ruby, dark brown with light brown foam head. Aroma is quite strong, burned coffee, bit caramel. Taste is little caramel, dominated by bitter cold coffee. Aftertaste is lasting. (Velp 201305)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

big creamy coffee beige head that disappears slowly with lacing. coffee coloured. malty, chocolate, earthy, liquorice, fruity, sweet aroma with slight metallic note and some solvent. full flavour, slightly sweet, roasted malt and chocolate. very dense mouthfeel that reminds of almonds. slight bitter aftertaste with some liquorice. very nice porter and for the low abv very good body.  bottle 35.5 cl / notes from backlog
Very dark appearance with a creamy head.  Aroma is of dark roasted malt, with chocolate.  Aroma follows through to the flavor.  Mouth feel is silky smooth.  Very good brew.
Bottle 0.355l at Pivo, Oulu. BBE 7/2013. Colour is black with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate, sweetness, vanilla and roasted malts.

355 ml bottle bought at CitySuper in Harbour City, Tsim Sha Tsui.
Clear deep blackish brown colour; Half a finger head and beige foam which last for 30 seconds; Small sticky lacing and notable carbonation; Fragrant aroma of roasted malt, vanilla, sweet caramel, raisin, dark fruit, coffee, chocolate, and nuts; Pleasant and savory sweet taste of roast malt, with burnt toffee, black coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, light liquorices, nuts, dry biscuits, light citrus / lime, and pretty grassy hops; Mid to light body, slick and quite creamy palate; Taste profile is prominently creamy and tasty black coffee, toffee, and dark chocolate in a nutty, lightly roasted malt background. Complemented by light biscuit and hint of dark fruits; Hoppiness is moderately expressive citrusy lime in aroma and taste, and a lingering, nice and natural bitterness for finish. Nice! Pretty dry after taste, very  easy to mouth.

Comments: Very nice Porter with fragrant aromas, moderately strong roasty taste, creamy palate, slightly bitter and astringent finish. Every element in the right place with right dose, and fit like a T. Highly recommended!

A - Pours an almost black body with a 1 finger tan head that sinks slowly. Bits of lacing here and there.

S - Tangy coffee, creamy chocolate, vanilla, very rich and acidiic.

T - Creamy toffee covered in chocolate, sweet and tangy, roasted coffee beans, raisins, has an acidic bitterness but doesnt bother the other flavors. Finishes with hints of tannin.

M - Medium to full bodied, moderate carbonation, creamy feel.

Its hard to describe the way these flavors meld together in perfect harmony. One of the best American Porters out there.

Serving type: bottle

02-03-2011

12 ounce bottle purchased at Holiday Wine Cellar a year ago ($1.79).  Pours a dark brown hue with a full three fingers of very creamy tan-brown head.  Aroma of coconut cream, roasted nuts, milk chocolate, and some vanilla coffee.  Flavor of vanilla fudgesickle, slightly burnt chocolate, coconut, and dark toffee.  Nice and soft on the palate with some lingering sweet roastiness.  A lovely and very easy-quaffing porter.  (2367, 785)

Flaska. Svart öl med ett kolossalt moccafärgat skum, som aldrig riktigt försvinner. Doftar mörk choklad, kaffe och lakrits. Rågbröd är det mest framträdande i smaken, men även lingon, vanilj och mörk choklad finns med på paletten.

very dark colour, huge beige head - excellent appearance; aroma of chocolate with berries and some roasted malt; taste of roasted sugar, chocolate, fruity freshness (it would be hard to identify one particular fruit), some sourness, hoppy bitterness and spicy alcoholic notes;best porter I have ever tasted (so far)

Láhev 355 ml. Aroma mléčné čokolády, nutely a jemné kávy. Pěna je vysoká s malými a středními bublinkami  tmaví krémové barvy s krásnou čepičkou, poměrně drící. Barva piva je temně černá při pohledu proti světlu je vidět takřka neprůhledná tmavě rudé zbarvení, krásné a impozantní na pohled. Chuťově je pivo velmi zajímavé, připomínající kombinaci kávy, suených vestek moná i malin. Je středně hořké a má výrazný hořko-sladký ocas. Vcelku se jedná o velmi zajímavý porter, originální a svérázný.
Has a nutty, chocolate aroma, and near black color.  Medium body and full flavor.  Great drinkability. A standard for porters.

Pours very dark brown with some red highlights and a beige head. Licorice, chocolate, and a slight medicinal aroma on the nose. I taste a lot of sweetness and some yeast esters. Ends with a slight hop note and some raisins. Very creamy mouthfeel.
Draft. Black pour with tan head. Roasted aroma with some lighter sweetness. Roasted tones are lighter in flavor with some more almost artificial sweetness notes.

Pours a black beer with a thick off white head. No lacing on the glass. Chocolate and sweet taste not overly roasty which suits my taste. Malty sweet aroma. For me a great Porter for others maybe not roasty enough

Talvez seja exagero, mas é a melhor Porter que já tomei na vida. Aroma delicioso e forte de chocolate, sabor marcante, levemente amargo, de café e notas de chocolate. Retrogosto super agradável,  com algo maltado. Quero comprar uma caixa, e beber num só dia.

Bottle at the Brouwcafe, Scheveningen. Poured a dark mahogany, with a thin off white head.  The aroma is floral and hoppy leading to a liqourice bitter flavour, with some hoppy bitterness and floral notes on the palate. A little like a black IPA. Super tasty. One of San Franciscos best.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 Roasty malt flavor and smooth steam yeast flavor, combined with wonderful drinkability, showcase that a beer done right need not be complex. Simple, classic, well-balanced, easy-drinking porter.

A nice dark, malty style porter that is easy on the palate and finishes nicely.
Just the right amount of bitterness in the finish and it leaves a warm good feeling.
Bottle.Pours black with beige head. Coffee, chocolate aromas. Taste is sweet, with coffee and some roastiness. Light body.
Bottle pours deep dark amber with ruby edges, tan head. Nose of roast and light chocolate. Taste starts with dark chocolate, light roast, and finishes with a creamy sweetness. Mouthfeel is silky.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2013 Bottle at home, from BOE, 11/04/13.
Pours a light black with a mahoosive frothy tan head that dissipates slowly.
Nose is roast malt, big blast of brown sugars, molasses, cocoa powder, treacle toffee.
Taste is rich treacle toffee, roast malt, chocolate notes in the background.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry and roasty in the finish.
A solid porter and one Id happily return to.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Two tall and very cold glasses of this Porter in Players on Pier 39 in San Fran, 5 Feb 2013.

Looked like a posh Guiness: black with ruby red edges, on top a good foaming head of tight tanned bubbles. No aroma or taste at first: far too cold.

As the beers warmed the dark chocolate notes began to assert themselves in the nose and mouth, the beer became richer and creamier, no need to freeze the arse off it.

Took me a while to drink each glass because of the waiting around for them to warm up, worth the wait though.

Tres bonne Porter !
Noire reflet brun à la lumiere. Aromes classiques de chocolat et de cafe, cette Porter marque des points sur sa presence en bouche. Ronde et equilibrée elle marque son amertume sur la longueur. Note desspresso sur le final.
Un régal !

Dark brown, almost black beer, with an off-white head. Faint aromas of dark coffee/chocolate. Tastes of dark chocolate, dark coffee, some toffee, mild bitter hops, and roasted malts. Bittersweet, chalky finish. A bit dry and one dimensional, but it works in favor of the brew. Solid porter, very impressed by this one.

Pours pitch black with a tanned head. Mild nose of sweet coffee/chocolate. Aroma of sweet chocolate and coffee notes. Dark roasted malts, some caramel. Sweetish for a porter, but balanced. Goes perfectly with a medium cigar.
Schwarz, wenig Schaum, röstig im Aroma. Röstmalzig und leicht weinig im Geschmack. Durchschnitts-Porter, Standard. Da fehlt es an Vollmundigkeit und auch an Hopfen.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle - jet black with thick tan head.  Aroma has caramel, molasses, toasted malt.  Taste follows the aroma, also picking up some dark cherries.  Mouth feel is medium, good carbonation.  Overall, very good beer.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2013 Bottle at the Thomas House. Deep dark brown almost black with medium brown head. Lasting and lacing. Aroma. dominating roasted malts, caramel, chocolate, decent hops, bit smoked. Its quite bitter with intense bitter finish. Very nice beer. Y
Dark brown on the pour with a strong scent and aroma of espresso/coffee. Hints of chocolate and bitter sweet flavors on the palate and a delicious after taste.

Almost black with reddish tones with light coming through it. Foamy head dissipates fairly quickly, moderate lacing.
Aroma is malty with hints of chocolate, coffee, and in the taste a hint of licorice.
Nicely balanced malty sweetness with a generous dose of hoppy bitterness.
Nice creamy mouthfeel, mild carbonation.
Pretty good brew.
bottle. pours black. medium khaki head. roasted aroma. taste has slight fruity ester. roasted nuts and some chocolate.

0,3 bottle from kvadrat. Pours dark with brown head. Nice licorice tones from this. Dark choholate and prunetones. Taste is very rich and mouthfilling, no watery aftertaste or nothing. The flavour is dark, caramelish and some nice licorice that stays.

Bottle 355 ml from Bier-Bienne (CH). Pours black with creamy and beige head sticking. Porter prototype with aromas malted chocolate and a point of licorice. Unctuous mouth, round and very malted, slightly tart note. Roasted coffee and chocolate, toffy and dry fruits. Beautiful specimen.

Bottle, 355 ml, at home. Poured into a big english pint glass. ABV 5.6%
Black colour on the body, with something more than one finger of dark, brown head. Good retention and good lacing around the glass.
Very nice aroma with roasted malts, chocolate, liquorice, dark fruits.
Nice bitterness on the taste, with lots of roasted malts, and coffee and chocolate finish.
Quite thick on the body, creamy as silk, good carbonation.
This was a great beer on all levels. a pleasure to enjoy.

12oz bottle. Pours a very dark brown, almost black, with a thick tan head. Aroma of heavily roasted malt, espresso, and dark fruit. Taste is roasted malt, some chocolate and caramel, coffee, and dark fruits.
UPDATED: DEC 18, 2015 A beer that brings old memories, probably from when I really started to appreciate tasting beer. A great beer.

Flaske hjemme: et flott skum legger seg over en mørk brunrød øl. Ikke den store aromaen, men smaken er desto bedre - rik, frisk og samtidig balansert og behagelig (noe den fine karboneringen bidrar til). Kaffe og konfektsjokolade med røde bær. Deilig munnfylde og ettersmak selv om vi bare snakker om 5,6%. Rett og slett delicious.

Bottle poured into a glass. Dark, almost black appearance with a light brown head that laces a bit. Smells chocolate sweet, bubblegum, light coffee.  Tastes slick, slight carbonation, cocoa, dark malt. Good basic porter.
Bottle at the the draft house. Raisin treacle aroma. Choc roast finish a little too fruity. Dark caramel with persistent light tan head. Looks good. Metal.
This review is exported from olutopas.info with no comment. Original rating date  12.3.2011

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2014 Nov 2012 - Bottle.  Sweet, well rounded, smooth, decent body.  Aftertaste is spicy, mild smokiness, slight liquorice.  Nothing to dislike about this.  A good porter.  (3.5) Jan 2014 - Bottle BB 04/14.  Pours black, tan head.  Smell - strong yeast character similar to Belgian beers.  Body is light and foamy.  Taste - mild malts, slightly metallic, some liquorice, nothing really offensive about this but nothing special either.  The age hasnt really changed it, other than giving it a very yeasty smell.  OK. (3.4)

35,5 cl bottle from vinmonopolet Buskerud storsenter. Pours almost black with a lasting medium tan head. Aromas of cocoa and dark dried fruit. Chocolate and coffee flavors. Light body and very easy to drink, but still a complex porter..

Smoked black color. Average size head., higher than standard in a porter. 
Delicate aroma, malty, cloves, cocoa, roasted coffee and licorice; slightly smoked. Light body, very fresh sensation in the mouth. Perfectly balanced finish, leaves a hint of licorice, and maybe some vanilla. Alcohol perfectly masked. Taste is led by vanilla, a little of sour; the whole picture seemed more complex than the usual porter to me. Usual cofee and chocolate hints, but not so present as in others of the same style.

Deep dark brown almost black with medium brown head. Lasting and lacing.
Aroma.. dominating roasted malts, caramel, chocolate, licorice, decent hops, bit smoked.
Its quite bitter with intense bitter finish, bit bit watery finish thou
Very nice  beer. Start is bit weird because of barley, thou very decent and interesting
Very malty and slightly bitter...decent  flavor but nothing special...strong taste with wineish smell/taste...very similar to daytona brew

Pours coffee black with an almost absent head. Aromas of chocolate malts and coffee. Flavor is overall rather sweet with a hint of some smoke but not much in the realm of hops. A bit watery in the back end and the complexity thins out after a bit. Highly drinkable but nothing really stands out.

Very dark, almost black with small and quickly fades head. Aroma is not intensive roasted malts. Taste is much better, smooth, malty and bitter with coffee anf nutty background. Texture is too watery, Finish is medium long and dry. Not bad one.

Very deep brown color, almost black, nice creamy head, moderate lacing. Sweet malty aroma, very similar to light malt extract if you have home brewed. Occasional sour note too. Flavor is a mix of the same sweetness plus bitterness from the roasted grains. Wood character on the end. Thin palate. Going back to the light malt extract: this is very reminiscent of a simple no-mash home brew kit. The bottle description sort of implies that type of simple process so maybe i shouldnt be surprised, but overall pretty disappointing. No date on bottle, maybe it turned?

Colore ramato carico, alcuni riflessi  color rubino. Schiuma beife, fine ma poco persistente. 
Olfatto maltato, caramello, torrefatto, fondo di caffe, erbaceo, nota luppolata.
In bocca ritroviamo le stesse sensazioni, cun una luppolatura pronunciata ma ben bilanciata da una solida base maltata. Corpo medio, birra armonica.
An excellent Porter. They claim that it is highly hopped, although it does not seem like it because the malts balance it out.

355ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown colour with small beige head. Aroma is mostly roasted malts. Taste is more complex: cacao and some wine added. Curious Im feeling this winy sensation...Indeed, I noticed exactly the same years ago. Creamy mouthfeel, no alcohol presence. Thats all folks.
Aroma is a sweet malt. Taste is more on the sweet side with limited amounts of roasted coffee. Overall just an average porter.
Has a faint aroma of chocolate but pretty lacking in my opinion. Taste isnt very complex. Chocolate, coffee. Well balanced, just not very many distinguishable flavors. Goes down very well. Standard.
Bottle shared with McTapps. Nice coffee aroma but the taste does not hit the points as this one is a bit too bitter and watery. Drinkable but in the end not the beer for me.

Deep brown-black colour with low head and smooth body. Nose of bittersweet chocolate. Taste of rich malt, bitter chocolate, sweet coffee and roasted nuts. Despite its deep character quite easy to drink. Wont get another bottle, but for once it really was nice (but just no explosion).

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2013 appearance: Dark brown, nearly black. Cant see through it. Mocca foam head, about 1/2 fingers that fades quickly.

smell: Roasted malts. Rye bread with caramel sweetness and a faint licorice finish in the nose.

taste: I get rye bread right away with some caramel sweetness and banana. This mellows out to into a mild licorice bitter with figs. Theres some coffee and roasted malts bitterness too, but faint for a porter. Theres also some lemon in the background, balancing the sweetness out.

mouthfeel: Creamy feel, milky with quite a carbonation kick. Not very strong, but does linger quite long. 

overall: This must be my favorite porter ive had so far. I love the easy going mellowness of this one without getting too thin, milky of watery. Usually porters are all about coffee and chocolate bitterness, but i love the sweet rye base flavor of this one together with the more subtle usual porter flavors. It gives more body and balance to it then any other porter ive had (quite a lot). So for me this one is the benchmark right now :) Highly recommended!

Pint pour of deep dark and murky brown with a decent khaki head.  Nose is roasted malts and some smokiness.  Mildly sweet.  Flavor is also mostly roasted malts with some nutiness in the back.  Fairly smooth with some smoke in there as well.  Actually quite drinkable.  Really decent.

Black with a medium dark beige head. Aroma has some light sweetness and roastiness plus some crispiness of lingonberries. The body is medium minus. Thin sweetness and bitterness match quite well. Mouth feel is a bit watery with medium carbonation.  Quite an enjoyable porter.

Had this many times, but I guess Ive never rated it. Deep brown pour with a creamy white head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee beans and cocoa powder. Good carbonation and creamy mouthfeel with flavors that mimic the aroma. Touch of a dry earthy finish. Great easy drinking Porter.
From 355 ml bottle, pours brown / black, in the aroma caramel, chocolate malts, some berries and dried fruits, good carbonation, easy to drink. Very nice porter
Pours dark brown amber tint with coffee colored head.  Roasted malt aroma.  Rich roasted malt aroma with hints of chocolate And molasses.  Hop in the finish.

Un birrificio con un sacco di storia alle spalle e che ha dato molto allarte birraia americana. Finita lintroduzione da sentimentalista depresso, iniziamo a descrivere la birra... Laroma già stupisce di per sè: incredibilmente dolce molto delicato, in parole povere non ci bombarda con note secche di caffè e cioccolato. Si orienta, si, verso i malti tostati ma regala al nostro naso più quella sensazione di caramello e cioccolato al latte. Al palato più o meno lo stesso; un corpo non molto possente, mediamente carbonato e molto molto beverina (insomma da vera porter). Le note sono quelle dei malti tostati e del caramello, con una venatura luppolata a fine sorsata. Splendido esempio di porter.

This is hard to rate. Rich with dark berries coming through after, but theres something Im not ok with.  Dunno what. Some pepper in there maybe. Very rich. Tasty, good. Keep changing scores. Had a tough meeting with an old friend on Saturday, they reminded me of difficult times in the past and made me unsure of what Im doing now. Didnt need that, but it could be a wake-up call. Cheers all. Monday here we come...
Bottle. Pours hazy very dark brown with with airy tan head. Clear aroma of malt and caramel. Dark flavour of malt, caramel and liquorice. Dryish-sweet, lingering aftertaste. A very decent thing.

Dark brown, almost black with a lasting tan head. Aromas of cocoa and dark, dried fruit. Rich chocolate and coffee flavors. Body is surprisingly light given the richness of the aroma and flavors. One of my favorite robust porters.

Light aroma with a little roast.  Full mouth.  Taste has hints of copper and sweet roast.  Slight bitterness.  Something was a little off in this bottle.  Pretty plain beer in my opinion, but not terrible.

Decent porter. My favorite thing about this brew is the dense, lush color. I enjoyed this beer but didnt find the flavor particularly exciting or nuanced- just your average porter done decently well, but nothing to write home about. I did really love the label and bottle shape, however.

355ml bottle from Bitter Virtue, Southampton. A deep magohany colour with a tight beige head; intense aroma of cinder toffee, honey and toast; slightly spritzy in the mouth, soft, and full of deeply roasted malts that sooth the throat; and with just enough bitterness to give a clean finish with a lingering mocha taste and a creamy finish. Exactly how a Porter should be in my opinion.

12oz bottle in an English pint.  Pours very dark brown with a lacy, light tan head.  Aroma of roasted malts and chocolate, a little smokiness, dough, and floral hops.  Flavor about the same.  Average texture.  Not a bad beer, but I wish it were a little more complex.

Pours a pitch black colour with a creamy white head. Looks really beautiful! Aroma of chocolate. cheese, nuts and some good fruityness. Flavour is roasted, barnyard, nuts and some notes of licorice. Medium bodied, with soft carbonation and a smooth mouthfeel. A really good balance in this one, very enjoyable!

Kaatuu lasiin sysimustana ja isokuplaisella runsaalla vaahdolla. Haju on ruisleipäisen paahteinen, salmiakkisen suolainen, anismainen ja muita mausteita löytyy. Maku on ruisleipäinen, aniksinen ja suolainen. Paahteisuus pysyy mukavasti taustalla. Suutuntuma on suht kevyt. Kokonaisuutena todella hieno porter, maistamistani kolmen parhaan joukossa tässä tyylissä. Anismaisuus on itselleni pelkkää plussaa.

Bottle at Bodeans Tower Hill. It pours very dark brown (near black) with a medium light tan head. The nose is roasted malt, toast, cola, caramel, varnish and dark fruit. The taste is roasted malt, toast, varnish, caramel, nice bitterness, dark fruit and cola with a dry, roasty finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Not complex, but smooth, well balanced and very drinkable.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2013 Dark cola color with good head and lacing.  Candied cherries and roast aroma.  Sweet on the tongue like molasses with malt roast and slight savory.  slick mouthfeel low/mod carbonation.  Very good porter.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown with little head.  Smell of marachiano cherry and roasted malt.  Slight sweet cherry taste with roasted aftertaste.  Maybe some molasses at the end.  Watery mouth feel with little carbonation.  Not very complex but okay.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Strong aroma of chocolate, coffee, and dough.
Deep brown liquid with a thick tan head.
Chocolate flavor, medium sweetness/light bitterness.
Creamy texture with a long finish.
Very excellent!

(bottle from Mr Lawrence, SE London) Black in colour with a medium tan head, light lacing and medium body. Caramel and chocolate malt character and light fruits, and the lack of smokeyness/complexity actually leads itself to a very smooth easy drinking refreshing porter. Good stuff.

Pours medium brown, with a tan head. Good aroma, good flavor, just not a lot of it. Some chocolate, some roastier malts, and a little bit of a fruity note. Slightly tinny, easy to drink. Not a whole lot to it.
Creamy bittersweet chocolate taste with smooth silky brown pour. Tastes more like a chocolate stout. Mellow and coffee-like. Good beer. Again, not reminding me of a porter.

Bottle at Marcello's, Albuquerque. Nice black pour.  Toasty aroma. Nutty flavor, smooth finish.  Nice porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

15 cl. draft @ Delirium Hoppy Loft. Black with a thick creamy mocha head. Smell is very heavy on black liquorice, damn way too much, underneath some sweet malts, dark bread, black bread, quite a bit of spices & some herbs. Taste is way too much black liquorice for me, like eating the stuff (I can see this coming from a Belgian brew but an American one?); thick sweet herbs, black bread, sweet spices, malty, touch molasses, lightly milky, touch hops, everything is dominated by black liquorice. Body is a bit sticky liquorice  yeah, I am not a fan of black liquorice candy.

Bottle. Pours near black with huge lasting and good lacing frothy tan head. Aroma is caramel, dark malts,bread, chocolate, herbal hops, smoke. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is average. Finishes sweet. Impressive brew considering the ABV. Veeeery easy to sip, but also a somewhat one-dimensional beer.

Bottle. Pours black, with a small creamy, lightly coloured head. Aroma is roasted malts and coffee, as well as some liquorice. Full creamy body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet with lightly burned malts, caramel and coffee.
Poured black with a frothy tan head. Aroma of molasses and soft malt. Medium bodyt, flavour is sweet caramel malt with a bitter/sweet finish.

12oz into a Porter/Stout glass. Pour was a nice dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate and a hint of caramel. Mouth was rich in  flavor, mostly chocolate and malt. More of a hop bitterness than most porters Ive tried. Medium to full bodied.
Creamy and very delicious. Quite incipit after a while but the first features are very concise. Nice foam and aroma.
Excellent beer.  Easily the best widely available beer from Anchor.  Dark and rich in character, with deep chocolate in the flavor and nose.

It poured a dark color with a creamy tan head. The aroma was of malts and chocolate. The taste was notes of malt and chocolate followed by an almost bitter carbonation. It had a thick creamy texture on the palate. Not bad.
bottle. brown with small head. caramel and chocolate malts. smooth and very drinkable. thankfully, i am not detecting the licorice others have noted.
Bottle. Pours black to dark red with nice tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, licorice, hint of smoke. Flavor is licorice, roastiness, malt, hint of fresh milk and hops. Slightly bitter aftertaste.

Pours a very dark almost opaque brown with a one finger tan head that dissipates leaving heavy lacing. Roasted malt flavor with some caramel. Mild herbal hop presence. Slightly smokey. Full body with medium carbonation that is not at all overwhelming. Long, mildly sweet, almost bourbon finish. This is fantastic.

Around is nice, chocolate, roasty slight fruit notes. Dark but thin looking and the taste confirms that feeling. All the right flavors and a decent mouthfeel but not quite what I like in a porter. Used to be one of my favorites but Ive grow more fond of full bodied richer versions. Solid beer though, didnt disappoint as usual.

12 oz bottle pours dark brown/black with a big, lasting tan head.  Aroma has roasted malts, bread, licorice, some dark fruits, coffee, and a bit of chocolate. Tasteis sweet at first, then yeasty, with a bitter finish.  Body is medium to full. This was the first porter I ever tried, 8 years ago, and it is still one of the best.  Always satisfying.

Apariencia: De un negró bastante intenso oscuro con espuma cremosa Aroma: A chocolate y café con un ligero toque a lúpulo. Sabor: A café, malta tostada con notas de vainilla.
Genialmente hecha.

Large creamy light brown head that lasts. Body is black.Aroma contains caramel, roasted malts, citrus fruits, dough, and licorice. Palate is full, with thick texture and soft carbonation. Taste is sweet going to yeasty going to bitter, with light acidity in the beginning. Finish is light bitter and licorice. My first porter and I liked it. Not for every day but certainly worth a repeat.
Bottle. Black colour with large brown fully lasting head. Aroma is roasted malt with notes of chocolate. sweet spicy flavor. Creamy palate.

355ml bottle. Nice roasty and coffee aromas. Pours dark, with good tan head, some persistance, some lacing. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is roasty, some sweet, coffee and dark cocoa. Typical porter, maybe a bit more hoppier than british ones, but a good choice anyway.

Aroma is primarily sweet malt with hints of dark dried fruit. A rich opaque brown pour with a non-lasting ivory head and minimal lacing. Generally this is a sweetish porter accompanied with some notes of chocolate and cherries. Has a mild bitter finish. Medium bodied and medium carbonation. Overall this was a good porter. 

-Fish!
An aroma that is sweeter than the taste.  Very complex flavors being all at once, sweet, sour, and bitter.  Each drink leaves a different impression.
Bottle  pours black with thick tan head. Aroma is coffee. Chocolate and toasted malt.  Taste is sweet espresso coffee with a nice bitter finish.  High carbonation works well.  Pretty good porter.

Pours a deep black color with aroma of chocolate and hops.  Taste is smooth and creamy with a chocolate aftertaste.  A mild burnt hops taste left on the palate after the swallow.  A very clean easy drinking porter, easily one of my favorites for the style.  Thanks to knewell!

Brown sugar and sweet fruit smell. Dark pour marbling on surface. Light bitter after taste, little o the sweet comes through. A little smoke. Not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black body with a decent tan head that lasts long. Taste is mixed sweet and bitter, very balanced with a alcohol ending.

Bottle- pours out a dark brown with a burnt orange head.  Aroma was sour, a little rancid.  Fortunately the taste didnt follow suit.  Sweet black coffee with some obvious alcohol.  Palate was thin and heavily carbonated.  Not my cup of tea.  Average.
Una de mis porter favoritas. Todo lo que buscas en una buena porter lo encontrarás aquí sin lugar a dudas. Me gustó mucho la espuma.

Black with a creamy tan head. Looks inviting. Roasted malt, dark fruits, vanilla and a hint of smoke on the nose. Taste is a lovely mix of filter coffee, stewed dark fruits, treacle, milk chocolate. Soft, smooth mouthfeel. A modest delight.

Its all a bit arbitrary really isnt it? Anyhow, Im back where I belong. Perhaps I used to work on the docks. Its a natural fit. Although I get hideously sea sick so maybe not. Ill tell you one thing for nothing though...Bullitt is overrated. Take away the chase and what have you got? On the otherhand, Harry Callahan is first class. First one anyway, goes downhill after that, but you cant have it all. Bet he drank beer like this. Puts hair on your chest. And they have a great bridge, iconic. One day Ill visit.

Black color, bubbly khaki head.  Its not too heavy, surprisingly (I heard this beer had a crazy high calorie-count).  Slight alcohol finish, medium carbonation.   I thin the description is a little "grand", but its definitely a great beer, and a superior porter.

I bought this because i love porters and have never had this one. Too bad this was apparently bottled in April of 2010 so it wasnt as good as it could be I bet. Dark black, smells ok, malty. the taste was so malty it was actually sweet and I could not get past it. It was not a bad flavor but I would bet if there were still some hops present this would be more balanced and Id also bet not as sweet. Oh well.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-05-2010 01:15:06

Pours black like tar(my favorite beer colour) with a nice foamy head which leaves a little but very nice lace. The smell is of toasted chocolate, coffee and hints of caramel. Tastes of roasted malt, mocha and a little bitterness at the end. Great mouth feel.

355 cl bottle poured into a Pint Glass
App/  black colour with a big brown head 
S/ mocha, cacao and toasted malt
T/ caramel and chocolate , then the sweetness ends and hops make his appearance
M/ medium-full body , medium carbonation. Long lasting  aftertaste
O/ the balance is perfect for a porter. One favorite from today

Pours deep brown black, with a tan head, creamy and with good lacing. Nice roast malt aroma with highlights of chocolate. Quite full bodied, smooth, slick mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. A little bit of sweetness in the middle and a nuance of hop toward the end. Big flavours yet easy drinking. Class.

Umami smell/taste (tough to distinguish, I have a strong nose haha); beautiful black; crisp hit with a smokey, flavorful finish and wonderful delayed aftertaste just rolls in nicely.
The palate is nice; I like how it plays along the tongue.
Overall yumyumyum

Pours dark brown with a thick tan head that sticks around.  Nice roasted malt aroma.  Excllent balance of the malt and hops with just a slight bitterness on the palate.  Dry roasty finish.  One of the best American Porters available.
UPDATED: OCT 22, 2012 Hints of chocolate coffee. Full body but not heavy. Nice head when poured. Good overall beer

From a bottle, pours black with a small amount of light coming through, a beige head that quickly dissipates. Smell of roasty malts, chocolate and  a bit of liquorice. Beatiful taste, plenty of liquorice which makes it stand out from the rest with chocolate, roasted malts, a bit of coffee and some creaminess. The liquorice flavour lingers on the tongue and there is also a nice roasty finish, lovely mouthfeel, quite thick, full bodied, medium carbonation. Excellent beer.
355cl bottle. Neutral nose, beautiful dark color and light brown head. Superb taste with roasted balanced taste. Greatness bottled.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2012 355ml bottle. Dark black color with white head. Aroma of roasty and coffee. But taste is wonderful. Full body, licorice, roasty, coffee and hops nicely burning. Very nice low % porter.
Bottle. Dark reddish color, tanned head. Full aroma of roasted malts, some hoppy background detected. Flavor is full, medium sweet and has a dry, bitter aftertaste. Very nice, full bodied porter.

355 ml bottle.
Originally rated on 20100730.
Pours dark brown color with small head. Aroma of spices, dark malts, chocolate notes and some fruits. Flavor of chocolate, toasted malts, fruits and some caramel. Nice.
Bottle@ with Bolton. Small head. Faint roasted malty notes blended with nonrefinded brown sugars. Fine taste suprised by the anis/licorice finish. Very nice.
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2013 Very good American porter. Rich, smooth, and slightly sweet with a clean after taste. Flavors of roasted coffee with vanilla and chocolate.

Color is black with a oily texture and small hazelnut head that quickly disappears. Smells like blackberry, molasses, raisins, vanilla, rape bananas and a little bit of warming alcohol. Taste is nicely balanced, not as sweet as it smells a bit sourness and salty  the palate is like sweet espresso. Enjoyed it a lot. Excellent porter.

Pours a dark black color with a small white head and very little lace. Smells is a very nice raison caramel smell on the nose. Taste is of dark roasted malts with a hint of coffee and chocolate and a surprisingly fairly dry finish for such a sweet smell. Definitely one of the best in its class.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2012 Aroma is very sweet. Toffee, raisins, almost like a sweet stout. Appearance is very dark, light brown head, two fingers. Taste is sweet at the front, a little carbonated, but tastes of toffee, dried fruits, then some coffee bitterness. Mouthfeel is thin, carbonated, flavor doesnt hang. Overall, it is decent, I wouldnt turn it down but wouldnt buy it myself.

35cl bottle from ABCBeers.
Thick off white head.  Deep clear burgundy pour.  Smooth chocholate/coffee taste.  Very nice porter.

Aroma: The smell is full of sweet dried fruits, raisins and dates, sherry and port. A whiff of really dark chocolate.Appearance: Pours dark brown, almost black, with a thick beige head leaving a good lacing.Taste: A sweetness like the mentioned dried fruits and caramel sugar. But also the sherry and some dark roasted coffee beans. But very well balanced with a good lasting bitterness.Palate: Small carbonation, but a good smooth body.Overall: A very good and warming porter for a bad and cold weather.Note: Bottle. Reviewed 2010-02-20.

355ml bottle - thought Id venture into some US bottles from Mitchells Wines, seeing as Ive tried very few from there. A perfect black body, a tan top, excellent 5 out of 5 appearance. The nose is smoky, a sweet caramel, dried fruits. excellently pungent but delicate. A lovely oily mouthfeel, a little froth on the tongue, superb. The taste has a lovely rounded bite of malt and chocolate. Overall, magnificent.

Nice deep chocolate porter. Only with a strong malt chocolate taste but surprisingly light and less filling than one would expect. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very smooth porter. Lightly hopped with non-overbearing roasted flavor. Good with food or by itself.

Good clean porter.  the nose is very malt forward in the chocolate range, but with a strong pure malt presence.  Deep brown bordering on black with a tan fading head.  Umami and sweetness with a snappy bitter finish.  Smooth and medium plus bodied.  Fantastic.
This is a nice light porter, pours black with tan head, nice mouth feel not to thick roast malts and light chocolate hints nice easy drinking porter
Negra, impenetrable. Con una suave espuma color crema que se va diluyendo y una textura sedosa. Aroma a café y regaliz, predominando el sabor amargo del café. Tremeda!

Pours a thick dark color and leaves a creamy tan head. Aroma of malts and chocolate. Taste is decent with notes of malt and chocolate followed by an almost bitter carbonation. Has a thick creamy texture on your palate. Overall, an enjoybale porter.
Pours black. Smell is roasty and sweet coffee. Taste is cream and sugar with a nice roastiness. Pretty good.

Aroma is primarily sweet malt with hints of dark dried fruit. A rich opaque brown pour with a non-lasting ivory head and minimal lacing. Generally this is a sweetish porter accompanied with some notes of chocolate and cherries. Has a mild bitter finish. Medium bodied and medium carbonation. Overall this was a good porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1500+ ratings and I havent rated this? Bizarre...  Pours clear black, thin tan head, fantastic lacing... Nose is roasted marshmallow, mixed nuts. Creamy roast character is quite charming and carries through to the palate. Flavours are moderately roasty, with toasted coconut, salted black licorice, a bit powdery, but excellent nonetheless.

170612: Large and nice creamy foam and deep black color looks very promising. The taste is good with a significant rounded and slightly roasted acid in aftertaste. Classic well brewed porter with easily creamy flavor.

Pours a dark black color with an inch thick beige head that lingers a long time.  Aroma is lots of roasted malt and sweet cream, a touch of chocolate.  Taste is fairly sweet with a lot of roasted malt and sweet cream flavor.  Not much complexity but tastes really good.  Love the mouthfeel too, creamy, thick, and sticky.  Finish is very smooth and the earthy hops finally come through a bit.  A very good Porter.  Excellent mouthfeel, closer to an Imperial Stout than a Porter, yet its only 5.6%.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */(2001), 35,5cl. Head: off-white colored. Color: coca-cola. Aroma: bananas, laurel, roasted malt. Taste: bitter, roasted malt. Palate: smooth, bitter, medium body. Overall: very nice.
Pours very dark with a moderate head. I think the beer has a lot of bitter coffee notes to it that arent the best. Some mild unattractive bitter notes to the beer. Not the best porter.
Kinda shocked this beer is so well rated... Absurdly malty, with roasted barley, chocolate malts, and nuts... Really no balance at all, not terribly impressed
Bottle @ home.....  It pours pitch black with a medium tan head..... The aroma is licorice, chocolate and roasted malt.....The flavor is roasted malts, chocolate and caramel...... Nice......

Botella de 355ml. Vaso de ½ pt. Sesión de cata de Cervecera única en agt´12. (Disfrutada muchas veces en el pasado). Color negro intenso y tintes de marrón muy oscuro a contraluz. Espuma marrón claro que crea una corona persistente y cremosa. Aromas de maltas torrefactas, maltas caramelo, toffee y frutos oscuros maduros con matices de café. Maltas Black al primer sorbo seguidas por cacao amargo y frutos oscuros deshidratados. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación moderada. Los lúpulos en el intermedio junto a las astringentes maltas torrefactas aportan un seco final. Caramel quemado en el retrogusto. Sabrosa y deliciosa.
355ml bottle. ½ Pint glass. Single brewer tasting session on agt´12. (Enjoyed many times in the past). Pure black, very dark brown to the light. Light brown froth creates a creamy & lasting crown. Roasted malt, caramel malt, toffee & ripe dark fruit aromas with coffee hues. Black malts at firs sip followed by bitter cocoa & dried dark fruits. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Hops in the middle & astringent roasted malts provide a dry finish. Burnt candies in the aftertaste. Flavorful & delightful.
bottle. Deep black, thick head. Caramel, roasted, smokey. Taste lasts long. Very good indeed.

5/22/12

Alright, my cold has subsided and my palate is back for the most part. Ive got some editing to do though so this is going to be a bit rushed. Luckily this isnt my first time having Anchor Porter.

A: Creamy head with near black body. Perhaps a very slight reddish tint. Think darkly stained wood as opposed to nasty maroon mini-van.

S: Sweet. Straight up cane sugar and sawdust (the yummy kind of sawdust).  I really cant smell any of the bitter cocoa/coffee/smokiness that is common in the modern porter.

T: Medium-full body. Smokey and creamy but NOT overly syrupy. Balanced carbonation and sweetness with a dirty tinge at the back of the tongue with somewhat of a tangy aftertaste. Hipters beware, this is a beer that tastes good.

Overall: Full disclosure here: This is pretty much my go-to beer when it comes to friendly Denton shindigs when I want to lay low, have fun and not pretend like Im cool or something.  Its affordable but its not Budweiser, its drinkable but its not Shiner Bock, and its interesting but its not Banana Bread Beer. I appreciate moderation in almost everything in lifeincluding my beer.  Anchor Porter is the Ron Paul of beer. On that note, vote for Ron Paul.
This porter does not hold a candle to the MI porters (Founders, Bells).  So light in every comparable category.  Very disappointing.

12 ounce bottle.  Aroma - Toffee and caramel aroma.  Appearance - Dark brown, foam layer on top that sticks around to deliver the aroma.  Taste - Honey-doo and roasted caramel.  Palate - Medium bodied, not too filling.  Overall -  The roasted flavors have a nice lasting effect if you let it sit around in your mouth.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle. Dark black in color with a small tan head. Strong roasted malt and coffee flavor. Ends with a bittersweet dark chocolate taste. Smooth and emjoyable to drink. I would pair this beer with pizza.
Bottle.  Poured a blackish color with huge foam head.  Aroma of candy, cocoa, roasted malt, caramel.  Med light sweetness.  Medium body.  A sweeter, smooth tasting porter.

Bottle. Opaque black with a dense beige head. Roasted, quite fruity aroma - light coffee, grapefruit, plums. Smooth mouthfeel, fat texture, sweet kinda port-like flavor with a dry hoppy, medium bitter finish.
Overall this is a unique porter. Hard to rate. Its Belgian characteristics threw me. But its enjoyable. Nice to have but not what Im looking for in a porter.
Rich dark chocolate predominates with a strong roasted bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel and well balanced. Fades to a not overly sweet caramel malt. Good porter!

16/03/2012 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Bevuta al 5th Stout&Porter Beer Festival. Nera, riflessi color caffé, schiuma biancastra sporca, poco persistente. Aroma di malti tostati, cioccolato e caffè, con leggeri sentori di luppolo. In bocca è molto ben equilibrata, di facile beva e appagante. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Una porter molto ben fatta e in splendida forma, sicuramente tra le migliori mai bevute.
Pint @ Ridge Pizza. This was after 40 oz. of beer at PNA Summer Beer Fest 2012 so my memory of it may be a bit hazy. However I remember it was very tasty and went well with my pizza.
Dark chocolate aroma. Some sweetness. Likewise flavour with a bit of caramel, perhaps.

Pours a dark brownish black from the bottle with frothy tan head that dissipates to leaves good lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, and a slight hop note on the backend. Taste is almost all the malt, with a slight soy sauce and hop characteristic. Very good porter, and probably the best from Anchor.
Bottle. Pours deep brown with a small brown head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is grain and roasted malt. Flavor is roasted malt, coffee, a bit of caramel and a mildly bitter finish.

Pours totally black with a light brown head. Aroma is roasty, chocolate, coffee, dark fruits and caramel. Taste is also roasty with dark fruit sweetness and caramel leading to a roasty and bitter finish. Great Porter
A great smelling porter. Has an aroma of chocolate, vanilla, and some coffee bean. Thin body, slick texture.

Pours very attractive. Solid porter smells.  Black licorice stands out quite a bit, but non-annoying(Im not searching for red licorice), dark chocolate, coffee. Lively, fresh, solid carbonation, feint malted barley. 

On the high end of coffee/black licorice taste for me, I prefer a Cutthroat or Black Butte but not bad.  Top 10 porter, between 5 and 10.

Pours a beautiful ebony with thick dark head.  Aromas of chocolate and roasted malt with hints of coffee.  Full taste of chocalate, hints of coffee with inittial sweetness followed by slight bitterness and a long mellow finish.
355 ml bottle. Pours black with large tan head. Aromas of roasted malt and milk chocolate. Flavors of chocolate and espresso. Rich with nice dry bitter finish. A touch acidic. Porter or stout?
Pours black ..huge brown thick head...taste is great..nutty chocolate joy..will do again
