12 fl. oz. bottle from Citys Choice, San Francisco, CA. Pours a deep dark brown, almost black color with a beautiful and persistant beige head. Aroma is malty and roasty with notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, tar and hints of ceylan tea, Zinfandel wine and licorice. Wow! Taste is bittersweet with a moderate toast. Lots of pure dark chocolate and licorice flavors. A small hint of cigar smoke. Wonderful. Full bodied Porter, warming and luscious. Bold long finish. Aftertaste is a little tarry and long. A marvelous classic Porter. Im glad I was able to try this in my San Francisco expedition.

Has a good aroma of hops, chocolate, espresso, and a little fruitiness. Taste is of dark chocolate and espresso with a slight bitterness. Somewhat chewy but in a good way. Overall a very good porter that I would like to buy again.
Black pour with a nose of chocolate and roasted malts. Taste is same with a little hop bite at the end. Very well balanced porter.
Great porter nose. Medium carbonation. Somewhat sweet when in hits the tongue but with a better finish.

Bottle. Dark coppery brown pour with a creamy lasting tan head. Aroma is pretty light and has notes of coffee, cocoa, nuts, citrus and vanilla. Flavour is quite roasty and similar to the aroma with the malt characteristics standing out but the hoppy hints of citrus and grass underpin it nicely. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel with soft carbonation and a lingering roasty finish. Nice, highly sessionable porter; exceptionally smooth and well-crafted.

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a very dark brown, almost black, with a thick tan head that lingers forever. Awesome lacing on the sides of the glass too.

Aroma of heavily roasted malt, espresso, and dark fruit. A little fruitiness from the hops is there too. 

A lot of roast comes through in the flavor along with a soft sweetness. Some chocolate and caramel along with a lot of dark fruit. Much more fruit in the taste than in the nose. The bitterness is moderate but it helps to balance out the sweetness. Fairly full mouthfeel.

Overall, this is an amazing porter. All the right components are there with nothing really being too overpowering. This would be a great beer in the winter and it is light enough to have a few of in a sitting.

Aroma has roasted sweet malt with licorice and some coffee. Bit medical herbs. Makes me wanna taste. Ebony black beer has bit beige expresso-like head. Leaves lacing. Looks good also. Taste is excellent: like french roast coffee with dark caramel sweetness. Abundant and long taste majes me happy. Damn I like this a lot. Its velvety smooth, bit oily. Had dark finnish rye-bread with strog cheese with this. Lots of flavor but this beers is just dancing in my mouth. Handled barbecued chorizon also easily. I think Im in love.

355 ml bottle. Pours beautiful opaque colour with mediumsized cappuchino colour head that leaves a lacing. Delicate aroma of strong coffee, roasty malt, milk chocolate, dark fruits and distant notes of ash.  Delicious taste of cocoa, chocolate, coffee, roasty malt, dark fruits and mild licorice as undertone. Full bodied, smooth mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Long, roasty and a bit ashy finish. An excelent beer.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2013 Close to black body with just vague hints of something deep maroon close to the walls of the glass. The head is large, creamy, light-brown, long-lived and laces the glass well. The heavy malty aroma is strong and very pleasant. Delicious chocolate, dark berries, roasted notes and caramel. The taste is moderate sweet and moderate to light bitter. Strong and delicious flavours, the rich chocolate is again in front, but the roasted notes, dark caramel and black currant are also playing along. Also some salty liquorice notes, almost soy sauce-like. Very impressive for such a low ABV. Smooth and pleasant mouthfeel with soft carbonation. One the best porters Ive ever had!
[35.5 cl bottle, enjoyed 1 year before BB date, from Vinmonopolet online]

Wow, thats a bit of a shock. Not at all what I would expect from a porter. Far from unpleasant, but at the most, its interesting. Perhaps a little too thin and fruity, with a dry sourness and a strange, resinous, almost flowery San Francisco tingle. The beer keeps biting the palate for a while. They say the Anchor Porter was the first modern American porter, and we gotta give a lot of credit to the history and resilience of Anchor Brewing. And what do I know about American porters or the West Coast? Its probably all part of that California attitude. I must say that from a distance, it looks fabulous, the first sip is disappointing, but the flavours do wrap up much better by the middle of the glass. Nothing wrong to say its an acquired taste. If I have a second one, I could even get something going with this Anchor Porter.

Tap. Pours deep, dark brown with average, creamy beige head; decent retention and spare lacing. Aroma is roast malt, milk chocolate, cocoa, figs, faint earthy hops, and black cherries. Flavor is balanced sweet malt and dark fruit esters with faint hops; semi-sweet finish. Medium body, carbonation, and warmth.

Decent sweet roatsed barley aroma, nice full dark tan heas. Medium  mouthfeeel, More hoppy than some Porters I have had. Bitterness at first then sweet rich barley. Elements of toasted sesemee oil, and bread.  Good mid grade Porter.

Pours deep dark brown with a fluffy tan head. The aroma is sweet, caramel, vanilla, sweet fruit finished with some coffee. Im a little thrown off, this is a lot sweeter than I expected. The flavor is dark malt with caramel, coffee, sweet fruit and a bit of tobacco. The body is thin with a long finish.

Rating #63 for 2012. 12oz bottle cold for a stem glass. Aroma, lightly roasted malt, alcohol, and sweetness. 2 inch tan colored head completely opaque black liquid, frothy tan cap and lacing. Taste, burnt malt. Palate, thin bodied medium to light carbonation finishes with a mild bite.

Pours a deep cloudy brown colour, with a small frothy tan head. Aroma is of slight coffee scents and toasted malt with a little bit of caramel. Taste has a nice dry bitterness with a really nice muted sweetness. Medium body, smooth mouth feel and good carbonation. Overall an amazingly good porter.

pours black with large tanned head. aroma is raisins, coffee, roasted nuts and brown sugar. taste is coffee, nuts, and floral resin. there is a surprising amount of bitterness, and strong earthiness, which make it quite an unusual drink. not my favourite style, but this is very good.

Pours black with a thick white head.
Malty, hints of coffee with a fruity sweetness.
Fairly light feel to it, evident dry hop, almost herby, finish.
Agree with Kevinator below, something very recognisably Anchor about this. 
Good solid porter, very tasty.

A truly malty porter. This was evident in the nose and the lingering taste. A nice thick head that reminded me of a root beer float. Any hops presence was nonexistent but I wasnt really expecting to find much. Ive come to discover how Old School and traditional this brewery is, and I mean that in a good way. Whats amazing is how this is different from their Steam
product but I could readily tell this Porter was theirs. Great choice if you are looking for a good American porter.

Den är helt underbar att titta på i sin iskalla svarthet, doften går inte heller av för hackor så ölen inleder på ett ytterst trevligt sätt. Smaken präglas främst av choklad och kola med en liten ton av humle som går igenom. Slutsas: en enkel men ack så intressant, god och mångfacetterad öl.

Backlog
2010
Dark color, ok foam
Medium body & complexity
SOme coffee notes
Enjoyable, but not a favorite
Bottle from Alko. Black color, full brown head. Mildly sweet, roasty taste with wood, smoke, coffee and herbs. Bitter finish with hops. Wonderfully different porter.

Bottle - not at all what I was expecting and I love it. Has aromas ant taste of chocolate and fruit, and an earthy-sour taste that is great, plus a solid dry hop note on the palate. A bit milky and a lint of sweet spiciness. Absolutely unique beer, only thing close to it was Guinness Foreign Extra Stout (the dry sourness.) Dark brown with big tan head.
Så prisvärt och gott. Smak och doft av choklad, karamell, en touch av laktris och kaffe.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2012 Black pour orange hue thin creamy beige to khaki head light lacing sticky .... aroma of roasted malts, faint caramel malts and light chocolate malts .... taste is of roasted slightly burnt malts, chocolate, caramel malts and light licorice ... Mouthfeel is thin has a light bitter hop bite that flows into the dry finish.  Solid porter very sessionable

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 Another very decent porter.  its close to Bells, but Bells is a Michigan brewery and I have to give the nod to the local boys.  Theres nothing wrong with this beer.  It has all the qualities you expect in a good porter - just not great.

Bottle from Csakajósör. Strong lasting foam, very light aroma. Overpowering banana hints in the falvour that put me off totally. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a rich ebony black color, with a creamy mocha head. Nose is malty and somewhat sweet. Taste is full bodied with bitterness and chocolate. Despite the low ABV can taste some alcohol. Landing is medium, with some chocolate and again some alcohol residue. Personally, would have liked a bit more sweetness. Quaff Score 7 /10 Nothing to rave about have had better
Pours black with a brown head and aroma of roasted malt. Taste is sweet and toasty, of roasted malt, hops, chocolate, fruits and alcohol with a smooth finish. Different tasting porter, nicely done.
Poured dark brown, almost black. Medium tanned head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla and hint of coffee. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee and herbs.

Bottle.  Pours a deep black with a thick brown head.  Nice, malty aroma of chocolate, cereal grains, and a touch of coffee.  The flavor is similarly malty - not much presence of the hops.  Complex malts, with chocolate, vanilla, and toast.  A bit of coffee on the aftertaste.   A solid porter.

35 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a big mocha head that fades slowly leaving some lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, sweet chocolate and a little vanilla. Taste is chocolate and roasted malts and is generally very smooth and drinkable.

drank out of bottle in my new half yard glass .. . pours a dark brown with a massive head. Light roast and charcoal, not thick like most of the dark beers ive sampled. A good beer, but with the warmer months arriving, i am still a lager lover..
Aroma is malt and chocolate.  Pours dark brown with a tan head.  Taste is sweet with malted barley and chocolate.  Great mouth feel.  This beer is like a great dessert.  Awesome.

Draught @ Anchors AT&T Park bar. Poured dark brown, slight coffee head. Chocolate, some roasted malts, vanilla, but all overridden by a powerful bitterness. In retrospect I probably should have let this one warm a bit, but Im not sure that would have given more balance.
From old backlog. Dark brown colour with small head. Aroma and malt is roasted malt, dark fruits.

On tap taste at Anchor Brewing Company at San Francisco Airport.

Opaque, very deep brown with huge head and very good lacing. 

Malty aroma with dark malt, toffee, mocha and dark fruit. 

Taste of mocha, toffee and roast malt. Delicious. 

Medium/light body and medium carbonation but very smooth mouthfeel.

Like a cross between a Scottish ale and a porter.  Very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2016 Bottle. Pretty much black with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate, grass, coffee, vanilla, aniseed. Medium bodied and very silky. Taste is slightly sweet with mocha, modest charred flavour, licorice and spices. Quite firm bitterness perhaps overshadows the clean malt side of things. But very nice all the same. [3.7][2/13] As above. A good and refined drop that could use a couple of slightly rough edges. [ 5/16] Seemed overwhelmingly sweet until I remembered it needs to be colder than youd think for a porter - 8Cish. Still like it.
Velvety smooth and delicious. The mouthfeel on this beer is fantastic. Simple yet delightful. Many of the top rated beers on this site are famous for their very complex and prominent flavors

Velvety smooth and delicious. The mouthfeel on this beer is fantastic. Simple yet delightful.  Many of the top rated beers on this site are famous for their very complex and prominent flavors. This beer is incredible in its drinkability, not big bold flavors.
Bijna zwart van kleur, flinke dichte kraag. Aroma van roggebrood, koffie, chocolade. Smaakt  wat naar hele pure chocolade, wat wrang.  Body mocht wat voller zijn wat mij betreft.
Gedronken in buitenlust met dutchdrebus. Kleur is zwart/rood met een flinke bruin/beige svhuimkraag. Ruikt zoet, koffie en smaakt ook zo.

Bottle @ Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Almost pitch black, just some ruby redness shining through with a light brown head. Smells coffee, roasty, chocolate and sweet. Tastes coffee, roasty, chocolate. Quite a full body for its abv. Great carbo. Great beer!

Pours an absolute jet black with ruby edges. Large foamy tan head that retains as good as any Ive seen. Nice spotty webbing on glass edge. 

Smells of chocolate, sourdough, and some grape. 

Taste of bitter chocolate, slight cola-like flavor, and some raisin. I dig this.

Excellent mouthfeel, with almost perfect drinkabilty, save for the heaviness. I like this porter. I would get again, and again, and again...
Bottle. Very dark color with a thin brown head. Aroma is roasted malt with some smoke and coffee. Smooth taste of roasted malt. Medium full body.

Bottle. Roasted malt, prune, coffee, molasses, chocolate aroma.  Clear black brown with a small tan head. Dark roasted malt, anise, coffee, dark fruit flavor. There is also a citric tartness and some spicy hops in the finish. Medium body.
Black with a brown head - sweet malt aorma - good malt body with some roasted malt biterness and some chocolate in the back - linger roasted malt finish - this was very good

Poured into a shaker glass from a twelve ounce bottle. Appearance is fairly dark brown with a huge fluffy khaki colored head of foam. The aroma is sweet like a cola, a Mexican cola perhaps, with notes of syrup and dark malts, and a touch of chocolate. Taste is sweet up front but moves to a mild to light bitterness in the finish. Good beer overall. I should have been looking into anchor long ago.
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is bitter chocolate, coffee, and dried dark fruits. Cocoa, roast malt, and coffee flavors. Great porter!
UPDATED: MAY 27, 2012 Defiantly anchors best beer. A very nice porter probably the second best that I have ever tried.
You can taste the experience in this one.  It hits the mark on all sides.  Id take another spin with this porter.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dagans place. Pours brown to black with a beige nice head, aroma of wood, cherries, dried fruits, malt syrup, flavor of malt, dried fruits, nice malty acids, nuts and some roasted tones, medium bodied, nice
Bottle.  Hazy dark maroon color, medium tan head.  Aroma of roasted coffee and dark fruits.  Taste is similar.  Nice.
Pours a dark almost  black color with a light brown head and good lacing. Aroma is roast, coffee, and chocolate. Flavour is coffee, cocoa along with some dark fruit. Medium to full bodied.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place. Thanks zvikar. Pours dark, opaque with a minimal head. Chocolate and carob aroma, smooth, sweet chocolate milk taste. Medium body, medium finish, almost no carbonation.
Bottle at Bishop Arms, Skövde. Dark beer with a nice beige head. Malty aroma with dried fruits and maybe a hint of licorice. Same flavour. A nice beer :-)
UPDATED: JUL 13, 2013 Rich and very flavorful. roasty, black, frothy, medium bitterness, creamy. The best domestic porter out there.

Bottle (355ml from Brewdog shop)
Cocoa and dark chocolate aroma to begin with, there is also a very sweet bitter aroma. Some dark fruits as well as some coffee.

Opaque black, large, foamy head that is light brown coloured and nice retention.

Very sweet to begin with, almost sugary but not quite, there is a rich chocolate taste and a lot of dark fruits. This looks set to be one of the nicest porters I have tried thus far.

Light bodied but not thin. Very smooth and well balanced carbonation. Bitter aftertaste with touches of coffee that stay around long after the beer goes.

It was a lot lighter that I was expecting but at the same time a lot more refreshing and easy to drink. The flavours all seemed well balanced as did the smell, this is a beer I can see me going back to time and again.

1001 Beers To Try Before You Die:
/1001beers

Bottle. Black colour with light brown head. 
Quite light malty aroma. 
Some roasted, maltflavour with a hint of bitterness. Coffee?
Aftertaste is a pretty good balance between sweetness and bitterness.
A pleasant porter.

Pours black with a substatial tan head.  Lots of roast in the nose, with some hints of cocoa and coffee. Just a hint of sappy hops lurking under the broad, dark roast aromas. The flavor is mostly comprised of a malty, chocolaty flavor - very similar to the aroma.
Attractive, dark color with tempting smokey nose.  Nice balance between malts and bitterness.  Very good!

Appearance: pours a dark black with some traces of ruby on the edge; 1-finger khaki head. Aroma: very roasty malt and chocolate malt aromas with some dried fruit (raisins) and some mild astringent alcohol. Taste: dried fruit flavor up front leading into the middle with some some cerealy maltiness, the dark chocolate/coffee bitterness on the finish with touches of floral hops. Mouthfeel: surprisingly thin yet creamy, slick body, dry aftertaste. Overall: itâs a pretty good beer. Iâm not an expert at porters (yet!) but itâs much thinner and almost more watery than I was expecting. The flavors are nice and somewhat complex but itâs definitely now wowing me.

12 oz bottle. This is a tried and true classic for the style. Rich, roasted, well hopped, and balanced example. Pours with a layer of bubbly dark cream head that dissipates and leaves a thin layer with some good lacing, and a ruby brown body. Nose is with prominent roasted malts, some cocoa malts, creamy caramel, and hazy earth and pine. Simple, yet appealing aroma. The body is mildly carbonated and sweet up front, but creamy and dry through the finish. A good variety of rich dark malts through out the flavor with caramel, malted candy, cocoa, some pale, and some mixed cereal. Again, a herbal and earthy bitter stand out and are prominent through the finish and pleasant linger along with a roasted cookie malt. Overall, great drinkablility. This will always be a go to when in the mood for a solid porter.

Pours a deep black with a very creamy brown color that retain very well and laced nicely too. Rich malt sweetness, not overbearing though, nice chocolate smell is present as well. Nice and malty sweet, chocolate taste is present as well, a little bit of coffee taste is there as well. Nice carbonation for a dark beer, medium body, taste stays around on palate for a while.

An above average porter, pours nice and black with a nose of smoke and chocolate. A nice malty start with some hop bitterness makes this a classic example of the style, just nothing very outstanding about it.

Pours dark brown, nearly black with off white head and lacing. Medium nose of bitter chocolate roasted nuts, cafe au lait. Really nicely balanced palate of roasted nuts, black coffee, bitter chocolate. Great finish. Nice bitterness throughout and a great flavor. Really good beer.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2012 This is a very nice Porter. Pouts really nice with a nice top. Deep dark color. Nice coffee and I get a hint of hazelnut at the end. I actually love this porter. ---Rated via Beerology

Another Anchor, another wonderful brew. Anchor Porter is a nice, simple, direct porter. Not burnt, nor over done with coffee beans. Just a wonderful, deliciously dark ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown colour. Roasted malts aroma. Flavour is burnt malt and chocolate. Nice porter

Bottle at Pelican Inn Muir Beach.  Standard porter with with a good head.  Smells sweet of malt and raisins with perfumy wood and hops.  Good balance between mild sweetness and bitterness.  Chaulk on the palate. Nicely textured though less creamy. More hoped than my I prefer in a porter but in way unpleasant.

like with most of what Anchor makes, im not a huge fan of this porter. the flavors are kinda thin and the finish is overtly dry. im sure at one time this was the standard bearer of porters, but this one is kinda meh to me.

a bit strange that I have never bothered to type in a rate for this god´s elixcir. This is THE best porter in the world, and the industry standard for a craft brewed porter. Complex aroma of burned wood, malt, liquorice, chocolate. Dark with a firm head. Medium sweetness, awesome balance of bitterness and malt notes, perfect combo of hops and malt for the style. Long finish. simply awesome
Dark brown in appearance. Taste is roasted malts, dried fruit, vanilla. Quite sweet. Quality porter.

355ml bottle. Aroma is not too strong, but some caramel and roastiness comes through. Pours very dark brown with a thin toffee head. Taste is relatively complex, caramel, roasted malts, and a little tart and saltiness. Body was a full medium. Overall, quite solid, but not the very best.

Solid... if you like horehound candy... this is the most perfect beer created on earth.  It is definitly unique..  Good... good smell... liqourous, malt, dark candy.

A nice beer.   Why do I rate it so high?  Because it is very very unique.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2012 On tap at Beer Bier, Budapest. Black opaque color with medium brown head. Roasted malty aroma with bread and butter. Its a bit like that we eat a bread-and-butter to the beer. Oily, dry, creamy, roasty, coffee, caramel. Intereting, complex and delicious one. Dry, light bitter taste. Light body with creamy texture and average carbonation. Long dry malty and coffee finish. Very delicious beer, light body, but rich and intensive aroma. Its easy to drink, but it can easily make you drunk.
On draft pour.  Pitch black with a light tan head.  Light roastiness with some chocolate malt.  Very smooth and drinkable for a porter.

Pours a nice black with a frothy tall brown foam.  Caramel and malty aroma.  There are some coffee and chocolate subtleties.  The taste is slightly bitter with an upfront sourness.  Very interesting.  The finish is clean and butter leaving the palate wanting more.

Pours a dark brown, not black, has some mocha colored edges. Huge head, huge. Fluffy and bone white. Smell is certainly not overpowering, but I can detect the roasted malts, maybe even some floral honey scents. Tastes much like the scent, doesnt get in its own way. Hops have more of a play than I would have thought. Mouthfeel is creamy but not overly thick. Roasted malt is more noticeable in the back as this beer warms. Overall, a soild Porter.

Bottle. Pours black, full tan head. Excellent aroma mixing malt and hops, caramel, chocolate, floral and fruit aromas. Taste is medium sweetness. Caramel and fruit come through nicely. Full body, creamy, nice bitter hop finish. Very tasty and well balanced, unique porter. Great overall.

355 ml. bottle @ home. pours a dark brown almost black colour with 1 finger of dense white foam. medium duration. aromas are of chocolate, licorice and maybe tobacco. the taste is kinda light bodied, but the notes is caramel, chocolate and licorice in a small amount.. a hell of a porter :)

Dark brown/black color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, chocolate, & subtle dark fruit; Flavor of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, coffee, and dark fruit; Nicely balanced; Overall, I enjoyed this one.

6/II/2012 355ml bottle from Gradi Plato @ home - BB: II/2013 (2012-106) 
Clear dark purple brown to black beer, big frothy beige head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet caramel, dried fruits, slight mocha hint, liquorish. MF:low carbon, medium body. Taste: caramel, sweet malts, brown sugar, toast, little nutty, dried cranberries. Aftertaste: mocha, bit sour, some hop bitterness, cocoa powder.

Purchased at Armanettis in Chicago, IL; enjoyed after a couple of days span of saying bye to people at work.  Appearance is pitch black with a very frothy tan head that laces to the glass, looks decadent.  Aroma of roasted chocolate malt, more malty than anything, a hint of molasses which is unusual for a porter.  Taste is pretty good, standard really, more malty than hoppy, chocolate presence, nice bitterness to it.  Very solid porter.

Wow! Black color with ruby highlights, thicky moka head. Aroma of porcini mushrooms (Boletus aereus), roasted malt. Taste is rich, from coffee to mushrooms again (unbelievable!). Leaves a pleasant aftertaste. Body is a bit oily, soft carbonation.
Bottle; black beer with large beige head; aroma-roasty, coffee; taste-medium sweetness, lightly bittermedium body, creamy, average carbonation. Good beer but mediocre porter
Botella de 35,5 Cl. Muy buena cerveza Porter. Muy aromatizada y un color perfecto
Bottle Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, plums. Taste is malts, chocolate, sweet dark dried fruits. Very good drinkability.
Good beer for drinking or boiling brats. Pours a deep dark brow with a billowy off white head. Nose and taste are of malts with a trace of hops. Another reliable offering from Anchor.

Pours a deep black with a fair light cocoa head.  Aroma is of roasted malts, chocolate and barley.  Nice smooth flavor, fair level of carbonation, chocolate, roasted malts, barley and a hint of hops in the finish.
300ml bottle. Pours dark brown body with a small, escaping, beige head. Aroma and taste of coffee, mocha and vanilla. Little bitterness. Not bad!

Bottle.  Brownish but basically black pour with a medium brown head.  Roasted, chocolate, coffee malt aroma.  All these notes are present in the flavor as well.  It also, however, has a little banana and some musty finish.  A very good porter - straightforward and tasty.

coffee, chocolate, nuts, herbs, spruce, floral, barnyard, leather, basement aromas, bubblegum, cooked vegetables, smoke, skunky, woody, vanilla, cooked vegetables, brown, sparkling, rocky head, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, salty, thick feel, full body, oily feel, flat, bitter, long finish, astringent,

Pours a clear black with a good brown head and thick spider-web lacing.  Taste is bitter malt with coffee.  In the middle, there are hints of licoroce, prunes and currants.  There is clean bittering in the finish, but it seems more related to the coffee than to hops.  Over a little heavy, but just right on cold winter nights.

Not getting as much from this as some. Initial hings of coffee, some vanilla. Backing is bitter with hints of metal. Picking up wet dog in the nose. All in all, it works, but Im not sure it works for me on the level of others. Maybe try another.
the aroma is earthy. lots of malted barley. excellent hop profile.natural carbonation is outstanding.very good licorice notes.

Bottle at home. Pours black-brown with thick, tan head. Aromas are plummy, raisiny, chocolatey and creamy. Flavours of gorgeous liquorice, raisin, chocolate, possibly marzipan and some caramel. Subtle yet present carbonation. Excellent, classic beer.

Nice dark appearance with decent brown head. Nose is fairly sweet, hints of vanilla and chocolate and roasted malts . Taste is coffe bitterness with some chocolate, roasted malts and hops. Like the aroma more than the taste in which the hops are a bit too present for my taste. After a while the chocolate warms up and becomes more present.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2012 Pours black with an awesome, pillowy head, which turns into nice lacing. Aromas are not significant at first...but as the beer warms notes of caramel and banana hit the nose. On the palate, espresso, followed by a nice sweetness...again, I get caramel and bananas. Nice slightly bitter finish. Amazing beer!!!
36cl, American brew, from Bierzwerg Greven, not complex Porter, sweet/malty and slightly roasted/fruity, easy to drink, balanced, clear, good head, good brew

355 ml. bottle. Black colour with dark brown hues. Thick, creamy tanned head that fades to a fat cap and leaves a good lacework. Sweet and roasted aroma with hops, chocolate, coffee and licorice.  Light sweet taste with roasted notes of coffee, dark dried fruits and chocolate. Medium body with a creamy texture. Finished long lasting with a hoppy, bitter chocolate note. An excellent, well balanced porter, that states a beer do not need to be extreme to be well made. Love it!
(Bottle 07/01-2012) Medium light brown head, light roasted hoppy aroma, fit body, fresh porter taste slight dry roasted after taste. BB date 04.22.13.

Anchor Porter has a thick, creamy, beige head and a dark, black (ruby, under light) appearance, with lots of lacing. The aroma is initially neutral, but as the beer warms, one detects prunes, other dark fruits, and hops. Taste is very bold, with licorice, prunes, dark cherries, fruit, hop bitterness, chocolate, dark coffee, and malt across the taste. Mouthfeel is heavy, and Anchor Porter finishes mostly dry and bitter. This is a wonderful beer. RJT

Superbe présence en bouche agrémenté par leffervescence naturelle. Le malt rôti, le chocolat et le café nous amènent vers une confortable amertume fraîche. La finale assez sèche contribue à sa buvabilité morbide. Des notes de mélasses sajoutent après quelques minutes de repos.

Petite bouteille brune. Avec un peu de retard, jai finalement bue ce classique de bière brune foncée qui a au somment une mousse brune brune durable. Le nez est peu complexe mais combien embaumant, les notes de fruits, de chocolat et de caramel se partage la vedette. La bouche est tout simplement superbe, ronde et expansive. Les saveurs de chocolats et de noix grillés sont divines. Il y a une touche métallique en fin de bouche qui nous éloigne de la perfection malgré quon est pas loin.

Bottle to pint glass.  Pours a dark brown / ruby color which is mostly opaque.  Sparse tan head.  Lots of roasted malt flavors going on, and maybe some fruit like dates or plums.  Another nicely done porter.
Poured opaque black, with a thin, tan head.  Aroma is faint chocolate.  Taste is very straightforward: chocolate and roasted malt.  An excellent representation of the style.

Best porter Ive had in awhile. Dark chocolate flavor, not too sweet, good carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pours very dark brown with a big, doughy light brown head and great retention.  Aroma is signature anchor oxidative butterscotchiness, raisins, some chocolate, molasses, and coffee.  Taste is coffee, raisin, caramel, butterscotch, some mint.  Body is full, chewy, low carbonation, long bittersweet finish.  Overall, this must be what beer was like 100-200 years ago; reminds me of Samuel Smiths with the fruity butterscotchy fermentation profile.  Pretty good if it were brewed in someones kitchen, but lackluster for a commercial example.  Why is this so highly rated?

355ml bottle. Dark brown with a creamy head. Initially I get a sort of musty, aniseed-like aroma rising up. Dark fruits and chocolate swimming in the taste; different to the English porters Ive had but everything seems so well balanced. Little bit of alcohol heat in the finish. Superb.

Bottle:
I do vaguely remember that I tasted this beer in the past, though not making any notes, all I remember was that is was a delicious and well balanced brew.
So I guess until next time, when I drink this beer again and feel the need of making a review for this brew, I might change this rating...
Though now it is here in the database, why bother...
Its a good beer.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: slight citrus note in the aroma, along with syrupy chocolate notes. quite sweet for me, but the body helps absorb that to an extent. medium body with medium carbing, makes it stay on the tongue long enough to bring you back to the glass.

Date: December 19, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Ale Jail Description: Opaque dark brown pour with nice amount of head. Aroma was chocolate and nutty. Taste was similar to aroma with some coffee. Was a tad too thin for me, otherwise very tasty brew!

Bottle bought from Cellars in Billericay. Pours a lovely dark brown with a magnificent beige head. Aroma is heavy on the banana with toffee notes. Taste is gorgeous raisin fudge with banana coming through with a touch of vanilla. Quite thin on the palate, but it is a porter and not a stout. A simply gorgeous beer. If you like rum and raisin fudge, youll love this.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2012 Dark brown with a red tint and a light brown head. Smells of roast coffee, caramel some fruity plum and malt with a smoky element. Medium thin body light carbonation. Sweet banana start with a caramel malt middle and a smooth chocolate light roast coffee finish. Very smooth. Goes down very easy. Balance between the sweet and sour. I like it a lot.

The head was average, creamy, and between light brown and dark. The color appeared to be between dark brown and black. The malt aroma smelled of molasses, coffee, with a sweet underlying roasted tone, with just a hint of black licorice. The palate was medium, creamy, and average. The flavor duration was average, with a light to moderate sweetness. Overall, there was an excellent aroma, creamy head, with an excellent roasted malt flavor, without being burnt. Great porter.

1 Pints 6 fl oz- Bottle- Poured into a Sniffer. Pour is Dark with a Dark tan head..The smell is roasted Malts and and chocolate with light toffee, Palate is well balanced flavor of Malts and chocolate, This is a damn good Porter..Not heavy or overpowering at all..Save a few swigs and Pour it over a bowl of Vanilla Ice Cream. It is amazing

Bottle @ home. I havent had this in ages, so Im pretty pumped to finally try it again. Deep brown/black appearance with a creamy, brown head with great retention. Roasty, chocolate malty, light smoke, a touch woody, light espresso, chocolate aroma. Creamy mouth feel. Quite roasty chocolate malty, moderate espresso, somewhat burnt, lightly smoky (more so on the finish), light caramel, chocolate flavor. A touch burnt, smoky, roasty chocolate malty aftertaste. Easily drinking tasty beer.

Sinceramente questa è davvero una gran birra, aspetto meraviglioso, nero impenetrabile con schiuma color cappuccino che rimane fedele al bicchiere. Al naso caffè, liquirizia e leggero cioccolato. In bocca scivola via che è un piacere e lascia un retrogusto lungo di liquirizia. Manca solo un buon toscano...
From bottle. Pours black with no head. Lots of dark roasted coffee aroma and burnt chocolate. Slightly smokey with an oily texture. Tasty tasty.
Bottle. Pours black with a beige head thaty linger Chocolate and toffee aroma. More chocolate in the flavour with sweet raisin too. Medium body. Very good.

Une tête solide sur un liquide à la robe presque noire.  Des parfums alléchants de café et de chocolat avec une réglisse expressive.  Des saveurs chocolatées subjuguées par une réglisse noire et salée.  Des flaveurs mémorables.  Une bouche qui propose une densité qui saccorde au style.  Un apport de bulle maîtrisé et efficace.  Une texture à la limite huileuse.  Une finale amère et longue de grains rôtis et de houblons mentholés.  Classique.

Last 4oz draught before keg blew.  Persistent foamy head (last of keg).  Very thin lacing.  Body dark red passing some light.  Aroma is roasted chocolate toffee that really carries in the taste which is sweet.  Palate is smooth, balanced, nice.  Overall great.  Might still be there if it hadnt blown.

The chocolate malts hit first followed by milder toffee aroma. Black with a tan pillow like head. Head starts off at a strong two finger then levels off to a one.   Has rich coffee like taste that is only mildly bitter. Has a nice smooth feel. Has a nice sweet follow through that is quite pleasant. The rich malt in the beginning is superbly balanced with the sweet hop finish. Each mouthful is better than the one before. Havent had a dark beer like this taste so sweet. Pity I only bought one bottle. Nice job Anchor Brewing Company!
Aroma is malty with a little chocolate and mocha.  More of the same in the flavor, bread, chocolate, coffee and nut.  Carbonation gives it a nice mouthfeel and a nice finish.

Bottle @ Home. Pours black with a light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, raisins, plums. Taste is malts, chocolate, sweet dark dried fruits, notes of licorice in the finish. Thin to medium body, soft carbonation, very easy drinking. 261111
goes down so perfectly!! shame only have 6 of those!!!

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2011 Aroma is chocolate, plum, toffee, roasty, coffee, black licorice. Appearance is black with full tan head that holds well. Taste is sweet chocolate and roast, coffee, plum, toffee, caramel, creamy. Palate is medium full and silky. Overall a great porter.

Very dark beer, without much additional colour in the dimple than black. Lovely fluffy mocha head that sits nicely on top of the beer. Good cocoa and chocolate aromas. Maybe a little brandied, christmas cake fruit. Theres notes of allspice as well. Lovely.
The body is slightly thinner than I was expecting, but maybe then I was expecting a stout. Those Chirstmas cake flavours come through nicely along with cola and fluffy soft drink. For all that, tasty and a beer that I cant wait to try on tap in a pint in the States. Lovely.

Bottle.  Pour is deep brown/ almost black with a nice medium light brown head.  Aroma is loaded with roasted malt, light coffee, and a distant touch of hops.  Flavor is also loaded with roasted malt, faint mocha, and a clean faintly piny finish.  This beer is so clean and pure.  This is a great porter macro or micro.  I crave this every fall.  Also quite warming for cold nights.

12 ounce bottle that pours a dark black color with a tan head.  Aromas of roasted malt, caramel, dark chocolate, and a touch of vanilla.  Flavors dance on the tongue a sweet melody of the aroma blended together, and extremely balanced where each flavor doesnt over power each flavor.
black, medium body, my first feeling of the aroma was that it smells like a cellar, but was positive suprised by the taste.

355 ml bottle. From bierzwerg.de.
Black colour with average size creamy tan head.
Roasted malt, mild coffee, dark fruits and mild hoppiness in aroma.
Flavour is roasted malt, some sweetness, mild coffee, dark chocolate and dark fruitiness. Very nice traditional Porter.

Pours black with quarter inch head with great retention and some lacing.  Flavor contains roasted malts with hint of dark fruits and coffee.  Texture is slightly more slick than expected, soft carbonation.  Great porter.
Very light caramel nose, not much head. Starts out light on the palate with not much sweetness, followed by roasted malts and chocolate, ending bitter, almost grassy. Drinkable but not great.
Very fine light brown head, quite dark. lightly sweet nose with bread and coffee. Fullbodied and half long. Bitter chockolatre, coffee with a sweet exit. Pleasant "light" porter.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours opaque black with very small dark brown highlight and big beige head.  Pretty good lacing, medium body, and medium carbonation.  Taste is roasted malt, some caramel malt, some woodyness, and finishes wierd sweet.  Pretty good porter, but finish is wierd.
pours dark with low white head. smoky but weak body. not everydays beer, not the best porter too:)
Poured from bottle to pint glass.  One of the best Porters I have had.  Very very tasty!

pours very dark brown with a decent beige head, some retention and lacing. aroma is loads of caramel malts, some roasted malts. baltic sweetness, raisins, woodyness. soft carbonation, medium body, relatively short grassy finish. not my type of porter.

Pours a very dark brown with one of those creamy heads that great beers have.  Smells roasty with chocolate and dark fruit.  Faint alcohol smell too.  Taste of raisins really comes through.  More fruity than you migth expect, but very well balanced and smooth.  Tastes great.

Bottle. Dark reddish brown with a thick, creamy beige head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee with a light smoky roasted malt. Flavor is very rich chocolate and roasted coffee malt with a light bitterness and faint smoke. Medium body with average carbonation and a thick, creamy mouth feel. This is an outstanding porter, its been a long time since Ive had this but after revisiting this Im going to drink this more often.

Pour from a 12oz bottle. Inky dark brew with thick and frothy head. Great head retention. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, a little dark fruit, a little smoke, and a little ethanol. Taste is sweeter malts blending into aa roasted malt with a very well balanced finish. LIngering hops bitter in the after taste. Excellent palate. A technical masterpiece that is indeed excellent, but lacking a bit in distictiveness and character.

Anchor porter is almost black porter with big foamy head.
Aroma has hints of coffee like roastiness, caramel and hints of chocolate, plums and liquorice.
Anchor has light coffee/cocoa flavor, with light touch of roasted malt. Its pretty sweet for porter, but aftertaste has balancing fairly dry bitterness.
Mouthfeel is medium to medium "well", quite easy to drink.
 Afterall, Anchor Porter is rather good porter and classic example by the style.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2012 Tasted from bottle into standard pint glass. Pours an opaque, very dark brown color with creamy beige head. Very aromatic: rising dough, baking bread, roasted barley, some fruity yeast esters. Flavors of toast, caramel, molasses, dark coffee and chocolate, ripe apricots, black currants, dried cranberries. Medium body and "chewy" mouthfeel. Balanced bitterness from hops and roasted barley make for a lingering aftertaste which dries out a few seconds later. Exquisite. One of my all-time favorite beers.
bought a bottle at corte ingles, lisbon. Quite thick texture and dark and dense appearance. Overall quite interesting.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2013 Pours black, with thick, light tan, lacy head that sticks to the glass. The aroma is malty, roasted, hoppy, with hints of chocolate, that carry right over into the taste. Balance with mild roasted, bitter flavor, hints on dark chocolate. Palate is a bit light but somehow a little chewy as well. Finish remains balanced, not bitter, somewhat dry but satisfying, and lingers just the right amount of time. A solid, balanced, mildly interesting porter, and definitely well for done for a modest ABV beer.

Bottle.  Pours very dark brown to black with a light brown head.  Aroma is of roasted malts and slightly smokey.  Flavor is slightly sweet with notes of roasted malts, caramel, sweet smoke and a hint of licorice and coffee.  Pretty good for a porter.
I dont know if something was wrong with this keg, or what. This was downright awful. How is this 3.84, and a 99? Ugh. It smelled and tasted like stale pancakes and mold. This was disgusting.

Draught at Csak a jo sor, Budapest. Funny how I seem to end up trying Anchor on tap everywhere on this trip... Very dark red body, almost black. Off white head, creamy. Nice full creamy malty nose, light notes of chocolate. Creamy malty taste, light herbal bitterness, light alcohol, maybe light chocolate. Simple but cool enough.

355mL bottle poured jet black into glass with light brown head, good retention and some fine lacing.  Aroma of rosted malts and chocolate and a hint of hops.  Taste is roasted malts and chocolate with a bit of coffee bitterness followed up by a mild hop bitterness in the finish.  A very full bodied and nicely carbonated brew that was truly enjoyed.

355 ml bottle served in snifter. 3 finger beige-mocca head that reduces to 3mm, black body. Nose: Coffee, dark and bitter chocolate, figs. Taste: Coffee, chocolate, Madeira, a hint of tar, roasty malts, caramel, raisin, dried plums, dates, dark dried fruit. Great!

In bottle. A black porter with a nice, thick tan head. Aroma of caramel, roasty malts, oatmeal and toffee. Great roasty flavour with just enough caramel sweetness. The finish is also a little sweet with coffee, caramel and bitter dark chocolate characters. Foamy mouth-feel and medium carbonation. Alcohol comes through in the finish also. Delicious!

One of my favorite go-to porters! This brew poured up near black with a mocha-colored, very foamy head with amazing retention and lacing effects.  Aromas of caramel, coffee, toffee, dark fruits (figs, raisins), and a touch of molasses.  Flavors of the same in a medium-bodied brew.  Extra creamy and smooth with just a touch of a hoppy bite to make for a clean, refreshing finish.  You cant go wrong with this porter!
Tap at brewdog. Sweet aroma, some coffee, some berries. Malty taste, some coffe, lots of berries and dark fruits, raisins and plums. Nice clean mouthfeel. Pretty decent but not really my thing

Bottle. Pours jet black, nice two-finger tan head. Nose is pretty big and roasty, with some dark chocolate and sugar. Taste: pretty much a great American-style porter. Nice mild chocolate undertones, slight coffee roastiness, strong malt bill. If this were a bit less sweet and emphasized the roasted bitterness a little more, it would be perfect.

One of the finest examples of a porter. Very nearly bordering on a milk stout with its creaminess, the hoppy finish bordering on a black ipa, the roasted malts bordering on a Baltic porter, this takes all the best from the above and comes out with the easiest drinking, most delicious porter.

Bottle from Systembolaget, at home. May, 2011.

Pours dark brown with a small tint of red. Large beige head. Aromas with notes of chocolate, coffee and dried fruits like raisins and dates. Very fruity, sweet and rich. Medium bodied. Flavours of dark malt, coffee, raisins and chocolate in the taste. Slightly sweet and very well balanced.
Bottle.  Nice balanced flavor of alcohol, chocolate and coffee.  A little wine-like in a way.  Thin palate, medium carbonation.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint.

Appearance: Almost black mahogany with creamy tan head and some lacing lines.

Aroma: Molasses, licorice, roasted malts and some coffee and chocolate.

Taste: Molasses and roasted malts co-mingle with bitter notes of coffee and dark chocolate. Turns more bitter at the finish with nice hop accents.

Palate: Moderate carbonation, smooth and creamy body, very dry finish.

Overall: Dry and somewhat bitter Porter that surprisingly did not overdo the roasted character to accomplish that feat. Just a very smooth, complex and drinkable Porter.
Appearance: Pours black with about a finger of light tan head. Nose: roasted malts, coffee, chocolate. Taste: smokey chocolate, maybe a bit of dark fruits and a slight hoppiness. Very smooth.
Black with a couple of inches of tan head. Roasted malt, coffee and smoke nose. Quite thick, good carbonation. Plum, roasted malt and some alcohol taste.

A creamy brown head with an aroma of roasted malt and a bit of coffee and chocolate.  The flavor is pretty much the taste equivalent of the aroma with a slightly stronger coffee/chocolate aftertaste.  A great standard porter.
Bottle. Tidy. Pours black with a resilient beige head. Tastes of roasted dark malt and chocolate. Everything I could hope for from a porter.

Draft in a pint - pours like chilled used motor oil with tan head that disappears quickly. Aroma is coffee and all around malty like a doppelbock. Taste is sweet and mildly bitter. Aftertaste is noticeably hoppy.  A tasty style but not for me.

En lätt wärldsporter där den mörka malten spelar första fiolen men lämnar tillräckligt med utrymme åt humle att få glänsa också. Torrare, men också något tunnare efter lagring. Mycket öl för pengarna drar upp betyget.
Pours a deep brown body with a lively tan head. Sweet, smokey flavor. Some chocolate, raisins, and bitter coffee. Very dry finish.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2015 33 cl bottle from "Il regno di Gambrinus". Served into an english half pint. Pours a dark ruby red/brown with a nice and big beige head that last long. Lovely aroma of dark fruits, coffee, chocolate, smoke, burnt malts and liquorice. Goes down extremeley smooth thanks to an awesome creamy and almost liquorous mouthfeel. The carbonation is soft and the finish is smokey/sweet and dry. Delicious.

Bottle at home. Dark brown, thick tan head fades to nothing. Ovaltine, roasty, chocolatey, slightly porter-tangy nose. Possibly perfect porter nose. More tang on the palate, with plenty of dry ovaltine/malty/chocolatey richness. Lovely roasty hop linger, really works. Textbook porter, really stunning.

Bottle from Regional Wine and Spirits. Pours chestnut brown with a small off white head.  Banana chocolate nose which was quite odd. Not bad at all. Smokey, almost tar-like chocolate in the taste. Has a rather dry and bland finish but besides that its solid
Black with a dense tightly packed thick brown head; coffee and chocolate nose; chocolate on the tongue; bitter, malty, coffee like finish.
Dark cola colored pour. Heavy malt aroma. Bitter coffee notes with a solid malt backbone. Too heavily carbonated for me.

Surprised I havent rated this. 12 ounce bottle from Total Wine West Richmond, rated 3/21/11. Pours a dark brown color with a large brown creamy head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of bitter metallic hops, chocolate and roasted malts. The taste is roasted malts, caramel, bitter hops, some fruity notes. Medium bodied.

36 cl bottle, BBE 02/2013
Aroma has really roasted malt and chocolate. Flavour has really nice roastiness and dark chocolate. Sweetness and dry roastiness are in perfect balance. One of my favourite porters!

1 pt 6 fl oz bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a near black, dark brown with fairly large, creamy, light brown head.  Aroma is roasty with coffee, chocolate and some rich dark fruits.  Flavour is smoky with coffee, cocoa and dark fruit with a modestly drying finish.  Rather creamy texture.  Quite nice.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2011 Bottle - pours inky black with 3 fingers of milk chocolate head. Aroma is chocolate,  aroma is chocolate and toasted malt. Taste is sweet with a bit of lingering bitterness. The lingering bitterness becomes more pronounced as the beer gets warmer. Body is thick like milk.

Bottle from Bestillingsutvalget enjoyed at home
Dark brown, black in glass, big big tanned head. Smells of coffee, caramel and malts. Taste is fruity, alot of coffee, full malt body with good sweetness. Also hints of tar. Nice oily feel and a nice hoppy bitter finish. A very nice beer from Anchor
This beer didnt stand out in my opinion. Standard black porter color, not much smell, average taste and decent mouthfeel.
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2014 A black beer with a thick brown head.  The aroma is of sweet roasted malt and raisins.  The flavor is  overripe bananas, chocolate, and raisins.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown with a big and creamy, but diminishing beige-brown head. Good lacing. Quite sweet aroma, with notes of bread, toffee, fruits, sweet liquorice and remote barbecue notes. A bit cloying. Flavour is sweet and roasted with notes of sweet liquorice, fruits, faint smoked notes and a hint of vanilla. Feels a bit watery. Dry and a bit tart, roasted finish. Too much carbonation. Overall okay, but a bit too cloying for my liking. 15.07.11.

Draught @ Beer Temple, Amsterdam on 18 March 2011. Clear red-black, with pale brown foam head and part lacing. Deep earthy pungency and sweetness in aroma. Roast malts with some sour lactic flavours in-mouth; finish is sour with some citric notes. Zingy mouthfeel,

Very dark, but not coal black. Light barely comes through. Head disappeared quick and was not large. There seems to be some bubbles coming up constantly so theres bohemian silk which lasts probably long. Smell is malty. Taste is dry and first aroma brings licorice in mind. Malts and hops are well balanced, while texture is a bit too fizzy to my taste. Finish is long and interesting.

Very dark Brown. Like black, at the glass. Ok head, holds pretty good, sticks nice. Coffee, chocolate, dark fruits. Good spiced, decent Porter for sure. But like most I miss a small boost. Moderated dry bitter roastiness gets trough mostly at the end.

Pours dark brown/black with thick, brown-stained head.  Strong roasted barley aroma: I smelled it before I even poured the beer!  Notes of coffee and mild chocolate on the nose. Complex flavor with mild chocolate, coffee, roasted grains and caramel blending to form a smooth, creamy texture.  Slightly bitter finish with mild earth.  Make no mistake: this is a fantastic beer.
UPDATED: NOV 16, 2012 A rich and sweet porter with noticable alcohol. More of a strong mild with toffee malt characteristics with none of the earthy characteristics I enjoy in porters.

Tief röstmalziger Geruch. Sehr röstmalziger und leicht säuerlicher Antrunk. Im Mittelteil ist der röstmalzerne Teil weiterhin vertreten, eine dezente herbe ist darin zu erkennen. Richtig stark wird es im Nachgeschmack, wo das Bier Kaffee-Geschmack annimmt, dazu herb-bitter. Fruchtige Aromen sindimmer wieder mal hintergründig zu erkennen, im Nachgeschmack auch eine deutliche Schokoladenote. Mit solchen Details ausgestattet ist es wirklich ein super Bier! 	 
Test vom 18.1.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,13,13,15,11,13 - 13,00

Colore nero impenetrabile, con schiuma beige, bella pannosa, fondi di caffè, cioccolato fondente dominano gli aromi ed il palato della birra. in bocca sa essere morbida, con un corpo eccelletne per essere una porter. la carbonazione è ben presente, ma equilibrata nel complesso.

Recommended by Chipalsa. Thanks! This one was awesome with nice hits of chocolate and caramel on the nose. Some metallic sweetness too. The body was thick and dark with a solid milk chocolate colored head and lacing. Flavors abound, consisting of milk chocolate, roasted coffee, sweet caramel, cherry, and plum. Excellent malt profile with a touch of bitter at the end. Quite smooth too. Excellent

Pours black with a thin off white head. Nose is bitter chocolate, coffee and roasted malt. Texture in the mouth is quite thin and flavour is predominantly bitter chocolate and coffee. Finish is roasted bitterness.

Pours black from bottle with a half an inch of khaki foam. Some notes of roasted malt on the nose. Slightly thin mouthfeel. It doesnt exactly fill my mouth with flavor. Some notes of caramel on the tongue. Finishes clean. Im not quite sure where the acclaim comes from for this one.
Bottle. Pours  a deep black color, foamy head. Smells of chocolate, malt and cocoa. Taste is not overly sweet or heavy, has a crispness at the end. Really enjoyed this brew a lot.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2013 Wow :-). Poured a nice pitch black with a hint of brown in direct light. The enormous off-white head gave it a very delicious appearance. Smelled thick of sweet milk chocolate, lightly roasted coffee and some lingering hops. Tasted extravagant; Notes of creamy smooth chocolate, with hints of roasty coffee, raisins and bitter cocoa overflowed the senses with satisfaction. The finish was a little earthy, while the bitterness of cocoa lingered and taunted you for another sip. One of, if not the best porters Ive ever had!
Almost black with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and bitter finish. 291108
Really good smooth and rich porter. Nice mouthfeel, taste is more "fresh" than in most porters.

Very dark,almost black colour with thick white head with modrate lasting. Aromas of caramel, roasted malt, coffe, chocolate,classic porter on the nose but with a higher intensity on the nose. Taste is moderate sweet with slightly dry yet sweet finish. Heavy body and texture is oily.

Very dar, black colour with a slight, fizzy tan head. Aroma of toasted malt, caramel, some coffee along with bitter hops. Taste is very mature, rich in malt with bitter aftertaste. Oily, full-bodied porter. Nice one.

birra scura quasi nera con bella e duratura schiuma color cappuccino!odore e sapore prevalentemente di ciccolato fondente malto tostato e liquirizia!in bocca è corposa e aggressiva!finale lunghissimo amaro a volontà!
ottima porter

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2011 Bottle at North Bar, Leeds. Cant believe it took me so long to try this one, think I may have a new favourite porter. Generous light head on top of a perfect deep black colour. In fact, you look at it and wonder - how much more black could it be? And the answer is none. None more black. Lovely rich aroma, roasted, chocolate, fairly sweet actually. Nicely contrasted by bitterness in the taste. Hard to improve on Anchors own description - it really is intensely rich. Bitter dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruits. Bitterness balanced by a touch of sweetness. Wonderfully balanced, a very, very good beer.

Good tasting porter.  Black pour, light brown head.  Good balance of malts that have taste off roasted coffee, creamy, nutty, chocolate, hint of sweetness, creamy body, and slight bitter finish.  Good brew!!!

Pours a dark brown with deep garnet highlights when held to light. Creamy frothy espresso like head sticks around for some time before attaching itself to the side of the glass. Rich malty aromas waft above the glass. Coffee, chocolate, brown sugar and toffee mixed with a hint of earthy hops. Taste is malty with coffee toffee and chocolate. Earthy/herbal bitterness mixes with a hint of alcohol and a touch of smoke somewhere in the middle. Long lingering bitter chocolate and hops in the finish. Creamy, bubbly mouthfeel, ample almost to much carbonation, medium body. Great old school American style porter.

220z bottle. Tan head, has dark black colour and frothy head. aromas of barley, roasted malts, molasses and sweet oats (kind of un-expected but pleasing). has a very charcoal roasted taste but is quite creamy at the same time. An overall enjoying brew.

Pour dark brown creamy beige head decent lace. Aroma fake chocolate, cocoa, strange boozy smell?? not to fond of smell. Taste very roasty and bitter, sweet, sugary, coffee, chocolate, decent hopping. MF decent carb medium body. Not my cup of beer not horrible tho.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2011 Looks are spot on for a porter; great dark looks. Aroma similarily typical for the style, with bread, chocolate, roasty, caramel... just very generiusly hopped and malted. No surpise the taste is very rich yet balanced, only slightly sweet, and just very nice. One of the best porters Ive head. (33cl bottle at Cafe Belgie)

Bottle at home. Dark brown colour, with creamy brown head. Aroma of sweet chocolate and sweet roasted malts. Taste is of bitter chocolate and roasted malts. Nice bitterness, and the sweetness makes it a smooth, balanced porter. Really good stuff.

Bottle. Pours a deep black, slightly red tinted color. Good lacing retention, not much head present. Aromas of figs, sugary toffee, smoked nuts, vanilla, caramel. Taste is dark plums, candy sugar, molasses, slightly roasted malts, very smooth and silk like mouthfeel. Really an impressive porter.

Small bottle. Black with a large light brown head. The aroma has lots of chcolate and even more dark fruits after a while. When you taste it, you still feel the large amount of chocolate and fruits, very nice!!

Pours dark brown with some ruby coloring around the edges and a finger-wide tan head. Aroma is of roasted coffee and some lighter hops. Flavor is light, crisp, and refreshing. Notes of cream, coffee, and walnuts with a slightly bitter finish.

Bottle. Dark brown with beige head. Aromas of cocoa, pumpernickel, toast, toffee. Flavors of toffee, cocoa, pumpernickel, toast. Balanced finish. Medium body with soft mouthfeel and moderate carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a clear and dark mahogany beer with a large offwhite head. The aroma is malt, fruit and roasted notes. The flavor is close to the nose with some additional notes of acidity. The palate is sweetness with some dryness. Overall an average beer.

Very traditional porter ..... wich is good.
No head, roasty smokey nose.
Pitch black.
Simple straight forward taste.
Rather flat, short finish.
Good overall.

Im Geruch süßliche Malzakzente und eine latente Weinnote, durchaus stimmungsvoll. Süßlich-malziger Antrunk. Im Mittelteil dunkelmalziger und röstig. Trocken, leicht bitter gehopft und minimal fruchtig im Abgang. 
Gelungen.
Bottled: MCreamy off-white head, black color. Aroma is full of molasse, caramel, hints of banana. Flavor is light sourly, caramelic, ripe bananas, candies and roasted malt. Finish with roasted malts.

Bomber from Binnys.....pours almost black with thick light tan head.  First nose and taste is licorice...which eases off to the roasted barley and hints of chocolate.  I know its a porter but feels more like a stout than some stouts....very good
Bottle at De Paas, The Hague. Chocolate, coffee, roast malts and caramel.  A little too much carbonation stops it from being great

12oz bottle. Very dark, tan/white head. Satisfyingly smokey aroma. Slightly fruity aroma, maybe blueberry. Somewhat sweet taste, slightly salty and savory as well. A nice, unique beer, with a pleasant and different aroma.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2012 Great porter. To the palate it feels almost perfect, with enough creaminess to it but still refreshing enough, just the way it should be. It is very flavorful, with chocolate, coffee, caramel, licorice, dried fruits (raisins, for example) and roasted malts providing most of the thrill. Overall its just pleasing on every front. I hope they keep the supply of this steady, because Ill definitely want more of it for years to come.
Black, with a foamy, lasting, and lacy tan head. Aroma of roast, chocolate and butterscotch. Taste is roasted and a bit bitter and sweet. Medium-full bodied and somewhat creamy. Good stuff.
Another good one!  Has a malty caramel taste.  Also, chocolate?  Tasty.  Color is brown with a brown head.  I must have been getting drunk by this time because my notes are weak sauce.

650ml bottle. Opaque dark brown pour with a big mocha head that lasts and lasts. Heavily roasted nose with dark chocolate and fresh coffee beans. Theres also a good floral hop presence in there. Very silky on the palate with those chocolate and coffee notes dominating the flavour. Lingering espresso and mild hop bitterness in the finish.

Poured a dark color with an off-white head.  Aroma of caramel, vanilla, and corn.  Taste also has corn with lots of sweet caramel malts.  Some chocolate as well mixes in with vanilla.  Very creamy and flavorful with roasted notes.  Maybe a little too sweet, but still delicious.
Servida en Les 4 Pedres (Badalona). Nunca fui un gran amante de las porter entrada en boca sensiblemente dulce. Ciertos aromas a regaliz?

Anchor Porter: Drank out of Sam Adams glass
Pour: It pours an almost black color but with a reddish color around the bottom where just a little bit of light shines through. The carbonation doesnt seem to be too high but it is hard to tell due to the darkness of the beer. The beer has a massive three finger head with creamy consistency on top but a soapy consistency on bottom. The head seems to linger a pretty long while.
Aroma: Chocolate is the forefront aroma with a backbone of roasted malts. I dont really get any alcohol smell which boosts my optimism for tasting this beer. 
First taste: Although chocolate is the most pronounced note in the aroma the roasted malted barley is the main taste. The chocolate provides a nice accent to the malts but what really gives this drink its unique flavor is the combination of barley and hops. It has a nice refreshing flavor with somewhat of a thin slippery mouth feel to it. There is a nice quaint bittersweet finish to it that seem to end abruptly only to be replaced by a more barley flavor.
Overall: The anchor porter is a really nice tasteful refreshing brew that I did enjoy greatly. It is a beer that brings foreword the sometimes over shadowed barley characteristics. I would give this beer a rating of excellent.
Decent, but very little to set it apart from other beers... does not seem to measure up to Anchors typical product.
Blackbrown, not much head. Patent maltish, dark, full, with a bit of chocolate and aok. Drinkability quite good for a porter, not too heavy or malty. Ok, but not the best Ive had of this style.

Chocolate aroma with a hint of smoke. Appearance is dark brown, almost black with a brown leather colored head. Taste is caramel malts with hints of coffee. Palate is smooth and creamy with a hint of carbonation. Overall a very good porter.

This is a good porter. I poured it into a IMP pint glass and was greeted with a two finger tan head that stuck around for a while. The body was black on this brew no surprise there. The nose was full of coffee and roasted malts . Flavors were just like the nose coffee and chocolate notes abound. The mouthfeel was ok but need some more body. Easy to drink I could have a few in a sitting

Serving type: bottle

355ml bottle.
Pours a very dark reddish brown/black, with a firm brown head.
On the nose there is a clear element of roasted malts - chocolate, coffee, tar, etc - and notes of vanilla, spices, hops and sweet licorice.
The palate is medium to full bodied, with some residual sweetness, quite thick, and medium bitterness.
Flavourwise, again loads of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, licorice, vanilla, hops.
It finishes quite bitter and roasted, and the sweetness gets almost a tad cloying (but, hey, Im getting picky here), and it ends on a quite astringent, ashy note. On the other hand, the sweetness helps to wrap the somewhat robust roasted notes into a velvety coating, which increases the drinkability like h*ll. Rich, yet subtle.(2011-04-23).

Thanks to my dad for picking this up at International Beverage Selections in Grand Rapids. Served in a Hill Farmstead Wine Glass.

Pour yields a very dark brown-colored brew with a really nice tan head and quite a bit of lacing. Solid retention as well. The nose brings forward some light chocolate and roast. There is also a bit of toffee and caramel lingering in the background. The taste is similar, leaning more toward the chocolate with a bit of malt sweetness. Body is too thin and undercarbonated. Not my favorite from Anchor.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-14-2011

the liquid is very dark black/brownish, with a creamy tanned medium thick head. presentation looks very full and luscious. the aromascape is very creamy and milky with coffee, chocolate, caramel, a bit of roast, dark bread, dough, banana, vanilla.. the taste is very creamy sweet with lot of that milky character, probably has more of that than any other beer ive tasted. the flavours and aromas of coffee/milk/banana really come out. the taste really compliments the aromas with sweetness and slight sourness. the palate works very nicely here also, the creamy texture of the liquid settles nicely and puts tastes where they are meant to be. they have managed to create a very unique and specific porter here, not many similar ones out there. and what theyve done, theyve done it very well.

12 oz bottle.  What an amazing porter.  pours with an amazing 2 finger tan head that lasted through the english pint glass.  caramel, chocolate, coffee, roasty, sweet , good hop profile.  Awesome thick smooth mouthfeel.  Bravo!

On draft at Anchor tasting room. Pours mostly clear, almost black in color with some mahogany at the edges and topped by a thick tan colored head of foam that shows good retention while leaving nice lines of lacing on the glass. The aroma shows notes of dark chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, and ample earthy hop bitterness on the back end. The flavor follows suit and is just as roasty as the nose let on with ample amounts of dark chocolate and roasted malts while the earthy hops lend ample bitterness. A touch of vanilla cream smooths things out and adds nice balance between the chocolate, roast, and hops. Medium bodied and smooth with balanced carbonation that leads to a roasted, bitter sweet finish. Tasty stuff as all the flavors play off each other nicely. This is a well crafted, classic porter. Good stuff and my favorite of the day after the tour.

355ml bottle from Alko

Pours pitch black with a nice beige head. Aroma has hints of roastiness, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is quite smooth with hints of chocolate and hops. Roastiness kicks in at the finish nicely. Well balanced, classic porter.
Pours pitch black with a soapy head. Aroma is roasted malts with a hint of vanilla. Flavor is very soft but full, mostly roasted malts but also some coffee and chocolate. Very nice.

35,5cl bottle from Alko. Poured black with a creamy frothy brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, licorice, coffee and chocolate. Flavor is roasted, sligtly burnt malt, some vanilla and licorice. Very dry and burnt in finish. Incredibly smooth, full bodied porter. Amazing porter.
Bottle. great; more nutty than coffee taste, nice molasses like taste.  Body is a bit thin.  Can easily put back several in one sitting.  Not as good as Edmond Fitzgerald.

Bottled, 335 ml. Pours black beer with a creamy tan head. Aroma: Cocoa, coffee, fruits, licorice. Taste: Moderate sweetness. Banana flavours. Cocoa. Roasted malt. Pleasant bitterness. Palate: Above medium body, creamy, soft carbonation.
ottima porter.sensazioni olfattive di malti tostati abb. intensi.in bocca si percepisce il caffe il ciccolato un po di spezia di liqurizia, e il finale legermente amaro.

Pours nearly black with a nice thick fluffy light tan head. Good retention and lacing as well - Id have to give it a top score for appearance. Aroma is a pleasant sweet mix of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and some caramel. Taste is quite similar to the aroma, more on the sweet side with coffee, chocolate and caramel coming through primarily. Mild carbonation and a slightly oily mouthfeel. An excellent beer that Id be happy to drink anytime.

Anchor Porter on musta olut, jonka päälle muodostuu beige vaahto. Oluen tuoksussa on rusinaa, lakritsia, leipää ja paahtunutta mallasta. Maku on hieman katkera, kuivahko, rusinainen, mausteinen, leipäinen ja lakritsinen. Pehmeä olut, jonka kanssa voisi helposti sessioida, jos olutta saisi parin euron hintaan.

SCHIUMA:
schiuma di color nocciola, presente ma non abbondante, abbastanza compatta, che svanisce in fretta, lasciando un minimo residuo che peró accompagna fino alla fine.
COLORE: marrone molto scuro
INTENSITA / FINEZZA
piuttosto intensa, con una gamma di profumi però non molto ampia, dominata soprattutto sullapporto dei malti tostati. 
AROMI:
malto tostato, liquirizia, cioccolato e caffe.
GUSTO
In bocca molto intensa: mentre la punta della lingua percepisce un breve accenno al dolce dei malti (caramello), appena ci si sposta verso la gola aumenta lamaro, con note di cioccolato fondente, caffé e liquirizia. 
RETROGUSTO
lungo, proteso verso lamaro, con finale secco.
CORPO
corpo pieno, riempe bene la bocca
Un po troppo monocorda sulle note di liquirizia, che alla lunga stanca un po.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2013 17/11/2012 Bottle. Pours a dark brown, almost black with a huge, billowy light mocha, dark latte head. Aroma is liquorice, loads of maltbread. Taste is coffee, tones of liquorice, roasted malts, even lightly wooden, (malt) breadiness is very eminent as well. Light sweet. Palate is smooth, not much carbonation, quite easy to drink, light. Definitely nowhere near as good as I remembered.

02/04/2011 Bottle. Pours a dark brown with some reddish tints, a thick, large latte head.  Roasted malts and chocolate in the aroma, some coffee and liquorice. Much of the same in the taste. Very smooth and balanced. Excellent.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2016 355ml bottle. Pours lovely opaque chestnut colour with excellent head. The nose is a little lighter than expected, with gentle milk chocolate. More milk chocolate then burnt malt on the end, The palate shows reasonable structure, there is a creamy texture, but not as creamy as Id hoped. The finish is a bit cloying unfortunately. Overall, after the initial promising appearance, this did not deliver on nose, taste and palate.
Pours a an almost black color with a tan head.The aroma is of dark chocolate and coffee.The flavor is of sweet malt and coffee.The body full and leaves a bitter aftertaste.Overall a good beer.

pours a deep brown/black with subtle ruby hues...huge lt. mocha head...great retention and lacing.  aroma is roasty with caramel notes, subtle dark fruit and coffee...faint piney hops.  flavor has dark fruit, chocolate, and tobacco notes...hint of burnt toffee...rounded out by earthy hops.  mouthfeel is slightly lively but a bit thin for my taste...roasty and slightly burnt finish.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2011 Pours dark, dark brown, almost black, with a creamy, fluffy, pillowy tan head. Smells strongly of malted barley with hints of coffee. Tastes like coffee and bitterness with hints of chocolate; definitely has a full roasty flavor. Medium-bodied with a creamy texture and more than expected mouth-carbonation, Anchor Porter finishes smooth with a light, lasting bitterness.

12 ounce bottle, code of 0N3, bottled on November 30th, 2010, bought as a single at World Market.  Served in a nonic pint glass, the beer pours dark brown/black with about an inch and a half frothy tan head.  The head stays around for a long time, and theres a lot of lacing left behind on the glass.  Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, and some dark fruit.  The taste is similar to the aroma, but the dark fruit flavors (plum, raisins) and bittersweet chocolate flavors are the strongest, and some burnt/charred malt flavors are noticable too.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, its smooth, slick and a bit creamy with moderate carbonation.  Overall, I think its a good brew.  Id definitely buy this again.
Dark, roasted coffee aroma.  Pours dark brown/black with a mocha top.  Rich and flavorful roasted malt.  Smooth finish.
Very dark, nearly opaque, with a foamy tan head. 22 oz bottle. A flavor of roasty malt and nut along with woodiness. A crisp finish. Not as watery in the body as most porters can be.

Bottle.  Dark brown pour with a large, rocky, light brown head.  Sweet cocoa aroma along with some hints of  roasted malts and raisin.  Flavors of bittersweet cocoa with deep roasted malt, almost to the point of being smokey, with some hops detected in the finish.  Creamy texture and very smooth drinking with a medium body.  Worthy of a place amongst the top traditional porters.

Pours Blackish/Burnt Sienna.Malty/Hoppy Choco notes. Smooth Slighlty creamy front ending dry.Mellow Choco.Bitter cocoa with a nice balance of roasted malts next to the hops.Makes for a very drinkable Porter - Will be revisited many times. Thanks Darren for turning me onto these guys outta San Fran,.

Bottle.  Dark black pour, plenty of lasting carbonation and a sweet nutty nose.  Flavor is sweet dark malts, a little sweet hazelnut and finished a little coppery on the aftertaste. Too sweet for my taste.
Bottle. Color dark red-brown with medium brown head. Aroma roasted, coffee, chocolate.Taste sweet, chocolate, bitter, cocoa.

35,5cl bottle from a beer retailer. It pours a pitch black liquid with a small-medium tan bubbly head, somehow lasting throughout the beer, but leaving no lacing. The aroma has roasted malts and a nice hoppy touch. It smells of licorice, dark chocolate, toffee; very sweet. It also has this nice herbal touch. It tastes likewise, with high sweetness and medium bitterness. The flavour is very intense and gently malted; delicious. The mixture between roasted malts and hops is very balanced and good. It is medium-bodied and softly carbonated, ending semi-dry with a nice aftertaste. Cool porter: really good tasting, it feels like a very good companion for chocolate pastries. Presentation (bottle and crown cap) is very good (this people at Anchor BC take it seriously).

22 oz bottle. Pours a very dark black opaque with brown edges. Head dies to a thicker film, laces well, a bit frothy when first poured. Aromas are light cocoa, light roast and toast, toffee, creamy malts. Initial is medium bodied, perhaps a touch lighter. Blends of cocoa, sweet and bitter cocoa, touches of roast, toast, creamy body with a silky smooth finish. Finish is simple and smooth with touches of light hops and roast. Very well balanced. A solid, classic example of the Porter style.  I would drink this anytime!
The aroma is light chocolate, coffee, roasted. A dark black pour with a decent size head. Taste of light bitter and very earthly . Very creamy texture, good beer overall.

12oz bottle.
Near black pour, lots of creamy, lasting tan head.  Malty chocolate aromas - flavor is complex and very drinkable.  Good balance of hops and malt.
Pours blackish with a red-brown shine. Aroma of roasted malts and some bitter hops. Taste is similar, with a burnt coffee beans aftertaste. Great beer.

Easy drinking beer.Pours dark brown with a long lasting fluffy tan head.  Aroma is mostly earthy, with a slight roasted coffee edge.  Perfect carbonation allows this one to glide across the tongue into a short, dry, earthy finish.  Good stuff.

Bomber served in an English pint. Pours dark brown with a med-large light brown head. Good staying power and lacing. Aroma and palate match. Both slightly sweet, chocolatey, with a medium roast, and a hint of dark dried fruit. Medium body, average carbonation, creamy-slick texture, and a medium roasty, decently hopped, dry finish. Great porter.

Was primarily sweet in flavour. Cherry like. Strong stiff head with great colour and aroma. But average. 
Not strong in taste like a porter would be. 
Ended fairly bitter. 
As put by brewmastercody with whom I enjoyed this, I expected more from such a highly rated beer.
Not much aroma, nice colour, nice sweet to bitter taste. Not too thick, good palate. Not the best tasting stout. expected more for a 99 overall stout.
UPDATED: JUN 1, 2011 Sweet smoky palate, very drinkable, delicious, balanced hops and malts, malts are dark but not very roasted. Very interesting, highly recommended
Bottle. Poured a dark brown/black, medium tan head. Aroma is roasted chocolate malts. Flavor is malt, chocolate milk, cream. Roasted finish. Decent.

Medium black with a light tan head, persistent and lace-full.  Smells smoky and meaty, not unlike smoked bacon.  But still very porter-like aroma.  Taste starts sweet and toffee-like, turns smoky and actually pretty hoppy towards the end.  Generous kinda-bitter hopped ending doesnt take away from the oak and smoke tones from the darker, robust malts.  A true classic, just not my favourite.  Better than average, though.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 12oz bottle into a pint glass. The neck label has a nice description of the beer and there is a bottle code (OFJ) imprinted on the back label.

Appearance: It has a dark brown/black body with deep crimson highlights and a tall three finger beige head on top. The head is slow fading and thick. It coats the glass as I tip it to my mouth and leaves thick splotchy lace patters behind.

Smell: The nose is malty sweet and roasty with caramel, toffee, bready and light toasted bread notes with a hint of chocolate.
