1 pint 6 oz. Bottle. Pours black with a thick long lasting foamy light-brown head. Fruitty armoas control the senses.
Taste packs puches of: Smoke, roasted coffee, resin and basement whiffs. Carbination is present but doesnt control the flavor. Bitterness is minor and the finish is full. Excellant Beer.

Pours dark with a very nice and long lasting tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate with a hint of roasted coffee. Flavor of toffee, roasted barley and a hint of dark chocolate. Rich and malty but overall a very dry brew with a bitter finish but thats not always a bad thing. A very good porter thats worth a try.

22oz bottle, dark brown color, with a thick creamy tan-colored head, mild toasted, biscuity, roasted, chocolate malt nose, with a light mochaish, cookie dough, brown chocolatey accent, with some licorice, molasses, cocoa notes and with a faint dark dried fruity, raisiny, pruney, figgy aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a nice mild toasted, roasted, chocolate malt, faint mochaish character with some molasses, licorice, dark chocolate, coffee bean, burnt toast flavours, with a light cookie dough, toffee, brown sugar accent, leading towards a molasses, dark chocolatey, roasty bitterness finish.
A really nice, drinkable porter.  Just the right amount of roasty notes to counter the sweetness that sits a bit back.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2012 Re-rate 11/29/12: Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks Tom. Dark brown to black with a big beige head. Aroma of lots of dark chocolate, some dark fruits and a hint of licorice. Flavor with light coffee notes, some dark chocolate, some dark fruits, caramel, some molasses and a drier finish with a bit of roastiness. Medium-bodied. A good one. 7/4/7/3/14=3.5

Re-rate 3/7/12: Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place. Thanks zvikar. Very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma full of chocolate and some dark fruits. Flavor starts sweetish and chocolaty with some fruitiness and continues dry. Medium-bodied. 7/3/6/3/13=3.2

[9/9/09] Bottle at friends house in Amsterdam. Dark brown to black with a beige head. Sweet rich chocolate aroma with roasted malt, dark bread, some nuts and fruity notes. Sweet roasty flavor with chocolate, some fruit and some caramel notes. Medium to full body. A great Porter. 7/4/7/4/14=3.6
Tap at the Gingerman.  Chocolate aroma and a nice taste, but suffers from the metalic aftertaste in Anchor beers.
12 oz from Isaac Newtons in Newtown Pa.  Nice flavor.  Thick and rich.  Tasted chocolate and coffee.

12oz bottle from total wine in norfolk. pours a deep, dark, brown with a solid, tan head and great lacing. aroma  is very nice with big, dark fruit notes of prune and fig, black licorice, mild coffee, bitter cocoa, and a touch of earthy hops. flavor is great with with a wonderfuly balance of slightly tart fruit notes of plum, red grape, and apple with some earthy hops up front backed by dark, roasted malts, coffee, bitter chocolate, and a touch of toffee leading to a lingering, bitter, spiced, woody finish. palate is medium bodied and smooth with high carbonation. overall, a very nice porter.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2015 12 oz. bottle from Liquor Barn (Jefferson Commons). Aroma: Moderate dark chocolate; light hot caramel; light ashy roast. Appearance: Pours a dark ruby tinted black with a foamy mocha head that settles into a still skin. Flavor: Dry and subtle up front with the smallest hint of chocolate sweetness midway through; the sweetness is quickly quenched by a bitter/dry finish with a puff of ash. Palate: Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: Universally recognized as a great porter for a reason; still holds up beautifully after all these years.
Sampled @ Bieres et Saveurs served from bottle 09.09.07: Black in color, I smell caramel , chocolate, molasses, a touch of roastiness. A really great brew.

12 oz. bottle: A full, vinous aroma with a dash of spice, sweet figs and liquorice but first and foremost - cocoa. Pours deep brown, almost opaque with a thin light brown head. The flavour is again more reminiscent of real cocoa than coffee, with a toasted wood note, a little sweetness and a lingering, lighter medium bitter finish. The carbonation is unfortunately a bit too fizzy, the mouthfeel is quite full due to a rather low attenuation. Elegant.
dark brown pour with a small 1 finger light brown head . aroma and taste of coffee and dark roasted malts.

355 ml bottle. Black. Tall beige head that clings to the glass. Strong licorice aroma with a hint of anise and lemon curd. Dark chocolate and a little vanilla. Fairly high carbonation level without being fizzy. Feels quite sweet, but is balanced by bittering hops. Intensely aromatic. Very complex, but still a light and very drinkable beer. A very nice porter. Reminds me a little of a Taddy porter as it has much the same characteristics.

Pours a deep mahogany with a tan thin head.  Aroma is toffee, coffee, chocolate, lactic and some funk.  Palate is thick and creamy.  Taste is coffee, chocolate, stone fruits and a spicy bitter finish to balance.

Bottle into shaker.  Pours a very dark brown/black with a diesel coffee colored head.  Laces very nicely at the beginning but not afterwards.  Roasted aroma and flavor that was very upfront not so smooth.  A great robust flavor in the body of this beer and with a low abv thats a nice change.

The initial sweet dark fruit reminds me much more of a baltic porter than a porter, which makes me wonder where the flavor is coming from here. With baltics a part of that is of course the high alcohol. This is a low alcohol session beer. I am not sure this porter is to my taste, to my mind the platonic archetype of a porter is Founders Porter, which is creamier, roastier. 
I will give the anchor this though, its gorgeous. 
This just reminds me that I really need to rate Founders, because this just doesnt hold a candle.

Bottle, paired with pretzels: pours thick and dark with a foamy tan head. Coffee, and prune in the nose with notes of alcohol. taste is caramel malts, brown sugar. Finish is smooth, not too bitter. Medium-light but creamy body. A well balanced, session beer.

12 oz bottle from Bevmo. Pours an opaque black color with a big tan head that has fair retention. The aroma is soft with roasted chocolate malts and a slight bit of fruit. The taste is dark biter chocolate with red fruits way in the background. I also get an occasional bit of dust and maybe some spruce in the flavor. The hops nicely balance everything. Palate is smooth and full. The finish is long and bittersweet. This is a very tasty porter.

Bottle. Pours deep brown coloured with a big and lasting light brown head. Aromas of chocolate, sweet tobacco, vanilla, rosemary and dried fruit. Smooth texture. Flavours of roasted malt, mild coffee, licorice, chocolate and mild hoppy finish. Really tasty brew.
A solid brew from a solid brewery.  Good porter leveled with chocolate and hops.
33cL bottle. Pours dark brown with tan head. Semi sweet aroma, nice taste, light body. Not a very dark porter.

Pours a nice very dark brown with thin tan head, no lacing.  Aroma surprisingly mild of slightly roasted malts, chocolate, very light coffee, and caramel.  Flavor matches well, but doesnt impress.  Mouthfeel is thin, creamy, with a slight bitter aftertaste.  I had higher hopes for this one that were crushed pretty hard.

Thick and puffy tan head, like an ice cream float. Dark dark brown. No shine, no transparency. Head sticks around.

Sweet smells of burnt brown sugar. Not saccharine. Actually has the aroma of a Scotch ale.

Very sugary, sweet carmelized malts. Brown sugary and toffee. Just a bit smoky. The roasted bits are overpowered by the sweet. Toffee, caramel; a hint of decaf at the finish.

Feels thick and chewy. If I didnt know better, Id think it was a Scotch ale. Really somethin.
06.11.2005, 0,36l Bottle. The dark colour is brown. Aroma is roasted malt with some fruit and maybe coffee? Rich and very nica tasting beer.
Pours dark and thick with a thick brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel and some fruit. Flavor is very light coffee and dark fruit. smooth creamy finish.

Pours dark brown, dense tan head. Nose of dark fruit, roasted coffee, chocolate, brown sugar, very similar to a stout. Taste is of the same, with the addition of hops. Overall very enjoyable, well balanced, and sessionable.

Noire foncée, elle a des arômes de malt grillée avec une petite touche chocolatée. En bouche, on peut percevoir le malt grillé, sans avoir de saveurs de café. Très raffraichissante comme porter, elle napporte aucune sécheresse en bouche et est plutôt désaltérante. Très bonne porter.
Sweet and fruity. Looks nice, Very chocolatey, sweet, with caramel, fruity aroma. Nice, smooth palate, rich flavor. Very original kind of porter.

Pours a nice and dark oak brown with surprisingly thick beige head. Aroma of cocoa, malt, and some sort of dark fruit. Mmm... creamy! Flavor is roasted malt, a but of cocoa, and dark fruit. The finish has a lingering subtle bitterness and, dare I say, a pinch of salt? I like it!

Black pour with mahogany highlights and a dense, tan head.  Soft dark fruit aroma, with cocoa, roast and a hint of pine.  That flavor has lots of dark roast and hop bitterness with a healthy note of cherry, plum, and fig.  Creamy medium body with moderate carbonation.
bottle.  pours dark brown with a big fluffy tan head.  notes of coffee, fruit, some nice refreshing hop bitterness.  well rounded.  very smooth.  pretty good.

dark brown beer, offwhite head 
smells of coffe,e chocolate and dried plums and pears, caramel 
tasts  of malt, roasty, coffee, some fruit 
aftertaste is bittersweet with coffe-like roastyness, spicy, fruity

Bottled.
Black with brown head. Aroma is chocolate and dried fruit. Flavor is caramel, roasted malt and spices (vanilla)

Bottle.. Pours black with a creamy light brown head..Aroma is slightly sweet with raisins and maybe a little soy sauce..Flavor is roasty with a hint of sweetness.. Body is thin with smooth carbonation.. This is a beer I could session all night long.  And probably do other things to as well.. Giggity!

12 oz. into a snifter. Pours black with khaki head. Roasted malt and vanilla aroma. Medium bitter, lightly sweet. Medium heavy bodied, creamy feel, with light carbonation finishing sweet, dry then slight hop bitterness. Highly drinkable.

Very dark brown body with a beautiful frothy cappuccino head.  Malty, sweet aroma...brown sugar, caramel, and a hint of vanilla.  Thick, creamy mouthfeel.  If the aroma is fantastic, the flavor is superb!  Caramel, chocolate, and burnt sugar (think toasted marshmallows) melds to strong coffee and cream with a slightly bitter coffee grind bite.  Very impressive beer.  One of the finest porters Ive tried.
Pours a 1 finger head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee & chocolate. Taste is creamy with a sweet roasted malt taste that leaves a nice lacing on the glass.
12oz bottle. Deep dark body with creamy foam. Smells of coffee and roasted cerals with some caramel. Smooth chocolatey mouthfeel with roasted malt, coffee and a bit of vanilla. Great beer!
Aroma is of chocolate, hops and butter. Taste is also malty and buttery, with notes of chocolate and liquorish. Finish is a bit sharp, bitter and dry. A solid porter, but Ive had better.

One of my wifes favorite beers.  I have been rating quite a bit of porters lately, and this one is good, almost a textbook porter.  An old school porter in the British tradition.  Falls short of Founders and Great Lakes Edmund Fitzgerald, but very drinkable nonetheless.  Impressive looking with its dark body and creamy tan head, the aroma is of faint roasted malts and the flavor is mild, oily, malty sweet with some roast and coffee.  Finishes with a faint hop dryness.  A nice porter.
Originally bought six pack not knowing what it was.  So delicious a classic.  Malty, espresso flavors with great mouth feel.  One of my all time favs

12oz bottle from The Party Source.  Pours dark brown with a medium tan head.  Incredibly malty aroma with vanilla and some roastiness.  Flavor is of malt, a bit of alcohol, vanilla, chocolate and coffee in the finish.  Very good.

Bought at Bierei, Vienna. Deep ruby-black body, small beige head. Fine espresso coffee in the nose with roasted aromas, some caramel-candy sugar, a bit of dried fruits and vanilla. Smooth mouthfeel with sweet-roasted malt, coffee and vanilla. Fine, delicios and easy drinkable.

Deep clear brown, nearly opaque, ruby highlights around the edges. Thick rocky beige head. Aromas of coffee and charred peanut shells, a touch of honey and cut grass. Burnt sugar flavors, like a marshmallow blackened over a campfire, with vanilla. Crisp bitterness with dark berry and floral notes. Finishes thick around the tongue, leaving caramel that fades to bitter like coffee grounds.

bottle at redlight redlight.  Creamy vanilla and chocolate on the nose.  Pours black with a thin off white head.  Smooth chocolatey flavors with hints of coffee, creamy vanilla mouthfeel, very smooth, This is an excellent porter!

This beer i had on tap while eating a sausage/onion/pepper sandwich. it had a roasty, smokey aroma with a black, appearance and a frothy, head the flavor was medium bitterness, full body, sticky, soft carbonation , with a long finish, very strong taste. I enjoyed it but i couldnt drink more then 3 at a sitting.
Very good porter, well balanced and well made. This beer had a very pronounced raisin taste to it, which was surprisingly pleasant. I will definitely buy this beer again.
Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, raisin and liquorice. Flavor of roasted malt, coffee and dark syrup. A really good porter.

22oz bottle 4/17/09-Pours black with a decent head. Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Taste of the same with a little sweetness added. This medium to full bodied brew is very well balanced and quite tasty. Great porter.

12 oz. bottle.  I was looking at the list of most rated beers, and did not realize until then that despite having had this beer numerous times, Ive never rated it.  I rectified that at lunchtime today...pours black with a moderate-large light brown head that lasted until nearly the last sip and left a foamy film on the glass.  Very pleasant aroma of chocolate and roasted malt.  The flavor is predominantly lightly roasted malt along with just a touch of bitter chocolate.  Medium bitterness at the finish.  Very solid porter.
A delicious porter, smooth and silky.  Not too complex, but nice and easy to drink. As refreshing as a porter can be.
330ml bottle. Deep red black with an off white head. Lovely malty nose. Roast flavor with a nice gentle bitter finish. Very nice indeed.
Very dark brown/black pour supporting a creamy tan head. Aroma is of roasted malt. The flavor is a spicy malt with some hop in the finish.

354mL bottle from Beerstore.co.nz. Pours deep dark ruby/black with a nice lingering brown head.
Nice roast aromas. I get chocolate mainly, there is a wee bit of dark fruit there too. 
Flavour is incredibly roasted. Full of chocolaty roast malt. It fills the mouth with a light bitterness and silky smooth texture. There is some sweetness from the roast malt, which makes this beer very balanced. Finishes with a lot of chocolate and a mild bitterness that begs another sip.
Wow, what beautifully balanced crafted porter. Full of robust flavour, very nice.
Good dark but sweet flavor, this is a good porter, not real hoppy and not to malty.
Dark redbrown, cream head. Aroma is roasted barley, notes of coffee, liquorish and chocolate. Flavour is reasted malt, some sweetness and chocolate, and a light bitterness.

Bottle, Rehills, Newcastle. Initial vineous, rich aroma, leads to a tasty chocolate flavour, with plenty of roast malt. The hoppiness I associate with their other brews is subtle, in the back of the throat, accompanied by ripe fruit. Great deep black appearance and lovely caramel head. Tastes like it should be stronger, with an alcoholic flavour that suggests more than 5.6%.  Having first tried this a few years back and not overly enjoying it, Im so pleased Ive rediscoverd this superb ale.

Bottle from Real Ale Ltd, cheers Duff, consumed 03-05-09   Pours very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is roasty and fresh coffee beans Taste is slightly sweetened black coffee but quite rich and good roastiness, in fact there is a subtle undercurrent of creaminess in here as well. Loz got liquorice when she snook a sample and she was right, some dark fruits and just the most lovely balance of bitter and sweetness that you could get, marvellous stuff.  A7 A4 F8 P4 Ov15   3.8

On tap and pint served at the Bavarian Lodge, Lisle, IL. The pour was black/brown, with a foamy, dark tan head and clingy, curtain-like lacing. The aroma was initially roasty, dark malt, with some tart/sweetness as dark fruit and a hint of caramel The flavor followed as a combo of toastiness, malt sweetness, and respectable hop bitterness. A robust and full bodied "meat and potatoes" porter.
Very dark and rich color. Aroma is roasty and needs to be warmed. Cold it is a bit thin. Taste is smooth and roasty with some usual coffee and a hint of bittersweet cocoa.

pours deep brown with a 3 finger pillowy head. smell is very metalic and macro. taste is not even close to a porter this is just darker version of the steam beer.  mouthfeel is the best thing that this beer has going for it - with a light crisp feel which i feel does not even come close to how this style should be. over all this one of the worst porters ever made. it would be an ok session beer for people looking for a bud ligt of porters

pours a cola like, dark brown color with a nice tan head which lingers for a while.  Aroma is of roasted malts, and dark fruits.  flavor includes coffee, chocolate, and some hops.  body is medium and has a dry finish.  overall, a very good porter
Good solid porter a very good malty taste with just the right amount of hop. Smooth and creamy to the palate. A good beer but not over the top

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine.  Cola-like pour; dark brown to black with mild carbonation for a 1/2 inch off-white head.  Sweet and dark fruit aromas; not at all the roasted aromas I usually get in a good porter.  The flavor however is a very good balance of strong roasted malt and light hops.  A good, solid porter.

Bottle poured into an english pint glass.  Enormous pillowy tan head quickly dissipated, leaving great lacing atop dark brown/black porter.

Aroma dominated by heavily roasted malt.  Flavor matches with extra-strong chocolate and coffee notes.  Smooth texture, but with a bit of oiliness.

Deep brown / black. Not transparent.Well carbonated, brown head settles quickly. 

 Fruity aroma.

 Medium body, thick at the end, fizzy.

 Not sweet, quite bitter, hints of liquorice. Long dry-bitter finish indeed. Some alcohol at the very end.

 Interesting, but too bitter and dry for me.
BJCP would probably classify this as a Robust Porter.

 Purchased for 14dkr in Metro Glostrup.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2010 (19-Apr-09) Imported bottle - thanks Tom! Pours a deep brown-tinted black with a large beige head, nose of malt, a little mocha, dried dates, a bit appley. On the palate its roasty, bitter-hoppy, theres notes of strong dark cocoa and under it all a hint of port. Dry and full bodied with a long dry-bitter finish. (3.7)

Re-rate 8-Dec-10 at the Euston Tap on draught, treacle and apple on the nose, the body is malty, toffee, coffee and a bit roast and bitter. Dry bitter finish
good solid porter. roasty toasty moderate malt flavor with bitter chocolate characteristic that is pleasing.

great porter. not quite as good as fullers but pretty close and cheaper too! lots of roasted malt flavor with some bitter chocolate too. some hops add variety. im very impressed that its this good and only around ten bucks for 6! definitely going to buy this often

Poured from 22 oz.  Dark brown, almost black, with huge frothy head.  Mild nose of hops, malt, chocolate.  Tastes of chocolate malt and hops coming through.  Tasted better as it warmed up, with a nice dry finish. Overall very good.

Bottle.  SOLID.  Especially for something I can get all the time.  Black Body, tan head.  Smoked malty smell, almost a saltiness to it.  Taste has coffee and licorice notes, but is also malty and sweet.  Awesome.
Definetly a good Porter and a strong representation for Anchor.  Will have to try some of their other offerings basd on how good this was.

Chocolatey pour, fluffy brown head, serious lace, looks awesome. Sweet, tangy nut aroma. Sweet tangy nut aroma. Smokey nutty malts with some dark fruit hops in there. A bit of bitter worcestershire sauce and roasted caramel malt taste. Very good.

12 oz bottle.  This is a rich creamy porter with stong taste of chocolate malt.  It has a slightly bitter beginning and a creamy malty end.  Color is almost black with a good head.  Aroma was a bit yeasty.  This is only the second time Ive had it and I would recommend for those that like porters.  Not easy to find in my area.

(Bottle) Almost black. Small tan coloured head. Roastedness and chocolate in aroma. Full bodied palate with medium carbonation. Roastedness, liquorice, hint of sweetness, bitterness and some chocolate in taste. Roasty aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours with a khaki head over a dark brown, near black body. Aroma is sweet chocolate, vanilla, cocoa, light banana esters, and light dark fruit notes. Taste is light roast and light bitterness with vanilla, sweet fruit and finishes slightly nutty. Light carbonation with a water like consistency.
Bottle. Dark brown body with a large brown head. Smoky meat aroma, with some hints of caramel. Ashtray taste, with a sweet caramel flavor and some notes of vanilla.

Great porter. Nice mellow aroma of roasted coffee and dark chocolate. Flavor is packed with coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malt. Mouthfeel is very creamy, especially since the head lasts the entire glass.
12 oz bottle.  Pours black, creamy head, some lacing.  Huge aroma of coffee, malt, and chocolate.  Flavor is similiar with big roasty flavor. Creamy mouthfeel.  Not your typical porter, but it works.

1 pint 6 oz bottle from BevMo. Pitch black with a small tan head. Smells of malt, barley, coffee, dark chocolate, and black cherries. Taste is lots of coffee, rich, thick, and full of dark chocolate. I dont usually go for porters but this is a really well made tasty beer.

Bottle @ Henriks øl og vinstue, Bergen.
Pours almost pitch black, with a generous creamy tan head. Caramelly aroma with strong coffee scent. The taste is mild, caramel with some coffee and chocolate.

Bottle.  Pours pitch black with cream colored head, nice lacing.  Can smell mocha, roasted malt, and with a touch of smokiness.  Very rich flavor, chocolate, heavily roasted malt, a touch of hops and banana, unusual for a porter.  Very smooth and drinkable.  Excellent and recommended.

Bottle  Pours a black with a big tan head.  The head lasts nicely.  Has a weak aroma of mostly malts and hints of coffee.  Has a good flavor.  Nice malty and hints of roasteness.  Light carbination.  Good mouthfeel.  A solid finish.  Reminds me of some English beers.  A fairly decent porter.  Very drinkable.
Very dark coffee like outlooks. Taste has some coffee and chocolate in it. Very good winter beer.

pours black, mocah head.
Aroma of nice roasted malty with some light notes of dark fruits.
Taste was similar, plenty of good roastiness, thin coffee, chocolate, cherry, with light bitter finish as wella s some sugary malts.
This is a fine porter, cant imagine what it would be with just another 1 or 2 abv on top.

De un marrón muy oscuro y una bonita cabeza también marrón. Escasa, pero persistente. Débil gasificación. (3/5)

En nariz se nota rápidamente un intenso aroma a caramelo. También se encuentran tonos a malta tostada casi a quemado. (7/10)

Ya en boca muestra un buen cuerpo, pese a un gasificación medio-baja. (3/5)

De un sabor amargo en principio y un regusto a quemado que tienen sin embargo un contrapunto a caramelo. El equilibrio entre tonos tan diferentes está muy bien conseguido. Deja un final a caramelo y quizá algo de regaliz... Ummmm!!! (8/10)

Enjoyed this over dinner at Pops in the South End.  Complemented a great meal.  Pours a gorgeous deep DEEP brown (almost black) with a nice head.  Aroma is strong roasted malt with just a hint of bitterness and some vinous notes.  Rich on the palate - nice and creamy and with chocolate roasted flavors predominating.  Gorgeous beer.  Im more partial to stouts than porters, but this is an excellent beer (no surprise from Anchor!)
Tried this at a gas station in Big Sur on the Pacific Coast Highway.  Toasted malts and coffee in the aroma, and some cream and chocolate in the taste.  Excellent with a cookie.

Bottle. Nice lacy tan head. Hold it to the light and it blocks the sun. Toasty malt and a hint of red wine in the aroma. Luxurious creamy mouthfeel. Taste of coffee and chocolate. I really like this beer.

Biting alcohol in the aroma with hints of clove and coriander.  Chocolatey in the mouth with some clove still and metallic flavours. Its very mild with a pleasant, roasty finish. Surprisingly light and green and a good herby character. Grand biscuit characters build in the mouth and knock around for a deliciously long time. Mmm

A solid comfortable porter with enough character to force you to buy a sixer every now and then.  I get toffee and mild nougat maltiness in the nose.  Flavor is the same with the smallest tinge of mild bitter sweet hops and chocolate at the finish.  Medium to full bodied for the style.  This is a very smooth beer that begs for a pipe or stogie to go with it, and I dont even smoke.  2008 12 oz.

Pours a dark red with a huge, velvety tan head. Aroma of light roasted malt, chocolate, and alcohol. Flavor is full on roasted malt with a hint of coffee. Taste of alcohol isnt masked very well considering its only 5.6% Finishes like bitter chocolate. Very good.

Bottle. 
Pours black with a big dense tan head. 
Aroma is liquorice and roasted malt with notes of dark chocolate and alcohol. 
Flavour is soft roasted malt, dark chocolate and coffee with slightly dry bitter aftertaste.
It has a light to medium body, a delicious porter.

From a bottle.  Pours with an extraordinary amount of head!  Smells of chocolate and coffee.  Good solid mouthfeel without being too syrupy.  Just right for a porter.  Taste was of slightly burnt coffee and chocolate.  A great taste for a porter.  The only thing that really knocked this beer down from being excellent, was the undertone/aftertaste of bitterness.  Every sip had this minor undertone of biting bitterness that just didnt go away.  It was very noticeable compared with most other porters that Ive tried.  Still, it is an excellent beer and I would gladly drink the others five in the fridge!

A slightly smokey, sweet and malty aroma, with a touch of maple. Nearly opaque, dark brown in color. Deep malty flavor with a mild hop bitterness in the backdrop, a touch of smoke, and a bit of pine and toasted oak in the aftertaste. Although the initial taste is great, it declines a little bit through the glass, ending up a tad watery at the end. A solid effort nonetheless.

Bottle.  Pours solid black with light brown head.  Aroma is slightly sweet roasted malt with some mild smokey notes.  Flavor starts pretty sweet with lots of roasted malts as it warmed I picked up much more chocolate and coffee.  Very smooth finish with light bitterness.   Nice beer.
Bottle.  Pours blackish brown with a meduim brown head.  Aroma is mostly roasted malt.  Flavor is roasted malt with rather light coffee and chocolate notes.  Excellent.

Has a bready malt aroma with florals.
Pure black color with a hint of an amber hue, did not notice any sediment, and too difficult to se any action.
Sweet roasted malt taste, almost burnt, and has multi floral hops of pine with a butter background.
Full bodied, resinous, bready, slightly buttery, with a soft carbonation.
Very good session Porter with lots of hop florals, minimal bitterness, and a well balanced sweetness of malts.
Not a bad porter. Has all the things you would expect of a good one; chocolate aroma, very dark pour, tan frothy head. It was just alright though.
AMAZING PORTER!!!!  Thanks to Steve for making me get this.  Dark black color and big bold flavor.  Must try for everyone.

Black gold with a snowy, fizzy head approximately the color of the label. Bountiful aroma of dark, bitter chocolate. Nutty, roasted malt, brown sugar, burnt espresso, licorice, and hint of oak in the finish. Its watery mouth-feel  and carbonation reminds me of a soft drink, but, with that out of the way, probably the quality standard in porters. Its reputation speaks for itself.

35,5 cl Bottle. One of the few decent US beer that can be found in Greece. Very dark brown to black color, with a small brown head. Roasted malt aroma with coffee and faint hints of licorice. Again roasted malty taste with coffee , caramel, some chocolate and licorice. Very nice

pours inky dark blackish brown.
Nose - roasted malt, coffee, bakers chocolate. Flavor - Strong coffee, vanilla, burnt sugar. Finsh - smoky bitterness

Pours dark brown almost black with hefty tan head. Rich roasted malty aroma, also a  strong coffee presence. Espresso, vanilla and licorice flavor with a noticeable hop finish. Medium body, a little lighter than I expected. Not sure if it should be the 9th highest rated porter, but a very good beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Poured one month after the best before date.Deep black with a soft tan head. Roasted malt, caramel aroma. Porter typical coffee, liquorice aroma. Medium body. Nice smoky bitter finish. Enjoyable.
Bottle.  Pours as thick/thin as a typical porter.  Good flavor to the porter, nice notes of deep roasted malts, coffee.  Finishes thin and clean.
Nice spiciness to this porter alongside typical porter flavors- malt, coffee, chocolate. All are a little light though. Palate doesnt last very long. Balanced, but not very exciting.

Black pour with a tan head.  Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, and caramel. Flavor is sweet and caramel with some bitter roasted coffee at the finish. Very smooth and drinkable. Light to medium body.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2009 Bottle.  Pours very dark reddish brown with a big but short-lived bubbly beige head.  Smells great- caramel malts, roasted nuts, fresh bread.  Espresso comes through as well in the taste, which to me didnt quite live up to the aroma.  Slightly watery mouthfeel didnt help, but the finish has a nice smoky bitterness.

Pours a clear dark brown with a suddenly exploding head that became unmanageable and overflowed out of the glass unexpectedly. Aroma is not too powerful but is consistent woth the flavor to come: Smoke, smoked nuts, a slight hint of dark fruit, and some good dark chocolate and espresso flavors in the center of the body. Overall, very good, and pretty much exactly what I expected.

Nyckelordet här är kraftfull. Med sin runda, fylliga smak, och sin närmast glödande beska i kanterna, är Anchor Porter en - ja, just det - kraftfull smakupplevelse som är svår att skaka av sig. Inte fulländad, men ändå klart över snittet.

(bottle from the fat cat, Norwich) Looks opaque with a dark white frothy head which lasts till the end of the drink. Smells malty with a touch of fruit and coffee, although the aroma isnt as strong as would be expected. The taste though is beautiful - has a full yet light mouthful, easy to drink yet satisfying. Tastes of sweet vanilla, brown sugar and caramel initially but finishes bitter chocolate, coffee and roast malt, with a touch of citrus hops. Great after taste, an awesome drink.
Dark brown in color with a medium sized beige head. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malt and coffee. Taste is of roasted malts, coffee and toast.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Pours dark brown with a big brown head. Lots of nice roasted malt.

Big head after moderate pour into glass

Really enjoyed the mouthfeel; perfect thickness for me.

I expected more taste in beginning but nice smooth bitter end - not over powering.

I will try/buy again

12 oz bottle. Dark black with a dark creamy head. Malty sweet aroma. Malty and sweet with a little bit of hops at the end. First impression on the mouthfeel was a little watery. Pretty good example of a porter, but a little watery.

I am a definite fan of Anchor.  This porter was sweet and thick, though not syrupy, and it was balanced quite nicely with enough hops to be sensible.  This little bottle entertains from the moment you pick it up off the shelf, throughout the pour of its sensuous black contents to the finish of this pleasantly thick beer down your throat.  Great beer.

Bottle. Moderate malt aromas of toasted, nutty and molasses, light perfume for the hops and earth for the yeast, with background notes of raisin, charcoal, brown sugar and vanilla. Head is large, frothy, light brown with excellent lacing and is fully lasting. Color is clear dark brown with a red tint. Flavor starts moderately sweet and lightly acidic and finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is medium to full, between watery and creamy and has a carbonation between soft and lively. This is an awesome Porter, full and rich. Its aroma eludes to a flavor and palate most fitting for the style.

(bottle) pours the darkest clear brown colour with a creamy brown head. aroma of roasted malt, dark fruits and herbal hops with a hint of chocolate. flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, dark fruit and coffee, very balanced. full body, with smooth carbonation and a nice roasted-bitter finish.

pours a rich black with a healthy cream colored head. Aroma is very nice, with roasted malt, bitter chocolate, and some smoky qualities as well. The flavor is excellent- a middle flavor characterized by cream and malt is juxtaposed with a delightfully bitter finish. Palate remains bitter, but in a quite pleasant manner. Phenomenal porter.
Bottle: Nice and smooth. Molasses and hop flavor. Bitter finish. A really nice porter, that I would buy again.

Bottle.Pours a very dark brown with an   average light brown head . Aroma is roasty, and sweet.Flavor is sweet caramel and banana with hints of molasses and caramel. The finish is dry and quite bitter. The body feels pretty full, sticky mouthfeel would have liked a little more carbonation. A very good porter that I will buy again for sure.
Burnt toast biscuity mild sweetness thick body deep brown color creamy tan head complex and straight forward quality dry mouth feel.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2009 purs a nice, dark brown color, with a slight dark red color around the edges. 3 finger head, with really nice lacing throughout.
First sip i thought this tasted a lot like a wine, its a little dry in the end. And has enough bitterness to balance out the hops but not to be overwhelming. not bad, but i dont think i would drink more than 2 in one sitting due to the dry wine taste i get from it, which maybe how porters are, as this is my first, i didnt know what exactley to expect from this one, eager to try more of this style though.

Bouteille de 330 ml. La bière est de couleur noire avec des reflets rubis et un col de mousse cappucino durable. Au nez on respire des arômes de café froid, de caramel brûlé et de madère. En bouche le corps est moyen avec une effervescence faible. On goûte des saveurs de toffee, de caramel, de grain torréfié, de madère et de café.

Bottle at California Academy of Sciences. Actually not a bad porter. A little sweet and overly moasses-like. But definitely not a bad porter. Goes down smooth and clean, with a nice warm dark malty note.
Wow. I really like this one. Well balanced and rich flavor. Smooth and rich, with notes of caramel and chocolate. Thumbs way up!

Whoa.  I truly hope I just got ahold of a few bad bottles but this is very dissapointing.  Pours dark brown with huge tan head.  Flavor is very metallic and harsh.  Ive drank two and Im honestly considering giving the other 4 away.

Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has tons of banana and grass, very fresh, with more bitter hops opening up as it warms. The flavor is solid and smooth, with an excellent balance of bitterness and sweetness that nullifies the bad aspects of both. A really nice porter.
Very soft full bodies carbonation that is pleasant in the mouth. Extremely dry roasted complex that is very light on the toffee and chocolate flavors.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2009 Dark pour with a thick tan head.  Big aroma of banana bread, coffee, chocolate, malt.  Plenty of all of that in the flavor, plus a spicy peppery note and some hoppy bitterness at the end.  Good complexity, and great balance.  Really good.  I loved it.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2009 WHOOOOAAA, this is WAY overrated on RateBeer. This is only a slightly above average beer and an average porter. Maybe I got a bad keg or something. Taste is fairly flat and one-dimensional. Malty flavor, a little smoke, not much else.  Nothing interesting on the mouthfeel - pretty standard.  Actually tastes a bit like Anchor Steam, which is a little odd for a porter.
UPDATE: Tried this again at the brewery and its actually not bad at all.  Must have been dirty tap lines or something last time.  Still has that Anchor Steam taste to it that sort of dulls the flavors.  Must be their yeast.  Has nice roasted malts as well though with some chocolate, and has a smooth, creamy palate with soft carbonation.  I would put this in the "pretty good" range overall.

Bottle. Aroma of molasses, caramel, brown sugar, sweet malt. Flavor rich with all these weighty, sweet notes, maybe even some vanilla in there. Not really my kind of porter, but interesting and enjoyable.

Bottle.  Pours black with a light tan head.  Aroma of raisins.  Flavor of raisins, molasses, chocolate.  This is a raisiny beer.  I am not getting this beer, but it might be old...but for now I am not a fan.

12 oz bottle pours deep brown with a very thick tan head.  Roasted grain and raisins in the aroma.  Rich caramel and chocolate in the flavor with a bit of dryness at the end.  A fruitiness at the end of the swallow.

Pours very dark brown, may have particulate, its really hard to tell, tall darker tan/amber head that has great retention and leaves some lacing. Aroma is delicious chocolate and roast malts, a little caramel, dried plums, and burnt sugar.  Flavor is lots of roast, chocolate, butterscotch, raisins, a bit of char and a playful fruity note that is difficult to tie down. FInish is fairly bitter with vanilla, banana, roast notes following through.

From bottle:  Pours a dark brown that is almost black.  Has a thick, creamy, tan head.  Aroma is of malt and caramel/chocolate.  Tastes of malt, caramel, chocolate, and brown sugar.  Slight bittersweet finish with hints of some type of fruit and vanilla.  Overall a very good beer.
Solid all around porter.  Pour is black with a thick, creamy off white tanish head.  Roasted malts, caramel, dried fruits, and some toast give the aroma and flavors.  Very easy to drink.
Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Roasted malts, molasses, some dried fruit. Brown sugar.

12 oz bottle. Solid Porter! Poured a dark ass brown with light brown head. Scent of roasted malts, molasses, chocolate, carmel and some fruit. Taste is soft with a heavy roasty taste and chocaolate/carmel malt finish. Overall a nice brew. Nothing over the top with this one.

Bottle.  Pours dark brown almost balck, with some amber in there as well.  Head is creamy tan, thick and long lasting.  Smells roasty, sweet, and carmely.  Tastes deep and roasted, sweet with some fruitiness.  Chocolate, raisin, carmel, coffee, vanilla, and plum are present, but not overly done.  Some tastes of pine hops are barely present, but come out more as the beer gets warmer.  Strong alcohol flavor is also present.  Very good.

Pours almost black with a nice foamy tan head. The retention and lacing is excellent.

The smell is of roasted malt, brown sugar, and hops.

The taste is initially of roasted malt with the subtle presence of hops. After washing over the tongue a few times, the brown sugar comes through (especially as it warms) and all the tastes blend into a nice bittersweet finish.

The mouthfeel is on the light side for what I would expect form a porter, but this is not necessarily a negative. Carbonation is balanced and lends to the brew’s crispness.

This is a very easy drinking porter. I would take delight in having several of these in a sitting (though I don’t normally like to do that). The bittersweetness of this brew makes up for any loss in complexity. This is a great straight-up porter and I think it will become a regular for me.

Reviewed on: 04-20-2007

12 oz. bottle.  Pours black with fleeting amber hues and a rocking, lacing khaki head.  Nose is dark fruits, raisin and cherry with chocolate and caramel, maybe a touch of roasted malts.  Chocolaty and fruity, cherry, raisin and date, with mild roasty character.  Great mouth feel.  A touch fruitier than I expected, but not a detractor.  Tasty brew.
From a bottle poured dark brown/black with a small head.  Nice toasted malty flavor with a quick finish.

12 oz bottle. Pours a tan head, tiny bubbles, fair duration, no lacing, over a dark clear body...nose of bread, yeast, coffee, molasses, very minimal hop....tastes of roasted malts, coffee, mild bitterness in the finish....rich mouthfeel, no sharpness, perhaps a little light. 11/07/2008
Crushed with Jakebra.  Now that is a robust mofo of a porter.  Chocolatey and roasty aroma.  Pretty damn delicious.  Finish lasts forever with vanilla and roasty tobacco-y flavors.  Top-notch.

On tap at the brewery. Deep brown but clearly not black. Tan frothy head with some decent lacing. Fruity chocolate cordial aroma. Flavor is chocolate malt balls with a hint of red fruit and a nice roasty bitter finish. Light bodied and smooth, very drinkable. A porter with no frills, just quality.

Brewed in the USA !! (KSBF) Pours a lovely dark brown color with a med tan head. This porter has a nice chocolate malt aroma with a mild coffee, dark fruit taste. The mouthfeel is a bit on the thin side but quite refreshing.

Looks great. Is opaque dark brown and the tan head is thick and luscious. Lacing is lovely. Aroma is pure quality. Roasted malt, fun asphalt smells, chocolate, rich enticing earth. Creamy, gulpable mouthfeel. Chocolate, cream, mellow, balanced, nothing burnt, nothing bitter. Just nice quality creamy chocolate-forward porter. A really solid go-to beer!

Pours the darkest of browns; almost black with a frothy, tan, two-finger head that lingers. Aroma is of sweetness, roast, and maltiness. Perfect mouthfeel. Nice and roasty, but does not accumulate on the palate like many porters. Nice molasses, fig, raisin, and roast taste. Very tasty, a world class porter.

Well-designed label.  Dark pour with  a rocky head.  Rich aroma with malt, yeast, and a little coffee.  This is pretty sweet and light for a porter, with some coffee and coca-cola flavors - but it is not flabby.  Some hop tartness and bitterness comes thru clearly.  It is a touch medicinal too, unfortunately.  A little overrated i.mo., but this is still a nice porter.
12 oz bottle. Pours dark brown with a big ol’ tan head that dissipates rather quickly. Very creamy and chocolatey, the flavor melts well into the palate. This is a great session porter, very tasty.

Porter sampled at the KSBF- Very dark chocolate brown with a settled off-white head.  Malt-grain light sweetness on the nose.  Pallet on a malt-grain path with some   seasoned fruits,coffee and toffee notes.  Well rounded with a slight dry finish.

12oz bottle from Jans Wine and Booz #2 (Tampa, FL). Pours a very dark brown to black with massive tan head that settles slowly. Head laces the glass. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of caramel, molasses, ripe dark fruit, coffee, milk chocolate. Flavor is strongly malt, coffee and dark chocolate with slight bitter coffee notes close to finish. Generally full body with a bitter finish. Not bad for a porter.
12 oz bottle.  Very dark brown with not much of a head and really good flavor.  Chocolaty flavor with a nice finish.

12 oz bottle.  Poured a deep, dark mahogany color.  Nice tan head, too.  Aroma was malted barley, some coffee notes.  Flavor was robust, with rich chocolate and roasty coffee notes coming through.  Palate was excellent, a thickness that didn’t get in the way but carried the flavors nicely.  I plan on getting some more of this.

12 oz bottle.  Pours nearly opaque brown with a medium tan head.  Aromas of sweet dark fruits (tons of raisin and red grape), caramel, chocolate.  Flavor follows suit with the dark fruits and chocolate, then some roastiness.  Clean finish.

Very dark pour with an off-white head that left nice lacing. Aroma was weak, consisting mainly of muted malt and coffee. Taste was better, with a mix of chocolate and coffee and some roastiness/smokiness.

poured dark brown with nice head that disapated to a thin head that lasted forever.  didnt get much aroma but my smeller may not be working too well.  Flavor is great - creamy and chocolate/malt/coffee - nice little bite in the aftertaste to mix it up - awesome palate - Very good and I plan to get some more of this stocked up.
From bottle. Poured dark brown with thin brown head. Big chocolate and coffee smells.  Sweet coffee flavors with a chocolate finish. Classic Anchor.

Bouteille de 1Pt et 6oz, acheté à City Market (Burlington, Vermont) le 25/9/08. Brune cola, moyen collet. Arome de malte cafiné, avec des notes de ptits fruits alcoolisé. Goût bien malté, sensation de choco café, avec une finission de fruits rouges légèrement sûrette. Un bon porter malté et un peu sucré, simplement agréable!

Bottle.  Poured a dark brown with a thin brown head into an English pint glass.  Aroma of malt, chocolate and coffee.  Flavor was awesome with balanced malt and coffee tones with a chocolate finish.  Great beer.
dark brown colour, light brown good head. Very nice hops - a bit of bitterness. roasted, sweet malts. some mocha. very good palate. absolutely enjoyable.

Bottle, Ale Cellar, Darlington. This is a little cracker. Poured a rich, very dark brown with a nice lingering  creamy tan head.  Aroma  was knoclout, and had malt, chocolate and burnt orange. Flavour was just as good and was  wonderfully balanced and intricate. Loads happening with the malt, hops, chocolate and coffee all superbly poised. Hop bitterness spot on. Absolutely tasty.

Nice muddy brown pour.  Tannish colored head.  Roasted aromas, malt, charcoal.  Flavor has what you would expect, roasted malts and coffee with nice mocha tones.  A little more carbonation than I would like, but it doesn’t seem to hurt this one too much.  Finish clean.  Nice standard medium bodied porter.
user_location: from Michigan now in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle.  Can’t believe I’ve never tried this...  Pour is a dark brown with a beautiful tan head.  I’m not seeing any light peek through around the edges.  Aromas are week, but dark malt and chocolate are present.  Flavor is great... a big mix of chocolate, roasted malt and a dark fruit finish are just what the doctor ordered...  Nice and full across the palate.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Fairly good sand brown head topping a dark roasted like brew. The nose is a mix of coffee, dark chocolate and some raisin. Flavour is some caramel and cocoa. Bitter and slightly sweet.

Ink black with an enormous 3+ finger head that dissipated slowly and left thick lacing. Roasted coffee is strongest in the aroma, along with dark fruits like plums and raisins. Taste followed the smell, with the fruits coming in stronger than they were on the nose, with a slight hops bitterness that materializes late. Moderate carbonation, medium body and a pleasant warming alcohol presence.
Dark brown, almost black with a tan/brown head. Coffee and chocolate dominate the flavors. One of, if not the best porters I’ve had.

Very dark brown, with a tan head. Almost no lacing. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, & hoppy spices. Nice chocolate, espresso and hop spices give a great body to the beer. A bit of licorice in the end. It may be a bit over the top, but in a good way, tastee

Pours black at first with a nice red tinge upon closer examination in the light.  Tan head, didn’t last.  Aromas of chocolate, licorice, and raisins, flavors much the same, with a predominant coffee effect.  A smooth, clean, very drinkable beer with just the right amount of complexity.  Very nice.
Pretty good, very drinkable. Full flavored but relatively light bodied. Coffee and roasted malt flavor. Not much else. Lightly dry, which was nice. Lightly creamy. Very smooth taste.

A black colored beer, with a big foamy beige head. The aroma of chocolate malts, with coffee and a fruity freshness in the back. The taste of chocolate, coffee, dry bitter, dark fruits like raisins. The aftertaste is dry and long bitter. I like it.

Bottle. Black colour with a nice creamy tan head. A bit light aroma of sweet, roasted malt. The flavour is roasted malt, coffee and chocolate with a hint of smoke. Smooth mouthfeel. Bitter and dry finish. Maybe a bit too thin for a Porter but it was still very tasty.

12 oz bottle. Pours a deep brown, good dose of visible small bubbly carbonation clinging to my New Belgium glass, and an average size foamy light beige head. Aroma of sweet coccoa, raisin bread, rum soaked cake and just offly sweet overall compared to lots of other porters. Flavor is initially very sweet that fades into bitter chocolate and finishes with burnt malts. Solid beer that is consistent time after time.
6 Sept 08: Black, with a generous head. Burnt malt with roasty finish. Very good porter.

Opaque dark ruby, fluffy mocha head. Nose is rum, burned malts, banana syrup and dry fruits. Similar burned and rum fruity flavor, alcohol, and a herbal finish. Quite light bodied. Very old school feeling, I’d like it a bit thicker.
Dark brown pour, tan head, spotty lace.  Thick bodied.  Chocolate and coffee, combined with a roasty finish

I was surprised at how dark and thick this beer poured. With its thick flow to its brown head, this resembled a coffee stout more than a porter in appearance. The smell is a lovely, deep chocolate licorice and the taste and mouthfeel is creamy and chocolatey. This beer is so full bodied and full flavored that you’d guess it was a stout. This could be dessert.
Chocolate smell, ruby dark brown/black in colour. Beautifully smooth mouthfeel, creamy texture. Very pleasant toffee, coffe, licorice, anise flavours. A treat.

Taste 8/8 Bottle(7DT). Looks: Opaque black, tan head. Aroma: Roast/toast. Dark fruit licorice. Biscuit/yeast. Taste: Nice roast and fruit mix. Medium sticky body. A nice smoke. Good and evenly complex.

bottle 335ml from Alko EXP Dec 08
murky black tiny beige head scent:roasted malts dry hops Taste: hops kicked first tickling then rich roasted malts pleasant coffee chocolate as well. I have tasted this many years ago last time. One of my favorites
UPDATED: JAN 3, 2009 Large head. Taste of alcohol and burnt coffee. Pretty good. I like Olg Fog horn better though.

I had my first two Anchor Brewing beers while in Texas on a sort for Borders, and they were the classic Steam Beer and Liberty Ale. But up until yesterday, I had yet to partake of their Porter. Thankfully that travesty of my life is now over and I can consider myself an enlightened Anchor Porter fool.

My Anchor Porter poured a thick blackish brown with very little room left for light. Holding it up to a lamp, only faint hints of amber can be seen along the bottom of the glass. a minimum two finger head of soft cappuccino tinged foam tops off my glass, lingering for at least a couple minutes, leaving masses trails of brussels lace as her soft depths slowly retreated into my brew. Her nose is brimming with creamy milk chocolate notes, hints of licorice, dark malts, and vanilla. A quaff later and my tastebuds are reveling in a pleasantly light body with mild weight. Its certainly not as light as a lager, but not nearly as heavy as some porters I have enjoyed. She is smooth, balanced, and more than happy to show off her lush body resplendent in chocolate and café latte notes, vanilla nips, and a lingering bit of bitterness in the finish do to either the richly roasted malts, hops, or both. The tinge of lemon zest I was trying to pin down in the nose is the hop backbone that keeps Anchor Porter from being overly sweet and giving her a nice crisp dry finish. Each quaff leaves a trail of brussels lace all the way to the last which was a bitter-sweet moment.

At certain times I was almost reminded of a milk stout do to Anchor Porter’s lush creamy milk chocolate latte palate. But overall, she shined as a porter through and through.

Bottled. This darks brown beer has a strong brown sugar aroma with flavours of burnt toffee and chocolate. The bitter finish is extremely long. Indeed, this beer is almost too flavourful; it could benefit from being somewhat more subtle.

dark dark brown with a medium puffy tan head
roasted coffee, dark chocolate, deep malts
coffee with a chocolate tone bursting more into a creamy chocolate
clean body, great palate

Fantastic beer!  Aroma of chocolate, malted milk and coffee. Flavor was chocolaty, but had a Belgian-ale like banana in the finish.Warms me up, makes me smile, and helps me open the door to other people who are hesitant about "good" beer.

Pours like a stout from the bottle with a soapy tan head.  Dark cocoa and sweet malts are featured in the aroma as well as charcoal, coffee, mild hops, chalk, and possibly cornmeal in the flavor.  An odd blend of tastes.
Sweet malty aroma.  Simple, but luxurious roasted malt and molasses flavor with more bubbles than you expect.  A hint of bitter in the finish.  What a wonderful, drinkable porter for the price.
Bottle 33cl. Creamy beige head, black colour. Aroma is Sweet malty aroma with hints of honey. Flavour is not as sweet as the aroma, more burnt malt  Quite long dry finish.

Pours black from the bottle with a huge light brown head. Beautiful roasted aroma. On sight alone this looks this a nice thick porter. Surprising that the appearance and the flavor do not match. The first sip is pleasant and roasty...hints of chocolate and molasses. This is wonderful. The initial flavors though do not finish strong for my tastes

Chocolate aroma, slightly smoky, sweet.  Chocolate taste, nice bitterness in the end along with sweet notes. I like this a lot more than in the first try, the mouthfeel is soft and rich. A very good beer.

Poured from tap black with a mocha colored medium sized head.  Aromas of sweet malt and roast grain.  Flavor is mildly sweet with malt, toffee, soft roast grain and coffee.  Palate has a smooth feel with a light grain bitter-sweetness at the end.  Not too thick, not too thin.  Great porter for most occasions.
On tap. Dark brown/black beer, beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, coffee. Flavour is sweet, caramel, coffee and bitter roasted malts. Bittersweet finish.
Remarkably complex flavor - toffee, chocolate, ripe fruit, peanut brittle, hoppy bitterness, and even a touch of alcohol.  Could use a bit more body, but I’m not complaining.  Good beer.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours dark brown with a large creamy beige head.  The aroma is chocolate, barley, slight roast, and dark fruit.  The flavor has creamy semi sweet chocolate, cocoa, dark fruit, anise, and a nice touch of bitterness in the finish.  Medium bodied, smooth, very enjoyable.  Nothing is over the top, just a well crafted porter
UPDATED: AUG 18, 2009 22oz in mug.  Dark chocolate brown and lots of tan head.  Pleasingly dry, medium body.  Toffee, amaretto, and toast notes throughout.  Totally delicious and drinkable.

(Bottle).  Mild sweet cocoa aroma.  Black color with a lovely deep tan creamy head.  Flavor is malty and sweet milk chocolate, not much bitterness.  Some nuts in the finish.  Not a porter that makes a huge "notice me" impact, but nonetheless extremely drinkable and pleasing.

6er from Ralphs Venice Beach.  Like Taps porter, this is classified by a distinct butteriness.  Even the malts and coffee take a very distant backseat to the creamy buttery texture and flavor - it isn’t even that large, it’s just all I could detect.  Some very faint hops as well.  This beer is there when it’s needed.
Dark brown pour. Tan head is beautiful. Dark chocalate and silk in the taste, feels great in the mouth. Very smooth. Some nuttiness.

Cute little anchor bottle, served in an English pint glass. Dark brown pour, a bit of ruby around the edges, topped with a dense tan head. Smells of chocolate, cola, and dark fruit. Smooth body. The taste is hard to describe, the flavors are so well integrated that I can’t pick them apart. It is very good though and fairly unique.

This is one of the best and most balanced porters out there, and have found very few porters that lives up to this one.  So I consider this one as a standard bearer.

Black body with brooding head and nice sticky lacing.  Aromas of anice, chocolate and coffee, just the right amount of each.  Flavors are the same and in balance with each other, nice medium to full body and washes down with some bitterness... it’s an amazing porter and very low alchohol presence.  Definately, one of the best out there.

Bottle (35 cl) from Systembolaget. Dark reddish brown with a medium beige head. Caramelly and roasted malt aroma with herbal hops. Medium bodied and smooth. Very well balanced with some initial sweetness, followed by a dry finish and a lingering soft bitterness.

Bottled. Invicible black beer. Medium head is beige, ok creamy with some bigger bubbles. Aroma has lots of chocolate, dark fruits and sour coffee and chocolate beans in the finish. Malts are delicatedly roasted. Hops in the finish are dryish. Flavor is sweet & sour; swetness from the malts and fruits - sourness from coffee and chocolate beans. Medium to full bodied, smooth mouthfeel and a bit bitter-sticky finish. A great porter!

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2011 Draft sample offered after the Anchor Brewery tour first, draft at many other locations afterwards.  Pours a dark brown/black color with a foamy tan head.  Excellent lacing along the glass.  Great combination of roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee.  Nice amount of bitterness in the finish.  Simply delicious.  This is easily my favorite Anchor variety.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2010 Bottle. Pours a dark black color with a very thick creamy head. Smells like chocolate and caramel. Very drinkable. Very rich and very complex roasted flavors. Got this on a create your own six pack. I would definately pick this up in its own six. 

Re Rate. Dont know what I was thinking the first time when I gave this a 3.1. Guess I was young and stupid. Way better than that

355ml bottle. Black (or very dark red) with lots of brown head. Sweet aroma, bread, some hops, brown sugar. Taste is also sweet, a bit burnt. Bitterness comes in aftertaste, ends with ashes. Thick mouthfeel, balanced acidity.

RateBeer Rating, Style and Glass: 98, porter, english pint or stem glass
ABV, Volume & Calories: 5.6% in 12 fl oz. estimated at 150 C
Purchased at: Circle Liquors Super Saver, Pennington, NJ for $2.50

Aroma: leather, funk, armpit. feet. 7 out of 10.

Visuals: opaque, black and oily, persistent tan head, thick lace. 5 out of 5.

Taste: leather, tea, licorice, corn, little hops, well crafted brown style. 8 out of 10.

Palate: flat soda, smooth, quick flat finish. 3 out of 5.

Overall: Like delicious but flat root beer. I would not seek it out a second time, but this is not my favorite style. It seems of a high craft. 15 out of 20.

Rather thin but dark pour with quite a huge brown head. The nose is dominated of burned malts with hints of caramels and coffee. I sense a bitter citrus flavour together with a nice roasted malty finish. The palate is too waterish imo.

Poured from bottle.  Dark as a coke with a nice thick brown head.  Smells malty but has a hint of cantaloupe.  Very smooth and sweet flavors of coffee and chocolate.  Nice and creamy on the tongue.  Very nice.
Dark reddish black pour with beige head. Strong malty nose. Deep roasted malt flavor with a surprising sharp pang of bitter bite. Good to great.
kind of so so to me. not very complex. roasted malt and more roasted malt. no head. mouth feel not the greatest, i found it to crisp. need to rate this one again.
Bottle 08.’  black pour with a nice bone white head.  sweet with complex hop bitterness.  rich and roasty.  great malt flavors.
On Draft - Very dark with a white head. Aroma is slightly smoky, roasted malt. The taste was much the same with a bit of a bitter hop finish and a nice creamy feel. Nice beer.

the beer pours a deep black with a thin off white head that leaves a nice lacing. the nose is a nice mix of burnt malts and sweet chocolate. the body is somewhat water but the flavor is a nice mix of toasted malts and burnt sugar. the finish is slightly acidic and medium lived.

Almost black with a reddish tint when held up to the light. Head thins out soon from nearly rocky but leaves some nice lacing.

Not certain on what exactly I’m smelling; a hint of caramel and perhaps sweet, dried fruit with a hint of sourness.

Malty, fruity caramel on entry goes roasty with a coffee aftertaste along with a touch of hop bitterness. Quite nice.

[Bottle] Pours a clear deep brown with a medium tan head. Aroma is candi sugar, bittersweet chocolate, and roasted barley. Flavor was determined to be a little off, but I actually still liked it, and it wasn’t too far out. But regardless, it was nice and smooth and followed the aroma pretty well.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2009 Re-rate: 12oz bottle. Pours a black body with an incredibly creamy, light brown, finger-width head that dissipates very slowly and remains very very very frothy and evident throughout the session. Lots of lace. Really nice looking porter coming out of the bottle. Aroma is sweet and malty. Lots of cherries. Very soft chocolate and roasts. The aroma is mainly dominated by the malty cherries. Different for a porter, but still a solid aroma. Flavor is also different, but quite nice. It starts slow, but grows and grows throughout the finish. Starts with a thick, cherry maltiness then moves into a mild hop bitterness, slightly acidic, and soft creamy mocha middle before finishing with a chocolate cherry overtone and a solid, soft roastiness that lingers for a good amount of time. Palate is full and very smooth. Overall, a really nice, soft porter with lots of taste. Not the bold, in your face roast or hoppiness like some porters, but very well balanced and flavorful. Really good stuff.

Dark beer with small tan head. Nose has chocolate and milk with hints of roast. Flavor is very nice: bitter roasts and licorice give way to sweet chocolate malts. Gets more bitter and ashy as it warms. Enjoyable, perhaps even unique, but not a favorite.

Deep black pour, thick and viscous with a large foamy brown head.  Smell tons of bread, some spice and coffee, lots of malt and some alcohol.  The smell is pretty good but I found the taste dissapointing, brown bread and malt flavours overpowered anything else.  Not to my taste.

12 oz. bottle. Pours deep black, with minimal head, but nice lacing. Who knew such great a viscous beer could come in the neat little Anchor bottle?! Chocolate and coffee flavor and finish. Very drinkable for the style (at 5.6%, I guess that is reasonable). Will purchase again.

Pours with a rich head that lasts to the bottom of the glass.  Has a creamy feel and an accompanying smooth roasted coffe and chocolate flavor and just a hint of bitterness.  A really easy-to-drink porter.

Pours an almost syrupy dark brown. Has the aroma of caramel,
with a hint of chocolate, and a subdued burnt undertone. Has a semi sweet taste 
of caramel, chocolate, and a little roastyness. This one is quite
mellow all around with a smooth finish. Very solid porter.

Dark brown almost black with a good sized tan head, some lacings. Aroma is dark malty some chocolate scent.
Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, some molasses, bitter hops.
Substantial Porter. Easy drinker for the style.

12oz bottle from BevMo! Mission Valley.  Pours deep brown almost black with a small beige head that left great lacing.  Very faint aromas of caramel and toasted malt.  Not much to this beer, drinkable but, overrated.

Pours a very dark brown color with a light tan head. Aroma is a bit subdued but contains some chocolate, smoke, and coffee bitterness. Flavor is kind of dry and smoke but with a nice chocolate and coffee finish.
On tap. Creamy head.  Rich aroma.  Had a hint of chocolate and an almost oaky flavor to it.  Not my favorite porter, but I wouldn’t turn it down, either.

wasnt getting so much aroma from this but the smooth, creamy, thick feel is the one thing to note. coffee, cocoa and nuttiness to the flavour but it only just scrapes a 7 in all honesty because i was expecting a bit more.

Pours a very dark brownish black with a nice creamy tan head. Very nutty aroma with some coffee and chocolate notes. Flavor starts out with a hint of fruitiness and roasted malt. Some strong coffee notes come through in the finish and a very intense nut flavor lingers for a bit. Full bodied and rich. Definitely a tasty porter, and a great sipper if you like those coffee and nut flavors.

Pours a deep opaque brown with a rocky light tan head.  Aroma screams soy sauce with hints of cocoa and coffee.  Very smokey.  Very lively carbonation and heavy mouthfeel.  Taste is much less soy saucy and more on the roasted grain/coffee side with very little bitterness.  Not that complex but not a bad choice.

Pours an almost opaque reddish/black...  the amber color shows more at the edges and with the nice head.  Aroma is nice, but not overpowering...  flavor is of roasted malts, with mocha.  Balanced sweetness with this one.

A very nice beer. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, banana nut bread, prunes, smores, and scotch. Appearance is dark as coal. Flavor is nice- chocolate, coffee, and Robert DeNiro mole juice. So, overall, its quite delicious, if a bit one-dimensional.

Deep deep deep brown with a milk chocolate head.  Smells of delicious dark malt though not especially roasty with strong hints of chocolate.  Taste is smooth chocolate which follows into a bitter finish that is more cocoa bitter than hop bitter.  A fantastic porter.

(Sample from November 17, 2006 Beer Club Meeting; Sample from December 14, 2007 Beer Club Meeting; 22oz bottle at home on June 20, 2008) Popped the cap, poured the amber-brown brew into a pint glass, and watched the light brown foamy head form, which holds itself well on top the solid mohogany/black porter.  Aroma is roasted and malty.  Flavor is uniquely bitter and roasted.  Medium malt body, coats the tongue with a tasty film of spicy, malted bitter.  A great comination of texture and flavors on the palate...  very enjoyable.  Each sip is just as good as the previous, allowing the tongue to open up to additional flavors of chocolate and spice.  Rich, but not too complex or heavy.  Id score this higher only if it had a better palate - I think I would enjoy a slightly heftier body.  All in all, cant complain about this cant-go-wrong beer!

Bottle. Pours an almost opaque black with ruby highlights.  Aggressive pour resulted in a 3 finger tan head and great lacing.  Nose has some dark fruits, mellow coffee and chocolate aromas.  Taste is milk chocolate, prunes and coffee with a powdery cocoa flavor in the finish followed by some hop bite.  Medium mouth feel.  Good stuff.
Pours a nice black color with a nice size light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, barley, malt. Flavor is barley, malt, chocoate, roasted coffee. Finish is bitter powdery chocolate. Decent porter.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2010 Black, Roasted malts, creamy, nutty, chocolate, sweet, little coffee, little earthy hops, with a slight nice bitter finish.  Update 6-8-10: I have been drinking a lot of this and I still love it!

Bottle. Very malty smell of toffee and chocolate, also roasted and nutty, quite sweet - an extremely nice smell. The head is large, brown and creamy, long lasting; the body is black. Light acidic start, then it gets a little bit more bitter, then it gets sweeter and the finish is finally bitter again. Rather long duration. Medium to full body, creamy and oily texture and a soft carbonation. A very nice Porter!
Nice porter.  Dark brown pour with a small amber head.  Aroma of roasted malt.  Tastes of roasted malt and coffee.

Im amazed at the rating of this beer! Im realy not that impressed. The aroma was pretty good. Nice dark color with a tan head is to be expected, but the flavor was terrible.  Sorry if I offend anyone but... I didnt like it. And there was a little harshness on my palate. Didnt like this porter.

bottle. not much aroma, looks great, flavor is sort of dark and roasted, but not hard roast. bit boring. palate okay, but somewhat glyey/slimey, overall okay beer, but not one ill have again. average too high imo.
bottle, Mild acidic milk chocolate mild coffee taste.  Medium bodied with a creamy texture.  Lively carbonation with a astringent finish.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2011 This is my favorite porter, no, this is my favorite beer. I am a big fan of the porters but this is one of the first ones I ever tried and, I guess I just got lucky. No other porter can match what Anchor brings to the table. Thick, creamy caramel head, dark black, just a wonderful appearance. Smells of chocolate, roasted coffee beans, and a slight sweetness that I cant quite place. The taste is just wonderful. Everything mentioned in the aroma comes through in the taste. Its not too thick of a beer, but definitely not too thin either. The aftertaste is wonderful. Cant say enough about Anchor Porter.
A dark brown coloured beer. A tanned head. Some chocolate in the nose. Better colder than warm. Some honey in the aftertaste.
black in color with ruby edges.  tan head with decent lacing.  aroma of dark malt but very muted.  flavor carmalized malt a a slight bitterness.  decent finish.

One of my very favorite porters. 
Pours deep black with a fluffy tan head. Aroma is of coffee, deep roasted malt and a very little bit of floral hops. Flavor is similar to the scent, this porter has a very strong coffee flavor, along with cocoa, and a good bitterness that plays well with the roasted malt flavors. The palate is a little thick and grainy, however with a creamyness in the back of the mouth.

Bottled 355ml. It pours a very dark beer with a beautiful reflect of ruby. Strongly tanned mocha head. The aroma is mainly of dark chocolate, licorice and raisins. Full bodied and extremely rich. Nicely malty. Dry. Low bitterness. Beautiful lace, excellent appearance. Sweet. Licorice in the finish. Very pleasant, nothing more. Remarkably low carbonation.

12 oz bottle into a mug.  Thin pour: black body with a dirty tan head, which provides descent lacing.  Aromas of dark fruit, small hints of coffee; simple delicious aroma, though not very complex. Flavor is very unique for a porter.  It is less smoky and earthy and more light and fruity, but not overly sweet like a fruit beer.  Its flavor is dominated by grapes, which my friend pointed out and I ultimately agreed with.  Medium bodied to light bodied on the palate; a bit watery and should be thicker in my opinion.  Little to no carbonation.  Overall:  Nice to have an original beer in a certain style every now and then, and this does it for porters.

Dark black with a fairly substantial tan head.  Carbonation is apperent in the mouthfeel, its nice but perhaps a touch to aggresive.  Finish is fairly smooth with a touch of coffee/chocolate bitterness.  Not my favorite style but overall a good beer

2/10/08 notes:  bottle. Pours jet black with a small tan head. Nose is coffee, malts, maybe some bread. Palate features fair degree of carbonation.  Body is very smooth, and has great semi-bitter finish.  Flavors of coffee, roasts, and dark chocolate.  Just really solid, without any gimmicks.

12 oz bottle into imp pint.  Nice tan, tight head poured onto dark brown with ruby highlights.  Smells of coffee and chocolate- and malt.  Tastes of bitter/ smoothe chocolate.  Can taste the roasted malt.  Great feel in the mouth and very easy to drink.  I havent had too many American porters, but I think of it as the American Fullers- different but very good and very consistent.
Wow. This porter is really good. Very dark, almost black pour. Nice brown head and a TON of flavor. Coffee at the beginning with chocolate. I really enjoyed this one.

355 ml bottle. Very dark brown, nearly black colour with a medium light brown head. Roasted malts, coffee and chocolate in the aroma. Palate was smooth, but not as full as I expected. Sweet, roasted flavour with nuts, liquorice and coffee. A good porter.

(bottle, 33cl) A very dark red porter with thick, brownish foam. A roasted, hoppy arome with some fruityness. At first it felt like a good palate but it fast became thin. The taste is quite sweet and plenty roasted. It could do with a bit more aftertaste although it had a bit of bitter harschness. Quite a good beer.

Bottle: Poured a dark black color with a medium beige color head. The aroma is coffee but sweet with some hops. The taste is sweet coffee with nice hops and twists as it warmed up. Very nice old style porter.
Bottle. Very dark brown/black, with thick head. Aroma of cream and coffee. Chocolate flavour with a hoppy finish. Some alcohol. Not as full body as you might expect

Black with a small creamy head. Aroma of chocolate and pistashio. Flavor is nutty (almond, pistashio, hazelnut...) with a bit of chocolate. Some hops come through in the finish. Medium bodied. This is exactly what I think of when I think of porter. Quite good, but nothing fancy.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2008 I live in NH and have driven across state lines to find it by the bottle. Had this at Tapwerks in OKC. Pours dark dirt brown, with slight red tint. Notes of roasted malt, spices, wood, coffee, and fruit. Taste is amazing, complex. Not too dirty, not too hoppy. Some sweetness. Finishes with a small bitter kick. An amazing beer, but much better by tap than bottle. Really amazing stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2009 Fairly large head, very deep red color, and the foam settles to a nice level that keeps for the entirety of the glass. Licorice, mocha aroma. Taste is not too bitter: almost like unsweetened chocolate with some brown sugar. Easy to drink- could put a few of these away in one sitting. Rich and not too heavy- awesome.
Bottle.  Dark beer with a tan lacing around the glass.  Smoked malt, licorish, sweet fruit.  Thin carbonation and mildly hopped finish.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2008 A very good porter.  Sweet, slightly roasty, and very easy to drink.  Roastiness doesnt linger too long.  Sweetness is almost a bit too much, lingering on fruity.  Roastiness could be more, and the beer is a bit tannic after a while.  Otherwise, this is a very smooth, easy drinking excellent porter.  High recommended.
Bottle from Systembolaget,sweden.  Aroma is a bit fruity with some smokey and sweet notes. Flavor is roastad and sweet with notes of fruit,licorice and coffee. Good porter!

Pours dark brown with large light tan head that lasts forever.  Aroma is sweet with caramel.  Flavor is roasted and sweet and goes down real smooth.  This is different than other porters Ive had.  Rich but smooth, it makes you want to drink more.

Had on draft, poured dark red to black with tan head. Aroma is sweet with sugar and chocolate. Flavor was sweet with notes of coffee and bittersweet chocolate. Creamy mouthfeel. Enjoyable to sweet to have more than one or two.

Bottle from Systembolaget. In the new world of monster ABV porters, this is a great example of a more drink-friendly beer. Lovely burnt sugar and coffee nose. However slightly too sugary sweet for my taste, with an oil-slick mouthfeel. Very rich beer considering the strength.
Bottle.  Very sweet aroma, like honey.  Caramel like taste.  Nice head/head retention.    Nice dark brown/black color.  Very well balanced.  Perhaps a little flat tasting.
Bottle 35,5 cl. Nice porter, much better than other porters I have drinked. Not much to say though, roasted flavours with some smokiness. Good!

Chocolate syrup and mocha (coffee bean) nose.  Black with a hint of crimson.  Huge long lasting head.  Very understated roasted coffee dark chocolate sweetness, just enough hops to balance.  Full mouth feel, good carbonation, with a mellow bittersweet chocolate finish.  An excellent Porter.
Sampled after our mvp tasting session consisting of some serious beers.  So my palate was pretty pwn3d.  Poured nice, but not the best porter if had.  Will rerate eventually.

Bottle, 35.5 cl. Pours a black colour with a pale brown head. Aroma is roasted with notes of coffee beans and chocolate (both sweet milk chocolate and darker and more bitter chocolate). Flavour is quite sour-sweet and roasted with notes of coffee beans, sweet milk chocolate, tart unripe blackcurrants. Dark bitter chocolate in the finish. A quite straightforward porter. At 16 Swedish kronors (~2.60 USD) a bottle this is a great QPR!

Very deep and dark reddish brown beer with scant beige head, leaves nice lacing though. Sweet, roasted malts, liqorice and nice hoppiness in aroma. Roasted malts, chokolate in flavor. A bit grassy also. Aftertaste is quite bitter. Palate is oily, medium-bodied and low carbonated.
Bottle. Brown-black with large mocha head. Sweet, roasted aroma. More like sweet coffee.  Caramel. Medium body. Slightly roasted after taste. Very nice porter but maybe a bit too sweet..

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2009 Black/brown color with a pale brown head. Roasted and sweet aroma with notes of coffee, dark fruits, chocolate, caramel and light citrus. Taste of roasted/lightly burned malt, dark fruit, licorice, coffee, chocolate, raisins and a bit of citrus. Medium bodied and smooth.
Pours dark brown with light brown head. Aromas of roasted malts and chocolate. Sweet roasted malt flavor. Full body with minimal carbonation and a slightly dry finish. A very good porter.
Bottle.  Dark brown pour, with some off-white head.  Aroma is sweet malt, some smoke, and chocolate.  The flavor is the same, a little smoked, a little sweet, and overall pretty decent beer.
Pours a dark black color with a thick tan head.  Flavor is chocolatey and roasted, nicely balanced.  Very good overall.

This porter is just hard to beat.  Seriously a wonderful brew here.  Chocolate, coffee, dark dried fruits in the aroma and on the palate.  Hops are perfect.  Carbonation is perfect.  Head is nice and tan with some good lacing.  Full body, full flavor.  Winner!
