malt, barley and chocolate flavors in a winey base of beer... this is a nice porter. moderate caramel flavor yet this beer is not slick but more full bodied and substantial yet refreshing. the bitter finish and tingle on the tongue is my signal of good hops inside. a little roasty and a little sweet. and a little surprised! nice beer.

Bottle.  Pours very dark with a tan head.  Nice lacing.  Aroma is a bit of chocolate and coffee.  Taste is great, with a lot of chocolate malt, but has a dry ending with a nice bit of hops.  A pretty harty porter - very close to stout.  Very nice.
The first porter I ever had. Pours a deep dark brown colour with a fairly large head. very smooth and chocolatey like flavor. A nice sweet caramel finish and roasted malts.

Light brown head. Black colour. Aroma is malty with coffee, dark chocolate and light nutty notes.
Flavor is malty too with banana, hoppy and roasty tones, ending in a balanced moderately malty finish. Light bodied.

It seems there are a lot of people who really enjoy this beer.  I would like to try it again, because a lot of these notes are old and I remember not being overly impressed by this porter.  The malt profile is extremely rich and roasty at the beginning, with some slight cocoa dustiness, but just dropped right off in the finish which I found to be somewhat chalky, a tad smoky and very dry.

a great robust porter....gotta love the bjcp
super nice roasted malts....great silky mouthfeel...great head retention....super balanced roasted malt flavors

Dark black pour with a creamy tan head.  Nice aromas of roasted malts and coffee, with hints of fruit.  Good flavor too, coffee fruit chocolate and vanilla come through.  Actually much better than I was expecting.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, 12 April 2008) Black colour with ruby hints, creamy pale brown colour. Roasted, malty nose with notes of chocolate, coffee and hints of smoke, tar and ashes. Roasted, malty taste with tar, liquorice, chocolate, vanilla, toffee, dark fruit and cocoa bitterness. Slightly sweet. Lovely, complex porter with lots of character.

Pours pitch black with a nice milk chocolate colored head. The beer looks great. The aroma is chocolate, burnt malt, some coffee. The taste is the same, chocolate and coffee very well-balanced. Mouthfeel is perfect for a porter. I admire Anchor, because you can tell they put a lot into their beers. Always a good choice.
Just cant go wrong with an Anchor beer.  All their beers are great.  This is just another example.  Nice full flavored porter with a beautiful creamy head.  A must have for porter fans.
Delicious aroma is roasted and burnt malt with syrup, coffee, chocolate and hops... "a bit like Asam Bock" first came into my mind :) Very enjoyable.
A very enjoyable porter. Dark as night with a really nice head. Smells of roasty delight. I get the aroma of toffee and chocolate. A very, very good porter in my book.
bottle.  puny tan fizzy head (dissapated almost immediately) into black body.  minimal lacing.  aromas of chocolate and light coffee also some hops noticeable.  this is a good porter, very drinkable.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2009 12 oz bottle froma trade with thecheeseman. pours black with a mid tan head. aromas are tin and malt. uh oh infected for sure. flavours are tinny gross badness with some good stuff underneath. man i put this one off for so long and now thats its infected im truly peeved. i hate infections. man. arrrggg. ok im start an ISO so i can give this another try///////////////////////////////////re rate. 12 oz bottle from scrizzz. deep brown with a thick tan head. wonderful caramel and chocolate aroma. perfectly balanced flavour. the best porter ive ever had. this bottle was a 5!!
12 0z. bottle, really enjoyed this, nice toffee head, good chocolate and coffee and some light malt make this very drinkable
Smokey, creamy, and bitter. Its very smooth and drinkable, and it manages to exhibit hop character better than most porters I have had.
This one was definitely enjoyable. Taste is quite smokey with dark chocolate, coffee, liquorice and roasted malt. Great!

Nice and malty, but fully propped with a boatload of hops as well.  Dark black in colour with a fluffy tan head.  Thin mouthfeel as a porter often has.  I dont typically like porters but I find this one very drinkable.  Does that mean its a good porter or actually one that doesnt quite fit the style correctly?  Rich and smoky aroma, smooth and bitter finish.

Its not popular to say, but Ive always regarded this one as mediocre.  Its good, but there are so many good porters out there that blow this guy away - blackish brown pour with a medium head.  Aroma is roasty and grainy.  Flavor has a bit of coffee and hop presence with doses of chocolate and dark bread.  Smooth finish, but again always boring to me.  A classic, but not Anchors best.
pours a very dark colour with a creamy head. aroma of coffee and caramel and a similar taste. very enjoyable

WELL DONE!! A very black brew with a developed short lived head. Chocolate hints fill the air as you begin to take your first sip. Perfectly balanced with a light heartiness at the end. Excellent at the end of large meal, this brew has captured the right essence of quality. Definitely recommend!

12oz bottle poured into a tulip glass.  AP pours black as can be with a large fluffy tan head that persists.  The aroma is subtle with hints of vanilla and chocolate.  The beer is surprisingly dry.  It is moderately bitter, tasting of coffee beans and vanilla.  The bitterness is slightly more intense than I like but overall the beer tastes good.  The finish, like the body is dry and the after taste is quite bitter.

Black with an off white head.The aroma consists of dark malt,coffee,dark chocolate,cola and a hint of molasses.The flavor is a fleeting sweetness immediately followed by semi-sweet bitterness that fades slowly into a dry finish.Smooth texture.Very good.

Bottle. Pours almost black with a nice off-white head with very fine bubbles. Smell is lightly roasted dry malts and some dark fruits. Taste is not too roasted lots of nutty flavor with a dry finish. I really like this, probably the best porter Ive had.

This beer is smoking hot. Pours deep black with a nice thick creamy head on top. Aromas of roast malt, caramel, coffee, and maybe a hint of citrus. Tastes of coffee, chocolate, and malt. I can see why so many love this great beer.
12 oz. bottle - dark brown with tan head; medium body and minor lacing; mild roasted aromas with a crisp hop kick; flavors of chocolate and hops; slightly thin texture

bottle poured to an English pint has a dark black color and a huge three finger head that melted down the glass leaving sticky foam down the inside. aroma has dark malt, plumb, fig, smoked roast, and light peppery hops. flavor is somewhat sweet with roasted malt, coffee, and caramel. hits of chocolate mix in with the  malt mix. mouth feel is medium and a bit chewy. hops disappear and only come through a little in the finish mixing with some bitterness. actually a good porter that is easily sipped away.

12oz bottle. Dark brown with light brown slowly fading frothy head.  Biscuits, toffee and caramel on the nose and coffee, caramel & chocolate on the tongue.  Smooth malty finish with a mild sugar aftertaste.  This one went down nice & quick.
Deep black color, thick tan head. Roasted malt aroma. There is a strong sweetness with a nice roasted malt flavor to balance it out. Very smooth, maybe a tad too light, but a good beer.

A fabulous porter. Pours a dark brown, light tan head.  Head fades fast with no real lacing.  Roasted aroma and a chewy roast flavor with hints of coffee.  Very smooth, dry finish with a roasted flavor that really lasts.

Pours very dark brown with a thin tan head that leaves a little lacing. Very week earthy aroma. Nice sweet malty flavor though with a punch of coffee in the middle and a light but smooth roasted hop finish. A little thin but not too bad.

THOUGHTS: A really nice beer. I was very surprised by this one. I knew anchor did California commons well, but I didnt know they did incredible porters too. I think I will be trying more styles of anchor beers in this new year. (Had this on New Years Day.)
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a dark brown that was black in the glass with slight red highlights and an average, tan head. The aroma was moderate to heavy roasted, chocolate (like hot cocoa mix and chocolate syrup) malts and very light hops. The initial flavor was lightly sweet and lightly to moderately acidic; while the finish was moderately to heavily sweet and lightly biter with an average duration. The flavor was mostly roasted malt with a little bit of bitter chocolate and just a hint of hops in the finish. The medium body was a little oily and a little dry with lightly fizzy carbonation and a moderately astringent and lightly chalky finish.

Average color for a porter, small head that lasts, no lace. Aroma is a sweet molasses/chocolate with slightly burnt notes. The flavor is roast barley, molasses. All in all a bit sweet for me, although Im a little sick and stuffed up.
12 ounce bottle purchased at ABC Liquors Pembroke Pines, FL for $1.89. Very good.
Dark color with a really nice head.  Aroma has roastiness with some carmel and cofee.  Taste has some chocolate and coffee.  Very good beer.
Very drinkable.  Wonderful, yeasty bubblegum aroma.  Very lacy head.  Less roasty or hoppy than I had expected.  Well balanced between sugars and roasted malts. A classic.
pours extremely dark with big foam. very pleasant caramel malt aroma. has a nice thin feel with subtle coffee flavors and some sweetness. tremendous beer overall.
pours dark with light brown foam with dark chocolate and dark fruity notes very creamy this beer is very smooth with some coffee flover , this is a great beer

From tap at Ølbaren. Pours dark brown to black, little red hue and a dense tan/brown head. Roasted malt aroma, mild coffee note. Caramel malt, chocolate and a smooth roasted note following. Minor liqourice note. Ends with a smooth chocolate and light roasted note.

Pours black and creamy with minimum lacing. Texture is thin, has a thin head, with minimal lacing. Looks like a Coke, smells like a Yoo-Hoo, tastes like an alcoholic Yoo-Hoo. Slightly watery, rich flavor. Fairly simple, but good. One of the better porters thats readily available.

Thanks to akevitt for sharing.  Pours a dark brown body with foamy, light brown head.  Aroma of chocolate and caramel with a hint of taffy.  Initially, flavors of sweet malts and dark chocolate are present, with the chocolate becoming more dominate in the aroma and taste as it warms.  Medium-bodied and smooth mouthfeel.  Slight mocha finish with a tinge of hoppiness.

12 fl. oz. bottle, St. Regis Hotel, San Francisco, 21st Feb 2008. Pours pitch black with a small head. All the aromas youd expect from a porter are present and correct - rich malt, bitter coffee and dark fruits. Likewise in the flavour. Palate is fine too, but while this is a nice porter, its not wholly superior as the commercial description claims. Give me Fullers first, please!

12 oz bottle.  Pours a dark dark brown/black with tan head that diminishes with noticable lacing.  Aroma is of carmely and toasty malts with almost a metallic scent here and there.  But wow, the taste is where its at.  Im not generally a big porter fan but this blew me away.  It has a very delicate and complex balance between toasted malt, bitter hops and the sweetness of the chocolate and coffee and even banana flavors.  These all play off eachother and then it finishes oh so smooth with a very balanced bitterness.  And to top all of this off, the mouthfeel is also great. Silky smooth without being too heavy and just the right touch of carbonation.  A suprisingly drinkable porter.  This is a wonderful beer, two thumbs up!

Pours a dark chocolate brown with a nice thick beige residual head. Rather lively carbonation on the palate. Unsweetened chocolate, dark roast coffee, burgundy, dried sweet plums. Medium body with some hop bitterness in the finish. Smooth and highly drinkable. Stands above the average porter, but does not quite emphasize its qualities to thoroughly entice the palate. - Very good.
12 oz bottle, dark dark brown body with a foggy light brown head. Very flavorful and tasty porter, not at all watery, but not too thick. Delicious!

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2010 Anchor Porter -- 3/4/2008 from 12 oz. bottle . . .
  Aroma: Bitter-sweet; Roasted malt; Mocha-like chocolate and coffee; Blackstrap.
  Appearance: Clear; Rich coffee-black color; Creamy tan head with good retention; Good lacing.
  Taste: Medium bitter; Coffee; Roasted malt; Bitter chocolate.
  Palate: Medium thick; Good carbonation; Somewhat bitter, yet refreshing, finish.
  Overall: This is a big, delicious Porter, yet it goes down lighter than it really is.  Even K, who isnt a huge fan of Porters, liked this.  This is a really good beer.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2017 12 oz. bottle - Poured black with nice tan head. Smelled like every other porter which is light coffee, sweet chocolate and also nutty. Taste is smooth, alot of hazlenut flavor. A really nice porter, easy to drink and alcohol is not detectable.
My first porter.  Rich roasted malted barley, very lite bitterness.  Dark black in color.  Flavors of coffe, chocolate.  Complexity never tasted so good.  Top two beers for me.
Tap at Lemmys,Leiden: Very black looking porter thats have its roasted malts, and chocolate taste and well balanced bitter finish.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2008 Pours black with dark ruby highlights and small beige head.  Toffee nose, rich and creamy on the tongue.  Wonderful balance between roastiness and sweetness with a nice chocolate flavor and subdued hop bitterness.  One of the best porters youll ever have.

Paors dark, almost black.  Thick one finger head.  Aroma of toffee and coffee.  Taste of coffee cocoa.  Has a disctinctive smoke taste to it.  Bitter finish creeps up on you,  Rich mouth feel.   I rememebr this fondly from my SF days (late 90s).  Was a great beer then.  Still is.
Dark black oily color. Roasted malts in the aroma. Coffee, dark chocolate malts. Balanced sweetness, licorice taste. Very balanced. Very pleasant brew, could use some more bitterness though.
as perfect as a poter can be.  not too sweet, not to smokey.  it is perfectly balanced.  if this is your first porter, you will be spoiled.  This is one of my top 3 beers of all time.
THIS IS MY FAVORITE PORTER. ITS DARK RICH COLOR AND TASTE ARE EXCEPTIONAL. A MUST TRY FROM A GREAT BREWERY.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2008 AROMA:  Pear banana hops accompained by cookie + burnt carmel malts.

PALATE:  Syrupy texture.
Coffee bitter finish with legs.  

FLAVOR:  Light floral hops up front.  Bitter charcoal + coffee mid mellowing to  medium toasted malts, chocolate and licorice.  With a rich mocha aftertaste, this porter is a real treat, like sippin hot cocoa next to a campfire, in the woods.

Pours a dark black with a nice creamy tan head. Sweet aroma, caramel and coffe tones, toasty malt, some discernable hop.
Bitter chocolate flavour with smooths out into a deep coffee and fruity raisin sweetness.
Very tasty.
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2008 Anchor Porter is a dark beer with a light brown head. A slight smokey aroma is intriguing, but not very strong. With a creamy body, this beer is very smooth and very enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2008 Truely fantastic porter - Silky smooth and rich, hearty roasted malt backbone with a strong, but not overpowering, bitter coffee bean and dark chocolate note.  Lightly hopped with some sweet earthy cast members, maybe weak licorice and berry. Smooth and dark, very rich and satisfying.

Re-sample June 2008 - yeastier than I remember. Old rating 4.0, New Rating 3.8 - Avg Rating 3.9

Pours black with a big, creamy-brown head.  Aroma is nice, with a chocolaty, alcohol bite.  Flavor is bittersweet, with hints of chocolate, coffee, and blackberry.  Good carbonation, but just a bit thin.  Great beer.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2009 Bottle at the Manchester Winter Ales Festival. 98%? Didnt think it was that good but I certainly enjoyed it. Full bodied and slightly vimto like. Not educated enough in Porters to know whether this is a good one or not but I certainly enjoyed it.
Dark brown/black pour with diminishing tan head.  Black licorice and chocolate aromas.  More black licorice and chocolate in the flavor.  Medium mouthfeel.  Melting chocolate finish.

Dark pour with creamy tan head.  Aroma of a lot of malt, chocolate.  Tastes th same but with a little bit of hop bitterness towards the finish.  Was a very clean and smooth beer.  One of the better porters out there.  Would buy again.

A beautiful dark brown body with red hues sits beneath a creamy chocolate head leaving great lacing. Smells a tad weak and super crisp. Slight roastiness, with a bit of chocolate. Tastes full and robust, with rich chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt notes. Super creamy and rich. This is an easy drinking porter, and one I have no problem quaffing a few of.
Black with brown lasting head.  Coffee, chocolate, and licorice aromas.  Coffee / espresso, chocolate, licorice, and balancing hops flavours.  Farily blanced with a nice bitter finish.

12 oz bottle (sixer) into a tumbler, chilled. 

Pours murky black with hints of red on the edges with a small off white head.
Smells of nuts and molasses and coffee. Taste is light and deep with coffee, roasted malt and a alcholic bitterness. A good solid porter.

Very good porter with an absolutely beatufil black color topped off with a strong beige head.  Great malty flavor with a nice hops finish.  Big body to go with the big taste.   Much better than its more well known brother Steam.

Black with a thin tan head. Mild roasted malt and black licorice aroma. Med body and smooth. Has a rich , hearty taste of blackened malts with a hint of herbal hop sweetness to finish. Good stuff.  8905
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
Very dark brown color with delicate and thin head. Very malty, burned, even a bit stinging aroma with a hint of chocolaty liquorice.

Superb, creamy soft mouth feel with low carbon dioxide. Most drinkable (good) porter Ive had due to the softness and lack of any strong-tasting characteristics. Aftertaste is hops and coffee, but a bit thin. Gets sweeter as it warms up.

A balanced beer but lacks complexity and real character. Good first porter. 060208

Very nice porter, at first it had a strong aftertaste of alcohol, but that diminished after a few drinks. Several burnt flavors mixed in well together - more of an alcholoic mocha taste to it. Another fine brew from Anchor
Very satisfying beer that pairs well with food. Quality is very consistent on tap or in bottle
another great full bodied beer... i have yet to be let down by anchor brewing

22 oz bottle.  Pours black with a thin tan head.  It left a thin head throughout.  Smell was of roasted malt with hints of coffee and chocolate.  Taste was of chocolate, cola, some coffee and candied fruit.  Mouthfeel was medium and creamy.  Nice porter
12 oz. bottle. Poured a very deep black with a craemy head. Rich malty aroma. Tasted of nutty chocolate.Smooth finish.

A standard porter, dark color with thin head, flavors of cocoa, accented by some burnt flavors. More bitter than sweet, easy to drink. Lower alcohol than what Ive been accustomed to in porters lately.

General66 shared a 12oz bottle of this one with me.  Thanks!  Very dark brown, almost black pour.  Roasted malt and caramel malt aroma.  Even more roasted character came through as it warmed.  Dark chocolate, slight roasted malt notes, and come coffee flavors.   My description sounds very generic when describing a porter or stout, but the flavors in this mesh beautifully.  Really an outstanding porter and one that I wish I had tried much sooner as it is readily available to me.  Some slight hop bitterness in there as well.  Good stuff!

12 ounce bottle shared with Illini08. Poured a brown color with a one finger width tan head that disappeared quickly. Smelled very roasty with hints of coffee and caramel. Tasted exactly how a good porter should... very roasty with hints of dark chocolate. It had a bitter aftertaste. In my opinion, this is what a solid porter should be. Nothing out of the ordinary but a very tasty beer!

22 oz. bottle.  Pours very dark brown with big dark tan head.  Aroma is banana bread, roasted malt, coffee, and some chocolate notes.  Flavor is roasted banana, molasses, coffee.  Very, very tasty and unique.
Pours dark with a mocha head. First taste is molasses. Very creamy tasting. One of the finest examples of a porter I have ever tasted. Would buy again
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: Bottle. Pours very dark brown with a beige head. Smokey and roasted malt nose with caramel and coffee notes. Medium/full body. Flavor is dominated by the roasted malt. Also notes of sweet caramel and coffee. Nice balanced finish. Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2008 what a clean tasteing american poter awesome great job of brewing. one of my favs, 98 is a very good score so i checed it out also along with another porter that got a 98, no comparesion to great lakes edmund fitzgerald. blows it away will keep this in my fridge anytime

12 oz bottle.  Dark brown with a lumpy beige head.  Nose of grapes and licorice; some resin.  Taste is similar.  Surprised at how vinous this is, almost like a sherry.  Dark chocolate emerges in the finish with mild hop bittering.  Medium light with moderate carb.  Nice drinker.

Pours opaque deep brown with a fluffy oatmeal colored head. Looks and smells like a stout, with a malty, chocolaty nose. Head persists. Flavor is rich and smooth, with a touch of coffee, a touch of cola, a touch of chocolate. A bit creamy on the palate. A very nice brew.

VERY dark brown pour, verging on black, but revealing ruby at the edges when held up to the light. The mocha head laces prodigiously until it settles down to a wispy film for the last half pint. The aroma of rich roasted caramel malts is paired with a herbal hoppiness and figs. The initial taste again reveals the caramel, but this is soon cut into by the leafy hops, which lend a pleasant bitterness to this drink. In fact, this is probably the only porter Ive had where the hops have been given this prominence. Adding to this the melange of well-meshed traditional porter flavours of roasted malts, chocolate and mild coffee, and you have a winner. The mouthfeel is smooth, with perfect carbonation for the flavour. Dangerously drinkable.

Bottiglia da 355ml comprata ad Alessandria: non potevo farmi sfuggire una Anchor dopo aver provato la loro ale festiva ed essermene innamorato. Ho deciso di puntare sulla Porter perché è uno stile che non mi dispiace, e non sono rimasto deluso: intanto fin dallaspetto che ha nel bicchiere è qualcosa di spettacolare... marrone scuro scuroo con schiuma marroncina, ha ragione oreogobbler somiglia al caffè come colore. Si annusa e anche lì caffè, e qualche reminiscenza di tabacco da pipa; la schiuma è cremosa e compatta, la birra ha corpo non pesante però abbastanza presente con frizzantezza superiore alle aspettative, ma non spiacevole. Cioccolato e caramello sbruciacchiato che si chiude in un finale asciutto con una buona dose di amaro che pulisce la bocca e prepara ad un altro sorso. Ottima

Aroma smells of chocolate and a little smoke. Pours dark brown like italian coffee, with a nice thick head. Smooth palate from start to finish with a nice full body. Tastes like a bittersweet chocolate with a hint of smoke at the finish. Well rounded and easily drinkable.

Very dark brown with a thing but creamy tan head that lingers nicely. Aroma is chocolate/caramel/coffee, but is very subdued. The flavor is mostly burnt, chewy malts with a bit of the chocolate from the aroma coming through. The caramel and coffee are in there too, but seem to be hidden behind the burnt malt flavor. Palate is good, but not as a thick as I would have liked. Good beer, but I seem to enjoy it less every time I drink one.

From bottle : A very dark pour with half finger of light brown head that has nice retention.  Great lacing too.  Aroma is very inviting, roasted malts and chocolate.  Taste is much the same, but has what seems to be a little bitterness toward the end, but the aftertaste is a nice roasted chocolate.  Thick body, with a smooth palate.  Very nice easy to get porter.
goodness this smells great! like dark chocolate raspberry fudge. aroma leads to the flavor, roasted gritty chocolate notes long soft finish

pours a beautiful dark brownish black with a frothy cream colored head.  aroma is like a caramel mocha minus the sweetness, with a milky cream and roasty malt.  taste is roasty coffee, some chocolate, some cream.  emphasis on the roasty quality, great taste!  great balance.  bubbly mouthfeel, not as full bodied as i had expected.  an excellent porter, i think if you want to know what a porter should taste like this is the most readily available good example of the style.  will definately buy again any time of year.
quite flaverfull.  you can taste the roasted malt. low hops taste. with an Average length of aftertaste
Pours a dark brown/red/black. leaves a medium head which lasts for a decent period of time. Aroma is light and pleasing, taste is thick and satisfying.
Pours dark brown with nearly perfect looking, but small head.  Clover like aroma.  Flavor is a but sweet but full malt with a balance of hops.  Palate full but a bit watery.  Good dark beer.

bottle: pours a dark crimson brown eith a large creamy tan head with some lacing. aroma is a sweet candy caramell with a light creamy chocolate, some roastedness and a nice grainy scent. just afew wafts of hops come thru. flavour is excellent, perfect blend of roast and chocolate, small amounts of a good caramel malts int eh background. a wonderful almost burntness also thru the back.a real good bitter chocolate and hop bitter to finish. great beer.
One of the best American Porters. Relatively high alcohol content gives this beer an almost wine-like flavor. Dark brown with decent head. Slightly thin or would be rated even higher.
Tap.  Dark black with a nice tan head.  Very roasty, burnt malt.  I enjoyed in bottle for years and enjoyed on tap even more.  Not as thick as some other porters you may come across.
taste and smell of dark chocolate and sweet fruits.  smooth and creamy with a bitter dry finish.  nice beer...

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2013 Black in colour with a thin creamy head. Aroma of dark fruit and roasted malts. Flavour is dominated by burnt, treacley malt flavours and a little smoke. Smooth silky texture and a dry but easy aftertaste make this a great beer.

12 oz bottle at The Chop House, and they chopped my wallet at $4.50 for one!!  Poured small tan head.  Tastes of roast mostly.  The alcohol was not present compared to most porters I have had.  It was alright,  I cant believe I payed that much.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2008 12oz bottle.   Black with a small tan head.   Acidic, chocolate aroma.   The flavor is quite acidic and roasty with chocolate and some alcohol.   Bitter, but in an odd way that I cant pinpoint.   medium thickness with small carbonation.   Something just isnt clicking for me with this one; its a nice beer, and a good porter, but maybe Im going through an anti porter stage in my life. (3.2)   Rerate:   Less acidity and bitterness than my last rating.   Quite smooth and sweet, with plenty of chocolate flavors.   I would actually like some more bitterness or roasty flavor, as the sweetness kinda runs with it.   A nice porter, but by number two it gets to be a bit much in the sweet department.
12 oz bottle: Nice and dark.  Notes of coffee and chocolate.  Excellent representation of a porter.  Very drinkable, if somewhat heavy.

Wow. Poured deep and solid black. I tried to see through it to no avail. Roasted aroma and a roasted flavor through out. Coats mouth nicely. Hides alcohol content well. Top notch choice. EDIT: Noticing a buttery after taste in this just as the Anchor Steam Beer.
pours black with faint ruby highlights,nice frothy tan head.roasty malty nose.roasty malty chocolate,flavors,light bitter finish on the back of the tounge.ligh carb almost creamy mouthfeel,nice beer

Poured a nice large tan head.  Beer was a wonderful dark that showed red with light shining through it.  The aroma was this very fruity, possibly plum, and roasted malts.  The flavor first hits with the fruit that you smelled, follows with a chocolate malt and finishes with the slight bitter of the hops.

Poured from a bottle. Has a nice dark black color with a nice foamy brown tan head. Aroma is not overwhelming. Has a nice taste of roasted malt, caramel, smoky and coffee tasting with a hint of chocolate. I likey.

12oz bottle from Degarth. Dark brown pour with only very slight hints at some red throughout. Creamy, bubbly dark tan head that is mostly lasting, and leaves a thick layer of foam. Spotty drip lacing. Dark vinous fruits, raisins, figs, tobacco, chocolate and molasses. Also get a sense of boozy soaked fruit bread or something similar. Also  a bit of a sour twang, presumably from the hops. My only complaint is I wish the aroma was a little more up front, but thats a small nitpick. Tons of roasted and charred malts on the fore, then segueing into sweet malts and chocolate, and a healthy dose of molasses. Sugary sweetness at the very end of the swallow, along with some ripe dark fruits. Very smooth, lightly creamy mouthfeel. Medium astringency, but very easily drinkable. Finish is in turns roasty, lightly bitter, sweet and slightly tart. Phenomenal, and the first thing Degarth ever told me the truth about.

Bottled, consumed on 12/17/07.  Pours a clear, dark brown.  Makes a nice tan head that quickly reduces to a thin skin.  Grape and mocha aromas.  Thin, smooth mouthfeel.  Astringency present but understated.  Sharp yet subtle sourness with hint of grapes again.  Touch of sweet maltiness.  Mild bitterness emerges on finish, segues into a fleeting chocolate note. A fine porter.
This porter wasnt as good as I hoped, but it wasnt bad by no means....Great use of roasted malts and hopes. Good head retention and nice color. Would drink again.
Pours black with tiny off white head. Aroma has chocolate and burned notes. Sweet burned flavor, coffee notes and chocolate. Old time porter that still rocks!

aroma of port/dark fruit, sweet malt, subtle coffee and a tiny plastic note. tastes as it promises with the dark fruit malty sweetness and nice amount of bitterness to finish. a little bit more hops would make this truly awesome.
Deep rich black colour, thick pour tan head, smells of roasted coffee and sweetnes. tastes like it smells with notes of chocolate. fairly big mouthfeel.

Nose is on the weaker side with hints of caramel and cotton candy.  Nice mocha head settles normally.  some sticky sparse lacing on glass. Frothy and tingly at first mouthfeel.  hints of toffe are overshadowed by the chocolate/patent malts. Smooth and rounded finsh does not weaken or diminish.  Body is medium but on the higher end of that scale.  A fine brew.  Never disapoints.
one of the best porters ive had in a good while.  it finishes well and keeps until the glass is empty.
A good solid porter.  Tastes like coffee and chocolate with a similar finish, though the lingering taste is a bit bitter for me.  Good solid beer, but I dont know that I will get it again.
This is a nice smooth porter with a clean finish.  There are some roasted flavors that are quite powerful then clear quickly leaving a lighter that a actual feel.  Really good beer.

Nearly jet black with a fine, light brown head.
The aroma is a bit fruity with coffee and some light burned notes.
The flavour is full and round with fruity esters working their magic in company with the choco and malty notes. Round but a little thin in the body

(bottle) Probably one of the first porters Ive had before I started rating, decided to re-visit it again.  Pours a dark dark brown with an off-white head that lingers throughout consumption.  Aroma is a nice mix of light fruit, dark chocolate, cocoa, and light espresso notes, with a generous amount of roasted barley.  Taste is a decent mix of chocolate, roasted barley, with a really nice finish and thick mouthfeel.  Quite a nice beer.

[Bottle] Pours dark brown with a light tan head. Aroma is barley, and sweet banana, with a bit of chocolate. Taste is similar with barley, more chocolate and the fruity banana sweetness. Good thick mouthfeel with a long finish that is a little dry. Overall not super complex, but a very solid porter.
Pours almost black. Nice hints of coffee and chocolate. Classic Porter malty taste with a nice dry finish.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Pours black with a medium tan head and smells like chocolate. Taste is pretty comples, initial taste is sweet, chocolate, caramel, banana and brown sugar. After that you can taste coffee, roasted malts and some spices. Nice finish, great beer
Very tasty and an interesting history.  Dark beer, its a porter hello.  I guess what it boils down to is, I like hints of coffee!
Pours a great dark brown, almost black color, with a great looking, slowly diminishing head. Aroma, taste is very malty, maybe a little on the burnt side. Hints of coffee. A great porter.

"It is aesthetically pleasing and wholly superior in every respect."

That about sums it up. Classic.

12oz. Bottle: Dark, dark brown w/ a hint of blood red when held in the light. Nice tan head leaving beautiful lacing as it recedes. Malty aroma w/ hints of dark chocolate & a licoricey/molasses mix hanging in the backround. Very roasty malt on the tongue w/ a light carmel tease. Very dry finish. Slightly thin mouthfeel, dare I say watery? Nice brew, me likey.

12oz bottle.  Aroma is fantastic, notes of dark malt, chocolate, smoke, and a little hops.  Large tan rocky head the lasts and leaves great lace.  Dark brown/black body.  Flavor is dark malt, smoke and typical porter ale character.  Palate is light and watery with a soft carbonation.  A very good porter and if I were a fan of the style it would be one of my favorites.
12 oz bottle.  Very rich, chocolate, malt, cream.  Black pour, minimal head.  Smooth and very drinkable, yet complex and heavy at the same time.

Deep black appearance with a lasting thick tan head. Luscious roasts mix, cocoa, licorice, coffee, spicy hoppiness. Smooth, ligthly acidic, perfect carbonation. Dried fruits. Hop and roast malt assertive bitterness, dry long finish.

OMG!  What a beer...  Pours like used motor oil with a caramel colored head.  A pleasing sweet brown sugar/molasses aroma.  Flavor is a nice roasted malt with a touch or smokiness thrown in for good measure.  I dont know if this is a perfect beer but it comes close to it in my book.

Why does Anchor feature its pedestrian steam beer when  everything else they make is excellent?  Pours deep brown with a short tan head.  Coffee, cocoa, roasty malts, hazelnut, and musty wood.  Excellent, creamy mouthfeel.  Rich chocolate, coffee, and malt throughout with nuts, barley, and a tiny bit of smoke.  Delicious.
Poured balck as night, small head.  Nice coffee, slightly sweet flavor, with roasted malt aftertaste.  Light bitterness. Frothy texture and smooth going down the hatch.  Top notch.

Black brown color with a red hue.  Big foamy light brown head that trails lace down the glass.  A distinct chocolate aroma - malty and no hop smell.  A medium palate for a stout; its pleasant to find this black ale not too oily.  Suble flavor not too burnt not bitter.  A smigen of coffee and chocolate but still a traditional beer.  This is a fine all around porter.

Deep midnight black, full and creamy off white head. All kinds of aroma in the nose. Roasted malt, licorice, raisins, hazlenut, chocolate, and a hint of coffee. Medium bodied and creamy on the tongue. Finishes mostly clean with a touch of bitterness from the hops. A very good porter, probably my best to date.
UPDATED: JUL 31, 2009 Wow, I was shocked with this beer becuase you can find it anywhere. It has so much chocolate in it. The mouthfeel is the best Ive ever tasted in any beer.

I dont know why Ive waited so long to try this, its pretty easy to find (Relatively speaking).  This is amazing stuff.  It really reminds me of a trappist ale.  This is the third porter Ive rated (Bully Porter and Rogue mocha porter being the others).  Its get a rare perfect rating.  Beautiful dirty head, almost black body.  Caramel, fruit (Cant quite describe it), coffee in the palate followed with a burnt bitterness that balances it out.  Wonderful aroma.  Fig?  Raisin?  I dont know.  Just a great effort from Anchor.
A good porter.  Nice aroma.  Cofee finish.  Pretty easy to drink for a porter.
12 oz bottle. I really enjoyed this beer. The color was as dark as strong coffee. I detected a hint of apple in the aroma. It has a nice thick head that holds up well.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2007 dark burgundy with a small dense cream colored head. sweet malt and dark fruit aroma with a light earthiness to it. very smooth and creamy mouth feel. lots of chocolate and plums in the taste with a light roasted grain and nuttiness to it.

Bottle: Deep red colur,flat head. Aroma of lakris,coffee,tar,smokey,citric and a nice hopy end. Flavor is almost the same , but has not the dominas of smkenes that I will expeckted. Nice, smouth citric,spicy mouth feling. Thin to medium body end a medium finish. Nice Porter.

Sweet wooden aroma, pours dark black with a big head that lasts a while. The consistency is thin for a porter. The flavor is well balanced and not overbearing. The flavor is dominated by malted barley with no hint of roasting, which is quite nice for a change.

12 oz bottle. 6N1. Fig and warm brandy aroma. Bourbon cask and tangy roast malt. Restrained. Pours a dark, dark mahogany, with a big finger of fluffy cocoa-tinted soap above. Flavor is a lightly watery, yet nuanced milk chocolate, hazelnut paste, and almond butter, with a curt corner of cafe au lait, turbinado, and creamed soup. Some estery, fruity yeast character in good fashion, tinted with some buttery alcohol character. Finishes dry, clean and calmly with a sweet nip of chocolate mint. Fine beer.

Beautiful beer. 3+ finger head; dark tan & very lasting; creamy. Pretty dark. Very nice lacing. Aroma: banana, and cherries; some crystal malts; strong caramel aroma; strong alcohol notes; also some nuttiness going along w/ the caramel. Pretty good body. Very complex finish with the roasted malts making a good showing, also some dry bitterness that comes out of nowhere, with the fruit notes lightly floating above them both. Alcohol still very much present considering the ABV. The malts arent like a stout, but this beer does seem to act like an imperial stout.

Slight decent chocolate aroma, pours an almost black dark red with a thin tan head.  Taste has a slight bit of chocolate, but the predominant flavor is of roastiness.  Slightly bitter finish that fades to a touch of tartness.  Drinkable, but not the first thing Id reach for.
Draft. Pours very dark with a minimalistic head. Chocolate, malts, your standard porter stuff.  OK.

Pours a very nice deep brown color with a black finish to it.  It formed a slightly creamy head, but didnt perform well on head retention or lacing.  It did have a nice creamy body to it, with chocolate, roasted nuts, and toast but also included a nice hop presence to round things off.  Very drinkable porter, and wasnt spectacular, but was just really balanced well

12oz bottle, pours dark brown with a medium creamy looking head. Aroma is all malt. very smooth to drink, I get a nice coffee like taste, little hops at the end. I had a friend try it, who dosent normally go dark and he loved it. I only wish I discovered this earlier.

Another of those staples from back in the dark ages taht I havent had in years.  Shame too, because this was actually a bit better than I remember it.  Pours black, creamy tan head.  Aroma is molasses and malts.  Flavor pretty much matches, but it is thick, rich, and just plain satisfying.  Hops balance out at the very end.  Great brew, not doing it justice here.
UPDATED: NOV 24, 2007 12oz.  All I can say is AWESOME; very smooth and tasty, glad its brewed just a few hours away; my favorite beer...I swear by it !!!!

Bottle pours dark brown/black and opaque with a frothy head.  The aroma is rich with a touch of sweetness and acidity.  The taste is rich and crisp with dark chocolate and coffee.    The finish is slightly bitter and warms in the mouth.  A very nice porter.

Tasted 2007-10-30. 35,5cl. Pours brown/black with dense light brown head. Powerfull, yet subtle, aroma of chocolate, liquorice, a little coffee and vanilla. Flavour of coffee and roasted malt. Flavour is a bit smokey - nice! An above average porter!

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2007 Poured an opaque dark brown with medium thick tan head that lingered well and left okay lacing. Nose was a very pleasant sweet chocolate-caramel and roasted nuts. Mouthfeel was thick and sweet, with just a slight tingle from the hops. Flavor followed the chocolate-toffee nose very well, and this all rounded to a nice, long finish that was sweet, without overdoing it.

 Another good beer from Anchor.
dark and full head.  root beer, coffee, chocolate and raspberry creamsickle aroma.  medium to lightly heavy bodied, goes down smooth.  black coffee aftertaste.

Bottle from Quaffs. Deep amber with a tan head, nice thick oily pour. Nose of sweet roasted malt, hop, caramel, ginger and cocoa. Taste is much the same, almost a bit too hoppy for a porter, sweet malt with some barley and a strange Cracker Jack note. Nothing to write home about but quite quaffable.
UPDATED: MAR 29, 2009 Beautful brown body with a thick tan head. Nice and smooth. Always a reliable porter.
Good porter.  Dark brown/black pour with disappearing head.  Light enough to give it a high drinkability, combined with a well balanced flavor of roast, chocolate, and hops.
Pours very dark brown with think head. Has coffe smell and chocolate taste. Very great taste with smooth ending. One the best beers I have had and thebest Porter I have had.
An excellent porter that has rich flavors of chocolate and malt.  There was a limited, bitter hoppy taste after drinking a couple, but this one left me feeling very satisfied.

12 oz. bottle into pint glass. Pours a dark brown with a light tan head that leaves quickly. Wonderful aromas of cherries, grapes, malts and alcohol. Flavors of sweet grapes, bitter hops, and malt with a caramel finish. Has a full-bodies, rich mouthfeel and goes down exceptionally smooth. An excellent porter.

Bottle.  Looks like a duck, quacks like a duck.  Poured like a stoutblack with  a grey/brown head.  Smells like a stout tooDark chocolate, malty, and bready.  Tastes almost exactly like the Bells Kalamazoo I just finished.  Wonderful.  Sweet espresso with a slight bitterness and plenty of roasted notes.  Finish is roasted malts and a little honey.
Bottle 22oz.  My favorite beer Ive tried so far.  Nice dark color, tan head.  Pretty easy to drink, a little bit of bitterness, nice finish.  Just what I was looking for.

Pours a gorgeous near-black brown, deep mahogany at the edges. Light brown head, thick and lacy. Chocolate, faint molasses, subtle fruit note. Initally sweet chocolatey flavour dominates, while a port-like plummy fruitiness sneaks in at the end. Finish is a satisfying stemmy bitterness. Rich and full mouthfeel (in contrast to the Baltika 7 I just finished). Absolutely delicious-- epitomizes what I love about a good porter.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle from a new local indy beer seller. Pours a reddish almost black colour, frothy beige head. Serious liquorice and coffee aroma, strong malt. Very smooth and with an excellent finish.

My rating may be a little biased.  I can appreciate the beer for its strong, chocolate character, viscous body, and dark pour.  But I will admit that it is just too sweet of a stout for my taste.  As many have said, this is one "black" beer.
Best porter period! I am a huge fan of this. A highly drinkable porter with rediculous taste! enjoy
Black with large beige head.Slight rosted aroma still mild,with note of coffee and raisin.Smooth mouth feels,but just to thin to be a great porter.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2008 This is an outstanding, rich porter.  From a bottle this pours almost black with a hint of deep red.  It has a thick, beautiful dark beige head which is creamy and long-lived, and leaves excellent lacing.  It is rich and full-bodied, with strong, but smooth, well-balanced, and complex flavour & aroma.  Incredibly drinkable yet full of rich flavour and with a smooth, strong finish, it is simply incredible.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2008 Pours a black with beautiful tight tan frothy head. Wonderful aromas of chocolate, rich roasted malt, raisins, with a hint of alcohol, licorice and coffee. Robust flavours of malt, raisin, chocolate, bread, and slight molasses. Smooth, rich, and fillling palate that goes down magically. An absolutely wonderful porter- One of my favorites.
A very happy surprise, exceeded my expectations.  Great flavor, full like a stout.  My favorite porter.
Pours a black/deep brown beer with a beige head. Some roasted malt in the nsoe. Very much a porter with a light body and some hops evident. not bad but certainly not amazing.
Bottled.  Poured a very dark brown color with a nice, stable tan head.  Aroma was roasted nuts.  Very creamy flavor with hints of sweetened chocolate.  Very nice porter.
Bottle. Very nice aroma and nice dark color. Good example of a porter. Strong start and great finish.
Bottle: Very good porter.  Pour dark with a dark frothy head.  Chocolate aroma and taste.  A little mild, but good.
This is part of a beer club tasting. Only had one bottle but it was a decent taste for the price. Would like to try again after it poured great and left a nice after taste.

Had this brew with a small brick of sharp cheddar and loved em both.  Very smooth if a little watered down, but barely.  Pours a dark chocolaty brownish pour with minimal brown head.  Nose is huge on chocolate and dark malts.  Flavor is as well with nice coffee attribute.  Solid.
Um Um good.  This is a damn good dark robust porter.  Very chocolaty and nutty.  The alcohol is present and blends very well.

(bottle): Pours a dark black-brown color. Big light brown head, good lacing. Dark heavy aroma, chocolate and some alcohol. Chocolately roasted taste, with some alcohol. Soft mouthfeel, fizzy. Somewhat acidic with meat pizza. An okay porter.
Bottle. Pours deep brown / black with decent foamy head. Aroma is chocolatey / malty with a rich and smooth finish. Taste is of liquorice and coffee. Not bad.
The color is absolutely perfect. Rich flavor, but not overpowering really. And though it is a porter I didnt find it as filling. The head is a nice beige and has a coffee/toasted scent.
Bottle. Pours dark with a nice brown head. The taste is great; a nutty burnt malt with some hops. A great drink. Smooth and yet a good strong taste.

Dark dark brown with a large foamy tan head. Aroma is espresso and chocolate with a slight smokiness.  Thick mouthfeel with lots of dark malts and toasty flavours.  Finishes slightly hoppy with a drying bitterness.  Nice well made porter.

Had beer April 1999.  Color is a solid black, carbonation looks a bit low as well as head.  Aroma is a rich roasted malt scent.  Taste is sweet, rich and smooth.  It starts with a rich roasted body that goes down smooth.  The finish is a wonderful slightly sweet roasted malt flavor that is followed up with an evenly balanced hop bitterness and light hop flavor.

bottle.  pours very dark with a thick tan head which became a 1/4" throughout.  Aromas of roasted malt.  Overall, a very nice porter - actually one of the best Ive ever had.  Medium body with average carbonation.  Flavors of coffee a tad bit of hops.  Very good session beer.
Dark with good lace.  Aroma of chocolate, espresso, some dark fuits?  Pours med body with flavors of sweet chocolate, slight coffee, and a roasted nuttiness.  Nice sweet finish.

Pours almost black brown with a large bubbled mocha head. Scents of toasty chocolate and mint with a a lite flavor of roasty coffee and a strange heavy peppermint like overtone that grew on second tasting.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2011 From bottle. Very much enjoyed this one. Cheer again JoeMcPhee. Charcoal aroma. Black in colour with a decent off white head. Great rich flavour of liquorice, coffee and hops. "Brown sugar never taste so good" Rolling Stones. Decent porter.

I was excitedly surprised by the beautifull dark pour of this beer with decent head for a beer from a bottle.  This had a strong bitter coffee taste that was just on the fringes of being harsh.  Some of that harshness is due to slightly too much carbonation.  This was a decent beer that I would have again in a pinch.

Pours extremely dark brown with very little ruby light coming through with a one inch tan head that drops after a short while. Nose is malty sweet, but not very strong in statement. Flavor is robust and matured with slight chocolate and coffee tones...though I think I am drinking this too cold. It is definitely better as it warms. Mouthfeel is thick with a good carbonation and bubbly feeling. Highly drinkable. Could go for this one again, and again, and again.
9/13/05. 375ml. Roast coffee aroma with a well balanced bitter coffee taste. Sturdy.

Overall, great commercial porter. Pours nice and dark--mahogany/black with a nice  head.  Aroma is chocolate, roasted malt, and some sweetness. Flavor is balanced nicely with great malt, a clean yeast throughout, followed by a chocolate malt bitterness. Bitter finish is well pronounced and dies rather quickly. Nice creamy mouthfeel as well. Great porter.
Anchor does most beers well.  The porter was no exception.  This beer poured rich and thick with a nice creamy head.  Flavors of chocolate, caramel, toffee, and coffee were noticeable .
355 ml bottle. Black. Extremely big, creamy brown head. Coffee, chocolate, roasted/burnt malt, liqorice and some hoppy bitterness. Lovely «low-alcohol»-porter!

Bottle. Pours black with milk chocolate colored head. Aroma is of roasted malt, rich and with a hint of sweetness. Flavor character is roasty malts, rich with notes of chocolate and a slight smokiness. Decently bitter in the finish.  Good stuff.

Bottle at Man In the Moon Sthlm. After a bad streak of drinking the poorer Anchor brews, this beer totally redeems Anchor in my eyes. Very smooth but rich at same time. Crystal and chocolate. Good stuff this.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2007 My favorite of the Anchor brews.  Nice dark chocolatey-brown appearance with a short, light-brown head.

12 oz. bottle.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2011 Update 10/11/11.  The aroma is extremely enticing, with chocolate, brown sugar, toffee, booze.    
The pour has a frothy, tan, foamy head.  Its color is black, with a twinge of brown.  The flavor is amazing, an array of mocha, chocolate, toffee and coffee flavors.   Medium in body.  The finish was clean, some roasted coffee on the palate, maybe slight fruit flavor, light pine and resin hops.   Very lively carbonation in this beer.  Excellent porter.

Tasty. I loved the Anchor Steam I had, so it compelled me to seek out another Anchor offering...and lo, my Dad had one in his fridge ripe for the picking! Beer poured dark brown with creamy head. Aroma was strong of coffee. Taste was rich coffee taste with sweet milky chocolate. Im not distinguished enough to pick out all the other flavors, but it was a nice, complex beer...maybe something fruity, and also the slight metallic tinge noted in another review (only thing stopping flavor from being a 9 in my book).

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2009 
Date: December 01, 1995
Mode: Draft
Source: Taco Mac, Sandy Springs
Appearance: dark, nice lace
Aroma: roasted aroma
Flavor: rich smokey roasted chewey chocolate flavor, smooth finish

Date: August 21, 1998
Source: brewery
Aroma: very rich aroma
Flavor: lots of chocolate aroma and flavor

Date: August 16, 2005
Mode: bottle
Appearance: black with ruby edges, thin tan head
Aroma: sweet vanilla and chocolate aroma
Flavor: rich chocolate flavor, nice sweetness, a bit of tart bitterness in the finish

Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20
Rating: 3.5/5.0Score: **4

The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Deep dark brown with a red hue.  Faint brown head.  Aroma of dried fruits.  Couldnt get much chocolate or coffee of this but very good for a porter.  Similar port like taste with a roasted malt character and thick mouth feel.

Black body with a medium tan head with medium retention and good lacing.  Strong yet mellow flavours of roasted malts, rich black chocolate and coffee beans.  Nothing new in the flavour spectrum except for a perfect dosage.  The light fruity notes (plums mainly) know to stay in the back.  The fresh herbal green hops are well integrated.  Creamy yet roasted mouthfeel.  Very lively carbonation.  Im not rating it as high as some of the best Imperial Somethingblack although honestly I cannot think of a stout/porter Id like to have more often.  One of the cheapest and most easily available basic stout/porter also happens to be one of my favourite!!  Thats great news.  Sometimes I feel like I am blessed by life until I walk in front of a mirror...

12 oz. bottle, pours a beautiful opaque black color with a small light tan head and a coating ring of lace.  The scent was very chocolately, with hints of roasted barley, nuts and malt.  The first sip provided a rush of malty flavor to the palate.  A coating mouthfeel with some nice notes of chocolate cake, figs and barley present themselves.  An excellent porter.

Almost black and opaque, with the deepest of ruby hues etching the pour.  The head is thick and brown, with decent retention and webbed lace.  The nose begins with a dark vinous nature, and transforms as it warms into semisweet and bakers chocolates, with roasted coffee beans... all the while maintaining the wine effervescence.  The flavors act accordingly.... at first, a somewhat dry bitter (not quite acrid) flavor steps to the forefront, but as the brew warms, it begins to open up substantially.  I pick up bitter chocolates, smoky roasted coffee beans, cacao, a vinous hint (here and there), accompanied by a nice bitter, roasted, lasting finish.  The mouthfeel is somewhat creamy and complex.. the body is deep and round.  This is definitely one to think about before rating.  Honestly, at first, I wasnt very hip on it, but as it warmed and opened up, it definitely cozied up to my palate.  Decent.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2007 Ok.. After trying Anchor Steam and giving it a poor rating, people are going to think I have something against Anchor brewing.  Well, I dont, but this porter just didnt do it for me. Average
Im a porter fan but this one just doesnt do it for me. I expect more complexity and thickness and this didnt have much of either.

Pours black with just a hint of ruby highlights and a dense, creamy, tan head. On the nose are notes of: chocolate, molasses, banana bread, and roasted malt. Quite nice. Medium-bodied and oily while remaining lively on the tongue and concluding with a lightly bitter finish. The flavor is a blend of dark roasted malt, chocolate and molasses with a tight, tongue squeezingly bitter finish. A roasty molasses aftertaste lingers along with a nice hop bitterness. This is a very tasty beer.

12 ounce bottle in pint glass.  Pours black with lasting flat light brown head and lotsa lace.  Aroma of roasted and chocolate and port wine.   Flavors of roasted chocolate, ripe fruit with a mildly bitter finish.  Medium body and carbonation.  A great sessionable porter.

Dark brown colour, with creamy brown head. Aroma of sweet chocolate and sweet roasted malts. Taste is of bitter chocolate and roasted malts. Nice bitterness, and the sweetness makes it a smooth, balanced porter. Really good stuff.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a dark brown w/ ruby highlights. 1/2" tan head w/minimal lace. At the beginning taste is of molasses and brown sugar. Towards the middle I began to pick up
an  odd  chalky taste, not overwhelming
, but it does detract from the brew. Finish is dry.

Dark brown brew, thick creamy head. Sweet malty chocolate aroma, a bit nutty with notes of banana,  sweet and inviting. Rich roasted chocolate taste, kind of reminds me of a chocolate covered banana. Smooth, dry and easy to drink. Dry bitter aftertaste.

This was the first porter my husband and I tried and we got hooked.  It has a wonderful, solid flavor with a nutty aftertatse that I love.  Definately a good one to try if first starting out on porters: rich and smooth.  There are better ones out there, but this one is awesome.  Best on tap.

12 oz. bottle from specs. very smooth porter.. average to small head. light carbonation. chocolate and roasted malt aroma.  great palate. would be a regular for me if i had access to it.  anchor porter blows the anchor steam out of the water, no pun intended. well, , maybe a little

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2010 old rating:
7/4/7/4/17 - 3.9 ( 8/18/2007 )

pours a jet black with a reddish tint when held up to the light, a medium size khaki head, and good lacing.

smell of oats, malt, milk chocolate, some coffee, dark chocolate, and a touch of vanilla.

taste is tangy, dark chocolate, sour malt, a touch of coffee, and smoke, ends dry and nicely bitter.

Little to no aroma with bottles sampled at initial pour but aroma builds down the glass to a  mild chocolate; nice dark color with an off-white head (1/2 inch or so); nice mouthfeel with a tinge of bitterness
Ill be honest, I was completely tore up when I drank this, so the score might be inflated.  But it was really good.

Huge fizzy brown head with a rich, dark brown pour, Id have to say this deserve its high ranking  on this site.
I dont care for the flagship anchor steam but these guys can make a porter as fine as anything that comes out of Samuel Smiths.  
Well done.
UPDATED: JAN 2, 2008 little bit of a caramel smell and a roasted malt scent.  tasted very good and has gotten me interested in trying porters.
Bottle Dark pour with tan head. Aroma and flavor of coffee, chocolate, sweet roasted malt. Smooth, very appetizing. Hats off to Fritz Maytag.

6 pack from Brewers World, Dumont, NJ...bottle pours dark brown-black, creamy tan head...smell of coffee, sweet chocolate...taste is much of the same, creamy mouth feel, not heavy on the carbonation...nice lacing...very enjoyable.

22 oz. Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a medium frothy tan head. The aroma is a strong roasted malt with a sweet chocolate. Very good lacing on this one. Has a very thick body with a roasted chocolate malt and a sweet finish. An outstanding porter from Anchor.

Bottle --  Deep, dark ruby black with a cappuccino froth head and quite good retention and ample lacing. Hmm... the aroma is good, with gently sweet chocolate but theres also some over-ripe fruit in there. The roasted/slightly burnt notes in the flavour were a complete surprise to me, but they give way to more chocolate, fruit and general malty deliciousness. But its all gentle, nothing is overstated and its all beautifully balanced. Possibly the best porter Ive had.

Bottle. Pours ruby-brown with medium tawny head. Vinous port wine aroma, along with caramel malt scents. Flavor is buttery caramel flavors, without sweetness. Smooth, moderately thick mouthfeel a bit like melted ice-cream. Some noticeable resiny hop bitterness and coffee flavors in the finish and aftertaste. Really good.

Bottled.  Poured a clear, garnet-tinted brown with a creamy cap of deep beige head.  The aroma picked up deeply-roasted bakers chocolate, some woodsy notes, and was incredibly sweet.. Im talkin much sweeter than excpected.. toasted black malts and mild smoke emerge toward the back.  Flavor was again driven by powerful sweetness.. roasted bakers chocolate and cocoa again at the core.. tasty chocolates.. moderate herbal and woody bitter accents.. left an almost burnt cocoa impression at the finish.  Medium-bodied, well-carbonated, and sweeeeet on the palate.  Tasty stuff, but more roast and less sweet would have made it better.

Flaske. Flot sort farve og lækkert brunt skum. Konen syntes der var en anelse stald i duften, men det lagde jeg ikke mærke til. Ellers en god sødlig porter smag, med en tand mere bid i eftersmagen end forventet. Superlækker øl.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2012 A very dark brown porter with a big and beige head. Aroma is sweet and malty, roastiness, some red berries, red currants, some coffee and sourness. Taste is nicely sweet, roasted, black coffee, hint of berries, aftertaste is almost ash and dry, also some herbs. Medium bodied with nice carbonation and long aftertaste. Good and easy porter, not too sweet with some hops.

Bottle. Sweet yeasty aroma with chocolate and licorice scents and maybe some smokiness. Black with a tan, fully lasting head.  Flavor is mocha, roasted malt, and hops.  The flavor ends bitter and dry.  Good body too. Over all, this is an outstanding porter. Perhaps a little too bitter for me though.
decisamente scura buona schiuma note di caramello e tostaura non molto amara

Aroma a bit weak, but is malty with a hint of chocolate. Poured a dark brown, almost a black. Small, but creamy tan head, that did not disappear or recede.  Light lacing. Starts slightly bitter, then slightly sweet, then a slightly burnt smokyslightly bitter finish that is long..  It has malt, chocolate, caramel, hint of coffee taste. Light to medium body, thin, slighly oily texture, very soft carbonation. A very pleasing Porter. I think it is a touch too bitter for my tastes personally.  But, its still a very, very good beer.  Ill buy it again. If you like your Porters a bit on the bitter side, although its a pleasant bitter, you may very well find this to be your favorite. 
Another very good beer by Anchor.
Nice rich brown color with a hint of chocolate overtones. Has a bitterness that I do not like.
Dark with a brown head.  Aroma of dark bread and fruit.  The flavor is rich, but has a sweetness to it Im not sure I like.  Medium body.

Il y a ce caramel, ce chocolat noisette, cette subtile cuillerée de miel et cette ponctuation de fumée et de tabac  autant en bouche quen nez  qui, assez bien amalgamés, rendent le tout pour le moins agréable, même si je préfère, habituellement, mes porters un peu plus robustes. De visu, un beau noir, presque entièrement opaque et qui nest trahi quune fois portée au regard du rayon incandescent des lampes halogènes de ce qui me sert actuellement de pseudo-salle à manger et/ou dégustation  tout ça pour affirmer quelle prend alors une coloration noire∕rubis assez charmante. 

(Bref aparté ; plus je laisse le nectar reposer, plus mes narines y reconnaissent lodeur dun Coca-Cola de plus en plus flatte et pour le moins herbacé! Awesome! Ça cest du commentaire choc!)

Belle amertume en fin de bouche. En tout et pour tout, une belle et bonne bière, certainement au-dessus de la moyenne, plus quhonorable dans sa catégorie mais qui ne réussit pas à sinscrire parmi les meilleures du genre (je lui préfère la toute jeune Porter 1920 des jeunes prodigues de Hopfenstark, indéniablement classique mais ô combien irréprochable, bien balancée entre le malt chocolaté sucré et la robuste amertume des plants de houblon mais cest une autre histoire, à explorer lors dune prochaine évaluation!)

Pours a nice black color. Smells of caramel with hints of choclate.  The taste is bitter and the alcohol is rather noticable.  Hints of chocolate are apparent in the taste and the finish is lightly smoky.  Not too bad, but Im not a huge porter guy.

A beautiful black brew with a nose of caramelized, malted, semi-sweet chocolate. The palate delivers upon every bit of that, coupled with a smooth creaminess, coffee notes, and lovely oat undertones with roasted barley mingling throughout. One of the better porters.
bottle. a dark brown with a brown head with big bubbles. As for smells, I got a roasted malt and caramel or chocolate and it tasted like chocolate and smoke with an pleasingly smoky finish.

Certainly the best wide-spread american incarnation of this style, anchor porter exhibits all the hallmarks.  Deep rose-tinged black with off-white head, smokey oak on the nose, immense character in the flavor, tones of coffee, toffee, smoke, caramel, lighter on the palate than a stout, smooth slight bitterness on the finish. Anchor really hit the nail on the head here.

Nice dark reddish brown color with an "espressoesque" head. Lovely aroma of coffee and fruit. The coffee comes also out in the flavor, which is also very full-flavored and almost creamy, very close to a creamy stout. Leaves a more fruity note in the palate and is therefore very enjoyable to drink. All in all a nice porter, nothing special, but then again the best things in life are simple.

Pours almost black with a tan head.  Aroma is malt, coffee, fruit, chocolate, and a little sugar.  Flavor is heavy coffee and chocolate in the front with lighter fruit notes becoming more evident as you drink the beer.  Very nice, well-done porter.

Black/brown with tan head, quickly fading  but finger sized head.  Mocha raisin malts on the nose, as well as brown sugar, figs and coffee.  A raisiny/toffe flavored porter featuring  chocolate roasted malts and  a comfortable amount of hops for balance.  While not overly complex, this beers simplicity is its strength.  A simple but elegant and delicious porter.  A good beer to watch the fog roll in over a cool harbor.
Great beer, probably my favorite porter. crisp and refreshing for a dark beer. dark carmel aroma. Smooth and well balenced with a carmely kick as it finishes. Great on the palete

$1.99 at Total Wine (& More) in Kennesaw, GA.

Appearane: Pours a dark brown body with a small, beige-colored head.

Smell: Creamy chocolate maltiness with bright, tart-smelling raisin fruitiness.

Taste: The taste of chocolate-coated raisins, like a glass filled to the brim with Raisinets. Hints of tobacco and citrus on the sweetish finish.

Mouthfeel: Surprisingly, Id say its almost a medium-full body. Very creamy and smooth. Mild carbonation.

Drinkability: This is actually alot better than I thought itd be.
A great porter from a commercial brewery. Very nice cappucinofeel to it. Sweeter than most, not sour.

A little background on your boy....Im not a Pale Ale only kinda guy...I love Porters and Stouts as well...its just that I steer away from them during the Summer...but there I was again in BEVERAGE WORLD (which is always a struggle because theres so much to choose from)...and I finally decided to try the Anchor Porter here...good for ME, because as it turns out, this Beer is DELICIOUS. Best Porter Ive had thus far...beautiful.

Ahh now this is a great Porter.  Pours very deep dark brown, almost black.  Light carbonation.  Chocolate and molasses and maybe even some wood aroma.  The nice head makes for a creamy taste of chocolate and hops.  Moderate bitter finish completes this outstanding beer.

Bieropholie, 12 oz. bottle, cold in a tulip. MA31/07
App.:  Black, opaque, foamy tan head.
  
Aroma:  Chocolate, cacao, light wood, ash/mineral; softer milk chocolate and toffee as it warms; hints of molasses and licorice, a touch of dark dried fruit.
  
Palate:  medium body, powdery, medium carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Dark chocolate and cacao, slightly vinous; dry with moderate bitterness; similar to nose as it warms.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008 Bottle. This brew is about a year old. Pours black as midnight. A half inch of perfect fluffy tan creamy head sits on the beer like a king on his throne. Some strands of lacing, but not much. Aroma is great: caramel, toffee, chocolate, licorice. Reminds me of many Baltic porters Ive had, not so much American. Flavor is sensational, too. Toffee, caramel, raspberry, and roasted malts. Quite good. Soft, warming, as drinkable as any beer youll find.

Aroma of syrup and dark syrup bread.
Small notes of coffee, and chocalote maybe som vanilla. Very small notes of alcohol.
Appearance: Has a black body with a short lasting big fizzy brown head.
Flavor is of burned, notes of coffee, vortbread and chocolate. Very sweet, but its very balanced between the sweetness and burned taste.
Palate is dry and sweet at the same time.

Poured a relatively thin brown with reddish hues. Nice head, thick brown and creamy. The aroma was sweet, some caramel, rich. The flavor was a little thin, definite caramel, sweetness, not too bad but definitely mass produced. As Ive been saying, a bit thin and body and palate. Overall, enjoyable but not worth the money. Thank goodness it was on sale.

Aroma of sweet coffee. Like a sweet starbucks drink. Pours black with absolutley no head retention whatsoever. Flavor is more coffee. Sweet roasty burnt malts. Some roasted nuts as well. A little bit of metallic notes. This is a pretty thick beer as well. Sweet, roasty, and nice.

Had during a stay in san fransisco and have been wanting to try for a while.  Very deep dark color with nice head retention.  Aroma of roasted barley, nuts and some floral hops.  Flavor very roasty yet still nice and light and hoppy.  One of the best porters Ive had.

Pours black from the bottle with a huge light brown head.  Beautiful roasted aroma.  On sight alone this looks this a nice thick porter.  Surprising that the appearance and the flavor do not match.  The first sip is pleasant and roasty...hints of chocolate and molasses.  This is wonderful.  The initial flavors though do not finish strong for my tastes.

Pours black, with a big, thick, foamy light brown head.  Smells of roast, dark fruits, a little chocolate.  A little bit on the mild side.  Nice and thick on the pa;ate, big roasty taste, some chocolate, and a touch of some dark fruits that I get up front.  The finish is slightly sweet with a nuttiness to it.  Really nice drinking porter.  Good body to this brew.  Quite enjoyable.
A very dark porter with a pleasant aroma and a brown head. The flavor is a spicy malt with some hop in the finish.

Black pour with a thin tan head.  Aroma is a mix of sweet and roast, licorice root, tobacco on the aroma.  The roast component is not the centerpiece of the aroma.  Creamy palate.  Mild coffee and chicle on the taste, with anise and some roast on the finish.  An interesting porter, quite a lot going on in there.

355ml bottle (Black door, Helsinki)
Jet black, light regular beige head. Malty aroma, sweet and a little coffee-y. Sweet chocolatey malt taste, some burnt notes at the back. Later, coffee comes through and vine-fruits, and even winyness come to the fore. Alas it tastes a little alcoholic, which is surprisig at 5.6%. the finish is a smooth, almost lactic, maltiness.
nearly two inches of beautiful brown foam and a rich chocolaty, malty aroma; smooth, creamy mouthfeel and a bit of sweetness with light hops.  very rich.

22 oz bottle via Roths. Pours a dark brown almost black with an average size tan head. Nose is toffee, some subtle fruitiness, and floral. Wow this is one tasty porter. Some sweet caramel, dark fruits (dates perhaps)some subtle chocolate, and some very roasted flavors, some subtle piney hops, and even a little coffee in the aftertaste. I think this is close to (if not the) tastiest porter I have ever had. Body is medium, carbonation is moderate/high.

Pours with an opaque black body and thick, lasting beige head.  Aroma is roasty with hints of fruit.  Taste is of coffee, chocolate, molasses and malt then lingering bitterness with a slight resiny hop aftertaste.  Gets progressively better as it warms in your glass.  Great stuff.

Poured a dark brown with a lasting tan head.  The aroma was of roasted malts with just a hint of coffee and chocolate.   The flavor was also a good portion roasted malt with a little bitter in the finish.  I liked this, but not as well as a couple other porters out there.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2008 Bottle. Huge, creamy and lasting head with crusty lacing on top of an opaque black body. Aroma is marshmallows, twangy butterscotch apple, slight peppery hop and coffee, faint alcohol. Flavor is the same combination, with less twangy apple and butterscotch. Thick and sweetish, with a medium-heavy body. This beer could pass for a foreign stout.
UPDATED: OCT 11, 2013 smell is yeasty, and roast malt.  thinnish body.  taste is similar.  didnt like this anywhere near as much as when i had at the brewery...wouldnt get again.

First taste 6/8/07.  Black as night.  Has a very thin dark brown head, but it sticks around the whole time with excellent lacing.  Aromas are sweet roasted malts, bakers chocolate, and a hint of licorice.  Didnt pick up the licorice in the flavor, but the malt and chocolate are accompanied by coffee with cream and mild hops.  Alcohol comes through a little on the smooth finish.  Wow, this is an excellent porter.  It might be my favorite to date!

Pours black with a quickly dissapating head.  Coffee and roasted malt in the nose. Very well balanced taste. Not heavy, very easy drink for such a dark beer. Nice amount of malt and hops, not an extreme beer. This is a really well crafted beer from on of the best breweries.

Pours a pitch black with a small tan head. Strong vanilla bean aroma, light coffee. Tastes of wonderful dark malt, slightly roasty (more like an americano than coffee) and notes of dark fruit, including fig and date. English hops, and alcohol in the finish. Thinnish body with decent carb. Reminds me, overall, of a baltic porter. Very pleasant, complex beer, lacking a bit of spit & polish, but a real treat all the same! Many thanks to Thaichile!

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2007 12oz bottle poured into a pint glass.  This porter poured a solid black with a thick tan head.  Some light lacing is left behind.  Faint roasted malt aroma with some chocolate and hops.  The flavor is outstanding for a porter.  It consists of a nice chocolate taste, along with sweet roasted malts, and some subtle hop notes.  Very smooth.  Medium-bodied with a decent mouthfeel...maybe a bit thin.  All that said, this is a solid effort from Anchor Brewing.

Bottle... This is a really solid porter.  Poured a deep black hue with a frothy, light brown head.  Aroma of hazelnuts, roasted malt and chocolare.  Silky yet well carbonated palate with flavors of choclate, nuts, malt and barley, dry hops and a nice, fresh finish. This is the poster boy for porters.

One of the best commercially available porters, in my opinion.  For comparison-- same level as Great Lakes Edmund Fitzgerald, a notch above Sierra Nevada porter.  I like it because it has more of a chocolate taste, than a roast taste.  Too much roast makes a porter like a stout, in my opinion.  I really enjooy this beer-- but wish I could try it on draft sometime.

Rated 1/27/07:  Was able to stumble upon this at a local store, havent seen it anywhere else. So glad I picked some up because this is one helluva porter. Black pour, nice brown head and decent lacing. Bitter-sweet scent, nice roasted malt nose. Incredibly thick and smooth, outstanding on the palate to say the least. Lots of roasted malt with plenty of chocolate and mild coffee flavors mixed with just the right amount of hops. This is a beautiful beer.

12oz. pours dark with tan head. nose has lots of bakers chocolate, and hint of smoke. flavor is pretty meaty, milk chocolate, slight roast. mouthfeel is medium. carbination is a tad fizzy. decent but way to meaty for a porter.
Bottle, very dark color, with a dark head and great lacing.Big rich dark aroma, dates, molasses. Great bitter sweet taste. Very nice, and creamy. A very nice quality brew. A nice and tasty porter.

Opaque black appearance, with creamy tan head.  Nice roasted malt aroma, some sweetness. Thin body with little carbonation.  Flavor is sweet all the way through, with some roasted malt, lite bittering hops, cocoa.  Not bad, but surprised how high a percentile its in.

Color is a beautiful opaque deep brown, tan head is fine-bubbled. Aroma is decidedly porter-ish with strong coffee hint. Rich porter flavor has strong chocolate overtone and smoky and hoppy components. Finish is bitter and zingy. Delicious!

Brown bottle, 12 ounces, savoured on May 28 2007; eye: black, opaque, creamy coffee head, lacing; nose: roasted malt, coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, light hops; mouth: faint tastes, roasted malt almost burnt, light hops that becomes more present in the finale, dark chocolate, dark small berries, finale is a bit short and in roasted malt almost burnt, mildly bitter, medium body, creamy texture, not much carbonation; overall: ok

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 12 onces, savourée le 28 mai 2007	; il : noire, opaque, mousse crémeuse café, dentelle; nez : malt torréfié, café, caramel, chocolat noir, léger houblon; bouche : saveurs peu prononcées, malt torréfié presque brûlé, léger houblon qui devient un peu plus présent dans la finale, chocolat noir, petits fruits noirs, finale un peu courte en malt torréfié presque brûlé, moyennement amère, corps moyen, texture crémeuse, peu carbonatée; en résumé : ok

Bottle: Pours black in color with a small brown head. I smell a bit of chocolate and some dark raisin smells. The smell is very nice. Taste has some roasted malt flavors, some coffee, chocolate and just a bit more of the dark raisin flavor. The tast is smooth and creamy.

Pours a dark brown/black with a medium tan head. 
Aroma is mainly roasted malt, little chocolate and a touch of sourness. Medium bodied on the palate and almost creamy in texture. 
The flavor is semisweet chocolate with hints of caramel and coffee and a touch of raisin. Very rich.

Picked up a single bottle from Cellars Wine & Spirits in St Paul, MN. Pours an opaque dark brown, nearly black, brew with a thick large bubbly creamy tan head. Good lacing. Aromas of cocoa, coffee, black licorice, toasted malt, and plum. Taste is full body, lightly carbonated, creamy and smooth, with taste character of sweet licorice. Finish is smooth and a nice flowery hop aftertaste. Nicely done!
Pours like a cola, medium tan head.   Flavor hints at smoked malt but is really dominated by chocolate ( something more expected in a stout than a porter).  Pretty darn drinkable...

Classic looking porter with a nice large soapy head.  Aroma is nice and malty with plenty of roastiness.  This beer feels delightfully creamy and thick in the mouth.  It is as much "oatmeal stout light" as it is a porter.  Those lines are blurred here indicating a substantial porter.  Many of this style offer muted flavors but  Anchors is quite robust.  Flavors are coffee, dark fruit, dark chocolate and sweet malt.  A great beer!  I want another one.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2008 sweet malty nose. very creamy...a bit too creamy for a porter. flavor is sweet tobacco, nutty, heavy dark malt and more cola than coffee. theres a slight bitterness on the finish.  characteristics of a good stout but a strange porter.  wheres the bitter? wheres the coffee?...must do some more research to find out...7/4/7/3/17=3.8
