Nice looking beer, black with nice frothy light brown head, and nice lacing.  Aroma was roasty with decent hops.  Flavor was pretty complex, but didnt like it all that much, have had better.  Lots of coffee, with some tart out of place citrus notes, although might retaste since other people didnt seem to get that, and a pretty good roasty finish.  A little thin on the palate, with a bit too much carbonation.  Good beer, but maybe my expectations were just a bit too high.

(bottle, with thanks to bierkoning) Almost black coloured hue with a mid-sized tanned foam, leaving some lace. Moderately sweet aroma of dark and slightly roasted malt with toffee and chocolate. Sweet and slightly bitter flavour, medium body, smooth carbonation. Strong toast-malty taste with toffee and chocolate; medium-dry, bitter-roasty finish with notes of coffee and hints of hops.
Very good stoudt. Full and rich with a hint of the burnt taste of a porter. Smooth yet complex.

Black with fine white head. The texure is rather filling and creamy. Liqourice and a bit caramel. The carbonation is medium and the beer when enters the mouth is very smooth. Easy drinkable porter(Almost no smoke). Pleasant & good!
12. oz. Bottle Pours out a nice rich black. topped of with a good tan head.  There is a hint of chocolate flavor that is very tasty.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2006 Pours almost pitch black with a nice tan/almost brown head.  Great lacing.
Roasted coffee was the most prevelant.  My first porter, so I will have to try others and revisit this one.
Re-rate:  Missed a lot of subtle flavor as I probably drank it too cold the first time.

Bottle: Has the typical malty sweet malt aroma of porters. Black body with decent tan head. Flaor has a moderate sweet licorice at first. Near the middle and till finish a great rich chocolate flavor that also lingers on the palate. Smooth enjoyable porter.

bottle - Pours black with a moderate, fluffy  tan head that leaves some nice lacing.  The aroma features roast coffee maltiness.  The flavor has the roast malt of the style with plenty of espresso and chocolate notes and a good hops balance.  The body is medium to full and the finish on the dry side.  Excellent porter.
Had this beer recently when my pub was all out of fullers stout. Thick pungent taste and aroma but somewhat bland aftertaste. Good beer that has carmel and coffee undertones but only good...
Pours dark chocolate brown, with tan head. Banana and chocolate aroma. Refreshing and sharp at first with a caramel after taste. Good stuff.
Bottle, Wellington, NZ (imprted via UK!).  Dark black, fairly carbonated for this style, lots of flavor that lingers.  Very good porter.

Very nice porter.  pours dark brown.  With tan head.  Aroma is dominated by carmel malt.  I could drink the stuff all day.  Rich flavor of coffee, chocolate, carmal, and good hop balance.  Good mouthfeel.  a must try
Great rich dark color. Has a drinkable biting quality, and a nice scent. Top quality porter.

This is by far my favorite "food" beer. Pours a dark black with a very thick head. Perfect balance of flavoring and doesnt leave a nasty taste in your mouth if you drink it while eating(like many beers do).

Wow!  More of a chocolate stout than a simple porter.  Great opaque brown-to-black body with a quickly vanishing tan head that leaves lacing on the side of the glass.  Taste of chocolate, espresso, dark roasted malts, sour brown ale and hops hops hops.  Nose of chocolate and hops.  Good mouthfeel ... large and full.

Pours a very dark brown, with a smallish head.  Aroma is slightly roasted, some sweet chocolate, but very faint.  Nothing outstanding to note on the taste, hints of bitter toffee and chocolate, with a roasted twist.  Watery mouthfeel, not as good as I remember it, possibly a bad bottle... ?

Appearance: Black/brown body, lets a little light through. Head is Creamy and full, even and slow fading. Very appealing.

Aroma:Sweet chocolate, espresso, anise, very roasty, slightly bitter.

Flavor: Mocha latte and licorice, a full and well balanced taste with a very satisfying bitter hop finish. The aftertaste lingers long with hops and chocolate. Excellent and sessionable.

Overall A fine crafted porter, balanced, with all the attributes a great porter should.

Bottle - Pours deep dark brown with thick, foamy head.  Smells like sweet chocolate fudge.  Creamy mouthfeel with roasted malty goodness.  Ttastes of coffee and bitter chocolate with a nice aftertaste.  Overall a very good porter.
Opaque ebony with a small tan head. Aroma of coffee and carmel malts. flavor shows coffee. plum, and chocolate notes with a mild bitterness in the finish.
Had this one bottled.  Wow.  Completely opaque, thick black pour with a thick, dark tan head, nose of orange, clove, caramel and coffee, with notes of chocolate, cherries and baked bread.  Wow.

Completely black with a tan head. Strong malty and meaty aroma. Coffee flavour from heavy roasting. Thick texture. More of a stout like flavour than a porter IMHO, with a little less dryness. Quite good but not nearly as good as their Bock.

12 oz bottle.  Dark brown-black beer with a thick tan lasting head.  Aroma of dark chocolate, plums and chocolate covered cherries.  A sweet rye-like toastiness.  Creamy body with plums, sweets toasted grains, plums and dried fruits.  Herbal/spicy hops are also apparent.  Long toasty/fruity finish with a hint of saltiness on the back.  Great balance, great texture, great beer.
Very dark brown color with a good light tan head.  LIght roasted malt flavor and aroma.  Mild bitterness.  Medium body.  A decent beer.  Easy to drink.

Nice!  Pours dark, dark brown, with a little ruby undertones when held to the brightest light.  Thin tan head, some lacing.  Lightly roasted nose with a slight "beer" note.  Nice tangy start, molasses and chocolate middle and smooth finish.  Nice medium mouthfeel - perfect for a porter, not as heavy as a stout, but not too light either.  Actually very stout-like in its flavor.  Which is a very good thing in my book.

Bottle at Stuff Yer Face. Pours dark with thin brown head. Faint aroma of dark roasted malt and dark fruit. One of the richest of all the porters I have had thus far. Flavor very heavy with molasses and raisens, and finishes semi dry with some mild bitterness. Damn good.
Very dark pour with a small tan head that dissolved rather soon.  Taste is rich with roasted maltiness, molasses, coffee, and chocolates.  Solid taste throughout the glass, excellent porter.

Dark body with a small tan head.  Lots of stuff in the aroma. Had the typical porter notes, but smelled like a beer too... the hoppiness came through. Very rich flavor, the head was very creamy.  I was suprised to see that the carbonation was totally natural.  Overall, I was suprised, I liked this beer a lot. I hold back on the rating though, I think that there are definitely a couple porters that are better out there.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2006 unimpressed.  something really weird about the finish almost had me start to wonder if the bottle was skunked.  lots of chocolate, sure, but some weird off notes, and also an unexpected hoppiness.  ill try it again sometime.  rerate: pitch black, better head color than SNs.  wow.  way more dark fruit.  pretty awesome flavor.  like a dubbel/porter cross.  no alcohol.  hugely balanced.

From the bottle.
Pours an astonishling opaque dark brown with the slightest hint of red highlights and big foamy dark tan head.

The aroma is alluring -- pumpernickel molasses, a hint of agar, lots of roasted grain -- but it doesnt even begin to prepare the mind for the slam-dunk overflowing flavorful goodness of what is to follow. This beer has so much going on: dark chocolate, the sweet pumpernickel that rode in on the aroma, hints of grape and apple that dive back down below the roasted malts before you can really get a handle on them, hints of tannin, a strong and absolutely delightful latte-with-sugar finish. The palate balances out just right, leaving one with a beer that is full on the tongue and yet deeply drinkable -- its hard to slow down as much as the complex flavors merit. 

Goodness I like this beer; this one has been a very pleasant surprise.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2007  From Bottle.  Dark brown, almost blackish pour with a medium, roasted brown head.  Lightly aromatic brew, consisting of swiss chocolate, vanilla, and a welcoming roasted oat bread maltiness.  Thin, relatively carbonated initial mouthfeel at first, but it develops a more syrupy palate as it moves across the tongue.  Pleasant, dry roasted finish with a hint of chocolate licorice on the final smack.  Update:  Ummm...yeah, this beer is awesome.  I appreciate it more each time I have it.

Bottle.  Poured a dark brown, nearly opaque except for a reddish hues against light.  A thick tan head rests atop this aromatic brew that pleases the nostrils with a sweet dark chocolate and mocha aroma that also contains hints of a smokey backbone.  A thick heavy scent that leads you to a faint sweetness as the full bodied liquid touches your tonge.  This malty sweetness parts way for a touch of bitterness that rounds out into a nice dry roasted finish.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2006 Bomber - Pours a very dark brown/black with a creamy light tan head that faded to a thin film, but stuck around.  Some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is sweet and malty with a dark brown sugar and/or molassas character.  Bready/yeasty.  Flavor is heavy of dark fruits... particularly pruney with some spices mixed in.  Faint coffee and chocolate too.  Heavy malt is very well balanced with some hoppy bitterness that sticks around for the finish.  Some hint of sourness in the finish as well.  Body is quite thick.  Nice job...

Dark brown with fast disappearing brown head; Deep, sweet nose with overwhelming molasses, under it very clear vanilla, cinnamon, cookie like nose. With time in the glass some dried fruit appears, but the molasses is still overwhelming; Pleasant, very soft body, nothing remarkable, but pleasant; Medium length and fill in a finish that starts out a little hoppy bitter and ends of softer with malt and vanilla, again. All in all the elements of this beer doesnt fit all that well together.

Tasted 20/03/2006.  330ml bottle from Rumbles, Wellington.  First rating in a while,  after the birth of the new brewery assistant.
Pours a very dark, garne-hued, mahogany, with a thickish tan (almost khaki) head that collapses, linger and laces.  Mild carbonation can be seen against the light.   Chocolate, rich fruitcake and a herbal liquorice note on the nose, simple but nice.  Flavour is predominantly bitter chocolate with underlying notes of caramel.  Slight hints of a green-apple sourness, which Im not quite sure about, in the long wood and liqourice finish.  Great creamy mouthfeel - medium weight and low carbonation.  Good drinking.

Mar. 18, 2006; 12 oz. bottle

First impression: Wow!  This is quite something.  Black, full, vaguely-fruity aroma. An extraordinarily well-balanced and flavorful cascade of chocolate, coffee, caramel & malts (not to mention hops) overwhelm the senses.

Hands down, the best porter Ive had the pleasure to sample, and right up there with any brew Ive rated here over the past 18 months.  Just wish I had more than one bottle on hand!
Pours a clear DARK brown. Smells of prunes. Aromas of dark malts and slightly portish. also hints of liquirish. Medium to full bodied. Bitter finnish.

From Bottle, Bites and Brews, Pgh, PA

Poured dark brown with a small bubbly brown head. Aroma sweet. Flavor of molasses which was overpowering and hops. Bitter as it warms. Dry finish. Light bodied. Chewy mouthfeel. Not what I expected from a porter, very disappointing.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2008 Bottled. Dark brown beer with a brown head. Aroma has roastiness, hops and a mellow coffee/moccha note. Chocolate, roasted malt, hops and coffee in the flavor. Full, sweet body and a finish that starts sweet, but the sweetness is soon overpowered by a dry bitterness. Rating: 6-3-6-4-14-3.3 (060312)Bottle. Pours an oily, dark brown body, low on co2, and it looks clear, with a small, tan head. Roasted malt, licorice, hops and some coffee and mocha in the aroma. Very balanced and pleasing, but maybe a bit weak. Theres even some earthy notes, almost like Brazil nut fruit. The flavor has some hoppy fruityness in the beginning, soon followed by coffee, roasted malt, a little note of sourness, some medicine touch, and a bitterness. Both hoppy and coffee-like bitterness. Full, oily, quite sticky mouthfeel. Rather dry. The finish is coffee-ish, bitter and hop-fruity. Its a shame I havent had this since the first time in the beginning of -06, as its a beer that deserves to be drank several times. (080129)

Bottle.
Pours an opaque black, covered by a tiny brown head.
Aroma of roasted malt and dark chocolate. Slightly caramelly.
Semisweet flavor of molasses,  caramel, mildly roasted malt, and a hint of dark chocolate. Bitterish aftertaste.
Rather heavy carbonation, but delicious.
Bottle. Very nice porter. Pours almost black. Malty with a faint hoppyness. Dark chocolate ans a bit of coffee.

21 Feb 06 - Roasted malt, some sweet and hop aroma.  Black colour, with good brown head and suds lacing.  Big weet malt flavour.  Distinct hoppy finish with a strange artificial tinge but good bitter balance.
Looks and tastes delicious.  Especially good fresh from the brewery.  A favorite, always.

Pours coffee dark into a shaker with long-lasting, micro-bubble mocha colored head.  Coffee, caramel, date and plum notes.  Very light and thin but with a slightly fizzy carbonation.  Rich roasted chocolate finish that lingers.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2007 Fadøl fået på Den tatoverede enke.
+ flaske hjemme

Sort øl med let brunt skum. Har smag og duft af engelsk lakrids.
Tyk i smagen

Passende niveau af brændt smag af en porter at være.

Megen kulsyre.

OK porter

Bottle-Good solid black color with a beige, tan head, medium size and not too long lasting.  The aroma had plenty of chocolate along roast malts.  The flavor was of chocolate and roast coffee.  One drawback was extra carbonation compare to other porters.  Im not as big of fan of Anchor Steam, but this is one excellent brew.

This was possibly the best porter that Ive had. Pours a nice dark color. Has a very full taste and a nice aftertaste. The flavor is sweet with many different things going on. I would recommend this beer to everyone.

Full bodied, malty and sweet describe this one.  Lovely in the glass with a head that stuck around just long enough to be appreciated.  Sweet and slightly floral in fragrance.  More sweetness and coffee grounds-ish on the palate.  Very enjoyable and with the lower ABV, very drinkable.

Bottle (from Bitter Virtue, BBE Jul 07). Roasty liquorice aromas and sweet malt with some hops in their too round it off. SLightly sweet with a light acidic prickle from the carbonation and a gentle bitter finish. Mouthfeel varies between thin and creamy. Quite tasty but seems undecided about what it wants to do preventing me from thinking any more of it.
Great thick palate really makes this a pleasure to drink.  Chocolate, smoke, coffee complimented by a nice bit of sweetness. Nutty aroma with a touch of caramel.
A very nice mixture of smoke, chocolate, and coffee.  This is the best Porter I have tasted.
Smokey malt sweet aroma. Dark brown colour with fair head and lacing. Malt hoop smokey flavour. Smooth palate.
A lot of dark chocolate and coffee with a creamy mouthfeel. A lingering finish thats very nutty. Earthy and rich.
This beer was very dark when poured and had a dark, thick head. There was a pleasant aroma and sharp flavor reminiscent of dark chocolate.
12 oz bottle.  Dark dark pour.  Decent head that faded.  Chocolate aromas that melded into the flavor.  Porter dustiness on the finish.  Pretty good for a porter.

A great porter for this strength. Dense and complex. It looks the business: an impenetrable teak with a fat tan cap that laced and lasted. And it smells great - much stronger than the 5.6% abv would suggest. Its dominated by molasses, with vinous port-like notes, soy sauce, vanilla and nutmeg. Full, creamy mouthfeel. First impression is of sweet, milky coffee, perhaps with a tot of Kahlua in there, licorice root, giving way to a long burnt, dry finish. Figs and a bit of oak in there. Veeery long, phlegmy finish. Too dry and bitter to be sessionable but it makes a fine nightcap. (355ml bottle, IBS Perth, bb June 2007)

355ml bottle (BB May07). Anchor Porter was introduced to Norwegians by Vinmonopolet in early September 05 and has since then been one of my favorite porters. Dark brown on colour. Expresso head that fades away slowly. Great lacing on the glass. Full bodied with delightful malty flavours. A powerful beer with a long, dry finish.

Dark brown pour with a tan head. A malty aroma, some chocolate and the odor of... orange circus peanuts?The flavor come on with chocolate, pear puree, and burnt coffee. Malty on the tounge with a slighty bitter finnish. I dont know if this is a bad batch or what...whatever it is...this.
Bottled.Dark brown in colour, beige white head. The aroma is that of burnt malt and smoke. The flavour is a smoky experience with burnt malt.

Dark brown, almost black with a good, lacing tan head. Delicious chocolate and roasted coffee aroma. Roasted flavours prevail, but there is good chocolatey sweetness underneath. Soft and surprising light, almost fluffy texture. Overall, a wonderfully complex porter that avoids being too heavy.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2007 pours dark with a small tan head, aroma of roast, alcohol, sweet malts, chocolate, and slight fruit, flavor is bitter, slightly carbonated, malt and alcohol, decent body good brew.

Lovely, unrelenting little lip-smacker of a beer this one is. Not convinced it fits in as a true porter and Im quite sure its fermented with a bottom dweller, but that doesnt hinder this at all. Its still so damn good. Tasted from the bottle into a stumpy chalice, cool but not cold. Off the pour a thick, 1", creamy tan head settled in for the length atop a jet black body. Head stuck like glue to the glass leaving behind conjoined rings of foam. Rich bitter/sweet chocolate on the nose; soothing and enticing, with light notes of licorice, burnt wood and vanilla. Quite dry in the mouth at first and loaded with complex dark malt flavours. Powdery dark chocolate offers a hint of sweetness before burnt grains, roasted coffee beans, bitter malt and hops and even a smidgen of ash dries it all out across the palate. Soft on the tongue, not overly big in body but rich enough in flavour as to keep it interesting. A little into it and signs of vinous dark fruits come through to join the rich malts. Finish was the highlight as a good hour after drinking this I could still sense it in the mouth. Malts linger with rich chocolate and ash, that add up to make this a truly lovely beer. Couldnt say that you could drink this one all night, but by itself its worthy of atleast a few. Cheers!!! (355mL, BB 06/07, Intl Beer Shop, W. Leederville)

As Im starting to explore "porters" I tried this at a local pub.  Dark brown, almost black.  Big roasted coffee aroma.  First sips were not impressive as the beer was too cold.  After it warmed up, the taste improved, but still didnt really impress me.  Maybe I had too many porters earlier in the day (Alpha Klaus and Alaskan Smoked).  I think Ill try to re-rate this beer when my taste buds arent tainted by hops and smoke.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2008 Pours midnight black with a medium sized tan head that lingers. Aroma is of chocolate and coffee along with roasted malt and some caramel. A truely delicious aroma for sure.  Flavor is chocolate and roasted malt along with coffee and a hint of smokiness. It finishes off with some bitterness but a near perfect amount of it that leaves you wanting more. A truely delicious porter.

This beer has a black body - hue apperance and a coarse light brown scum collar. I have drunk the beer from the bottle and it had no carbonic acid. The initial flavor taste is very bitter with a light smooked afther sweet with a caramel afther tast.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2007 Pours dark brown with a thick tan head.  The aromal is of malts, chocolate, coffee, and a hint of fruit.  Flavor is off chocolate and molasses up front with a decent roasted coffee flavor on the finish
Pours out to a dark full bodied porter. Strong on coffee aroma. Big mocha and chocolate flavors. Smokey and light bitter finish defintely a porter worth trying.
Very nice porter, creamy with a rich dark flavor.  Very full body.  I love this stuff.

Pours out brownish black with a good amount of light brown head.  Aroma is rich in mocha.  Flavor is full of coffee and chocolate.  There is a huge smoky after taste.  Overall a really good porter. One of the best.
another great every day porter that goes nicely with a meal.  very rich and full body.

Anchor Porter pours to an ink black color with a dense and creamy tan head, and a soft carbonation. The nose on this beer is a joy, just bursting with robust dark malty and chocolate aromas. Dark chocolate, coffee, roast, some piney hop aromatics, and touches of smoke flood the nose. The palate is soft and fat with lots of big dark chocolate, coffee, sweet malt, and tones of estery black currant flavors. Anchor Porter finishes with more of those big chocolate and coffee flavors up front, then ends with a dry, roasty, slightly smoky bitter finishs that lingers.

Bottle 33cl. Jet black body. Light brown, creamy head. Nice burnt, mild coffee aroma. Some grapefruit hoppyness with a slightly smoked toffee smell. Sweet, moderate bitter taste. Long lively aftertaste.
harmonic aroma and bitter  balanced taste  of coffee, black, full body. Nice beer
Deep dark black nice, thin head. Strong coff and dark chocolate taste with a big hop bite, was surprised at how tough this one was, basically a stout.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2012 roasty, resin, black, full body, thick feel, soft carbonation,  I remember the first time I poured, I thought, "Oh no, this ones way too dark and bitter"...however, I was pleasantly suprised.
Re-rated 05/20/12 to fit my scores more appropriately.

I have enjoyed this porter fresh many times at the Mariposa Street Brewery of Mr. Maytag.  It loses little in the bottle if it travels well.  A very creamy, sweet toasted mocha mouth filling treat. This is a substantial food!  Sip it cool, not cold, enjoy its lacing as the glass is drained. It goes so well with roast beef and Yorkshire pudding!  It is good as well with chocolate cake!

"Wow this is my second beer from anchor and i am pleased. Good porter. Poured with a little head, but left great lacing. Little coffee aroma. Tasted sweet, mapley and coffee. Mouthfeel was tick but kinda creamy. This one will get a do over too :)"

From lowest 10% to highest 10%... (see Labatt Blue rating... ew...)  12 oz bottle from Lous in Augusta...   Smells good, kind of sweet.  Thick body.  Taste is pleasing, coffee, caramel and chocolate flavors, flavorful but not overpowering.  I was really impressed with this one!

Small, creamy, brown head. Opaque black body. Dense, sweet, harmonic aroma of licorice and coffee. Again dense, almost sourish taste of roastiness, coffee, and lingering driness with notes of wild berries. Mouthfeel somewhat watery. Lingering sweetness with marzipan notes. A very good porter, reminiscent of Sam Smiths Taddy Porter, but not as good.

Look black but is actually a deep Deep ruby red almost opaque with medium size short lasting fine bubbled  mid tan head. Aroma is initially bready and barbyard yeast and molasses with hints of coffee and butterscotch. Chewy smooth low carb palate. Lowly sweet roasted malts  mild medium bitter hops. Faint vinous and acetone as well which is surprising for such a low ABV beer. Light bitter sweet aftertaste.
Bottled,  Black in color.  Creamy lightbrown head .  Aroma  burned mild cofee.  Sweet and bitter flavor

pours almost black with brown/white frothy head and long lacing.  aroma is roasted, a touch of sweetness malt and slightly nutty.  taste followed suit with a some sweet syrup tones.  decent but thought it was a little light, would have enjoyed more substance.

Pours a huge tan head.  Taste kind of tangy and sweet for some reason.  You can definitely taste the anchor vibe in this beverage.  Overall it tastes great with the typical coffee and more malt than an average porter.  Great beer that is easy to find.

Bottle.  Smoky cocoa malt and hops aroma.   Dark black-brown color with moderate tan head.  Initially a slight burnt coffee that quickly fades to creamy chocolate with a mild hops finish.  Long lasting flavor.  A bit on the heavy side for a porter but other than that, very good.

Black in color with a small tan head.  Aroma is really nice, malty, sweet, toasty, with notes of coffee.  Flavor of malt, coffee, a little chocolate.  Generally sweet tasting but very well balanced.  Smmoth, thick body with light carbonation.  Nice, light coffee finish.  An excellent porter.

The 1st of the porters that I got at BOTW with my Christmas gift certificate.  Poured a good size tan head with aroma of malt and roasted coffee.  Flavor of malt,light hops and chocolate.  Smooth with no btter finish.  Enjoyable
Wow, this is a great beer and one of the best porters Ive had. Aroma is good, but a little weak. Appearance is great; very dark reddish brown and tan head that has good lacing.

One pint, 6 fluid oz brown bottle purchased from Whole Foods, Deerfield, IL.  Black hued porter having a long-lasting creamy tan head with good lacing.  Soft carbonation. Lush chocolate and roasted coffee aromas.  Medium bodied with creamy smooth texture having complex vanilla, chocolate milk, and coffee flavors.  Finishes dry with light lingering bitterness. Mouth coating oiliness.  A very delicious delightful porter, one of my favorite ones.
Bottle. White short head. Black body. Barley liqorice aroma. Flavor of bitter English liqorice. A lot more bitterness than expected and also astonishing level of carbon dioxide.

Almost opaque black with a brown cover that recedes to patchy thin.  Toasty malt aroma with some roast and nondememo  hops.  Delicious roasty toasty flavour with considerable sweetness and contrapuntal bitterness.  Watermelon, currants, raisins, marzipan.  Medium body, moderate carbonation, sweet finish.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2006 Butter, malted milk, prune, raspberry sorbet, meringue, chocolate like OSA, sultanas, marshmallows and some liquorice in the finish. Sweeter and much less roasty and bitter than I was expecting. Mouthfeel is weird - initially flabby, but it finishes light and somewhat astringent. Nice stuff, but I think I was expecting more.
This is one of the finest beers I have tasted. Perfect for Christmas Eve. Hats off to the folks at Anchor for this remarkable delight!

Pours a dark brown, almost black, with a creamy medium tan head. Caramel, brown sugar, mocha and grassy hops in the nose. Very nice, smooth chocolately flavor with plenty of caramel sweetness, a touch of coffee and floral hops (Noble Im guessing). Not overly roasty or bitter. Medium bodied with a creamy texture and moderate carbonation. Good lacing and head retention. Nice Porter!

Bottle.  Pours black with a big tan head that settles out quickly.  Medium body. Its on the malty side.  A roasty flavor makes it seem more like a stout.  I also taste a dark sharpness most likely from black patent malt.  Has a good amount of hop bitterness making it very balanced, but little to no hop flavor.  The long lasting aftertaste is my favorite, you wont forget what youre drinking.
Black colour with a medium mostly lasting head. Aroma of coffee and sweet chocolate. Taste is dominated by the coffee. Great fullbodied beer.

I enjoyed a few bottles of this but dont get the 98th percentile. Yes its a very smooth porter with some coffee notes and a splendidly balanced taste and aftertaste. The aroma had a nice kick to it. It had some delicious hops in there. Now that I wrote this, I get the 98th percentile!

bottle, pours black with nice big light brown head. smells sweet roasted flovors. taste is great, mostly roasted malt flovors with some chocolate and coffee hints, sweet but with  a slighly dry finnish. nice amount of carbanation, smoooth creamy mouthfeel. nice nice beer

12oz - Aroma is toffee, roasted carmel and chocolate malts, and a touch of hops.  Pours a solid black with a huge brown head and great lacing.  Flavor is nuttier than the aroma.  Still roasty dark malts.  The chocolate stands out.  Palate is creamy and smooth.  Original and classic.  This is one of my first loves as far as porter goes and years later it is still great.

This is a superb example of what I think a porter is all about.  Fruity, super dark with roasted malts, and just the right hint of hops.  Super nice head and lacing.  An excellent beer from October - March

Nice medium-bodied porter, but nothing terribly special about this one (in my opinion).  The mouthfeel was too fizzy for me.  Good aroma and flavor, but it left me wanting something more.  Overall, a bit above average for a porter (but Anchor could have done better).

I was expecting some chocolate in this drop but I cant seem to pick it up, I do get some burnt yeast characters such as dry vegemite, a dry chalky texture, rich coffee bitterness. Deep black body with a light tan head. More lacing than my previous Anchor rating. Full aroma, first up burnt malt then some hops then a touch of liquorice. Smooth but full mouthfeel with full bitterness and a long finish.

pitch black pour with a pleasently sweet nose that encompasses raisin, cane sugar, alcohol, plum, and also chocolate. nice thick head that laced fairly well. smooth palate, but also nice and crisp. raisin, plum, roasted barley, and coffee. nice syrupy/sticky finish. overall, a very nice porter with a bit of a baltica taste to it.

Bottle. Small tan fizzy head that mostly diminished, various sized bubbles, poor lacing, mostly opaque, carbonated, and a dark brown hue. Aroma was malty, caramel, chocolate, hint of coffee, sweet, and dark fruit. Flavor was malty, chocolate, coffee, and dark fruit. Tingly mouthfeel. Medium body.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2006 Bottled.  Pours black with a tan head.  It looks more like a stout to me actually.  Chocolate aromas with some toffee and dark fruit notes.  Flavor is chocolaty but more like bitter chocolate, I cant tell if its simply from the bitterness of the beer or not.  In addition to the chocolate there are some hops, raisins and a small amount of astringency.  This has always been one of my favorite porters but these bottles seem different somehow, maybe its just better on draft.  Maybe my palate has changed.  Either way its splitting hairs, its still one of the best porters out there.

Bottle shared with tupalev. Pours a very dark brown with auburn hues and a small creamy light-brown head. Wonderful aroma and flavour of roasted malt, bitter chocolate, coffee and hops. Flavour has a great balance of sweet roasted malt and bitter hops. Medium body, not overly thin like some Porters. Fantastic, this sweet Porter is one of the best Ive had.

Its a splendid little beer - I seldom rate this high. French roasted coff, bitter chocolate and a slightly syrupy stickiness when you pour it. 
Sometimes I wish some brewers in Dublin sat down, tasted some of the best stouts and porters from around the globe and tried to make a brew like this. They would not have to push it as their primary product - just something to bottle condition and keep for special customers.

Again, Blankboy to the rescue, as I just got back from San Fran and saw this at quite a few places on tap - but ignored it, as I was sure I rated it.  Doh!  Good thing I was lucky enough to share the bottle now to make up for it. Black with red hues, bubbly tan head.  Strong roasted aroma with coffee bean hints.  Sweet as well.  Very strong flavourful roast in taste.  Sweet and hops and coffee linger.  This is an excellent sweet porter, almost Baltic like.  Excellent.
Beautiful dark body, nice head.  Aromas of chocolate and coffee with some nice hops.  Smooth, sweet, roasty, and slightly bitter.

nice strong porter.

stronger than many stouts Ive tried

inoffensive, but bold.

better than alpha klaus which tries too hard like the schoolyard bully

this is smooth and mellow. excellent
Rich dark color that compliments the smooth texture quite well.  Light brown creamy head atop creamy almost chocolate or coffee like flavors.
on tap-pours a brown creamy head with black color.  Aroma is malty, chocolate.  Taste is malty, chocolate.  Even though this is not my style usually, nice.

An amazingly well balanced porter.  Richly flavored with malted chocolate, light coffee, and something even creamier.  The body is full and thick but not cloying, in fact it feels remarkably light and creamy on the tongue despite how full it is.  Its almost impossible not to chase one sip with another.

Pours brown, but slightly lighter than Im used to seeing in a porter with a tan head.  Smells of roasted malt (coffee, chocolate, peppery) with some sweet caramel qualities.  Taste is of chocolate, coffee and raisins.  The roasted elements are not exaggerated as they can be on some porters which is a good thing.  Mouthfeel is oily and thick.  Finish is chocolatey with mellow bitterness.  This is an excellent beer for its style.

Bottle, at least a year old. Poured opaque brown.  Caramel malty aroma with some roasty coffee flavors.  The roasted aroma was very subdued, which I guess was a factor of its age.  More coffee flavors with subdued roastiness and some chocolate.

My first impression was "too thin, too carbonated." But I had changed my mind by the last sip. The aroma was a bit subdued  malts, nuts, hint of coffee. The flavor was a nice combination of roasted malts with a bitter-sweet hop bite. The mouthfeel is smooth and somewhat crisp owing to the bubbles. Yet the beer avoided a "watery" feel perhaps because of the malt presence. A straight-ahead porter that is done well.
Very good looking - with a nice brownish head leaving filigree on the glass. A porter full of taste with coffee and chocolate in the foreground. A lasting aftertaste.
Pours a black color with a small beige lacing for a head.  Aroma is malty with roasted coffee overtones.  Flavor is malty with roasted coffee and dark chocolate taste.  Excellent porter.
Pours black with a finger thick tan head.  Aroma of malt and slight chocolate coffee. Medium to full mouthfeel with a bitter finish.  Good porter.

A Mes rate: 
Ok its pretty straight forward but very good all the same. Typical porter in looks, aroma and taste for me so I shall refrain from saying too much about malty chocolate, coffee and the fairly full mouthfeel. Nothing really stands out as being unusual or special. Its just all done very well. A fine porter IMO
UPDATED: DEC 6, 2008 Light brown foamy head. Dark brown in the colour. Aroma with malt, grains and chocolate. Flavor is sweet, malt, chocolate and rich. Bitter finish. A very pleasent porter.
deep black color, lite thin brown head.  malty chocolate and coffee aroma.  thick and full bodied.  lots of carbonation.  little oily.

(Bottle) Body like black coffee, head tannish, rocky. So-so lacing. Aroma of molasses, vanilla, something floral also. Tastes pretty sweet, surprising for a porter. Mild coffee flavor also, some faint chocolate. Mouthfeel smooth, lightly fizzy. Kind of too sweet for me.
pours black with tanish head.  smell is rich and roasty.  taste is of mocha cut by the hoppiness.  rich and creamy, but very drinkable.  this is a great porter.

bottle. Anchor porter is a deep, near-black opaque red with a great frothy, dense head. Sweet cream aroma, very crisp, with a bit of coffee. The flavor is identifiableu from any other porter Ive had. Its a creamy vanilla taste with the roasty backbone of a porter. Refreshing and sturdy at the same time. Solid lacing on this one.

A truly excellent porter. It has been several years since I had it and I am very glad it is back in my area. It is hopier than I remember both in aroma and flavor. I love the blend of hops and roasted malt. Rich, smooth, a little sweet, hoppy with a lingering finish. Highly recomended.

bottle.  Pours almost black with a small dark tan head that grows slightly after the pour.  The aroma is dominated by alcohol and a little chocalate.  Flavour is good, but familiar for a porter.  Strong alcohol taste and bittering hops predominate.  Finishes clean with little aftertaste.  Decent but I was expecting more.
A very smoky porter.  The beer is so dark that the head is even dark.  A little too strong for my tastes but overall a good porter.
THE Porter. Not all sweet and syrupy...nice and dry with a superb finish. One of the few beers Ive come across worth its price.
A very good porter. Rich, dark, thick, and full-bodied. Great malt expression. Creamy and pleasing.

12 oz. bottle from a bunch of my friends as part of my 50th b-day gift.  had this one sitting around a backyard campfire after finishing off a Founders Impy. Stout, so my taste buds may have been a little damaged after that 12% stout.  that said I thought this had a nice roasted malt flavor but the hop presence was a bit too strong for my tastes.  all in all, a very good porter that I would not pass up the opportunity to drink again.

(bottle) Didnt get much of a head with this one. Strong roasted malt aroma. Flavor was biased a little more towards coffee than chocolate, but malty sweetness was the primary flavor. Pretty good, but not great.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2007 Aroma of smoked nuts and roast malt. The taste is sweetish malts and smokey bacon like goodness. An excellent porter probably the best iv ever had. Great stuff. Re-rate one dimentional thin porter.

Bottle from Utobeer. Very dark ruby colour with thick lasting beige head. Nice blackcurrant/blackberry fruit nose. Bit of liquorice and US hops too. Good in mouth and slightly oily. Finish has more black fruit and tar.

bitter mistery taste, nice sweed yeast afterdrunk.
its well made.
but,...wat is the meaning of the commercial description part: "our old-fasioned porter,...its since 1974????

I was told this could take on the traditional darks, but I found the head less creamy, the flavor thinner and sourer/bitter in the after-taste.  Something about the carbonation bugs me, as with almost all the Anchor beers.

A good malty porter with some what burnt aroma. This could be the smokiness coming out just not in the right way.   Good head with a deep dark brown color.  Has a semi hoppy flavor which is odd to style with a nice malty flavor.  Has somewhat of a metallic feel to the aftertaste.  I think this is light affected.   Needs more coffee flavor with maybe more time with the dark malts.
A nice enough porter. Deep chocolate brown, creamy head. Definitely quite well hopped. Taste is dominated by piney bitterness on top of some coffee flavors. Smoth and nice to drink. Solid.
UPDATED: NOV 18, 2005 Picked up a six pack of these at New Beer Distributors (NYC).  Dark brown color and hoppy taste.  A solid brew.
Hoppy flavor, spicy and sweet, thick feel and low carbonation, smooth, creamy, long  finish with herbal  tones
Deep brown with a thick head.  Balanced roasted malt flavor, with fruity hints.  Robust  finish, with a dry, slightly hoppy aftertaste.

Pours black with a bubbley tan head, mostly diminishing. Aroma is molases, some chocolate, coffee, roastedness and dark fruits. Flaovr is roasted malt, chocolate, raisins. Very dry, especially in the finish. Texture is thin.

The beer pours black with a thik tan head. very nice lookiing. the aroma is faint of chocolate and coffee as most porters. the taste is sweet at first with a sour aftertaste. there is definitly some chocolate and coffee flavors. A good brew that could stand to have a little bit thicker texture but other than that it is great.

22 oz bottle.  Pours a dark ruby, almost black color.  Finger sized light brown head with good retention, fluffy and uneven.  Nice balance in the nose between roasted malt and resiny hops.  Some coffee and earthy dryness as well.  Great balance again in the flavor, first you taste the roasted malt, then the soft hop bitterness, then finally more roasted malt and coffee on the finish.  Mouthfeel is just wonderful, very smooth and creamy with the most subtle amount of soft carbonation that makes this an incredibly smooth drinking porter.
What a wonderful porter, and it has been so for many years. Dark brown with smooth roasted malt flavor. Hops balance nicely. Cant go wrong with this.

I had forgotten just how decent of a porter this is. A good, every day drinking porter, particularly when one doesnt want to get knocked out by a bomber or a high ABV beer. A bit thin of palate, and not quite roasted enough for my liking, but some decent chocolate and malty notes without much of a hop bite, leaving quite a bit of sweetness lingering on the tastebuds.
dammnnnn good tasty roasty porter......i will definately come back to this .....tastes and smells great and.....mmmmmmmmm
A really good porter.  Nice and chocolaty, but not to the point that you think youre eating a Hershey bar.  Nice beer.
this is a damn good porter.  I wasnt a fan of this style, but I like it more and more.  A deep dark rich complex flavor that just tastes great.  Anchor is a great brewery!!!!!!!&
Robe noire aux reflets auburn surmontée dune mousse beige persistente. Arômes de bananes, de levure et de sucre. Saveurs de sucre, de banane, de café, de chocolat et dalcool. Houblon de soutien.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2006 Pours near black with reddish hues and a mostly maintained mocha head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts, with notes of vinous wort with chocolate and coffee goodness. Tastes of dark bread with notes of chocolate, earthy toasted malts, caramelized wort, and raisins.  Medium bodied with good carbonation. Surprisingly the hops are not overwhelmed by the other beer dimensions.  Exceptionally balanced. A mellow, delightful porter.

Dark dark ruby black with tan head. Aroma is pretty subtle, especially for the style. Mostly roasted malts and some coffee undertones. This is definitely one dry porter, for better for for worse. Taste is heavy roasted malts along with the usual coffee and a nice suprise with some dark fruit to add only the slightest bit of sweetness. Quite a hop presence in the finish, as it is very dry and bitter. Some acidity in the finish as well. Very creamy in the mouth, medium full bodied.

Pours with a light tan head, coffee and hazelnuts and a touch of brown sugar, though it doesnt smell very sweet. Smoke, a touch of chocolate, and coffee notes, with a bit more hops than many porters Ive had.  Medium body.  Carbonation starts out a bit biting, but mellows. Quite nice.

Quite a wonderful beer. For those of us not entranced with sweet porters, this brew is perfect, as the coffee flavors tend to prevail. This is one of the few beers that actually improves in taste thoughout the second glass. The bottled version is excellent, but the tap is sublime.
Dark brown with a medium tan head. Slight chocolate aroma and flavor. Not my favorite porter but not the worst.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2005 Bouteille de 1 pt, 6 oz obtenue via les Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur de chocolat et de café torréfié. Apparence: Couleur noire opaque. Mince col beige. Fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de café et de chocolat. Long arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture mince. Forte effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût de café. (Rating #297)

Another why havent I had this before? beer.  Aroma is malt and lightly roasted coffee.  Flavor has some light fruityness with a dark malt taste.  Palate is nothing special, but good.  A tastey beer, but nothing world stopping.

Aaah - that dark beer smell: burnt, toasty, rich dried fruits (prunes mostly) - very nice! Has a creamy, coffee-coloured head over deep blackbrown marmite-like liquid that looks syrupy and rich. The taste is huge. Rushes through first stages straight to the aftertaste! 1: very roasted with burnt fruitcake (almonds and a little dark choc!). 2: some maltexo and lactic sourness. The aftertaste is a burnt bitterness that zaps ya and clings on for dear life. Kinda thick big silky body with a surprising light feel.

Wow. Kicks steams ass. Big silky, dark and brooding. For serious drinkers and serious food: potent cheeses, hearty stews, fried food, pub meals, chocolate cake. Niiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiice!
Chocolate, carmel and raisins jump out on this one, tasted very fresh, probably due to living in California. Very nice on the palate. Very good.

Bottle.  Great looking bottle at that.  Pours a dark brown/black with a medium tan head.  Aroma is mainly roasted malt, little chocolate and a touch of sourness.  Medium bodied on the palate and almost creamy in texture.  The flavor is overwhelmingly semisweet chocolate with hints of caramel and coffee and a touch of raisin.  Roasted malt and even a bit of smoke in the finish.  Little bitterness compared to most porters and I think I like it that way. Very, very rich and complex with the perfect amount of  sweetness.  Its an outstanding beer.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2005 Bottle. Pours a black with a reddish tint, a tan fluffy head. Smells of cofee and sour fruit, and very bitter chocolate. Tastes of bitter chocoalte, mocha, ripe fruit like raisins and prunes, with a very full chocolate flavor at the end. It feels extremely creamy and smooth on the tongue with very few bubbles. Slightly bitter finish, but not overly so. A wonderful beer that makes me very happy to be across the bay!

Pours black with a fairly thick caramel head. Plenty of coffee in the aroma as well as dry fruit. Incredibly complex flavor has some chocolate, plenty of coffee, raisins, some molasses, and a mildly fruity finish. Very nicely done.

Bottle (650ml).  Pours almost black, incredibly lively with a big light brown foamy-creamy head.  Does the "guiness pour" settle-out thing wonderfully - head lasts forever, rocks out and leaves a half-decent lacing - top marks. Aroma is roast malt, somewhat vinous, stewed prunes and apple cores, slight hops, and tasty coffee and bittersweet chocolate notes as well - quite darkly fruit sweet on the nose.  Flavour is like heavens own semisweet belgian chocolate with nuts and raisins bar - with dark roast malt, sourish wine overtones, other steeped fruits, coffee and cream.  Mouthfeel is thick and creamy, only lightly carbonated.  This is one of the nicest porters Ive ever had.  Terrific blend of bitterness (coffee, chocolate, touch of hops), sweetness (fruit, malt and chocolate) with enough tartness to keep it all together.
This tasty porter is so round, sweet and fresh that it is almost not a porter anymore. Paradoxically there is no doubt, however, that this is one of the best porters on the market.

Pours black, creamy tan head. Aroma is chocolate roastyness, just what youd expect with a hint of sour. Taste is the same, its very smooth - smoother than I expected. Over time some extra flavors came about - more chocolate and less roastiness. Body is medium - not cloying at all. Nice porter aftertaste.

12 oz bottle pours black.  Aroma is of chocolate, coffee, caramel.  Flavor is good choclate base, some coffee bitters and a decent hop finish.  Palate is medium bodied and fairly well carbonated for a porter.  Creamy mouthfeel.  Smooth and silky.  A great porter!

Sweet maltiness, perhaps a touch too sweet, but not cloying.  I think the mouthfeel seems a touch thin.  But I do like this very much, VERY drinkable, just not in the mood to jump on the near-unanimous bandwagon.

Poured a very dark, almost black color from the bottle. Nice beige head didnt last, but good lacing. Chocolate and malt dominate the aroma. The taste is not as full as I would have hoped - good, but not that good. Chocolate and malt also dominate the flavor. The carbonation is awfully strong for a porter. This one is characteristic of a pilsner. Its distracting. Overall, a very drinkable beer, but with flaws.
jet black w/ brown head.  coffee aroma w/ a hint of plum.  full bodied, explosive flavor of caramel and chocolate.  creamy, malty and tasty.  one great brew from the anchor brewing co.
Not up to the very high standard of their superb Liberty Ale but nevertheless an excellent porter.Black with traces of liquorice and a few other things.Complex but simple and very easy to drink..
this was a treat... What a beut!! Nice dark black color with a great head, it glimmers! Good sweet taste that i could drink alll night! Now for the rest...

Reach for the stars creamy head in a tan color...long lasting. Aroma like a fine perfume. Ink black color. Bitter chocolate with strong coffe mouthing then some hops to hold onto ones aftertaste. A great porter. If theres better,I cant wait to find it!!

Ah how I love the Anchor bottle shape..wonderful.
well this is an extremelly lovelly beer to look at dark dark brown, fantastic looking tan head..just fills up my glass like it should!
Good potent aroma of roasted, toasted malts, somewhat milky..and baking chocolate in the back.
Nice satisfying chocolaty taste, dark-semi-sweet.. Some restrained flavours of dark ripened fruits..black cherries, figs and dark purple plums.creamy finish.
Great on the palate..very creamy and smooth 
A wonderful example of a porter..I have to wonder why I have never had this beauty before. This is an American classic every bit as much as their Liberty Ale.

Opaque nearly-black brown, thick, with a short-lived sudsy brown head.  Aromas of coffee, molasses, coffee, peanut butter, prunes, raisins, earth and yeast.  Tastes wonderfully malty, with sweet notes of dark fruit, molasses, coffee, yeast and ginger.  It finishes with a good herbal hop bitternes and lingering malt and yeast.  Thick and chewy.  Stronly malted and.
Pours close to black with a nice head. Tastes of roasted chocolate and coffee, thick and slightly creamy. Lots of great things have come out of San Fracisco, but this has to be one of the best.

Pours dark almost black with a thin tan head. Nice carbonation. Bitter chocolate smell and taste. The aftertaste has a weird bit of funk to it that I cant tell if its intentional or not. Its a decent brew, but the aftertaste is turning me off a bit. Was expecting a little more refinement.
user_location: Waco (Buckle of the Bible Belt), Texas, USA

text: Deep, dark brown/ruby color. semi sweet chocolate, coffee and toffee flavors.  Really smooth and tasty, like the perfect desert.

Lovely roasted aroma with hints of chocolate. Very dark brown beer with a lasting tan head. Fills the mouth nicely - almost creamlike and has powerful flavour of chocolate, coffee and dried fruit. Long pleasant aftertaste.

Chocolate and slight coffee aroma witha hint of dried fruit.  Nice, but not brilliant.  Dark, dark brown with a beautiful, creamy, light brown head with very tiny bubbles...very creamy looking.  Flavor is roasty chocolate and raisins witha sharp (rye?), creamy, metallic finish.  The flavor is just off in this one, I dont care for the mineral/metallic finish.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Great stuff. Dark brown with bown-white head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, licorice, chocolate and hop. Good body with roasty hoppy finish. Yum.

Perhaps my favorite porter and the only beer Ive ever bought because I craved its deliciousness.  It pours dark with a nice thick head.  Well-balanced blend of coffee and chocolate flavors with a good note of licorice.  Drinkable in large quantities.  After I finish writing this review, I may just find myself at the package store purchasing another six pack.

Dark brown colour almost black, with a tan head. Roasted aroma of coffee and hops, some chocolate too. Taste of chocolate and roasted malt, some coffee flavor too. Nice mouthfeel with a little bitterness.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2007 re-rate:  licorice, molasses aroma.  almost black with a small tan head.  flavor is very roasty with chalky black malts, burnt toast, molasses, licorice and a hint of smoke.  medium bodied.  wow...i love this beer.

35,5 cl Bottle. Good nice deep ddark brown allmost black in colour. Little aroma, of some roasted malt. Nice smooth flavor of choclate malt and some bitterness in the end. A nice easy to drink porter.

Tap and bottle. Dark black, you cannot see through this brew. It has a very strong chocolate and coffee taste. Nice hoppy aroma and sweet taste, with a somewhat bitter dark chocolate and coffee aftertaste. Highly recommended very good!!!

Bottle.  Bottled on:  02/28/05.  Near jet-black pour with a thick, fluffy dark-khaki head that leaves a good bit of lacing.  Lots of vanilla beans, anise, Bakers chocolate, coffee and hops in the aroma.  Roasty and toasty without any of that burnt taste so common to those aromas.  Starts off like a rich, lightly toasted wheat bread with dark chocolate and anise.  Finishes with just enough bitter hops.  Delicious.  Solidy medium-bodied.  Not the best porter Ive had, but pretty tasty.

Black as night with a thick full tan head. The smell of sweet malted barley screams drink me!. Strong roasted malt sweetness, with a coffee flavor. The hops are plentiful but not overpowering, a nice blend.

Poured a deep black with a nice thick, tan head. Great, full, round aroma with cherry, strawberry, hearts of palm, mocha, a little chocolate, and an enveloping aroma that I recognize but cant pin down and its driving me nuts. Nice robust, malty, smokey flavor that was great but unfortunately had a very watery, cat piss finish that really ended up bogging down an otherwise great beer.

Chocolate and coffee flavors, maybe a little smokey. Not at all fruity like some porters. Friends think its a bit hopsy but I disagree, theyre probably just not used to porters. My favorite of all beers.

Pitch black, opaque with a thin brownish head. Aroma of licorice and chocolate, dark malts. Flavor os caramel, chocolate, something roasted and bitter. A little vinous in the finish. Quite complex and enjoyable.

Darker than expected, black, opaque with a thin, tan head that darkens to brown at the edges.  Licorice aroma up front with chocolate, black malt, cola, milk and moroccan spice (WOW).  Flavor is espresso, sweet caramel, chocolate, charcoal, some bubblegum with a subtle but long bitterness that trails into a long, warm, winey finish.  Very inviting, complex but drinkable dark ale.

Very roasty tasting.  Loots of chocolate and malt in the aroma.  nice creamyflavor and palate.  hints of vanilla bean and a lot of chocolate and malts.  A LOT of butterscotch in the flavor too.  definitely a good purchase.

This is a really good beer that Ive waited too long to try.  ITs a porter but is really kind of half porter half stout in my mind.  Nice and datk with lots of roastiness and very full bodied.  I would highly reccomend this porter to anyones
Pours a deep deep brown with a nice tan head.  Flavor and aroma is both malty is chocolaty.  Very nice brew.  One that I will be consuming in the near future.
Pleasant malt smell, taste is nice and balanced. Highly reccomended. Will do again.
Black with nice tan head. The nose is full of roasty coffee notes, while the taste has a roasty bitterness from the dark malts, nicely balanced with a chocolaty sweetness. Strong coffee aftertaste.

Pours black with a small brown head. Nice malty aroma, feels very nice in the mouth, quite roasty and a little earthy. Great hop flavours, not too intense. Its a good porter, but not all I had hoped for.
Pleasant malt aroma and dark color.  Nicely hopped and roasted malt taste.  Quite pleasing to the palate.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2007 April, FRIDAY THE 13TH!!!! 2007!- Re-Rate.

Aroma is stewed raisins, cocoa, chocolate and black licorice. Huge fluffy mocha colored head. Very frothy and lasting. Black body. This beer is just damn close to perfect. Black licorice, cocoa, anise, roast malt and a deceptive alcohol kick. Its just farking awesome. That is all there is to it.

August 21 2006 re-comment

Still a freaking benchmark for the style though this time it seemed to have more raisin notes to it. Its still the freaking bomb as porter goes and it is still pushing the boundaries of the style after all this time.

June 12 2006 re-rate

Aroma is rich chocolate, brown sugar, raisin and maple syrup. Body is black and holds a slowly diminishing, two finger thick mocha head. Fore is stewed raisins, maple syrup, burnt malts and burnt bitterness. Has a baltic porter feel to it flavor wise. Mouthfeel is perfect for the style. Finishes like a liquid blast of rum raisin bread and chocolate tinged coffee.

original rating was 4.

Very nice and quite unique. Lots of deeply roasted caramel malt flavor along with raisins, chocolate, and coffee. I agree with those that think its more like a stout than a porter. It has a nice sweet aroma and bittersweet chocolate finish as well.
Bought it for a recipe and had one while i was cooking. WOW! powerful, really coats your mouth with a toffee flavor. A lot of rosted flavor with a 60 second finish. this is a belly-filler!
This is a great beer.  Great strawberry aroma with a smooth head and a chocolatey/coffee aftertaste that lasts just long enough to make its point.  I love this beer, and anything Anchor makes.

This seems more like an impy stout as I rate it.  Black as night with a light brown head with a good amount of lacing.  Aroma is malty.  Taste has caramel and nice roasty character.  I was not disappointed by this beer.

Not a style I typically enjoy, but this porter was borderline spectacular.  Great roasty flavor with a thick, sweet caramel to it as well.  Exceptional complexity and a nice, thicker body than most porters.  Puts the steam and liberty to shame.  This ought to be Anchors flagship.

I really wanted to like this beer, and at nearly a 4 I had high hopes, but I was honestly quite disappointed.  This beer displays a heavy prune or raisin taste.  Way too much of the flavor banks on that alone.  Its a shame to behind that cloud of prune taste i could make out some very nice malt flavors.  Just a bit too over the top, there are many porters that blow this away in just my local area.  How this got so high Ill never know.
Im a sucker for Porters.  Im not sure what it is about their flavor or appearance that really excites my palate.  Anchor Porter is no exception.  Very drinkable, mild hops.

This was a pleasant surprise.  Anchors Porter poured a deep black with a light brown creamy head.  The aroma was immediate with malt, coffee and mocha. The first mouthful burst with rich intense flavor.  This Porter is one to enjoy.  I will be going back for more.

After the lovely aroma and appearance, the taste of it was almost a letdown. Nice bright smell, with the hops right up front. Color is quite dark, and resistant to light. The hops are evident in the taste, almost overly so. The problem with this is it drowns out the natural mocha and coffee flavors inherent in a porter. Still a great beer, and a real treat. Think of the voice of Ally McCoist, thats how smooth it is.

This was the very first porter i drank, but i had no clue what a porter was and thought it was another ordinary beer that would be easy drinking like Anchor steam.  I didnt really enjoy it that much and i was getting a big stomach ache trying to polish off a whole 6-pack on that 4th of July night of 2004. Now the tables have turned, and i have a bigger understanding of porters, so ive bought another six pack this week to re-visit it.  The nose is a light presence of chocolate added with a slight whip cream aroma.  A dark black that in actuality is a brown color accompanied by a little rocky topping of head while it will leave behind a major amount of lacing down the glass. The flavor might possibly be the most smoothest porter i have rated so far even though it isnt the most flavorful.  What does cross my tastebuds is a moderate bitterness level with a dark toasted malt back bone.  As strange as this may sound, but when i take a sip while inhaling the aroma i swear it reminds me of red licorice candy ropes.  Although i admit that this may not be the most richest and tasty porter out there; however, i will proudly say that this is in my favorite top 5 list of the porter style.

Anchor porter is one of the definitive examples of robust porter. The head is thick and creamy, as is the texture. There is no roasted barley character, and no bite from over use of black patent. The hops are present, but not overpowering. This is exactly what I expect when I order a porter.

Im impressed by the drinkability of this beer; for a porter, its not excessively thick.  A good balance between hops and malt.  Jet black and creamy appearance, with quickly disappearing foam.  If youre in the mood for a porter, this one wont let you down
Bottle. Pours a pure, dark brown with a nice, foamy tan head. Aroma of nice chocolate and coffee. Very malty. Taste is pure smoothness. Nice and creamy with a great finish.
Pours jet black with beige head. Aroma is divine, with raisins, toffee and christmas galore. Full mouthfeel and a taste to match. One of the best beers Ive ever had.

Bottle: Dark dark brown, large foamy light brown head, sticky lacing.   Roasted malt nose, loads of apple skin.   Rich malt flavor, roasted of course, with quite a bit of light fruit (apple, pear) skin.   Very simply, but elegant, clean, and tasty.   Full bodied, medium to full mouthfeel.   Low hop presense, no real heavy coffee or chocolate, just good ol fashion roasted malty goodness with a pale fruit kick.

Pours like motor oil. Christ, its beautiful! Black with thick creamy brown head. lacy. Settles a la Guinness but more quickly. A perfect looking brew. Smells smoky and lightly of chocolate. Very nutty smelling.

Taste has lots of that nutty flavor to it as well. Malty with coffee flavors. Also some hints of bitter chocolate but the nuttiness rules this beer. Bitter-sweet finish. Smoky with a thick mouthfeel. Damn this is a good porter. Complex and just plain tasty. Very drinkable for me.

Havent picked any of this up in years. Not the best but a great robust big porter.
Pours dark with beige head.  Aroma rich with chocolate and coffee which carry through to the flavor also.  Well bodied and balanced.

Strong coffee aroma with chocolate undertones. Not too thick for a porter, which is good, because I couldnt stop drinking this stuff. Rich mocha flavor with a subtle hops kick. A little more carbonated than I expected. Could be the best porter Ive had yet.

Bottle.  Nice deep brown color with just the barest hints of ruby showing when backlit.  Medium lived off-white head fades down to a ring and leaves fair lacing.  Deep aromas of chocolate and coffee.  Medium bodied.  A bit astringent.  Flavors are highly roasted grain, bordering on burnt.  Pleasant coffee flavor.  Fairly nice coating texture.  Adequate hop bitterness at the finish balances out this porter quite nicely.

pours black with thin off white head. aroma is molassis, coffee and chocolate. taste is molassis, bitter dark chocolate. and barely a hint of coffee and a little hops. has a thin yet creamy and lasting mouthfeel if thats possible.
UPDATED: JAN 28, 2008 Black body, light tan head. Aroma is chocolately English style, some caramel and roast. Medium to light body, quite drinkable. Solid porter.

Bottled. Black opaque, brown huge foamish head. Fruitish and roasted aroma, with some caramellish hints. Sweetish banana flavour at first, and the sweetness grows in finish and then turns into a grapefruitish dryness in aftertaste. Mouthdrying.

Bottle. Nice bitter aroma with chocolate and coffee. Beatiful black body with off-white head - very inviting. Flavor-wise arguably one of the best porters in the world. Powerful bitter opening, extremely long finish, again with chocolate and coffee - the taste just won´t quit!! Mouthfeel just right and smooth. Overall the best porter I´ve had so far!

Deep dark black with thick tight dark tan colored head. Smokey, coffee, and molasses aromas. Semi sweet dark chocalate taste that intensifies as it warms(started too cold)with a suprisingly delicate mouth feel of soft carbonation. Finishes with a lingering mild bitterness.
UPDATED: MAR 3, 2009 A good, different porter.  Well balanced chocolate malt, hops, and coffee flavors.  Medium mouth feel would benefit from a bit more creaminess.

I chose Anchor Porter as my 100th rating as this is a beer close to my heart... one in which all porters seem to fail in comparison. Pours a deep, blackberry/red-brown with a large, tan, souffle of a head that falls slowly and softly leaving excellent lacing. Heavy malt aromas are dark chocolate and dark fruits, with a light alcohol presence. The full-bodied flavor balances bitter coffee and semi-sweet chocolate, leaving a light tingle of alcohol to dry the mouth... which causes you to open another...
<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Oak Lawn, IL<font size=-1>

Dark brown with a small creamy beige head.
Aroma of coffee and chocolate with notes of liquorice and nuts.
Flavour of coffee and chocolate, with notes of liquorice, that ends up with a nice bitterness.
One of the best porters Ive had.

Pours  black with thin tan head.  Leaves decent lacing. Aromas of chocolate and  molosses.  Tastes like bitter chocolate.  I was expecting more taste.  Has a bitter, hoppy finish to it.  Above average Porter for me.
a very nice porter.  very smooth and creamy with a great finish and a great look.
Pours dark, almost black, with medium head that settles well.  Smooth, almost chocolatey taste, full and dry.  The finish is fairly bitter.  Overall, a complex flavor that I truly enjoy.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2005 Almost completely black with medium tan head.  Smells buttery, chocolately,  with raisins and some other low key fruits.  Very full mouthfeel.  Tastes of bitter chocolate, some sort of fruityness, and coffee with a somewhat bitter finish.  Taste lingers a while.  I almost like this as much as Fullers Porter!  Very complex and delicious, I like this a lot.

Nearly opaque ruby brown.  Brown grewy head settles down quickly, decent linger.  Roasty, banana aroma.  Some chocolate notes.  Full, dry mouthfeel.  Chocolate nose, melds into sharp fruity esters.  Some chalky, earthy characters.  Acrid spicy finish, which mellows a bit as it warms up.  Nice brew.

I owe this rating due to a forum post DaSilky1 made months ago pointing out that I hadnt rated this yet and to Shadey for buying me a bottle so that I could.  I didnt think much of this beer the first time around but man have I changed my mind.  Near black colour.  Aroma is chocolatey, slightly sharp (acidic).  Slightly roasty, acidic, toasty with chocolate overtones and mocha highlights.  Really cool beer - like a mix between the assertiveness of 21st century porter and the complexity of 19th century stuff (yes, I was around back then).
This is prob the best porter you can find around the country it is thick and dark with a slightly fruit aroma... the taste has some sweetness of cocolate and fruit
Almost black beer with a brown head. Aroma of caramel and fruits. Very nice flavor, dark chocolate and dark fruits (raisins), well balanced, very good brew.
Very fruity aroma, along with a nice yet subtle chocolate presence.  The flavor is very good with a wide variety of sensations.  Very complex beer, very good beer.
user_location: The United States of Texas, Texas, USA

text: Cant believe I havent touched this brew in years.  Whats wrong with me!?  Pitch black, thick tan creamy head.  To me anyway, the nose was very Belgian like with buttery ripe dark fruits and sweet roasted chocolate leading the way.  A great roasted malt flavor is intermingled nicely with the dark fruitiness, with the back end kicking in the Anchor hop bitterness.  Just great balance.  Medium bodied, medium carbonation, drying, bittersweet, dark fruit finish.  Excellent session porter without a doubt...
Pours black with a thick brown creamy head. Sweet chocolate flavour with hints of coffe. A little fruity taste too.

12oz bottle.  Dark black color, opaque,  nice brown head.  Nice big aroma...chocolate, fig, coffee roasting, hops in the background and a good dose of fruity fermentation...a creamy, fruit laced chocolate flavor hits me...some toffee and subtle roastiness...smooth balanced finish, neither bitter or sweet.  Nice complex porter and very approachable too.
Opened it up and a plesant smell of bannanas hit me.  Poured jet black.  This stuff is delicious.
UPDATED: MAR 20, 2005 Very dark with ruby fringes. Malty toffee date aroma, flavour is more of the same. Full bodied.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2005   This looks like a fancy coffee drink you would get at a coffee shop in an isolated town.  The white head looks very creamy like Capuccino making the appearance very attractive.  The aroma has a lot of banana in it mixed with chocolate, caramel and mocha and licorice.  The malts have that recognizable Anchor malts which seem to work better in the bottle then on draft.  The banana, chocolate and caramel trio come together very well resulting in a session beer/dessert beer.  This was very good.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2005 bottle - 3/19/05 - The pour is pitch black. When it comes to smell, taste, and finish the overriding theme for me is chocolate, a little banana.   I smell banana, caramel, chocolate...very nice.  The taste is heavy chocolate, sweet, hint of banana.  Finish is chocolaty.  Very litte bitterness in aftertaste.  Well balanced.  I most definitely will drink this again...One of the best brews Ive had.

Nice packaging.  Not bad taste or aftertaste.  To be honest the first thing I tasted was metal..  Hopefully from the bottlecap.  I would probably try something new versus purchasing this again, though.
Bottle: As soon as i poped the top of this beer i could smell nothing but bannanas, and it only gets better from there.  This beer is perfect.  Great bannana chocolate taste.

very dark ruby brown color, deep garnet at edges.  very tall rocky and creamy tan head that cascades slowly.  lots of sticky lacing that forms a cave-like wall.  aroma is roasted malt, cocoa, slight smoke.  flavor is roasted malty sweet.  banana flavor!! medium mouthfeel, lively carbonation.  slight hop and roasted malt bitter aftertaste.
Fantastic Porter.  Quite dark, barely lets light through a pint glass.  Long lasting head.  Nutbread aroma with a slight sourness.  Full bodied.  Rich malty flavor, balanced sweetness, well bittered.

(Bottle, 35,5 cl) All the Anchor beers wakes up good memories from my US road trips back in the 90es. Oh sweet innocence... Tar-like blackness with a slightly creamy, brownish head. No extra added fermentables or carbon dioxide. Fat and powerful, sweet almost port-like with a dry hoppiness on the palate. Very interesting Porter.
Really attractive beer. Black with a rich creamy head.  Great aroma of nuts and caramel roasted malt.  Smooth roasted malt and hop finish.  Great and complex beer.

Bottle. Poured black with medium tan head. Aroma was full with malt, hops and sweet. Flavor was full bodied with same tones as aroma and smooth rich texture. The finish was not as full as other porters.

This to me is the quintessential American porter. Big chocalate malts with some dark fruit, Mocha and toffee. Absolutely no malt astringency, Clean as a whistle mouthfeel very velvety and round.  Great beginning,  middle and end. smooth as glass finish. Very pleasing.

Aroma: Weak.  Hard to distinguish anything.  (Bar caused?)  Appearance: Thin, non-existent head.  Dark black color.  Palate: thick mouthfeel, a little dry.  Flavor: almost like a typical porter + anchor steam mixed together.  Complex vanilla and roasted nut malt.  Overall, I gave this a good score because it tasted good.

The bottle poured a thick black liquid with a small, tan, creamy head that became thin after a time and  lasted quite long leaving nice lacing on the glass. The aroma is of sweet fruit - banana and cherry, I believe. The initial flavor was of sweet fruit, malt, and dark roasted nuts. There was a brief bitter middle that matured to a nice alcohol warmth that lasted for a long time. The texture was smooth as velvet. Very nice!
Mmmmm... a nice and lovely porter with plenty of body and kick to keep you interested.  Nice coffee and caramel tones make this one a good choice.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Pours a thick, dark black with a touch of ruby.  Thin, tan head with good lacing.  Nose is all malt.  Taste of sweet, dark malt, grain, a bit of raisin and a hint of licorice and hoppy bitterness.  Palate is well-balanced and complex with a body thats neither too heavy, nor too thin.  Feels just right around the mouth.  Quite good.  Would buy again.

Zis ist ein gut Englander style porter. Black malt be biting my tongue unt ze hops are plenty too. Beautiful head zat lasts unt gut lacink. Like mein zailor bud zays, "Lets weigh ze Anchor!"Earlier Rating: 2/26/2005 Total Score: 4.2A beautiful beer, thick tan colored head that lasts and lasts, rich mouthfeel with a taste of roast barley and black malt, generous hopping balances out this beer which finishes a bit hoppy.

Bottled. Light brown head on top of a black beer. Excellent aroma of citrussy hops, roast and malt. Almost perfumed. The flavor is full of taste with raisins and light roastiness. Relatively high carbonation and pleasant mouthfeel. Excelletn beer, but even better on tap!
Tap at Flying Saucer.  Very nice porter.  Some choc and coffe flavor.  Goes down very very easy.
Aroma seems roasted cherry. Another beer that goes down great! Smooth, rich dark beer with deep rosted flavor & coffee & chocolate tones. Fullers is better
Dark in color with a smooth even taste.  Rich taste with hints of burnt nut / coffee.

(12 oz botte)  Pours almost opaque ruby with a tan frothy head.  Leaves a pretty solid lacing throughout the glass.  Tastes of vanilla, chocolate, roasted malts and finishes with slight bitterness.  Mouthfeel is a bit oily but not unpleasant.  I like this mix although it is a bit sweet.

Dark brown with cola coloured head. I always passed up on this brew figuring it was average. It was pretty good though. I was surprised. Some roasted aromatic flavours covering a pine/earth tone with a hint of bitter-sweet chocolade. Palate settled nice. I also felt some licorace hints in there. A nice all around porter. Ill have to try some more!
This was decent. Dark brown with an off-white small head. Hints of chocolate and some roasted flavours. This wasnt bad, but its nothign memorable.

Poured a very dark brown with a reddish tint when held to light.  Thin tan head.   Aroma was lightly roasted with a touch of piney hops.  Flavors of roasted malt (but not as roasty as some other brands tried this tasting) fruity and mildly hoppy.  Medium bodied with a clean smooth finish.
What a pleasant surprise this porter was.  Excellent flavor, hops are present but not overbearing.  Very good and highly recommended.
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2005 impressive compared to an Anchor Steam.  Flavor was just right to my taste not overbearing roasty and yet still substantial.  Finish is smooth.  .
Not a bad porter. Dark brown, not black. Smoothened out roastiness and coffee.

Really like this beer. Poured dark brown with just a hint of red. Head was near  perfect dark tan. Couldnt identify the aroma, but red licorice came to mind. Flavor is smooth with a strong smoke finish. Only slightly acetic (which I like).Very nice.

Pours dark brown with a very little amount of tanhead that dissapears very quickly leaving almost no lacing.  Aroma is of moderate hops and bread with a light hoppy smell.  Flavor is intially sweet and bitter with the aftertaste being the same with the sweet dominating the aftertaste.  Body is light to medium with a soft amount of carbonation.  An unpleasent bitter flavor arose as the beer progressed that I disliked but the beer got slightly better towards the end.     Im not as big a fan of this beer as most people seem to be but oh well.
My wifes brothers scored again. This poured thick and black, with tan head. Aroma of caramel and chocolate and a bit Smokey. Sweet and dry and balanced by bitter. Finished smooth and dry. Excellent.

Bottle.  Dark black with foamy brown head.  Aroma had dark chocolate and a bit of licorice.  Taste is nice and malty with chocolate.  Finishes dry and bitter.  Excellent beer.  I will bump up its overall rating because its very cheep and I can find it anywhere.
Can definately notice a sweet chocolaty aroma. Nice dark brown/black color and not much head. Has a nice rich roasted flavor that lasts. Complex and pleasant taste. I want MORE!!!
Pours black, tan head. Aroma of toffee and chocolate and something I cannot quite place. Smooth mouthfeel, nice roasty flavour, finishes with a bit of bitterness. Good porter.

Bottle 2004.  Pours dark with a moderately light head that disperses quickly w/ medium carbonation.  Strong aroma of chocolate malts and pine needles.  Taste is well balanced with a malty sweet nose and a slightly bitter finish.  Very mellow porter that is very easy and enjoyable to drink.  More roasted malts and hops could replace some of the water in this porter to fortify its flavor.  Other than that this is definitely a classic American porter that is great all year long.

Pours creamy caramel and then settles into a near opaque, with a bit of crimson on the edge of glass.  Appealing aroma of chocolate, raisans, dates and plums.  A little mustiness is present as well.  This porter hits all at once - roasty goodness is quickly followed by a short metallic aftertaste.  Almost sour.  Im now checking the code on bottle and realize this was bottled over 8 months ago.  I really freaking hate my liquor store.  Will re-rate when I can get fresher.
Now maybe Im comparing this to Bully Porter but, this was just not good.  It had a black appearance and a sweet chocalate smell but, that was the end; and so it will be.

Pours a nice black. Nose comes off with a sweet chocolate with a mix of plums. A bit bitter in taste, mixing malt and bitter chocolate... I think there was even a hint of sour cherry. A decent porter.

Drink on tap
Aroma:small torefaction
Appearance:Black small head
Flavor:Chocolate and cofee,torefaction.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2005 Pours deep brown/red. Masive head. Really nice billowing effect. Had to hold of on the pour. Amazing aroma. Just wonderfull; sweet, molases, touch of carmel. This is a remarkable porter. Great mouthfeel not to thick and stoutlike but not watery. Almost a roasted almond, nutty flavor. Complex and well blended. Slight medicinal aftertaste. Pretty bitter finish but well balenced by the syrupy nutty flavor proflile. This is outstanding.
poured a dark ruby color with a thin head. has a hoppy fruit aroma.  Tastes of roasted malt with a sweetness to it.  Very smooth enjoyable porter.

Almost black in color with a quickly subsiding tan head. Coffee, chocolate, toffee smells jump out of this.  Nice and chewy with taste of chocolate malt but enough hops to keep the bargain.  A typical porter to me, but I expect alot of this style.
Bottle:  Light chocolate aroma is a little weak.  Pours a brownish-red with a nice tan head.  Light chocolate up front with a sweet roasted coffee finish.
